title: Power BI Designer
description:
We are looking for a Microsoft PowerBI Designer which would include the following skill sets:
The primary skill set we are looking for in a Power BI Designer is the bridge between raw data and meaningful executive-level insights, using Power BI's tools to create engaging and informative visualizations and dashboards.
Key Skill sets of a Power BI Designer:
Building reports and dashboards:
Use Power BI's tools to design interactive visualizations and dashboards that effectively communicate insights from data.
Creating and managing themes and style presets:
Define consistent visual styles for reports and dashboards to improve readability and brand alignment.
Data modeling and preparation:
Connect to different data sources, transform data, and model relationships between tables using Power Query and Power Pivot.
Sharing and publishing content:
Organize reports, dashboards, and datasets into workspaces and apps for easier sharing with others.
Collaborating with others:
Collaborate with colleagues or teams to build and refine Power BI content, assigning roles and managing permissions for secure collaboration.
Developing and deploying apps:
Bundle reports, dashboards, and datasets into apps for streamlined sharing with larger audiences.
Managing data access and permissions:
Control who can view and interact with Power BI content.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $65.00 - $80.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Application Question(s):
Are you comfortable working on W2?
Are you legally authorized to work in the United States, US Citizen/Green Card Holder?
How many years of work experience do you have with Dashboards?
Are you willing to work on a 3-month contract with possible extension?
How many years of work experience do you have with Microsoft Power Query?
How many years of experience do you have in designing interactive visualizations and dashboards that effectively communicate insights from data?
Do you have an available portfolio/sample works?
Do you have experience building C-Level Executive reports?
Does your work involve data visualization for at least 90% of the day?
Work Location: Remote

title: Power BI Developer
description:
19562
IES Holdings
Sugar Land, Texas

Job Description
About IES Holdings, Inc.
IES Holdings, Inc. is a leading provider of electrical contracting services, providing innovative solutions to complex challenges across diverse industries. With a commitment to operational excellence, we leverage cutting-edge technology to enhance efficiency and deliver value to our clients. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Power BI Developer to join our team and contribute to the digital transformation of our business processes.
Position Overview
IES Holdings, Inc is seeking a Power BI Developer with expertise in Microsoft’s Power BI Desktop and Power BI Services (Fabric), to support reporting and KPI development for business applications and intelligence. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in designing, developing, deploying, and supporting Power BI solutions to optimize business processes and enhance customer engagement.
Key Responsibilities
Power BI Development & Visualization:
Design, develop, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports to support business insights.
Create data models, measures, and calculations using DAX (Data Analysis Expressions).
Implement custom visuals, slicers, and drill-through capabilities to enhance user experience.
Optimize Power BI reports for performance, scalability, and usability.
Work closely and collaborate with business leaders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable reports.
Data Integration & Modeling
Connect Power BI to various data sources such as SQL Server, Azure, Excel, APIs, and other cloud/on-premise databases.
Develop ETL processes using Power Query (M Language) and SQL for data transformation and cleansing.
Implement data relationships and star schema modeling for efficient querying and reporting.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and governance across all reports.
Performance Optimization & Support
Monitor Power BI performance metrics and implement optimizations such as indexing, query tuning, and data aggregation.
Troubleshoot data refresh issues, gateway configurations, and report access permissions.
Manage Power BI workspace, dataflows, and app deployments.
Provide end-user training and documentation on how to use Power BI reports effectively.

Specific Qualifications

Education:
Associates degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or a related field. Bachelor’s degree is a plus.

Experience:
Minimum 3-5 years of experience with Power BI Development, DAX, Power Query (M Language).
Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and SQL.

Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL Server, T-SQL, and data modeling techniques.
Experience with ETL processes, data transformation, and working with large datasets.
Knowledge of Azure services (Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Power Automate) is a plus.
Understanding of data governance, security roles, and row-level security (RLS) in Power BI.
Familiarity with Python, R, or AI/ML integrations in Power BI is a plus.

Soft Skills:
Interact with senior leadership and business users.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Experience working in Agile/Scrum development environments.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment with minimal supervision
Preferred Qualifications
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate or similar certification.
Experience with cloud-based BI solutions and data warehousing.
Familiarity with Power Automate, Power Apps, and AI-driven analytics.
Previous experience in Finance and Construction industries.

Company Overview

IES is a national provider of industrial products and infrastructure services to a variety of end markets, including electrical, mechanical and communications contracting solutions for the commercial, industrial, residential and renewable energy markets. IES is publicly traded on NASDAQ under the symbol IESC. As of the end of IES’s 2024 fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, IES produced over $2.8 billion in revenue and employed over 9,400 employees at over 131 domestic locations across the United States. IES is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Minorities, Females, Gender Identity, Sexual Orientation, Individuals with Disabilities, Protected Veterans Encouraged to Apply.

From office buildings to wind farms, industrial complexes to housing developments, our employees and design professionals design, build, and maintain the systems that empower lives.

Our commitment to our employees is reflected by our actions:
Safety is Priority One – and our record shows it
Competitive Pay
Company 401K plan with Employer Contribution Match
Company Paid Time Off
Company Paid Life Insurance
Choice of Medical Coverage including Prescription and Short Term Disability Plans
Choice of Dental and Vision Coverage
Optional Long-term Disability, Critical Illness, Accident, Legal and Pet Coverage
Auto and Home Insurance Discount Programs

title: Data Analyst
description:
About us:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
What you'll do:
We are thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team in Carlsbad, CA! This hybrid role offers the unique blend of working collaboratively within our Carlsbad office and the flexibility of remote work.

As a Data Analyst on the Operations Analytics team, you will provide analytics and insights into manufacturing and supply chain and business systems in support of broad program areas across Viasat! A significant amount of this role’s responsibility is aggregating, cleansing, joining, and storing data from varied sources. The individual in this position will develop analytical models while automating reporting and bringing the data visualization to life by building dashboards for end business users. You will work within the system while helping the business with embedded analytics, dashboarding, and advanced analytics within SAP, SAC, and Tableau.
The day-to-day:
Parse and manipulate raw data using tools including SQL, Python, Tableau, SAC.
Ingest, understand, and fully synthesize large amounts of data from various sources to build a full comprehension of the story.
Analyze large data sets, while finding the truth in data, and develop efficient processes for data analysis and simple, elegant visualization.
Design and implement analytics solutions using SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP HANA, including SAP HANA Calculation Views, CDS Views, and SAC data modeling for optimized data reporting and visualization.
Identifies data gaps, research methods to fill these gaps and provide. recommendations.
Experience building intuitive and actionable dashboards and data visualizations that drive business decisions (Tableau/SAC).
What you'll need:
5+ years of related experience.
3+ years SQL experience.
3+ years data analysis experience with emphasis in reporting.
2+ years Python experience in data cleansing, statistics, and data visualization packages.
2+ years dashboarding experience. Tableau/SAC experience or equivalent with data visualization tools.
Experience in crafting visualizations and their usage charts, tables, maps, filters, drop-down menus, hiding functions, interactive objects.
Skilled in deciphering key players, adept at encouraging relationships, and influential in driving progress.
Essential to possess superb communication proficiencies and efficacy in collaborating seamlessly with all pertinent parties involved.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Analytics, a related field, or equivalent years of experience.
US Citizenship is required.
Ability to work out of our office in Carlsbad, CA or fully remote in the US.
What will help you on the job:
Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau and SAC.
Proficient in SAP HANA data modelling using Attribute View, Analytic View, and Calculation View, SQL, importing source system metadata, hierarchies and developing.
SAP/SAC Certifications.
Familiarity with corporate ERP systems, i.e., Oracle and SAP.
Superb communication and teamwork abilities.
Salary range: $89,500.00 - $141,500.00 / annually. For specific work locations within San Jose, the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, the base pay range for this role is $104,000.00- $156,000.00/ annually : At Viasat, we consider many factors when it comes to compensation, including the scope of the position as well as your background and experience. Base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Additional cash or stock incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Learn more about Viasat’s comprehensive benefit offerings that are focused on your holistic health and wellness at https://careers.viasat.com/benefits. EEO statement:
Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. If you would like to request an accommodation on the basis of disability for completing this on-line application, please click here.

title: Power BI Developer- Clearance Required
description:
Cydecor is a premier Federal Government solutions provider, delivering differentiated innovations in mission systems and business platforms. We leverage leading-edge secure systems and software development, backed by industry-leading subject matter expertise, and business intelligence to enable decision-support and remain ahead of ever-evolving national security challenges. Our success rests squarely on three bedrock principles: People, our center of gravity; Mission, what inspires us; and an unyielding commitment to Excellence, what separates us.
Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Power BI Developer to support advanced data visualization and analytics solutions for U.S. Navy and Department of Defense (DoD) initiatives. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain secure, scalable Power BI dashboards and reports that drive operational insights and strategic decisions across Navy programs. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in data modeling and business intelligence, with experience working in or supporting federal or defense-related environments.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Design and develop interactive, visually compelling Power BI dashboards and reports for Navy and DoD stakeholders.
Familiarity with and able to create solutions using Power Platform (Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint as well as Power BI.)
Integrate data from multiple structured and unstructured sources, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance with DoD data governance standards.
Collaborate with analysts, data engineers, and program leads to define business requirements and transform them into effective BI solutions.
Create and maintain developer user guides, or other related development products in support of application development initiatives.
Implement efficient data models using DAX, Power Query (M), and SQL to support performance and usability.
Perform data validation, troubleshooting, and optimization for report reliability and performance.
Ensure adherence to cybersecurity and information assurance protocols, especially in handling CUI and classified data.
Document dashboard designs, data sources, and workflows in support of ongoing system maintainability and compliance audits.
Support Agile/Scrum processes and participate in sprint planning and review sessions.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Intelligence, or a related technical field; an additional year of relevant experience required in place of a related/technical degree
Mid-level understanding of Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service
U.S. Citizen with an Active Secret Clearance (Final or Interim)
4+ years of experience developing dashboards and reports in Power BI within a business or federal context.
Must possess working knowledge of SQL Reporting, DAX, Power Query, and data modeling concepts. (including workspace and dataset management).
Experience working with stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting requirements.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail.
Effective communication skills, including the ability to present complex data in a clear and actionable format.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience working with Navy ERP, ADVANA, DEAMS, or other DoD systems and data environments.
Familiarity with federal data standards, including FISMA, NIST, and DoD CUI handling requirements.
Exposure to Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Synapse, Data Factory, Azure SQL).
Knowledge of Agile and DevSecOps best practices in federal environments.
Knowledge of Qlik and COGNOS desired, not required.
Security Clearance: Interim or active DOD SECRET required
Work Schedule: Hybrid
Benefits:
Cydecor offers a comprehensive compensation package including Health and Dental Insurance, Vision and Life Insurance, Short-Term & Long-Term Disability, 401(K) + company match, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Company Holidays, Tuition Assistance Program and more.
What We Believe
We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Cydecor has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.

title: Business Analyst (Entry Level/Junior)
description:
AEON NEXUS CORPORATION
If you would enjoy working in a collaborative environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a diverse team of professionals, we invite you to apply here today.
Aeon Nexus Corporation is a Microsoft Partner providing software development consulting services with our enterprise Microsoft Power Platform solution, JusticeNexus. Participate in SCRUM kick-off and daily SCRUM meetings with delivery team to review cross project progress including project timelines and actionable items

title: Data Analyst
description:
Working Model: Hybrid
We have a balanced working model to ensure you have the flexibility you need. The successful candidate will balance their time between working in the office in Goshen, Indiana (minimum of two days) and working from home.
As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting in the definition of and the execution of the data strategy governess and usage. Accountable for helping transform our business into a data driven organization with intent on building member value. Utilizes various business intelligence data, guides the direction to identify data sources and usage, maintains the stewardship of the data governance program, and has the extensive knowledge to utilize tools to create meaningful analysis and reporting.
Direct Reports: None
HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT
30% Act as the primary point for the business intelligence data lake infrastructure and processing questions and tickets. Collaborates with internal strategic business partners to develop decision making needs and planning for future data needs. Assess the key issues and data needs. Leverage data storage vendor relationships to support credit union initiatives. Lead efforts to find ways to use data to improve current business processes through analysis and review of discrepant data resources and scenarios.
20% Design and oversee the ingestion of data into our enterprise data lake, as well as architect data flow from the data lake for ingestion into other custom reporting environments. Identify priorities based on identified business needs and execute on those priorities. Mentor other members of the credit union's data community to include, but not limited to, junior data analysts and decentralized data users.
20% Develops and maintains data standards, data catalogues, data dictionaries, file view documentation, as well as templates for end-users to apply governance standards and table relationships knowledge to establish consistent single source of truth for key data fields.
15% Collaborate with various management teams and marketing staff to develop a plan for data usage, identify gaps in data, and work with external vendors to develop machine learning opportunities and predictive analytics leading to prescriptive analytics for actions to take. Work closely with other business data owners to understand business requirements, performance metrics regarding data quality, and performance of member facing products to grow the business.
15% Lead unit and/or acceptance testing when new data insights or platform changes occur. Develop information for complex requests including visualizations, query templates, ad-hoc reporting to various end-users in an appropriate form and frequency to include, but not limited to, dashboard content.
- Must comply with all company policies and procedures, applicable laws, and regulations, including but not limited to, the Bank Secrecy Act, the USA PATRIOT Act, and the Office of Foreign Assets Control.
WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED
Experience
6+ years of experience in the financial industry to include data governance, warehousing, and analysis plus 2+ years' experience working with predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Education / Certifications / Licenses
This level of knowledge is acquired through completion of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, Analytics, or related field. Must have and maintain a valid driver's license.
PREFERRED SKILLS

Expert knowledge of one or more data reporting tools including Excel, Cognos, Tableau, Power BI, SSRS or others.
General knowledge of SQL with a strong understanding of data tables and table relationships.
Professional level of verbal and written communication skills are essential to the position.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Demonstrated knowledge of Credit Union regulations, products, policies, procedures, services, related federal state and federal laws and regulations.
The ability to motivate or influence internal or external senior level professionals is a critical part of the job, requiring a significant level of influence and trust.
Obtaining cooperation and agreement on important outcomes via frequently complex and senior level dialogues.
Advanced analytical and project management skills for a variety of tasks or projects.
Ability to deal with complex problems involving multiple facets, variables, and situations.
Ability to provide world class member service while executing Interra’s vision, mission and delivery of Core Values.
INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

A significant level of trust, credibility and diplomacy is required. In-depth dialogue, conversations and explanations with customers, direct and indirect reports and outside vendors can be of a sensitive and/or highly confidential nature.
Communications may involve motivating, influencing, educating and/or advising others on matters of significance.
COMPETENCIES

Data Gathering & Analytics - Gathers data from relevant, sometimes independent sources. Able to synthesize data, recognize correlations, and draw conclusions that inform decision-making. Applies understanding of Interra and the marketplace to analysis.
Foster Innovation - Explores new and better ways of doing things. Encourages innovation of ideas, processes, and behaviors. Promotes activities that create greater efficiencies and/or experiences. Puts innovative ideas into practice.
Functional Expertise - Possesses a sufficient level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; keeps up with current developments and trends in areas of expertise; actively seeks ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development activities.
Interpersonal Savvy - Relates to and can connect with diverse individuals and groups at all levels within the organization. Externally, builds appropriate relationships and rapport with members and external partners.
Navigate Ambiguity - Operates effectively and with positivity, especially in uncertain circumstances or without a clear path forward.
Organizational Savvy - Understands Interra's culture and the interconnectedness between different parts of the business, including a knowledge of systems, practices, policies, and procedures. Able to identify opportunities and potential problems and navigate through formal and informal channels to achieve solutions.
ADA REQUIREMENTS
Physical Requirements

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear.
The employee frequently is required to walk and reach with hands and arms.
The employee is occasionally required to stand; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
The employee is occasionally required to lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Working Conditions

Must be able to routinely perform work indoors in climate-controlled shared work area with minimal noise.
Mental and/or Emotional Requirements

Must be able to perform job functions independently or with limited supervision and work effectively either on own or as part of a team.
Must be able to read and carry out various written instructions and follow oral instructions.
Must be able to complete basic mathematical calculations, spell accurately, and understand computer basics.
Must be able to speak clearly and deliver information in a logical and understandable sequence.
Must be capable of dealing calmly and professionally with numerous different personalities from diverse cultures at various levels within and outside of the organization and demonstrate highest levels of customer service and discretion when dealing with the public.
Must be able to perform responsibilities with composure under the stress of deadlines / requirements for extreme accuracy and quality and/or fast pace.
Must be able to effectively handle multiple, simultaneous, and changing priorities.
Must be capable of exercising highest level of discretion on both internal and external confidential matters.
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
Nothing in the position description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This Job description is not a contract and should not be constructed as a guarantee of employment for any period of time. Interra Credit Union is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against employees or applicants based on race color, religion, sex/gender, national origin, disability, age, or any other category protected by law.
Why JoinIN

Culture: We believe that a positive work environment is key to success. Staying engaged, informed, and keeping it fun, is how we achieve this.
Professional Growth: Our Learning and Development Team not only provide day 1 training but continuous improvement and career development for all levels.
Competitive Salary: Attractive compensation package with performance-based incentives and bonuses.
Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance, 401(k) matching, tion reimbursement, company holidays, and generous PTO.
Community Involvement: Being an active member in communities that we are a part of is important to us. We live here, work here and stay involved here!
Visit our Opportunities page for more information.
For more information about the role or the application process, please reach out to Ali Barden, AVP Talent Acquisition and Retention Lead at alib@interracu.com
Equal Opportunity Employer
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Sr. Power BI Developer
description:

On-site two days a week

Dynanet Corporation Overview:
Dynanet started with a focus on IT infrastructure and operations, helping organizations enhance their networks and overcome the limitations of 1990s technology. From strengthening communication channels to introducing innovative ways to collaborate and share information, Dynanet played a crucial role in shaping the early stages of digital transformation. The company’s efforts helped organizations build the very fabric of connectivity that now powers our modern world. Over the last three decades, Dynanet has grown into a trusted partner for organizations looking to innovate boldly and transform seamlessly. While technology continues to evolve and unlock new opportunities, for nearly 30 years, Dynanet remains committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions that drive lasting change for its customers. Through agility, foresight, and an unwavering dedication to excellence, Dynanet continues to empower organizations to thrive in a rapidly changing digital landscape. Our story is more than just a story of technology – it’s a story of vision, growth, and transformation that has shaped the past and continues to pave the way for the future.
Roles & Responsibilities:
In depth engineering experience in perimeter solutions, including the design, low level engineering, and delivery of new hardware systems for client applications across the enterprise DMZ.
Federal experience highly recommended along with comprehensive knowledge of business units’ functions.
Proactively engage to assess readiness and ensure zero impact from changes
Development and maintenance of High Level and Low-Level Design diagrams/documentation
Required Professional Skills:
Excellent oral and written communication - must be able to communicate at all organizational levels. Strong communication skills to work with senior management to provide status updates, deliver requirements and report details at the correct level
Building/operating various firewall platforms including Cisco and Palo Alto

Strong attention to details, analytical capability, and excellent verbal and written communications.
Strong knowledge of network routing/switching (routing protocols, multicast, other LAN protocols)
Functional understanding of diverse sets of networked applications requiring perimeter management solutions, including HTTP, HTTPS, SSH, FTP, DNS, NTP, ANYCAST services, and others.
DMZ Network infrastructure knowledge including topology, security policies, firewalls and the L2/L3 switch, and router infrastructure is required.
Administrator level ability with UNIX (Linux or another variant) is highly desirable.
Public Trust Tier2 security clearance - Moderate risk (formerly MBI Level 5B
Dynanet Team Requirements and Expectations:
Possess Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Highly organized with an ability to prioritize, balance, and effectively advance multiple competing priorities in a high-volume, fast-paced environment.
Ability to interact in a professional and collaborative manner with fellow Dynanet Teammates and the clients, and business partners that we work with.
Ability and desire to challenge and educate yourself to support and advance IT services delivery in the Federal agencies we serve.
Excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills.
Respond to team member and client requests via email, MS teams, or other communication means during core business hours.
Active listening skills to understand clients' needs, and collaboration skills to work with other developers and designers.
Education/Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or 5-10 years of IT experience with Firewalls & Threat solutions.

title: Power BI Developer- Clearance Required
description:
Cydecor is a premier Federal Government solutions provider, delivering differentiated innovations in mission systems and business platforms. We leverage leading-edge secure systems and software development, backed by industry-leading subject matter expertise, and business intelligence to enable decision-support and remain ahead of ever-evolving national security challenges. Our success rests squarely on three bedrock principles: People, our center of gravity; Mission, what inspires us; and an unyielding commitment to Excellence, what separates us.
Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Power BI Developer to support advanced data visualization and analytics solutions for U.S. Navy and Department of Defense (DoD) initiatives. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain secure, scalable Power BI dashboards and reports that drive operational insights and strategic decisions across Navy programs. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in data modeling and business intelligence, with experience working in or supporting federal or defense-related environments.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Design and develop interactive, visually compelling Power BI dashboards and reports for Navy and DoD stakeholders.
Familiarity with and able to create solutions using Power Platform (Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint as well as Power BI.)
Integrate data from multiple structured and unstructured sources, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance with DoD data governance standards.
Collaborate with analysts, data engineers, and program leads to define business requirements and transform them into effective BI solutions.
Create and maintain developer user guides, or other related development products in support of application development initiatives.
Implement efficient data models using DAX, Power Query (M), and SQL to support performance and usability.
Perform data validation, troubleshooting, and optimization for report reliability and performance.
Ensure adherence to cybersecurity and information assurance protocols, especially in handling CUI and classified data.
Document dashboard designs, data sources, and workflows in support of ongoing system maintainability and compliance audits.
Support Agile/Scrum processes and participate in sprint planning and review sessions.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Intelligence, or a related technical field; an additional year of relevant experience required in place of a related/technical degree
Mid-level understanding of Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service
U.S. Citizen with an Active Secret Clearance (Final or Interim)
4+ years of experience developing dashboards and reports in Power BI within a business or federal context.
Must possess working knowledge of SQL Reporting, DAX, Power Query, and data modeling concepts. (including workspace and dataset management).
Experience working with stakeholders to define KPIs and reporting requirements.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail.
Effective communication skills, including the ability to present complex data in a clear and actionable format.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience working with Navy ERP, ADVANA, DEAMS, or other DoD systems and data environments.
Familiarity with federal data standards, including FISMA, NIST, and DoD CUI handling requirements.
Exposure to Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Synapse, Data Factory, Azure SQL).
Knowledge of Agile and DevSecOps best practices in federal environments.
Knowledge of Qlik and COGNOS desired, not required.
Security Clearance: Interim or active DOD SECRET required
Work Schedule: Hybrid
Benefits:
Cydecor offers a comprehensive compensation package including Health and Dental Insurance, Vision and Life Insurance, Short-Term & Long-Term Disability, 401(K) + company match, Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Company Holidays, Tuition Assistance Program and more.
What We Believe
We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Cydecor has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Cydecor is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (EEO/AA). All employment and hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs without regard to race, religion, color, sexual orientation, nationality, gender, ethnic origin, disability, age, sex, gender identity & expression, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
If you are a qualified individual with a disability and/or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site because of your disability. You can request assistance by contacting HR@cydecor.com or calling 703-884-2105.

title: Data Analyst - Power BI
description:
Job Summary: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. This
role is pivotal in leveraging data to support strategic decision-making by creating insightful
reports and analyses using Power BI, Excel, and other tools. The ideal candidate will be
proficient in Power BI and Excel, with expertise in DAX programming, data automation, and data
integration from multiple systems. You will be working closely with senior leadership to provide
analytical support and drive business performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Power BI Reporting: Create and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly reports and analysis using Power BI to provide actionable insights to the team
Support Larger Models: Assist in the development and maintenance of larger planning models for annual and quarterly planning processes.
Template Building: Help the team by designing and building ad hoc data templates for various reporting needs.
Executive Support: Provide data analysis and insights to support the CEO, CFO, and
Operations VP in making informed business decisions.
Data Integration: Understand APIs and effectively link data from different systems for comprehensive analysis and reporting.
Automation: Implement and improve processes for automating reports to enhance efficiency and accuracy in reporting tasks.
Excel Analysis: Utilize advanced Excel techniques, including PowerPivot and Pivot Tables, to conduct detailed data analysis.
Presentation Support: Assist the team with PowerPoint presentations, optimizing them for visual appeal and clarity to effectively communicate data insights.
Qualifications:
DAX Programming: Strong knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions), the core programming language behind Power BI.
PowerPivot: Experience with data analysis within Excel, including building KPI tables, with familiarity of PowerPivot as a precursor to Power BI and DAX.
Excel Expertise: Advanced skills in Excel, including Pivot Tables, data modeling, and data analysis techniques.
API Integration: Solid understanding of APIs and experience linking data from multiple systems.
Automation Skills: Knowledge of automating reporting and analysis processes to improve efficiency and accuracy.
PowerPoint Skills: Proficiency in PowerPoint to enhance presentations and optimize visual representation of data.
Fast and Accurate Worker: Ability to work quickly without compromising the quality of analysis and reporting.
VBA (Visual Basic for Applications): Experience with VBA is a plus for automating Excel processes.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, with a strong background in Power BI, Excel, and data reporting.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
Why Join Us:
Opportunity to work closely with senior executives (CEO, CFO, Operations VP) and influence key business decisions.
Work with cutting-edge data analysis tools like Power BI and Excel.
A collaborative and dynamic team environment focused on growth and development.
If you are passionate about data, enjoy solving problems, and have the technical skills to deliver
actionable insights, we want to hear from you!

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
Overview:

Xanterra Travel Collection is a growing, exceptional group of travel and leisure businesses operating across the globe. Our properties/services combine dramatic settings and landmark buildings with exceptional service to deliver unforgettable experiences. We are inspired by our guests, our environment, and each other. Headquartered in our beautiful Greenwood Village, Colorado offices, we strive to create a collaborative experience and a transformational journey for our valued team members. We have a high commitment to sustainability, growth and are seeking driven, innovative individuals who value offerings in career development and professional advancement. Our Travel Collection includes lodging, food and beverage, Windstar Cruises, short-line railroad, and adventure travel companies. Please visit xanterra.com for more information on the company and its environmental initiatives.

We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and driven professional to join us as a Senior Power BI Developer within our Data and Analytics Team. Our technology team is dynamic, with a strong sense of dedication to our customers. In our collaborative and inclusive work environment, individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. Per our company policy, we will require this position to be in office 5 days a week.
Responsibilities:
In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate closely with business analysts, data engineers, and leadership to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. Per our company policy, we will require this position to be in office 5 days a week.

You Will Make an Impact By
Designing and developing advanced Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations using DAX and Power Query.
Translating business requirements into technical specifications and creating reports that meet business needs.
Optimizing performance of BI solutions, including data modeling and report refresh efficiency.
Connecting to data sources, importing data, and transforming it into Business Intelligence reporting.
Building and maintaining complex data models in Power BI.
Collaborating with data engineering teams to ensure high data quality and availability.
Conducting code reviews and mentoring junior Power BI developers.
Staying current on Power BI features, updates, and industry best practices.
Creating documentation for data models, workflows, and processes.
Working with stakeholders to define KPIs and success metrics.
Ensuring data governance and security best practices are followed.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. 5+ years of hands-on experience in Power BI development, including creating complex reports, dashboards, and custom visualizations. Significant work experience can substitute for formal education. Working knowledge of standard project management methodology, tools and software.
Technical Knowledge: Advanced knowledge of DAX and Power Query for data transformation and modeling in Power BI. Experience in Power BI Service for sharing reports, managing workspaces, and automating report scheduling. Strong understanding of business intelligence concepts and reporting strategies. Ability to work with large datasets and perform performance tuning to ensure scalability and efficiency in Power BI reports. Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights to business users. Experience with integrating Power BI with other business systems and data sources is a plus.
Security Knowledge: Knowledge and prior experience with common security and privacy standards – PCI-DSS, GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA — and implicit integration of these security standards in all aspects of your work. Understanding of Power BI workspace roles.
Documentation Toolset Skills: Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to synthesize and present information clearly. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite of products for authoring and collaboration is required.

What Will Set You Apart
Our preferred candidate will also bring one or more of the following skills:

Microsoft Power BI certification (e.g., PL-300 or PL-600).
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and user experience design for BI solutions.
Working knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Ability to interact with team members at all levels of the organization and with cross functional teams.
Experience in travel, hospitality and/or cruise industries.

COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $105,000.00 to $115,000.00.
BENEFITS: For full-time employees, Xanterra offers a comprehensive benefits package including: Medical, Dental & Vision; HSA & FSA; Life & Disability; Accident, Hospital & Critical Illness; Pet Insurance; PTO and paid Holidays; 401(k) with Company Match; Employee Assistance Plan; Education Assistance; RTD-Denver transit pass for in-office employees, and Employee Discounts & Travel Deals.
EEO: Xanterra is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Power BI Developer Temp
description:

Strong proficiency in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query (M).

Familiarity with datasets derived from API feeds, competitive monitoring, or scraping operations.
Strong storytelling, data interpretation, and business communication skills.
Experience supporting commercial, pricing, loyalty, or entertainment sector analytics is a plus.

Professional Skills:
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent computer skills
Excellent communication skills
Ability to multi-task and distinguish high-priority matters
Excellent reasoning and analytical skills
Excellent organizational skills.
Must be self-motivated with a strong ability to prioritize and recognize critical situations that need immediate attention.

title: Enterprise Power BI Architect
description:
LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY

Manager Notes: This is a mid-senior level role that will lead the design and implementation of an enterprise-scale Power BI environment. The ideal candidate will be based in the Boston area and possess extensive hands-on experience in Power BI implementation, with a strong foundation in architecture. This role requires proven expertise in setting up Power BI Gateway, integrating with Snowflake, and developing scalable analytics solutions. Additional responsibilities include supporting SSO integration and enabling Power BI functionality on mobile platforms. The preferred candidate will have 5–7 years of relevant experience, preferably within the financial services industry, but not required. 3. Governance and Security Knowledge:

title: Power BI Administrator / Developer
description:
Company Overview
Iridium is an award-winning and innovative satellite communications company with bragging rights to the only network that offers voice and data connectivity anywhere in the world. For over 20 years, Iridium’s unique network and services have supported critical communications needs for individuals, businesses, and the evolving Internet of Things.

At Iridium, we understand the importance of staying connected and the limitations of traditional communications networks. People across the globe, including first responders, humanitarians, global militaries, scientific researchers, and lone workers, as well as ships, aircraft and remote operations all rely on Iridium to stay connected. We take our responsibility for providing these essential communications very seriously and pride ourselves on offering a reliable lifeline when needed. Likewise, Iridium is committed to providing an exciting and innovative workplace, where employees are challenged to think outside the box and collaborate on new, bold ideas and solutions. Our talented teams are passionate about their work and the impact our company makes around the world. Iridium fosters an empowering and inclusive culture that allows employees to genuinely be their best selves. We are looking for others who want to join this truly unique company that celebrates our employees and provides the opportunity to truly make a difference in the world.
What We’re Looking For:
As the Power BI Administrator/Developer on our team, you’ll play a key role in shaping how our organization leverages data for decision-making. This position will own the administration of our Power BI environment, including managing user access, workspace structure, semantic model management and gateway configuration to ensure a secure, scalable, and high-performing BI platform.
Additionally, this position will collaborate with stakeholders to design and develop compelling dashboards and reports that transform complex data into meaningful insights. The Power BI Administrator will work with data analysts to apply principles of data storytelling and wireframing to craft intuitive, impactful visual experiences. You will thrive in this role if you have a technical background, creative mindset, and enjoy a fast-moving and collaborative atmosphere within in a modern cloud environment.
What You’ll Do:
Power BI Platform Administration: Manage and oversee the Power BI tenant and service settings, including administering workspaces, user access roles, and security configurations. This involves controlling who can access reports/datasets and structuring workspaces for teams or projects, in line with governance policies
On-Premises Data Gateway Management: Configure and maintain on-premises data gateways in conjunction with the AWS group to ensure secure connectivity between cloud Power BI reports and on-prem or AWS-hosted data sources. This includes monitoring gateway performance, adding data sources, clustering for high availability, and applying updates or patches
System Monitoring & Maintenance: Continuously monitor Power BI platform usage and performance, and perform regular maintenance (capacity planning, updates, and reboots) to keep the environment reliable and performant. This may involve tracking workspace usage, dataset refresh timings, and optimizing Premium capacity or cloud resources for efficiency
Security & Compliance: Enforce data security and compliance standards within Power BI. Manage user permissions and ensure that data access meets organizational policies and industry regulations. Responsibilities include auditing activity (using Power BI logs) and maintaining compliance with data privacy laws
Dashboard & Report Development: Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards, paginated reports, and data models according to best practices. This involves robust data modeling, writing DAX measures, and creating interactive visualizations that align with business requirements, style guide and core KPIs
Stakeholder Collaboration & Support: Work closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective BI solutions. Provide user support and training as needed, helping business users understand the dashboards and self-service tools. This can include creating documentation, conducting demo sessions, and ensuring user adoption of Power BI across the organization
What You’ll Need to Succeed:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology/Systems or related technology studies (e.g. certifications)
5+ years of proven experience in BI administration, business intelligence, or a similar role
Advanced proficiency with Power BI Desktop and Service, including strong skills in data modeling, Power Query (M), and DAX for complex calculations; Experience in developing rich dashboards and data visualizations, as well as knowledge of optimizing data models and report performance
In-depth knowledge of Power BI administration features and best practices – from tenant settings and capacity management to content governance (workspace setup, deployment pipelines, usage monitoring); Ability to configure security (both at the data level and the workspace/app level) and to use admin tools or REST APIs for automating admin tasks
Hands-on experience with the Power BI on-premises data gateway including experience in installing, configuring, and managing gateways to connect to on-prem databases or cloud VPCs.
Working knowledge of cloud platforms for AWS and Azure
Ability to use scripting languages and APIs to automate tasks and streamline workflows; SQL proficiency including CTEs and DDL for validation and to create data assets supporting the data products
Proficiency in PowerShell (or Python) for automating Power BI admin tasks, and experience using Power BI REST APIs or Power Platform (Power Automate) for deployments and integrations
Strong analytical thinking coupled with a sense of design for data presentation; Creativity and the ability to turn data into impactful visuals and narratives
Ability to be adept at choosing the right visualizations, designing intuitive layouts, and employing data storytelling techniques so that end users can easily interpret the insights
Excellent communication and teamwork skills to effectively communicate with peers, end users of all levels and engineers including collaboration on requirements, communicating technical constraints, training, documentation and requirements gathering
Be comfortable managing upward, including being a proactive communicator and asking for help when needed
Have confidence and be able to establish valuable relationships with others
Must be able to prioritize key tasks and have a strong sense of ownership over your work
Be active in seeking out ways to continuously improve yourself and gain new knowledge
Things That Would be Great if You Brought to the Table:
Experience deploying BI solutions in cloud environments and using cloud resources (for example, using Azure VNets or AWS VPCs for Power BI connectivity)
Experience in the telecommunications or related industries (e.g. utilities)
Familiarity with network setup (VPNs or virtual networks) to host gateways on cloud infrastructure (AWS or Azure)
PowerBI administration or development related certifications
Experience with automation, CICD or similar in BI operations
Experience with optimizing for large data volumes
Analytical engineering exposure or experience including developing marts and pipelines with tools like DBT
We’ll also need you to:
Be able to work in the office at least 3 or more days a week to foster collaboration with the team and stakeholders
Be able to travel occasionally, a few times a year
Work Environment:
This position primarily works in an office setting and is largely sedentary with the majority of the position working with a computer. The role typically requires the use of basic office equipment such as a phone, video, computer, keyboard, mouse, and printer.

Iridium is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

title: Business Central, Microsoft 365 & Power BI Analyst
description:
Business Central, Microsoft 365 & Power BI Analyst - Remote
Compensation: $95,000 - $120,000/Annually
ABOUT THE POSITION
Elevated Industrial Solutions is looking for a Business Central & Power BI Analyst to support and enhance our use of Microsoft Dynamics 365, Business Central and Power BI. This role will bridge the gap between operations, finance, and external partners, helping us get the most out of our ERP data through reporting, automation, and process improvements. We’re seeking someone who’s comfortable digging into data, understands business processes, and can build meaningful reports that support smart decision-making across the company. This position is remote and will report to the Vice President of Operations.
WHAT YOU’LL DO IN THIS ROLE
ERP Support & Development
Serve as the primary point of contact for Business Central user support, troubleshooting, and configuration Insurance, employee costs, almost 100% paid by employer contribution.
Work with departments to identify inefficiencies and implement process improvements within Business Central.
Create and maintain documentation of system workflows, customizations, and best practices.
Coordinate with external Business Central partners as needed.
Reporting & Data Visualization
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI that are accurate, intuitive, and actionable.
Translate business needs into functional Power BI reports using DAX, Power Query, and other BI tools.
Work with department leaders to define KPIs and ensure the right data is being surfaced to the right people.
Data Integration & Management
Ensure data from Business Central and other systems (e.g. CRM, e-commerce, WMS) is integrated properly for reporting and analytics.
Help maintain data accuracy and consistency across systems.
Assist with data migration or cleanup projects as needed.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Finance, or a related field. Work experience can substitute for formal education.
Minimum of three (3) years of proven experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (or Nav)
3-5 years’ experience in Power BI, including DAX and Power Query.
Solid understanding of business processes – especially in areas like finance, operations, inventory, or sales.
Experience with relational databases and basic SQL.
Ability to communicate well with both technical and non-technical users.
Comfortable juggling multiple priorities and working across departments
WHAT WE OFFER

Insurance, employee costs, almost 100% paid by employer contribution.
3% company contribution toward your 401K
8 paid holidays including your birthday

A fun, fast-paced, competitive work environment

title: Software Engineer – Data Warehouse & BI Development (SQL/Power BI)
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

We're looking for a Software Engineer specializing in SQL Data Warehouse Development and Power BI to join our team in building Delta Dental's Next Gen Applications & Products Suite-with a strong focus on scalable, data-driven solutions using Power BI and Snowflake. In this role, you'll design, develop, and maintain structured datasets, apply ETL processes, and create efficient Power BI data models, including calculated columns and measures. Your work will directly support user-friendly, visually impactful dashboards and reports optimized for performance and accuracy.

This is a highly collaborative role where you'll partner with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to deliver innovative, insight-driven solutions that support strategic decision-making.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Performs as a key contributor in building and supporting innovative data solutions, including the development, support, and optimization of Power BI reporting platforms to address complex business use cases.
Participates in architectural design and system analysis activities within SQL-based data warehousing and Power BI environments.
Develops high-quality, production-ready Power BI data models using best-practice data structures, design patterns, and frameworks.
Writes high-quality code, building secure and performant datasets and Power BI solutions from conception through production support.
Produces clear and readable technical documentation for developed Power BI reporting solutions, ensuring thorough documentation practices.
Tests and ensures quality of all deliverables utilizing test-driven development and quality practices within SQL and Power BI environments.
Assists in executing business intelligence initiatives to transition reporting from legacy platforms to Power BI.
Supports other Engineers through evaluation, design analysis, and integration efforts, aligning Power BI solutions with business requirements.
Maintains knowledge and promotes compliance with policies and procedures, serving as a technical expert across Power BI governance, data access management, and self-service enablement.
This list is not all-inclusive, and other duties may be assigned as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years of relevant professional experience with hands-on SQL dataset development, data modeling, and Power BI; 4+ years of experience with business intelligence solutions and Power BI development preferred.
BS in Computer Science or equivalent technical field or relevant work experience preferred; equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
Experience designing and developing secure datasets and data reporting solutions.
Demonstrated proficiency in building structured datasets, applying ETL processes, and developing data models in Power BI.
Experience with Snowflake or other SQL-based data warehouse technologies preferred.
Microsoft certifications related to Power BI preferred but not required.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to clearly identify and present technical alternatives across SQL data warehousing and Power BI development projects.
Ability to create and maintain detailed documentation supporting development, deployment, governance, and maintenance of Power BI solutions.
Proven ability to present data effectively, facilitating clear understanding of findings and technical recommendations.
Strong problem-solving skills using analytical approaches for dataset design, data modeling, and reporting.
Knowledge of prevailing data warehousing and business intelligence best practices and design patterns.
Detail-oriented, capable of managing multiple priorities in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and their application to business intelligence and data warehouse development.

Base Pay Information

The national base pay range at the end is a good-faith estimate of what Delta Dental may pay for new hires. Actual pay may vary based on Delta Dental's assessment of the candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities (KSAs), related experience, education, certifications and ability to meet required minimum job qualifications. Other factors impacting pay include prevailing wages in the work location and internal equity.
Pay Grade 21. $80,500 - $174,300

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Behind the smile! We are dedicated to safeguarding the health and financial stability of our employees and their loved ones. This commitment extends beyond the workplace to foster personal growth and holistic wellbeing. Our life-changing rewards package includes:


Competitive base and incentive pay
401(k) with robust matching and non-matching contributions
Rich medical & pharmacy benefits
100% employer-paid dental and vision benefits
Holistic wellbeing program with deep financial incentives
Generous paid time off plus 12 paid holidays and your birthday off
Culture of growth and learning: career development; tuition reimbursement; recognition program
Family support: adoption assistance, fertility treatment, child, elder & pet care assistance
Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities
Employee discount program

Fair Chance Ordinances and Criminal Background Considerations

This position requires that the applicant undergo a background check. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with any applicable federal, state or local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and/or New York Corrections Law Article 23-A.

Important Work Authorization Information

Please note, Delta Dental will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

#LI-Hybrid

ABOUT THE TEAM

At Delta Dental, we're behind millions of smiles and counting. For over 68 years, we've served our communities by increasing access to affordable, quality care - but that commitment to care extends beyond the people we serve, to the dedicated employees who make those smiles genuine. We've come this far by building fair programs that offer opportunities for advancement, create meaningful connections and improve the lives of our employees and their families. Because we know that when we take exceptional care of each other, we can make a positive impact for all.

We champion an inspirational workplace through our commitment to trust, service, excellence and innovation. Joining us means working for a company that offers stability and balance, opportunities for leadership at all levels, and a work environment focused on teamwork and camaraderie.

Discover the smiling faces behind Delta Dental and experience our values and culture in action by connecting with us on social media. Follow Delta Dental Ins. on Facebook and Instagram, #LifeatDDins on Facebook and Instagram, Delta Dental Ins. on Twitter and Delta Dental Ins. on LinkedIn. If you've got an appetite for innovation and want to be a part of a team that's transforming the future of health care, join us!

Since 1955, we have offered comprehensive, high-quality oral health care benefits to millions of enrollees and built the strongest network of dental providers in the country. The Delta Dental of California network includes affiliates Delta Dental Insurance Company; Delta Dental of Pennsylvania; Delta Dental of New York, Inc.; Delta Dental of the District of Columbia; Delta Dental of Delaware, Inc.; and Delta Dental of West Virginia, providing dental benefits to more than 31 million people across 15 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

The company and its affiliates are part of Delta Dental Plans Association (DDPA), a not-for-profit national association based in Oak Brook, Illinois. Through our national network of Delta Dental companies, we offer dental coverage in all 50 states, Puerto Rico and other U.S. territories. We offer vision coverage through DeltaVision in 15 states and the District of Columbia. Collectively, we deliver benefits to more Americans than any other dental insurance company.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Goldberg Segalla, a dynamic and collaborative law firm with a national presence, seeks a highly motivated and organized individual to join its team as a Power BI Developer in its Buffalo, NY office. The Power BI Developer will be responsible for maintaining the existing portfolio of reports and dashboards as well as developing new work as requested, producing excellent results using both SSRS and SSIS as necessary. Other responsibilities include support and maintenance of our SQL server infrastructure.
Responsibilities:
Development :
Develop expertise in all Firm application SQL table structure and relationships and become an expert in providing data analysis and addressing issues with data integrity and reconciliations.
Develop specifications for enhancements/customizations and integrations requested by management, and the needs of business groups.
Gain familiarity with various development tools utilized by Firm
Execute customizations and integrations and perform quality assurance and regression testing of all modifications to Firm applications in test and production environment.
Maintaining detailed records, documenting procedures, assumptions, workflows, methodologies and sources of information used during all analytical tasks.
Must be comfortable with SQL and have an understanding of TSQL development including writing stored procedures, triggers, data modeling and ETL.
Strong hands on experience using Microsoft SQL Server 2016 or greater suite of development tools. (SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, SSIS Catalog)
Understanding of SQL Server security and management tools.
Full life cycle development including design, development, implementation, documentation, training, and on-going support for enterprise level applications.
Use integrated development environments and version control systems Visual Studio and SQL Server Management Studio
Support/Maintenance :
Develop expertise in Firm integration tools, design integration logic and provide second level support resolving issues with integrations.
Conduct day-to-day support and technical administration of systems, reports, integrations and associated modules.
Responsible for monitoring the performance of integration and automation taking corrective action to identify opportunities to optimize and improve system performance.
Escalate problems not resolved within reasonable time limit to infrastructure and management team and communicate affected users of the situation promptly.
Project Management:
Ability to participate and contribute on internal and external/vendor project teams for initiatives at a variety of levels.
Assume project management responsibilities on selected projects.
Review specifications for completeness and accuracy.
Create, track and update all project tasks and continually inform the department and management of the project's status.
Work with management and users to evaluate and clarify requests.
Perform an ongoing analysis of departmental development needs and make recommendations for efficient use of Firm applications.
Other duties as assigned.
Experience/Requirements: :
5 years of experience working and supporting SQL applications in an IT environment
4-year degree in an IT related field is highly preferred
3 – 5 years developing reports using SSRS
3 – 5 years using ETL tools such as SSIS
3 – 5 years using visual analytical tools such as Power BI


Benefits:
The annualized salary range for this position is $105,000 to $115,000. Actual pay may be adjusted based on experience and other job related factors permitted by law. This position also offers bonuses, and a full benefits package. Our benefits package includes, but is not limited to, health insurance, dental insurance, life insurance, a 401(k) plan, flexible spending, and more.

Goldberg Segalla isn’t merely a business—we’re a community. We value the diversity of our team and strive to create a collaborative and enjoyable culture for everyone, where leadership is rewarded, and efficiency, mutual respect, and working together for the common good are traits we all embody.

Goldberg Segalla is a national civil litigation firm with offices spanning major metro markets across the U.S., providing strategic coverage wherever our clients do business. As a firm of experienced litigators and trial attorneys, Goldberg Segalla's capabilities span business and commercial disputes, employment and labor, insurance coverage, product liability, and more. Today, our more than 400 attorneys are trusted counselors to public and private clients in key sectors and industries including construction and energy, transportation, manufacturing, retail and hospitality, and insurance.

title: Material Handler
description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a dedicated and efficient Material Handler to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the movement of materials within the warehouse, ensuring that all products are handled safely and efficiently. This role requires a strong attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Duties
Load and unload materials from trucks and containers, ensuring proper handling techniques are used.
Operate warehouse equipment such as pallet jacks and forklifts to transport materials throughout the facility.
Assist in shipping and receiving processes, verifying that all incoming and outgoing shipments are accurate.
Maintain an organized warehouse environment by properly storing materials and ensuring clear pathways for movement.
Collaborate with warehouse supervisors to optimize workflow and improve efficiency in material handling operations.
Perform regular inventory checks to ensure stock levels are maintained and report any discrepancies.
Utilize mechanical knowledge to troubleshoot minor equipment issues as they arise.
Follow all safety protocols to ensure a safe working environment for yourself and your colleagues.
Requirements
Previous experience in shipping, receiving, or warehouse operations is preferred.
Familiarity with order picking processes and materials handling techniques is advantageous.
Experience with SAP Warehouse processes and transactions
Ability to operate heavy equipment safely, including forklifts and pallet jacks.
Strong mechanical knowledge to assist with minor equipment maintenance and troubleshooting.
Experience with Data Management tools such as Tableau and/or Power BI.
Excellent organizational skills with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to lift heavy loads and stand for extended periods of time.
A proactive approach to problem-solving and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.
Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.
American Express engages with thousands of third parties to provide goods and services. To ensure we protect our brand, avoid financial impact and adhere to various laws and regulations, all high-risk third parties are subject to risk management throughout the third-party lifecycle.
The GSM Third-Party Center of Excellence (COE) Reporting & Analytics team is responsible for the data management, transformation, analysis, and visualization of insights in support of the third-party management program. This team produces reporting and analytics for various stakeholders including the Third-Party COE, AXP Business Units, Management Committees and Risk Subject Matter Experts.
Our Third-Party COE Reporting & Analytics team not only understands how process, technology and systems work, but how the information is used to generate valuable and actionable insights for our program stakeholders. So, if you’re interested in a career in analytics, machine learning and data strategy, creating breakthrough analytical products and making an impact on our internal customers and third parties, look no further.
How will you make an impact in this role?
In this role as Data Analyst, the successful candidate will be responsible for understanding analytical requirements, data transformation, applying statistical tools and ML applications and data visualization for the Third-Party COE. The candidate will drive success of the analytical reports by working closely with program stakeholders, maintaining a strong project management framework, developing transformation logic, and providing value-added reporting.
Drive Analytical capabilities in support of GSM and AXP Business Units
Analyze the existing environment and derive opportunities, recommend alternative solutions to technical problems.
Deliver high quality and accurate results in a timely manner.
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic models and systems.
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.
Propose and implement solutions to ad-hoc business problems, working independently to leverage data, drive insights, and presenting results in a clear and concise manner.
Predictive Analysis and visualization
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods.
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance
Meticulous attention to details while preserving the goal and timeframe of end products
Translate requirements into concepts and user experience design – associate with stakeholders/ business partners to enhance design suggestions.
Drive Data strategy initiatives
Minimum Qualifications
2+ years of experience in analytics.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree relevant to the industry (other credentials will be a plus)
Strong analytical bend and experience on analytics tools in Excel, Tableau, SQL, Alteryx etc.
Proficiency in dealing with large quantities of complex data and ability to derive actionable insights.
Strong communication and relationship building skills.
Prior project management experience, with proven ability to create powerful analytics and reporting is a must.
Proven strong performance behavior in previous role.
Excellent Visual Design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction – experience in developing reporting solutions towards complex multi-paneled, interactive dashboards.
Preferred Qualifications
Third-party risk reporting knowledge would be preferred.
Ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple manner to a global audience.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Collins Community Credit Union, a growing organization, is currently hiring a Power BI Developer onsite at our headquarters in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.
We're seeking a motivated individual to join our Technology and Data team. This role is responsible for working closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable dashboards and reports using Microsoft Power BI.
Essential Functions:
Demonstrate enthusiastic support of corporate mission, core values and long-term objectives. Performs duties within our bylaws, regulations, Board of Directors policies, established internal and external service standards and our work procedures.
Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards based on business requirements.
Connect to data sources, import data, and transform data for BI solutions using Power Query (M) and DAX.
Collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and other stakeholders to understand data needs.
Optimize dashboard performance and ensure best practices in report design and usability.
Maintain and update existing BI solutions as business needs evolve.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Implement row-level security and data governance as required.
Stay updated on Power BI features and roadmap to introduce new functionalities
Job Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
2–5 years of experience in Power BI development or business intelligence roles.
Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases.
Experience with data warehouses, ETL processes, and cloud platforms like Azure or AWS is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Good communication and interpersonal abilities.
Collins Community CU is dedicated to teaching you skills to make you successful! We are focused on giving you a strong network of support, professional development, and career advancement opportunities, all of this we offer because we are dedicated to your success.

We live our Core Values with Purpose and believe putting our employees first will enable and embolden them to put our membership first.

description:

Power BI Specialist

description:

Job Summary:
We are seeking a Sr. Power BI Developer to join our team! As a Sr. Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for responsible for transforming raw data into insightful and actionable reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI. This role works closely with technical teams to enhance data analytics and business intelligence strategies, with moderate autonomy in decision-making and minimal supervision, adhering to established processes. This role involves collaboration with all levels of company personnel and external contractors.
