Execute advanced DAX queries and functions within Power BI.
Generate charts and document data models, parameters, and algorithms.
Implement technical improvements to existing BI systems to enhance their performance.
Apply expertise in database design principles (e.g., multidimensional and relational databases).
Ensure compliance with clinical trial processes, GCP regulations, and company SOPs.
Respond promptly to requests for documentation or bug fixes from the Validation/Test team.
Optimize complex DAX formulas and manage environments using deployment pipelines.
Create detailed, paginated reports as needed.
Conduct unit testing and troubleshoot issues as they arise.

Experience:
Minimum of 5 years of Power BI experience.
Experience with third-party tool integration and data visualization techniques.

Strong expertise in source code, database designs, integrations, and BI architecture.
Proficient in documenting, designing, and modeling technical solutions.
In-depth knowledge of software implementation best practices and SDLC processes.
Ability to analyze system requirements, propose solutions, and implement effectively.

title: ETL Reporting Lead Administrator
description:
Role: ETL Reporting Lead Administrator
Location: Houston, TX (Hybrid)
Who are we looking for?
We are looking for 8+ years of ETL Reporting Administrator experience in PowerBI /Tableau/Cognos/ MicroStrategy/Sigma/QlikView ETL reporting Tools. Administrator is a key figure within an organization responsible for overseeing and managing the Tableau environment, ensuring its smooth operation, security, and optimal performance. Overall responsible for the overall management, maintenance, and support of an IBM Cognos Business Intelligence (BI) environment. This role ensures that businesses can effectively utilize Cognos software for reporting, analytics, and forecasting by providing seamless operation and high availability of the BI infrastructure. Ensuring the optimal performance, security, and availability of QlikView applications and data.
Technical Skills & Responsibilities:
Strong knowledge of PowerBI /Tableau/Cognos/ MicroStrategy/Sigma/QlikView including its architecture and administration.
Power BI Administrator is responsible for managing, maintaining, and optimizing an organization's Power BI environment, encompassing configuration, security, performance, and user support
Overseeing the Power BI platform, including its configuration, security, and overall health
Managing user roles, permissions, and licenses within the Power BI service to ensure appropriate access and compliance.
Connecting to and managing data sources, ensuring data quality, and implementing data governance policies.
Monitoring the performance of reports, dashboards, and datasets, and optimizing them for efficiency. This also includes capacity planning for Power BI Premium
Installing, configuring, and maintaining Power BI gateways and ensuring seamless data flow.
Providing technical assistance to end-users, debugging issues, and resolving problems related to Power BI solutions.
Creating documentation for Power BI processes and providing training to users on its administration and usage.
Working with business teams, developers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver effective Power BI solutions.
Proficiency in Power BI administration tasks and the Power BI Service.
Strong understanding of data modeling, DAX queries, and data visualization best practices.
Experience with data sources like SQL, Azure services, and APIs.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Azure DevOps is often beneficial
Administration & Support: Administering and supporting the IBM Cognos BI environment, including server management and network tasks.
Installation & Configuration: Installing, configuring, and upgrading Cognos software. This includes setting up database connections and configuring the environment for optimal performance.
Performance Monitoring & Tuning: Monitoring system performance, troubleshooting issues, and implementing solutions to ensure smooth operation. This may involve performance tuning, optimizing reports, and managing server components.
Security & Access Management: Implementing security measures, managing user access permissions, and ensuring compliance with data governance policies. This includes defining security for packages, folders, and reports.
Data Modeling & Reporting: Collaborating with business units to understand reporting requirements and implement/maintain data models and reporting standards. This includes working with Framework Manager for data modeling and package creation.
Troubleshooting & Problem Solving: Proactively finding and fixing potential security vulnerabilities and technical issues related to the Cognos environment.
Documentation & Training: Creating technical documents, documenting system setups and best practices, and providing training and support to end-users.
Installation, configuration, and maintenance of QlikView Server and Publisher components.
Monitoring server performance, capacity, and resource utilization.
Troubleshooting and resolving server-related issues.
Managing server logs and backups.
Collaborating with the infrastructure team on patch and bug fix deployments.
Managing and coordinating the deployment and publishing of QlikView applications.
Scheduling and monitoring data reloads for QlikView documents.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with document reloads and application performance.
Managing application and server licenses.
Implementing and managing QlikView security, including user access and permissions.
Managing user access credentials and connectivity to all source systems.
Handling data integration and ETL processes.
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity within the QlikView environment.
Providing support and guidance to users and developers.
Creating and maintaining administrative documentation.
Staying updated on the latest QlikView and other BI technologies.
Participating in the overall architecture and strategy for the deployment of Qlik suite of products
Install, configure, and maintain MicroStrategy environments across development, QA, and production, including monitoring system performance and implementing proactive optimization.
Manage user accounts, roles, and permissions, ensuring compliance with security policies and providing access to data.
Conduct performance testing and troubleshooting for reports, dashboards, and the overall MicroStrategy infrastructure, including SQL query optimization and VLDB properties.
Address incidents and troubleshoot issues related to server outages, project accessibility, and reporting problems, providing support to both internal and external clients.
Implement backup and disaster recovery plans, perform version upgrades, patches, and hotfixes, and maintain system documentation and logs.
Maintain correct data source availability, develop and maintain schema objects, and monitor Intelligent Cubes and caches
Automate routine administrative tasks using scripts or MicroStrategy tools.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell for automation.
Familiarity with IT systems, infrastructure, and security methodologies.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in a 24/7 support rotation and handle urgent production issues.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $50.00 - $52.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Application Question(s):
Are you comfortable working on W2?
Are you comfortable working on Hybrid mode (2 to 3 days a week) working from the office located in Houston, TX?
Years of experience do you have as an ETL Reporting Administrator experience in PowerBI /Tableau/Cognos/ MicroStrategy/Sigma/QlikView ETL reporting Tools?
Years of experience with SQL, Azure services, and APIs?
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Houston, TX 77002

title: BI Engineer I
description:
Maybe you’re bored and need a new challenge. Or you’re tired of being the lone BI person stuck in a never-ending reporting cycle with no room to think strategically. Or maybe you just want to work somewhere that values storytelling with data as much as technical chops.
Whatever the reason, we want you to know that LT is different. And not just air quotes “different,” but more like “I actually look forward to Mondays again” different.
It’s a place where you can write your own story and make a difference along the way. At LT, you’ll have the freedom and flexibility to do what you think needs to be done, and you’ll get to do it while working alongside a team of other curious individuals who love a good challenge too.
We’re currently looking to add a Power BI Engineer I to this nerd club of ours. If you’re someone who has 1-3 years of experience turning messy data into meaningful insights, we’d love to chat.
Here’s what you can expect as a Power BI Engineer I at LT:
You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams—engineers, analysts, product managers, and clients—to design, build, and maintain Power BI dashboards that actually get used (and loved).
You’ll help clients define KPIs that matter and create visual stories that make those numbers actionable.
You’ll coach clients and teammates on Power BI best practices, modern data architecture, and why “more filters” isn’t always the answer.
You’ll push beyond basic reports to help automate insights, detect anomalies, and drive business strategy with data.
You’ll keep learning—because that’s who you are—and we’ll support you with the time, tools, and resources to grow in your career.

title: On-site Power BI Data Analyst (1099 Contractor)
description:
Company Description

At Abramson Labor Group, we're not just committed to defending employee rights—we're passionate about it. Whether you're up against a small business or a corporate giant, our highly skilled team of attorneys and legal professionals are ready to fight for you. About the Role
Abramson Labor Group is seeking a Power BI Expert to join our team on a contract basis to support our business intelligence and data reporting needs. This is a temporary in-person position based at our Burbank, CA office, with a project duration of approximately 3 to 8 months.
The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in Power BI and a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights. You will be responsible for building a variety of interactive reports and dashboards, extracting and consolidating data from multiple sources, and translating business requirements into analytical solutions.

Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain visually compelling and interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.

Excellent problem-solving skills and high attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
Strong communication skills for effective presentation of findings and collaboration with team members.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Position Summary:
As a Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and optimizing our existing suite of Power BI reports and dashboards. You will leverage your deep expertise in DAX, data modeling, SQL, and Microsoft Fabric to ensure our business users have timely, accurate, and actionable insights. This role requires a strong foundation in database management systems and hands-on experience managing complex BI solutions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders across data analytics, commercial, and finance teams to continuously improve report performance and ensure our reporting infrastructure aligns with business needs.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Data Analysis and Modeling: Conduct thorough analysis of business requirements and data sources to design efficient data models that support reporting and analytics needs.
Maintain and Enhance Reports: Manage, update, and optimize existing Power BI dashboards and reports to ensure data accuracy and peak performance
Database Management: Develop a solid understanding of underlying database structures and data pipelines that feed Power BI, ensuring reliability and integrity of data sources.
Data Visualization: Utilize best practices in data visualization to effectively communicate insights and trends to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
DAX & Query Development: Write, debug, and optimize complex DAX calculations and Power Query transformations for advanced reporting scenarios.
Performance Optimization: Diagnose and resolve performance bottlenecks in Power BI datasets and reports; implement best practices for data model design and query efficiency.
Fabric & SQL Integration: Leverage Microsoft Fabric and advanced SQL skills to unify disparate data sources and streamline dataflows into Power BI.
Collaboration: Partner with BI analysts, data engineers, and business stakeholders to translate evolving business requirements into robust, scalable BI solutions.
Documentation & Governance: Maintain clear documentation of data models, reports, processes, and best practices to support governance and team knowledge sharing.
Support & Training: Provide troubleshooting support for Power BI users and deliver knowledge sessions to promote self-service analytics where appropriate
Continuous Improvement: Stay up to date with Microsoft Fabric, Power BI features, and industry best practices to proactively recommend improvements.
Requirements
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related STEM field.
2+ years of full-time, professional experience developing and maintaining complex Power BI reports and dashboards. Advanced proficiency in DAX, Power Query, and SQL.
Strong understanding of database management systems and data warehousing concepts.
Practical experience with Microsoft Fabric and integrating multiple data sources.
Solid skills in Python programming for data processing, automation, or advanced analytics workflows.
Demonstrated ability to optimize Power BI datasets, queries, and report performance.
Proven background in data analytics or business intelligence, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities.
Experience in the spirits or consumer packaged goods (CPG) industry is a plus, but not required.
Benefits
Highly competitive compensation packages-Range $70-85k+10% annual bonus
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
Matching 401(k) plan
Yearly wellness stipend (gym membership or fitness classes)
Generous holiday and vacation policy

title: Reporting BI Developer
description:
Compensation: $85,000 to $105,000 annually
POSITION SUMMARY
Cardone Ventures is seeking a data-driven and analytical Reporting & BI Developer to join our fast-growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining dynamic dashboards, data visualizations, and automated reporting solutions that provide critical insights to stakeholders across the organization. You will work closely with business leaders and data teams to turn complex data sets into clear, actionable intelligence that drives strategic decisions.
ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES
Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.

SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE
Accurate and timely reports and dashboards that empower data-driven decision-making
Streamlined, automated reporting processes that reduce manual data work
High adoption and satisfaction from internal teams using BI tools
Clear and actionable data stories that align with business objectives
Consistently clean, reliable, and well-documented data models and visualizations

OBJECTIVES
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into reporting solutions
Automate and optimize existing reporting workflows for scalability and efficiency
Integrate data from multiple sources (CRM, financial, operational) into cohesive reports
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability across all reporting platform
Continuously monitor performance of BI solutions and recommend improvements
Support ad-hoc data analysis and deliver insights to cross-functional teams

COMPETENCIES
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases
Understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Ability to interpret complex data sets and present findings in a clear and concise manner
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across departments
Familiarity with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and cloud platforms (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift)
Experience integrating and analyzing data from CRM and financial systems

EDUCATION
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
3–5 years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or reporting roles
Relevant certifications in BI platforms or data analysis tools are a plus

10X TOTAL REWARDS
We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time employees that includes:
Medical, dental, and vision for FT positions and their dependents
Vacation and sick time policy that increases based on tenure with the company
Three work from home days per month (4/month during June-August)
Employee Assistance Program through Guardian
401k with up to 3% Company match
Pet Insurance through SPOT for your 10X pets!
Competitive parental leave policy: 100% paid - 8 weeks for primary caregiver, and 4 weeks for secondary caregiver + 1 month remote for both
Employee wellness initiatives including a 100% paid for gym membership and access to discounts on local meal prep services
Professional Development through reimbursements for courses/certifications outside of CV, and a 10X Mentorship Program
Continued Education: we provide team members complete access to our range of educational resources valued at over $250,000 in areas such as Sales, Operations, People, Finance and Marketing
Uncapped Commission Potential: all of our team members have the opportunity to sell our Products/Services (and are trained on how to do so). We have several examples of non-sales team members earning well over $20,000 in annual commission

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.
Equal Opportunity Employer
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Overview:
i3 is searching for a Power BI Developer to support the Missile Defense Agency Information Management and Software Services (AIMSS) effort. The mission is to design and implement a Missile Defense System with multiple layers of protection. The Power BI Developer is responsible for the design, development, testing, verifying, sustaining and fully documenting developed software. This position is located at Redstone Arsenal in Huntsville, AL.
Responsibilities:
Design and build BI dashboards and reporting solutions from the ground up, focusing on impactful insights and user-friendly experiences.
Maintain detailed technical documentation and create release notes for new features.
Monitor technological updates and emerging products. Provide recommendations for BI enhancement roadmap.
Support partners around the business through feedback and coaching as they adopt and integrate with our BI products.
Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, align priorities, and ensure reporting solutions meet business needs
Develops complex software applications involving graphical front-end interfaces, visualization toolsets, SQL Database interfaces, multi-user GUI interfaces, and rule base assessments.
Works with application Product Owner to decompose Use Case entities into implemental software requirements.
Performs software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software reviews, software risk analysis, and software reliability analysis.
Performs analysis on new software developments and revisions to existing systems to enhance system efficiencies.
Responsible for software testing and user/system requirements verification/validation processes and procedures.
Troubleshoots production problems related to deployment of software applications.
Evaluates implemented requirements in software to determine if these requirements were met in deliverable software.
Assists in the evaluation and recommendation of application integration and testing tools.
Participates in development of software user manuals and technical reports.
Works with project leads, developers, and end users to ensure application designs meet business requirements.
Understands MDA test processes related to data management, scheduling, planning and commitments across all types of tests.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related technical field. Additional experience may substitute for degree.
Minimum 10-14 years of relevant experience.
Working knowledge of current systems and applications.
Practical experience with data modeling, data design, database programming and data analytics.
Knowledge of database systems, as well as exposure to ETL software tools including best practices and methodologies.
Knowledge and/or experience in:
Translating data into informative visuals and reports.
Technical change management when it applies to business data that is under data governance.
Data and data domains.
Experience in data warehouse implementations.
Active Secret clearance required. Must be able to maintain the security clearance required for this position.
Approved DoD 8140 certification.
Must reside within a 50-mile radius of Redstone Arsenal in Huntsville AL or be willing to relocate prior to start date.
Ability to reliably commute to the office as business needs dictate.
U.S. Citizenship.
Knowledge/Skills
Knowledge of office administration and procedures.
Exceptional judgment capabilities and relationship management skills.
Excellent communication, teamwork, and client service skills; ability to clearly communicate in discussions and written documents, and to deliver feedback clearly and tactfully.
Interact with a diverse array of customers and staff in a professional and courteous manner.
Work independently with accountability for accurate and complete results.
Be extremely organized and exceptionally detail oriented.
Work well both independently and in a team environment.
Be energized by a fast-paced work environment.
Must be able to communicate with others effectively.
Analyze information and respond appropriately.
Manage time wisely and prioritize tasks.
Provide superior customer service.
Multi-task in a pleasant manner.
Work well under pressure.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Regular i3 hours are 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Monday-Friday, however, additional hours may be required on occasion. Regular and punctual attendance is required.
About i3:
i3 is a technically diverse, 100% team member owned business, headquartered in Huntsville, Alabama specializing in missile and aviation systems engineering and logistic services, electronic warfare and electromagnetic effects analysis, UAS system integration and flight operations, full lifecycle C5ISR engineering services, cybersecurity and IT/IA innovative solutions and virtual training, simulation & serious game development and implementation. We have established a broad offering of products and capabilities collectively providing decades of experience supporting the full complement of DoD military services, Missile Defense Agency, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, and a variety of other Government organizations and private industry customers.

Perks of being a team member owner include:
Long-term financial security
Higher job satisfaction
Greater job security
Personal and professional growth
Great company culture
Other outstanding benefits:
Excellent insurance coverage
401(k) match
Generous PTO
Health and wellness incentives
Tuition and certification reimbursement
Countless opportunities to give back to the community through i3 Cares
We work hard. We compete hard. We play hard. Apply now to join us!

title: BI Developer
description:
This position is 100% onsite.
The BI Developer will extract, analyze, and visualize data from PIH Health’s electronic health records (EHR), financial systems, and operational systems to identify trends, optimize workflows, and enhance patient outcomes.
PIH Health is a nonprofit, regional healthcare network that serves approximately 3 million residents in the Los Angeles County, Orange County and San Gabriel Valley region. The fully integrated network is comprised of PIH Health Downey Hospital, PIH Health Good Samaritan Hospital, PIH Health Whittier Hospital, 37 outpatient medical office buildings, a multispecialty medical (physician) group, home healthcare services and hospice care, as well as heart, cancer, digestive health, orthopedics, women’s health, urgent care and emergency services. The organization is nationally recognized for excellence in patient care and patient experience, and the College of Healthcare Information Management Executives (CHIME) has identified PIH Health as one of the nation’s top hospital systems for best practices, cutting-edge advancements, quality of care and healthcare technology. For more information, visit PIHHealth.org or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram.

Required Skills
Develop end-to-end ETL solutions.
Participate in requirements gathering and design sessions.
Create applications for processing financial and other transactions using ETL, SQL, and Web Services.
Design self-cleanup ETL processes and enhance existing ETL processes for better performance.
Develop reusable transformations, SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions.
Conduct feasibility studies and proof of concepts.
Implement data validation, data management, and file management processes using various scripting languages.
Design, develop, validate, and test reports, dashboards, and data extracts using tools like Excel, Tableau, Power BI, SSRS, and other BI platforms
Translate complex technical concepts and analytical findings for both technical and non-technical audiences, supporting collaboration and decision-making
Monitor BI outputs, identify performance issues, and implement optimizations to improve efficiency and accuracy
Analyze large sets of healthcare data, including EHRs, clinical, and financial data, to generate insights and recommendations
Improve documentation, scheduling, and administrative workflows to enhance operational efficiency and reduce errors
Participate in data validation, QA efforts, and analytics development to ensure accurate and reliable reporting solutions
Manage the BI object inventory, ensuring metadata is meaningful, standardized, accurate, and consistently updated


Required Experience
Required:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field or equivalent experience will be accepted in lieu of the required degree or diploma.
3 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a healthcare or hospital setting.
Strong SQL skills – ability to write and optimize queries to extract and manipulate data.
Proficiency in Tableau and/or Power BI for data visualization and dashboard development.

Preferred:
Master's degree in healthcare, Analytics, Data Science or related field.
Experience with Electronic Health Records (EHR’s) preferably PIH Health EHRs
Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g. Azure, AWS) and big data technologies
Experience with Python, R, or SAS for data analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.
Knowledge of ETL processes, data warehouses, and interoperability standards (HL7, FHIR, CCD, etc.) is preferred.

description:

You will develop dynamic dashboards, deliver insights from large telecom datasets, and support teams in areas such as customer retention, network quality, and revenue optimization.

title: Power Platform Developer
description:
Andworx is hiring a Power Platform Developer to provide expertise creating impactful and transformative solutions with the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) in support of a Federal Government client. As a candidate, you have strong technical skills with the ability to make visually pleasing low code/no code solutions and be able to construct rich data visualizations using the Microsoft Power Platform. You are highly organized and will be responsible for working with business subject matter experts and key stakeholders to understand customer business processes, objectives, and needs to provide timely and effective solutions. This position is currently remote, but candidates should live within a commutable distance to Falls Church, VA as there will be occasional requirements to meet with the team and work out of our headquarters and attend in-person functions.

Requirements

6 years' experience building technical solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power BI, Power Automate, Dataverse etc.).

Ability to make solutions look good – attention to UX/UI design and solutions that are visually pleasing to users.

Power Platform Fundamentals

Power Platform Solution Architect
Experience integrating with industry leading cloud platforms.

As a Microsoft Power Platform Developer, the candidate will leverage their blend of business analysis, organization, communication, and technical skills, to perform the following:

Andworx gets things done! We are a collaborative team of digital transformation experts and IT professionals who have an entrepreneurial mindset. We ignite the enthusiasm of our customers by delivering innovative, creative, and high-quality solutions, all paired with unparalleled services.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Company Description

At i360technologies, we’re invested in your success.
We offer competitive pay, robust benefits for full-time employees, and meaningful opportunities for professional development—just a few of the reasons why i360 is a great place to grow your career.

Founded in 1999, i360technologies is a fast-growing GOVCON professional services firm. We’re seeking motivated individuals who thrive in a dynamic environment and bring strategic problem-solving skills, a strong work ethic, and a positive, team-first attitude.

If you’re passionate about solving complex business challenges, technology implementation and are motivated to learn new technologies, you’ll find a home here.

Job Description

There are two task areas: 1) Report development; 2) Report Maintenance
Report development involves the following:
Identifying required data and its relationships within the enterprise system.
Note: The enterprise system will usually be related to Oracle Federal Financials, Azure-based .net developed systems, or the EFI Pace production management system. These enterprise systems will either have an Oracle database or a SQL Server database backend.
Once the data is known, the process of establishing and synchronizing data feeds to the Synapse Data Lake will be coordinated with the enterprise service bus team. If the data already exists within the Data Lake, then adding the fields to the semantic model will be done in Power Bl.
Once the semantic model is available, report development can be coordinated iteratively with the business unit staff until it is accepted and pushed to production.
Ad hoc Development: Business Units can and will request specific reports to suit their business needs, whether for reporting to upper management or producing reports for auditors. These could be enhancements or modifications of a previously developed report, or they could be something entirely new. These requests could come at any time during the contract year.
New report development will be done in Power BI, a cloud-based offering with application and infrastructure support provided by Microsoft.
Support work is currently underway to establish additional reports in Power BI, continuing the efforts to move away from Business Objects.

Qualifications
General report development using Power BI (Azure Synapse).
Knowledge of Business Objects is preferred but not required.
Must possess in-depth experience and understanding of Microsoft Azure Synapse, Microsoft Power BI report development and maintenance.
Five years or more of experience on projects that are similar to the requirements (reports development and maintenance)

Additional Information

Benefits
Referral Bonus
(401k) Matching
Eleven Paid Holidays
Adoption Assistance
Tuition Reimbursement
Technology Reimbursement
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Paid Time Off (0-3 years: 15 Days | 3+ years 20 Days)
Perks at Work – Employee perks program to help you live a better, healthier life.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or status within any other protected group.
Only Direct Hires - No recruiting or staffing firms’ submissions will be considered.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated BI Analyst / Reporting Specialist to join our Business Intelligence team. This role is designed for someone who is passionate about translating data into actionable insights, delivering clean, intuitive Power BI reports, and collaborating directly with department users to solve real-world business problems. You will work within a structured data warehouse environment, using curated data models. Your focus will be report building, visualization, documentation, data analysis and user engagement across business units. This is an in office position.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:
1–3 years of experience in a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or equivalent reporting role.
Hands-on Power BI development experience (measures, visuals, slicers, bookmarks).
Proficiency with DAX fundamentals (calculations, filters, time intelligence).
Ability to gather and translate business requirements into visuals.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic SQL coding and SQL Server (SSMS) knowledge (comfortable querying tables and views).
Ability to take ownership of projects and be self-directed.
Ability to interact with generative AI to assist in workflow, code debugging, and in other areas where AI may be of value.
BA/BS degree in computer science, information technology or related field preferred, but not required.
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Power BI Development
Create compelling and accurate Power BI dashboards and paginated reports.
Leverage existing semantic models and datasets to ensure consistency and reusability.
Apply visualization best practices (layout, interactivity, accessibility, KPIs).
Business User Engagement
Meet with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs.
Gather requirements and iterate based on feedback.
Document report logic and usage guides for business users.
Data Accuracy & Support
Work with various departments and business analysts to determine data needs and fulfill those needs as required.
Validate report data against source systems or business expectations.
Escalate potential data quality issues to senior BI developers.
Provide first-line support for basic Power BI usage or data inquiries.
Documentation & Standards
Maintain a report inventory with business definitions
Create onboarding and support materials for recurring report use.
Contribute to BI team efforts to drive data literacy and adoption.
Requirements:
WHAT YOU'LL NEED:
1–3 years of experience in a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or equivalent reporting role.
Hands-on Power BI development experience (measures, visuals, slicers, bookmarks).
Proficiency with DAX fundamentals (calculations, filters, time intelligence).
Ability to gather and translate business requirements into visuals.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic SQL coding and SQL Server (SSMS) knowledge (comfortable querying tables and views).
Ability to take ownership of projects and be self-directed.
Ability to interact with generative AI to assist in workflow, code debugging, and in other areas where AI may be of value.
BA/BS degree in computer science, information technology or related field preferred, but not required

title: Senior Power BI Analyst
description:
Location:
Palo Alto
San Francisco

Wilson Sonsini is the premier legal advisor to technology, life sciences, and other growth enterprises worldwide. We represent companies at every stage of development, from entrepreneurial start-ups to multibillion-dollar global corporations, as well as the venture firms, private equity firms, and investment banks that finance and advise them. The firm has approximately 1,100 attorneys in 17 offices: 13 in the U.S., two in China, and two in Europe. Our broad spectrum of practices and entrepreneurial spirit allow our staff exceptional opportunities for professional achievement and career growth.
We are seeking a Senior Power BI Analyst to join the Finance Technology team at the firm. This position is available as a hybrid work schedule.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Power BI Development: Design, develop, and maintain advanced Power BI reports, dashboards, and data models that meet the needs of various stakeholders.
Data Integration: Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into Power BI, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
SQL Expertise: Utilize strong SQL skills to query and manipulate data from databases and other sources to support reporting requirements.
SSRS Reports: Develop and enhance SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) reports to complement Power BI solutions when necessary.
Data Modeling: Create and optimize data models in Power BI to ensure efficient data analysis and visualization.
Mentorship: Act as a mentor to junior developers and analysts, providing guidance and training in Power BI best practices.
Lead Implementation: Lead the end-to-end implementation of Power BI projects, from requirements gathering to deployment, ensuring successful outcomes.
Performance Optimization: Identify and implement performance improvements in existing Power BI solutions to enhance efficiency and user experience.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.
Stay Current: Stay up-to-date with the latest Power BI features, trends, and best practices, and apply them to improve our reporting capabilities.
Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
6+ years of proven experience as a Power BI Developer, with a strong portfolio of Power BI reports and dashboards.
Expertise in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Proficiency in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services).
Strong data modeling skills.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Effective communication and mentoring skills.
Experience leading and managing Power BI projects.
Certifications in Power BI are a plus.

The primary location for this job posting is in Palo Alto, but other locations may be listed. The actual base pay offered will depend upon a variety of factors, including but not limited to the selected candidate’s qualifications, years of relevant experience, level of education, professional certifications and licenses, and work location. The anticipated pay range for this position is as follows:
San Francisco and Silicon Valley: $116,875 – $158,125 per year
The compensation for this position may include a discretionary year-end merit bonus based on performance. We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package.
Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

title: Healthcare Strategy Analyst, Corporate Strategy
description:
Baptist Health is the region’s largest not-for-profit healthcare organization, with 12 hospitals, over 28,000 employees, 4,500 physicians and 200 outpatient centers, urgent care facilities and physician practices across Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward and Palm Beach counties. With internationally renowned centers of excellence in cancer, cardiovascular care, orthopedics and sports medicine, and neurosciences, Baptist Health is supported by philanthropy and driven by its faith-based mission of medical excellence. For 25 years, we’ve been named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For, and in the 2024-2025 U.S. News & World Report Best Hospital Rankings, Baptist Health was the most awarded healthcare system in South Florida, earning 45 high-performing honors.
What truly sets us apart is our people. At Baptist Health, we create personal connections with our colleagues that go beyond the workplace, and we form meaningful relationships with patients and their families that extend beyond delivering care. Many of us have walked in our patients’ shoes ourselves and that shared experience fuels out commitment to compassion and quality. Our culture is rooted in purpose, and every team member plays a part in making a positive impact – because when it comes to caring for people, we’re all in.
Description:

The Healthcare Strategy Analyst serves an important role in the strategic framework development for Baptist Health South Florida, supporting enterprise strategy, analytics, and research. Works collaboratively in a team-based environment, is the analytic lead in the assessment and understating of internal business dynamics, external market drivers, and the quantification of current offerings and future opportunities. Develops, maintains and updates utilization, capacity and competitive databases to improve decision-making. Responsible for data mining, including collecting and synthesizing information from a variety of sources, routine ad hoc reporting, interpreting findings, and tracking performance. Assists with the development and monitoring of business plans, operational improvement initiatives, and financial analysis spanning the current and future continuum of service offerings and markets across South Florida. Maintains databases and software applications to ensure data accuracy, analytic integrity, and reporting validity. Estimated salary range for this position is $68813.24 - $89457.21 / year depending on experience.
Qualifications:

Degrees:
Bachelors.
Additional Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Health Services Administration, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics required.
Three years of quantitative analytic experience required, healthcare consulting, market research and analysis, or financial analysis preferred.
A Master's Degree in Business Administration or Health Services Administration is preferred and may be substituted for experience.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite required.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel or Access preferred.
Advanced data analytic skills to impact key business decisions required.
Experience in using business intelligence, competitive analyses, forecasting and visualization/mapping tools a plus, including Tableau, Premier, Advisory, SG2 or Diveport.
Highly motivated, detail-oriented complex problem solver, with an ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Exceptionally strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills required.
Some experience in organizational design, functional and business process design and improvement preferred.
Minimum Required Experience: 3 Years

EOE, including disability/vets

title: Lead BI Engineer
description:
Lead BI Engineer – Mortgage Banking (Onsite – Dallas, TX)
We are seeking a Lead BI Engineer to support a large-scale Data Modernization program in the Mortgage Bankingdomain. This is a hands-on, onsite role based in Dallas, TX focused on refactoring and modernizing BI reports using modern platforms and semantic models.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the migration and refactoring of legacy BI reports (e.g., SSRS, Excel-based) to modern platforms such as Power BI and Sigma
Redesign reports to leverage newly built semantic models and standardized data definitions
Collaborate with BI Architects, Data Modelers, and Data Engineers to ensure consistency and alignment with enterprise data architecture
Optimize report performance, implement governed self-service capabilities, and enforce role-based access control
Engage business stakeholders to validate functionality and support user adoption
Required Qualifications:
7+ years of BI development experience, including 2+ years in a lead role
Proven experience in BI report migration and refactoring projects as part of data platform modernization
Hands-on expertise with Power BI, Sigma, and legacy tools such as SSRS
Strong understanding of semantic models, DAX/SQL, and cloud-based data platforms
Experience in the mortgage banking or financial services industry is highly preferred
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
Location: Must be available to work onsite in Dallas, TX

title: Power BI Developer/Analyst
description:
JOB SUMMARY
Monday - Friday 8AM - 5PM
The Business Intelligence Architect is responsible for the design, development, implementation, and support of business analytics reports and dashboards. The Business Intelligence Architect is responsible for providing timely and accurate business information, via various reporting solutions, based upon metrics, sales and financial information. This will empower Group CBS employees to more easily make data-driven management decisions. The position will be responsible for generating and delivering reports and data analysis reviews. This work requires a solid understanding of Group CBS business processes, existing reports, and BI tools. The position involves technically rigorous work, including the use of data analysis technologies.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: May be modified from time to time. Other duties may be assigned.
Develop, test, and deploy complex reports using business intelligence technologies.
Work with the user community to ascertain reporting requirements and then develop proper methods for extracting and displaying the data to the user in the form of reports or dashboards, identifying gaps in customer requirements and developing innovative solutions.
Required to test and ensure accuracy of various Group CBS reporting data points identifying and possibly combining/reducing redundant data sources
Maintain deep knowledge of Group CBS products and databases and reporting technologies.
Required to gain specialized knowledge of current procedures and facilitate the definition of report requirements.
Identify data sources and the appropriate data fields to use for reporting needs.
Collaborating with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery.
Design, develop and implement a wide array of standardized and ad hoc reports from various reporting platforms such as BI, SalesForce, NetSuite, ADP.
Serve as a liaison to the leadership team for reporting requests and data analytics.
Demonstrate knowledge of BI and data warehousing
Gain a high-level understanding of Group CBS operational functions (i.e. sales order processing, purchasing, inventory management, shipping, and accounting) and the related software interaction.
Other tasks may also be required from time to time, at the discretion of management, in order to achieve department and company objectives.

METRICS
Business Intelligence Architects are required to complete reports & development commitments and are expected to conduct requirements analysis and presentation design of data quality. They will be measured by the quality of their work and on how effectively they accomplish their tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS
It is essential that a candidate possesses or can quickly acquire the necessary knowledge of the following systems which are crucial to the business:
Windows
Microsoft Office
Excel proficiency
MS SQL Server
Halo BI
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
MS Visual Studio
Data warehousing
Data Mining (plus)

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS REQUIRED
Ability to multi-task
Ability to work at fast pace
Attention to detail
Ability to solve complex problems
Ability to quickly learn and apply new technical
Ability to make and keep commitments to the team
Ability to work effectively with little or no supervision
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Interpersonal skills are a must
Sensitive to user needs

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
AS, AAS, BS or equivalent degree in Business or Management of Information Systems (MIS) with 3 to 5 years related experience and/or training.

title: Risk Management – Risk Reporting – Analyst
description:
Join JPMorgan Chase's Risk Management and Compliance team, where your expertise will be pivotal in maintaining our strength and resilience. You'll be tasked with anticipating emerging risks and using your judgement to address challenges impacting our company, customers, and communities. Our culture encourages innovative thinking and challenges the status quo, striving for excellence in all we do.
As an Analyst within the External Risk Reporting (ERR) team, you will play a crucial role in delivering complete, accurate, and timely risk metrics to US regulators, including the FRB, OCC, and FDIC. You will collaborate with stakeholders in Regulatory Strategy, Credit Risk Management, Operations, Finance, and Technology to streamline reporting processes and execute robust controls in a fast-paced environment. You will prepare report content, analyze reporting data, manage follow-up actions, and track, escalate, and remediate data issues, ensuring the highest standards of data quality.
Job Responsibilities
Prepare, Verify and Execute processes and workflows to gather and analyze data, ensuring our reports are accurate and insightful.
Collaborate, Connect and Work alongside a dynamic team to aggregate data from multiple sources and present it in a way that tells a compelling story.
Embrace change and quickly adapt to new reporting processes, ensuring we stay ahead in a fast-paced environment.
Monitor data quality controls and document processes to maintain the highest standards in our reporting.
Support Compliance and assist in preparing relevant documentation that supports reporting results and adheres to internal policies and standards.
Required qualifications, skills and capabilities
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, IT, Economics or a related field.
Analytical Mindset, ability to understand regulatory requirements and business drivers, and a curiosity that looks for the story behind the data.
Detail oriented approach within large datasets to verify accuracy of data and effectiveness of processes.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel, and familiarity with data analysis tools (e.g. Alteryx, Tableau).
Excellent interpersonal skills to work seamlessly within a team on both individual and shared responsibilities.
A presence that commands attention and effectively communicates with colleagues, stakeholders and management, both written and verbal.
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines with exceptional organizational skills.
Preferred qualifications, skills and capabilities
1 plus years experience within a risk, financial, and/or reporting environment is preferred.
Hands on experience with data analysis tools is a plus.

title: Assistant/Associate Engineer, Analytics Management - Power BI (Remote)
description:
Company Description

As a member of the Analytics Management team, this position is responsible for executing the development & support of our BI solutions. This position will work closely with our business partners & BI technical leads ensuring solutions meet their objectives including oversight of project delivery as well as management of day-to-day support activities

What Will You Be Doing?
Team up with the engineering teams, Business Analysis project members, and business partners to design and develop new Snowflake Views and Power BI objects including Dashboards, Reporting, and Apps among others.
Provide technical requirements for implementation of Snowflake and Power BI objects
Learn and support current on prem BI tools and processes while migrating to new Cloud tools
Work with Project Management to communicate timely estimates, updates, project status, and lead communication to project participants
Work in a fast-paced Agile/Scrum environment
Document and establish standards for best practices
What Do You Need To Bring?
1-3+ years of experience in a BI Engineering role, specifically Power BI
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred, or combination of education and experience
Strong organization, communication, and collaboration skills
Experience with retail industry, with focus on analytics, architecture and/or Business Intelligence
Strong understanding of data management principles
Personal Attributes: Self-starter, Collaborative, Curious, Strong work ethic, highly motivated, Team oriented
Experience designing and building BI Semantic layer models in an agile environment
Hands-on experience with Cloud technologies and open source technologies
Experience working with end users in a support style environment
Experience with new system implementation and change management
Demonstrated ability in developing a culture that embraces innovation, and challenges existing paradigms
Knowledgeable in DAX and SQL
Ability to identify usage scenarios and patterns for BI solutions
Experience with other BI reporting solutions such as OBIEE and Tableau nice to have
Our Company
Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a global, digitally led omnichannel specialty retailer of apparel and accessories catering to kids through millennials with assortments curated for their specific lifestyle needs.
The company operates a family of brands, including Abercrombie & Fitch, YPB, abercrombie kids, Hollister and Gilly Hicks, each sharing a commitment to offer products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that support global customers on their journey to being and becoming who they are. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates over 750 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites abercrombie.com, abercrombiekids.com, and hollisterco.com.
At Abercrombie & Fitch Co., we lead with purpose and always put our people first. We’re proud to offer equitable compensation and benefits, including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off, as well as education and engagement events, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities.
Benefits & Perks
As an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F Co. is committed to providing competitive and comprehensive benefits that align with our company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward:
Incentive bonus program
Annual companywide review process
Flexible spending accounts
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Life and disability insurance
Associate assistance program
Paid parental and adoption leave
Access to fertility and adoption benefits through Carrot
Access to mental health and wellness app, Headspace
Paid time off and one paid volunteer day per year, allowing you to give back to your community
Work from anywhere (Mondays and Fridays are “work from anywhere” days for most roles and six work from anywhere weeks per year)
Seven associate wellness half days per year
Merchandise discount on all of our brands
Opportunities for career advancement, we believe in promoting from within
Access to multiple Associate Resource Groups
Global team of people who will celebrate you for being YOU!

Additional Information

ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
This role allows for remote work across the U.S.. Therefore, in states and cities that require the hourly or salary compensation or pay range to be included in a job posting, the recruiting pay range for this position is $71,000 - $83,000. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, your years of experience, your work location, comparison to other employees in similar or related roles, or market demands. The range may be modified in the future.

title: Data Analyst, Transformation
description:
About Us
At Cast & Crew, we’ve empowered creativity and supported the global entertainment industry for decades. Together with our family of brands - Backstage, CAPS, Checks & Balances, Final Draft, Media Services, Sargent-Disc, and The TEAM Companies – we operate as a combined entertainment technology and services provider offering industry standard screenwriting accounting software, digital payroll products, data & reporting, and a host of creative tools. The industry continues to move faster than ever, and the need for our expertise, our technology, and our people has never been greater. We are a production’s best ally every step of the way. #OneCastOneCrew
Position Overview
Cast & Crew is seeking a Transformation Data Analyst who will report to Chief Transformation Officer (CTrO) and support the Director, Program Management in managing the Transformation Office (TO) by enabling effective delivery, reporting, and data-driven decision-making across the transformation portfolio. The analyst will build and manage dashboards, performance metrics, and reporting processes to provide insights that support transformation governance. This role often involves collaboration with cross-functional teams, data modeling, and ensuring data accuracy and integrity.

Be a part of an organization that is modernizing and transforming it’s platforms, processes, and skills to accelerate business strategy.
Core Responsibilities
Requirements:
Dashboard & Reporting: Design, build, and maintain executive dashboards and detailed reports aligned with transformation goals, using Power BI, Tableau, Monday.com, or similar data visualization tools.
Performance Measurement: Develop and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track the effectiveness of transformation initiatives, including identifying data sources.
Data Analysis and Interpretation: Collect and analyze diverse data sources, identifying trends, and extracting insights to support business transformation efforts. Translate complex data into clear, concise insights for stakeholders.
Data Modeling and Documentation: Creating and maintaining data models, data dictionaries, and documentation to ensure data integrity and consistency.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with engineers and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for reporting improvements, translating them into actionable insights, and communicate findings effectively.
Problem-Solving: Identifying and resolving data quality issues, troubleshooting data discrepancies, and recommending solutions.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to improve data collection, reporting processes, and PMO tools. Collaborate to standardize best practices.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required; degree in business analytics, computer science, mathematics or science preferred but not required
2-3+ years in project or data analysis, business intelligence, project/portfolio operations or PMO roles.
Strong experience with project-tracking tools, relevant programming languages, and data visualization tools, such as Excel, Smartsheet, Monday.com, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and data governance principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and draw meaningful conclusions.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Possess discretion and sensitivity towards confidential information
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw conclusions.
Understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and techniques.
Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines.
Special Work Conditions
Sedentary – Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Some positions may entail exerting up to 15 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force to lift, carry, push, or pull.
Benefits
Cast & Crew provides a comprehensive package of employee benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, health and wellness programs, employee discounts, and more! Note: Cast & Crew benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.
Cast & Crew is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.
CA residents
Your personal information may be collected in connection with certain services provided by Cast & Crew or its affiliated companies. A summary of your California privacy rights can be found at:
https://www.castandcrew.com/privacy-policy/
Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs. Compensation range for candidates in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. The compensation range for this position is: $80,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Description

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Power BI Developer to join our Data & Analytics team. This role involves managing and optimizing our Power BI environment to support business intelligence and data analytics across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including technical and business units, to develop insightful data solutions that enhance data-driven decision-making.

How You Will Help

Report & Dashboard Development
Design and develop interactive, user-friendly Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights.
Implement row-level security (RLS), DAX calculations, and performance optimization for efficient dashboard functionality.
Lead BI projects from requirements gathering to deployment, ensuring alignment between business needs and technical execution.
Build optimized data models (star/snowflake schemas) and integrate with diverse data sources, including Snowflake, SharePoint, D365 (CE/FO/BC), Azure, Microsoft One Lake, Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Warehouse), SQL Server, and external APIs.
Connect to and transform Dynamics 365 data (e.g., Dataverse, OData feeds, APIs) for analytics consumption in Power BI.
Maintain and enhance existing dashboards, ensuring they meet current business needs.
Power BI Administration
Manage user access to Power BI resources, including workspaces, datasets, reports, and apps.
Monitor and optimize Power BI and Fabric capacity for peak performance and efficient resource utilization.
Enforce security policies, data governance standards, and best practices to maintain a secure and scalable Power BI and Fabric environment.
User Support & Engagement
Troubleshoot and resolve user access, security, connection, data errors, and report rendering issues.
Investigate and clarify KPI and metric-related queries in existing dashboards.
Provide continuous guidance and support to users, promoting self-service analytics adoption.
Gather user feedback to ensure Power BI adapts to evolving organizational needs.
Training & Documentation
Develop and deliver training materials and workshops to educate users on Power BI capabilities.
Create and maintain user documentation, including FAQs, how-to guides, and best practices for effective Power BI utilization.
Document and promote modern data practices within Microsoft Fabric, including the usage of One Lake and workspace governance.

What You Will Bring

Excellent communication and collaboration skills to engage effectively with end-users, BI teams, and cross-functional stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree, in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
5+ years of experience in Power BI development and administration.
Strong proficiency in Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Power Query, DAX, and data gateway management.
SQL expertise with experience working in Snowflake, Azure Synapse, AWS Redshift, or other cloud data warehouses.
Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience working with Microsoft Fabric, including Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, Data Factory, and Notebooks.
Experience with Microsoft SSRS, Microsoft Copilot, Power Automate, and Power Apps is a plus.
Familiarity with Direct Query and Import strategies for D365 data sources.
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric governance, security roles, and deployment of pipelines is a plus.
Microsoft Power BI certification or related credentials are a plus.
Prior experience in the manufacturing industry is a plus.


Compensation

The base salary range for this position is $105,000.00 - $130,000.00 USD annually*.

The salary range for this position reflects a reasonable estimate of the range of compensation for this role. ASC Engineered Solutions’ philosophy on compensation is based on careful consideration of additional factors such as (but not limited to) an individual’s education, training, work experience, job-related skill set, location, and industry knowledge, as well as the scope and responsibilities of the position and market considerations.

About ASC Engineered Solutions
Following the 2019 merger of Anvil International and Smith-Cooper International, the unified company relaunched in March 2021 as ASC Engineered Solutions. Under a single name and logo, ASC Engineered Solutions continues our focus on improving the customer experience every day and striving to deliver service excellence.

The evolved ASC Engineered Solutions brand reinforces a focus on what matters most to customers: quality. As a solutions provider, this quality is reflected in our precision-engineered products, support and knowledge. Our organization is a dependable strategic partner focused on its customers’ success.

title: Power Platform / Dynamics 365 Developer
description:
Description:
HyerTek is seeking a Microsoft Power Platform / Dynamics Developer to design and implement Power Platform solutions while contributing to organizational growth through technical expertise and collaborative development. As a full-time member of our team, you will build and optimize solutions using your solid expertise in Microsoft technologies, particularly Power Platform, Dynamics 365, and related integrations. Your primary focus will be on Power Platform development, Power Pages implementation, model-driven applications, Dataverse solutions, and Power BI development, while contributing to best practices and organizational standards.
In this role, you will collaborate with senior developers, subject matter experts, and stakeholders to develop comprehensive solutions within the Microsoft ecosystem. You'll also ensure that technical implementations follow established security, compliance, and performance guidelines, while learning and applying best practices to continuously improve solution quality and your own technical capabilities.
If you're excited about developing business solutions using Power Platform technologies and want to grow your expertise in enterprise Microsoft development while making meaningful contributions to client success, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain Power Platform solutions following established architectural patterns and organizational best practices.
Build robust solutions using PowerApps, Power Pages, Microsoft SQL Server, and Azure Cloud Services across canvas apps, model-driven applications, and portal solutions.
Design and implement user interfaces, business logic, workflows, and integrations using the Power Platform suite including Power Pages for external solutions and model-driven applications for internal business processes.
Develop Power Pages solutions for external stakeholders, including customer portals, collaboration sites, and public-facing applications while following security and compliance guidelines.
Create and configure model-driven applications using Dataverse to support business processes, including entity configuration, form customization, and workflow implementation.
Contribute to Center of Excellence initiatives by following governance frameworks, utilizing solution templates, and documenting development practices for Power Platform projects.
Implement integrations between Power Platform, Dynamics 365, and other enterprise systems to ensure proper data flow and system connectivity.
Monitor and troubleshoot Power Platform solutions, identify performance issues, and implement optimizations to ensure smooth user experiences.
Support change management activities, including testing, deployment assistance, and system updates while following established procedures.
Collaborate with senior team members on Power Platform strategy, technical decisions, and solution design recommendations.
Share knowledge with team members on Power Platform development techniques, best practices, and lessons learned from project implementations.
Requirements:
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be able to obtain US DoD Secret Security Clearance.
4+ years of Microsoft Dynamics 365/Power Platform development experience or other related software development experience.
Hands-on experience developing solutions that involve Dynamics customization including custom business logic, workflow development, and basic integration work.
Solid experience with Power Pages development, including portal configuration, web templates, entity forms, and entity lists.
Experience developing model-driven applications with data modeling, business logic implementation, and user interface customization.
Familiarity with Center of Excellence concepts and willingness to learn governance frameworks and organizational standards for Power Platform development.
Experience modernizing applications to Power Platform solutions, including both canvas and model-driven app development.
Understanding of coding best practices and design patterns for Power Platform development.
Experience with DevOps concepts and Azure environments, with interest in learning Power Platform ALM and deployment processes.
Proficiency in C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, and Power Platform development languages including Power Fx and basic Liquid templates.
Experience working on agile development projects with collaborative development methodologies.
Proficiency in supporting Power Platform administration and environment management concepts.
Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with team members and stakeholders to understand and implement business requirements.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
HyerTek is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Sr BI Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Nintendo of America Inc.
About Nintendo of America : From the launch of the Nintendo Entertainment System ™ more than 30 years ago, Nintendo’s mission has been to create smiles through unique entertainment experiences. Here at Nintendo of America Inc., we deliver on this mission by partnering closely with Nintendo Co., Ltd., to bring Nintendo’s iconic and cherished franchises including Mario ™ , Donkey Kong ™ , The Legend of Zelda ™ , Metroid ™ , Animal Crossing ™ , Pikmin ™ and Splatoon ™ across the Americas through our video games, hardware systems, and collaborations with partners on a range of other entertainment initiatives like feature films and theme parks.
Based in Redmond, Wash., Nintendo of America serves as headquarters for Nintendo’s operations in the Americas. We are an equal opportunity employer offering a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, and the diverse consumers and communities we call home. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company’s website at https://www.nintendo.com/ .
Develops and maintains medium to complex data warehouse ETL (Extraction, Transformation and Loading), reporting, and analytic tasks for Nintendo global consumer contact centers.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:
Designs, develops, and maintains ETL routines and reporting with agreed-upon Service Level Agreements (SLAs) using Microsoft SQL Server, Excel, and Tableau.
Creates data extraction procedures and analytical products to measure, track and improve agent quality, contact center efficiency and outsourced vendor performance.
Provides expertise working with existing team (contract and FTEs) to create business intelligence stored procedures and reports, including design, development and management of a data warehouse environment used for analytics and reporting.
Understands the needs of the business and translates those into meaningful reporting that allows for actionable decisions.
Ensures the generation of standard or custom reports summarizing operational and financial data and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.
Identifies and recommends changes to optimize the ETL environment, implement monitoring, quality and validation processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Conducts or coordinates unit and system tests ensuring intelligence is consistent with defined needs.
Designs and deploys database table structures, reports, and queries.
Supports implemented BI solutions by monitoring and tuning queries and data loads, addressing user questions concerning data integrity, monitoring performance, and communicating functional and technical issues.
Documents specifications for Data Warehouse (DWH) extracts, reports, dashboards, or other outputs.
Facilitates and leads project planning and execution with cross functional teams across the organization.
Works with business and engineering managers to prioritize the project stream, aid roadmap definition and identify project dependencies.
Administers reporting systems including user/role provisioning, deployments and change control.
Conducts comparison processes to identify and develop process improvements; provides recommendations on next steps and manages deliverables.

SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in developing data warehousing solutions, dashboards, scorecards, and analytics.
Proficient in writing T-SQL code, SSIS packages, and Stored Procedures on Microsoft SQL Server.
Proficient in writing C# routines to extract data from various physical and cloud databases/data lakes through API calls.
Experience working as a database report developer to deliver BI to business users using Tableau or similar tool.
Familiarity with Operations KPI's and contact center forecasting.
Working knowledge of cloud data architectures like Snowflake.
Experience designing and deploying normalized and dimensional database objects (eg. star schemas).
Extensive reporting experience within an ETL based data migration paradigm.
Excellent native SQL skills; comfortable using a data access tool such as Toad or SSMS.
Share Point, Power BI, Excel macro, Windows script development experience (preferred).
Ability to analyze trends in metrics and suggest Dashboard layouts (preferred).
Customer Service, Operations, Retail, CRM, or B2C e-commerce background a plus.
Requires in-depth conceptual and practical knowledge in own technical job family and basic knowledge of related technical job families; has worked with a range of technologies.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience in computer science, information systems, or other quantitative field.
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role
This position includes a base salary range of $140,900 - $253,600 annually, potential for a semi-annual discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and paid time off. Please see our Benefits & Perks page for more benefits information. Fixed term employees are eligible for all listed employee benefits except tuition reimbursement.
#LI-Offsite
