title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
Overview:

Xanterra Travel Collection is a growing, exceptional group of travel and leisure businesses operating across the globe. Our properties/services combine dramatic settings and landmark buildings with exceptional service to deliver unforgettable experiences. We are inspired by our guests, our environment, and each other. Headquartered in our beautiful Greenwood Village, Colorado offices, we strive to create a collaborative experience and a transformational journey for our valued team members. We have a high commitment to sustainability, growth and are seeking driven, innovative individuals who value offerings in career development and professional advancement. Our Travel Collection includes lodging, food and beverage, Windstar Cruises, short-line railroad, and adventure travel companies. Please visit xanterra.com for more information on the company and its environmental initiatives.

We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and driven professional to join us as a Senior Power BI Developer within our Data and Analytics Team. Our technology team is dynamic, with a strong sense of dedication to our customers. In our collaborative and inclusive work environment, individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. Per our company policy, we will require this position to be in office 5 days a week.
Responsibilities:
In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate closely with business analysts, data engineers, and leadership to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. Per our company policy, we will require this position to be in office 5 days a week.

You Will Make an Impact By
Designing and developing advanced Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations using DAX and Power Query.
Translating business requirements into technical specifications and creating reports that meet business needs.
Optimizing performance of BI solutions, including data modeling and report refresh efficiency.
Connecting to data sources, importing data, and transforming it into Business Intelligence reporting.
Building and maintaining complex data models in Power BI.
Collaborating with data engineering teams to ensure high data quality and availability.
Conducting code reviews and mentoring junior Power BI developers.
Staying current on Power BI features, updates, and industry best practices.
Creating documentation for data models, workflows, and processes.
Working with stakeholders to define KPIs and success metrics.
Ensuring data governance and security best practices are followed.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. 5+ years of hands-on experience in Power BI development, including creating complex reports, dashboards, and custom visualizations. Significant work experience can substitute for formal education. Working knowledge of standard project management methodology, tools and software.
Technical Knowledge: Advanced knowledge of DAX and Power Query for data transformation and modeling in Power BI. Experience in Power BI Service for sharing reports, managing workspaces, and automating report scheduling. Strong understanding of business intelligence concepts and reporting strategies. Ability to work with large datasets and perform performance tuning to ensure scalability and efficiency in Power BI reports. Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights to business users. Experience with integrating Power BI with other business systems and data sources is a plus.
Security Knowledge: Knowledge and prior experience with common security and privacy standards – PCI-DSS, GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA — and implicit integration of these security standards in all aspects of your work. Understanding of Power BI workspace roles.
Documentation Toolset Skills: Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to synthesize and present information clearly. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite of products for authoring and collaboration is required.

What Will Set You Apart
Our preferred candidate will also bring one or more of the following skills:

Microsoft Power BI certification (e.g., PL-300 or PL-600).
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and user experience design for BI solutions.
Working knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Ability to interact with team members at all levels of the organization and with cross functional teams.
Experience in travel, hospitality and/or cruise industries.

COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $105,000.00 to $115,000.00.
BENEFITS: For full-time employees, Xanterra offers a comprehensive benefits package including: Medical, Dental & Vision; HSA & FSA; Life & Disability; Accident, Hospital & Critical Illness; Pet Insurance; PTO and paid Holidays; 401(k) with Company Match; Employee Assistance Plan; Education Assistance; RTD-Denver transit pass for in-office employees, and Employee Discounts & Travel Deals.
EEO: Xanterra is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
$120,000 to $130,000 At Outform Group, our guiding philosophy is Dare To Innovate.

Outform Group specializes in creating tangible consumer engagements that elevate, connect and humanize brand experiences. We unite leading experts in research, strategy, design, innovation and manufacturing, who work together to create unforgettable brand experiences.

Lean, interdisciplinary teams work in close collaboration with clients, helping them to solve their user’s biggest problems. Our user-centric, data-driven approach focuses on creating a seamless experience across different environments.
The Senior Power BI Developer will lead advanced dashboard development and business intelligence (BI) initiatives in support of operational and strategic decision-making for the Outform Group. The role is responsible for transforming complex datasets into interactive reports, managing large-scale KPI dashboards, and mentoring junior analysts. This position will work closely with key stakeholders from staff sections to design impactful, data-driven solutions.
Become an integral part of a professionally diverse team while working at an industry-leading organization. This is a great opportunity that will allow you to work on innovative projects that offer advancement and growth.
Responsibilities:
Utilize Power BI Copilot and other AI tools to streamline and enhance BI development processes and also to create powerful visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and iterate on reports using stakeholder feedback.
Design and implement data modeling concepts to support BI solutions (e.g., star schema, snowflake schema) and data warehousing principles.
Experience in connecting to and extracting data from various data sources with an emphasis on ensuring data accuracy and consistency (e.g., SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, Excel, CSV).
Develop and maintain refresh pipelines, gateway configurations, and PowerApps/Power Automate workflows.
Optimize Power BI reports and dashboards for performance and usability.
Excellent SQL skills for data querying and manipulation.
Understanding of data security and governance principles.
Develop and maintain documentation for BI solutions, including data models, reports, and dashboards.
Ensure compliance with organizational data governance standards and policies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years of experience working as a Power BI Developer using Microsoft Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Power Query (M) and DAX in a data analytics or BI development role.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience with advanced analytics and machine learning concepts within Power BI.
Minimum of 5 years working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O data model.
Data Modeling: Star/Snowflake schemas, normalized structures.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or R for data analysis and visualization.
Experience with data integration tools and processes.
Microsoft Power BI certifications (e.g., PL-300).
Experience managing and configuring Power BI workspaces and user access controls.
Familiarity with cloud-based BI platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake) is a plus.
A problem solver and troubleshooter who thrives in resolving complex problems.
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Superior organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.

Outform Group is an equal opportunity employer. Outform Group makes employment decisions and provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant's or employee's race, sex, color, age, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, and local laws. If you need a reasonable accommodation in the application or hiring process, please notify the Outform Group Human Resources department.
Outform Group, Inc. offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) and matching contributions, HSA and FSA, leave programs, paid time off including holidays, and we continually review to align and update our benefit offerings

title: Freelance Data Modeler & Analytics Engineer – Build the Pipelines That Power Insight
description:
Do you turn messy source systems into streamlined, query-ready data models?
Is writing high-performance SQL, orchestrating API ingestions, and stitching it all together in cloud warehouses your idea of a good day? If so, we’d love to meet you.
We’re a fast-growing data & analytics consultancy serving mission-driven organizations in Non-Profit, Education, Healthcare — and beyond. Your mission: architect scalable data models, build robust pipelines (from APIs to databases), and deliver clean, trusted datasets that unlock reporting and advanced analytics in tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
The Opportunity
You’ll sit at the heart of our data engineering workflow — from source analysis and schema design to ELT pipelines and documentation. Your work will guarantee that analysts and visualization developers always have fast, reliable, and well-governed data at their fingertips.
What You’ll Do
Analyze & Architect Data Models – Profile raw sources, capture business logic, and design dimensional or 3NF schemas that balance flexibility and performance.
Build End-to-End Pipelines – Ingest data from APIs, databases, flat files, and SaaS tools; automate transformations using SQL, dbt, or similar frameworks.
Optimize SQL & Warehousing – Write clear, maintainable queries; tune for speed and cost-efficiency on Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or comparable platforms.
Expose Clean Analytics Layers – Package data for BI consumption (Tableau experience a must) and set up extracts, views, or semantic layers with appropriate security.
Document & Govern – Produce ERDs, data dictionaries, and lineage diagrams; champion data quality checks and version control.
Collaborate Across Functions – Work closely with analysts, dashboard developers, and business stakeholders to validate requirements and iterate quickly.
Stay Current – Track advancements in cloud warehousing, orchestration, and API tooling, bringing the best of them into our practice.
Must-Haves
Expert-Level SQL – Proven ability to write, refactor, and debug complex queries on at least one major RDBMS.
Data-Modeling Mastery – 3-5+ years designing star, snowflake, or normalized schemas for analytics workloads.
Pipeline Development – Hands-on experience building automated ELT processes and consuming third-party APIs.
Tableau Familiarity – Comfortable publishing data sources and troubleshooting performance for Tableau (experience with other BI tools a plus).
ETL/ELT Tooling – Proficient with Tableau Prep, dbt, Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivalent.
Autonomous & Deadline-Driven – Manage your own sprints, surface risks early, and deliver polished work without hand-holding.
Nice-to-Haves
Tableau Desktop/Server/Cloud Certification.
Python or JavaScript for custom API connectors and data validation.
Experience with orchestration tools (Airflow, Prefect) and CI/CD pipelines.
Background in Non-Profit, Education, or Healthcare analytics.
Passion for data governance frameworks (Data Vault, Kimball, Medallion).
Why Work With Us?
Impactful Projects – Your data pipelines will fuel decisions that genuinely improve lives.
End-to-End Visibility – See your models come to life in dashboards and advanced analytics.
Flexible, Remote Freedom – Plan your schedule, work from anywhere, and integrate projects around other commitments.
Competitive Compensation – We value expertise and are prepared to offer excellent rates, determined by your experience, portfolio, and demonstrated capabilities, particularly in data-modeling leadership and efficient, budget-conscious solution delivery.
Collaborative Culture – Small, expert team that values knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement.
To Apply
Please provide:
Brief Cover Note – Tell us what you’re up to now, how your data-modeling and pipeline experience aligns with this role, and your typical rate expectations.
Resume / CV – Highlighting relevant projects, tech stack, and any certifications.
Sample Work or Portfolio (preferred) – ERDs, code snippets, or anonymized notebooks that showcase your best-practice craftsmanship.
Apply through the platform where you discovered this posting — no lengthy forms, just your essentials. We review applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to qualified candidates for a quick chemistry chat.
We’re excited to see how you architect data that powers meaningful insight. Let’s build something impactful together!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Pay: Up to $100.00 per hour
Experience:
Data modeling: 3 years (Required)
License/Certification:
Tableau Certification (Preferred)
Work Location: Remote

title: Freelance Tableau Developer & Data Visualization Engineer
description:
Are you the kind of Tableau developer who can spot a performance snag before the first extract finishes refreshing?
Do you delight in transforming raw tables into compelling, pixel-perfect dashboards that stakeholders actually use? If you’re equally at ease writing a complex LOD calculation, optimizing a SQL query, and collaborating with designers to elevate user experience, we’d love to meet you.
We’re a fast-growing data & analytics consultancy serving mission-driven organizations in Non-Profit, Education, Healthcare — and beyond. Your mission: translate design briefs (or craft your own when needed), wrangle data, and deliver performant, insightful Tableau solutions that empower our clients to act.
The Opportunity
This role sits at the heart of our delivery pipeline. You’ll own the end-to-end Tableau development lifecycle—from data prep and modelling through dashboard polish and deployment—while partnering closely with our design lead to ensure every build meets both aesthetic and analytical standards.
What You’ll Do
Develop & Optimize Dashboards Build interactive Tableau workbooks that surface key metrics, enable drill-downs, and perform smoothly at scale.
Own Data Prep & Modelling Craft efficient data sources using SQL and Tableau Prep (or the tool of your choice), ensuring refresh reliability and transparent logic.
Collaborate on UX & Design Translate wireframes or high-level requirements into concrete Tableau artifacts; offer feedback to elevate usability and storytelling.
Performance Tune & QA Conduct load testing, identify bottlenecks, and implement best practices in extracts, calculations, and server configuration.
Client-Facing Problem Solving Join occasional workshops or demos to gather requirements, validate prototypes, and transfer knowledge.
Stay Current Track the latest Tableau releases, extensions, and community tricks—so we (and our clients) benefit from every new capability.
What We’re Looking For
Must-Haves
Proven Tableau Development Mastery – 3-5+ years building production dashboards that balance form and function.
SQL Fluency – Comfortable writing, tuning, and debugging queries across at least one major RDBMS.
Tableau Prep Expertise – Able to design repeatable flows for data cleansing and transformation.
Performance & Scaling Know-How – Understand extracts vs. live connections, aggregation strategies, indexing, and VizQL optimization.
Collaboration Skills – Can read a design spec, ask clarifying questions, and iterate quickly in an async, remote environment.
Autonomous & Deadline-Driven – Manage your own sprints, surface risks early, and deliver polished work without hand-holding.
Nice-to-Haves
Tableau Desktop/Server/Cloud Certification (Associate or higher).
Familiarity with Python or R for advanced data shaping.
Experience with Snowflake, Redshift, or other cloud data warehouses.
Exposure to dbt, Alteryx, or other ETL/ELT tools.
Background in Non-Profit, Education, or Healthcare analytics.
Strong data-storytelling skills—turning insights into a compelling narrative.
Why Work With Us?
Impactful Projects – Your dashboards will guide decisions in organizations that genuinely improve lives.
Design-Dev Synergy – Partner with a UX strategist who ensures you’re never coding in a design vacuum.
Flexible, Remote Freedom – Plan your schedule, work from anywhere, and integrate projects around other commitments.
Competitive Compensation – We value expertise and are prepared to offer excellent rates, determined by your experience, portfolio, and demonstrated capabilities, particularly in visualization leadership and efficient, budget-conscious solution delivery.
Collaborative Culture – Small, expert team that values knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement.
To Apply
Please provide:
Brief Cover Note – Tell us what you’re up to now, how your Tableau experience aligns with this role, and your typical rate expectations.
Resume / CV – Highlighting Tableau projects, data environments, and any certifications.
Sample Work or Portfolio (preferred) – Screenshots, public gallery links, or anonymized packaged workbooks that exhibit your best practice craftsmanship.
Apply through the platform where you discovered this posting—no lengthy forms, just your essentials. We review applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to qualified candidates for a quick chemistry chat.
We’re excited to see how you bring data to life. Let’s build something impactful together!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Pay: Up to $100.00 per hour
Experience:
Tableau: 3 years (Required)
License/Certification:
Tableau Certification (Preferred)
Work Location: Remote

field.

title: Power BI & Power Platform Developer
description:
OVERVIEW:
JS Solutions is seeking a talented and experienced Power BI & Power Platform Developer to support a government customer. This role requires a strong background in building data visualizations, automating workflows, and developing custom business applications within the Microsoft Power Platform environment. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate, and related Microsoft technologies to support data-driven decision-making and process optimization for our federal client.
As a Power BI & Power Platform Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing modern business intelligence solutions that meet mission-critical needs. You will work directly with stakeholders to understand requirements and transform complex data into actionable insights, reports, and tools. This position plays a critical role in ensuring the delivery of scalable, maintainable, and secure solutions in a high-visibility, government contracting environment.
If you are a motivated, self-driven professional with a passion for innovation and problem-solving, we encourage you to apply and join our mission to deliver excellence in federal support services.

JOB DUTIES/FUNCTIONS
Design and develop Power BI dashboards and reports, with a focus on data modeling, DAX development, and performance optimization
Build and maintain custom Power Apps (canvas and model-driven apps) to support user-friendly, low-code business solutions
Develop and optimize Power Automate workflows to automate routine business processes and improve operational efficiency
Integrate Power Platform solutions with data sources such as SharePoint, SQL Server, Dataverse, Excel, and external APIs
Collaborate with internal and government stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and deliver tailored solutions
Ensure compliance with data governance, security, and records management best practices, especially within a government contract environment
Provide technical documentation, training, and end-user support for deployed Power Platform solutions
Troubleshoot issues, implement enhancements, and continuously improve solution design
Participate in Agile or project-based development cycles as needed

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Active Secret clearance
Must live in the Huntsville, Alabama area
BS/BA in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field
Minimum 14 years of professional experience developing and supporting Power BI and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate) solutions or relevant experience
Experience with data modeling, DAX, Power Query, and performance tuning in Power BI
Proficiency in designing low-code/no-code applications and custom workflows
Experience connecting to various data sources including Dataverse, SharePoint, and SQL Server
Strong understanding of Power Platform governance, roles, and permissions
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), with experience presenting solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and Power Platform administration tools

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of experience in Power BI/Power Platform development
Experience in a government contracting or DoD program environment
Familiarity with Azure, Microsoft 365 compliance, or PowerShell scripting
Microsoft certifications such as:
PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
PL-400: Power Platform Developer Associate
PL-600: Power Platform Solution Architect Expert


BENEFITS
Health, Supplemental Health, Vision, Dental Insurance
401K matching
Short-term and Long-term Disability
Flexible PTO
Hybrid Telework Options (as approved by the government client)

JS Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. The JS Solutions management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities, access to facilities and programs, and general treatment during employment.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
#WeAreParamount on a mission to unleash the power of content… you in?
We’ve got the brands, we’ve got the stars, and we’ve got the power to achieve our mission to entertain the planet – now all we’re missing is…YOU! Becoming a part of Paramount means joining a team that values authenticity and embraces inclusion for all. We are searching for individuals who not only recognize the power of content but also enjoy a touch of fun and uniqueness. Together, we co-create moments that matter – both for our audiences and our employees. You fuel our culture of purpose, passion, and collaboration. We’re in this together.

Overview and Responsibilities:
Paramount Streaming is a division of Paramount that encompasses both free, paid, and premium streaming services including Paramount+ and Pluto TV.
We are the Marketing Analytics and Data Integration (MADI) team, part of the Paramount+ Streaming Data & Insights Group (DIG) Business Intelligence team. DIG is a key connector among the Paramount Streaming verticals. The group is composed of subject matter experts that prototype, build, and scale data infrastructure and products; assess, aggregate, and analyze data; and craft qualitative and quantitative-based narratives and insights, providing stakeholders with decision support, performance clarity and business-driving recommendations.
The MADI team provides actionable, data-driven solutions to solve marketing challenges. We work closely with Media Strategy and Media Activation teams to drive Paramount+ growth.

The analyst will support media mix modeling and media optimization efforts. The role requires the ability to translate data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations using media mix modeling, cross platform attribution tools, and other advanced analytics tools. You will be collaborating closely with marketing and media activation teams to optimize media impact and enhance return on ad spend.
The ability to interpret data and provide relevant context to explain marketing performance will be key to success in this role. The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, an inquisitive nature, attention to detail, and a love of media with previous experience in marketing efficiency and measurement.

Day-to-day responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Analyze attribution data to quantify return on marketing investment and optimize budget allocation across channels and partners using media mix model outputs
Provide insights to marketing and media activation teams to inform strategic marketing decisions and implement budget recommendations
Create and maintain reporting and dashboards for internal marketing teams and external agency
Partner closely with internal data science teams and external partners to enhance and optimize the media mix model to increase significance and actionability of the results
Improve and strengthen data pipelines for media mix modeling with data engineering teams
Support ad hoc analysis to provide deeper and more granular insights on media performance
Additional other duties and responsibilities, as assigned

Basic Qualifications:
BA/BS. 2+ years experience in digital marketing and analytics, web analytics, online media industry.
Proficient in SQL with a thorough understanding of data and systems' infrastructures; experience extracting, cleaning, and transforming data within databases using SQL
Experience or coursework in media measurement including web, native app, video measurement technology and standards
Proficient with analytical tools and languages supporting data analysis, reporting, and visualization - Excel, Microsoft Office, Google Collaborative Apps (Docs, Sheets, Slides), Tableau, R, Python
Strong detail-orientation with a penchant for data accuracy and good grammar

Additional Qualifications:
Strong mathematics, statistics background
Strong solutions-oriented and critical thinking approach
Experience using Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
Experience translating requirements into actionable instructions and documentation
Experience in working independently to meet deliverables with some oversight
Experience using project management tools like those from Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience/ familiarity with GitHub for logic development and collaboration

Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from Paramount Global, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream Paramount Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

title: BI Developer
description:
About Ascendion
About Ascendion
Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.
Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life
We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:
Build the coolest tech for the world’s leading brands
Solve complex problems – and learn new skills
Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience
Experience a community of change makers!
Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.
Position Information
Job Title: BI Solutions Analyst/Consultant
Key Responsibilities:
Prior experience as a BI Solutions Analyst or BI Consultant.
Expert level technical skills in Tableau, QuickSight, and at least one other BI technologies – Power BI, MicroStrategy, Alteryx, or similar tools in a large scale environment.
Learn and evaluate new technologies and document findings for publication.
Author clear, concise, and accurate user documentation, including PowerPoint slides, job aids, newsletter articles/blogs, and research reports.
Presentations to large audiences.
Knowledge of BI and Data Analytics market trends.

Requirements collection, use case assessment, design reviews, and troubleshooting.
Multi-task and work effectively on multiple projects.
Exceptional customer service and consulting skills.
Write research reports and document team processes.
Apply advanced analysis techniques such as statistical functions, predictive analytics, and machine learning.
Write and understand SQL and read data models.
Knowledge of R or Python is a plus.
Experience with BI platforms on AWS is a plus.
Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent required.
Desired Qualifications:
Knowledge of R or Python.
Experience with BI platforms on AWS.

The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [10-15 days of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]
This position is eligible for commissions in accordance with the terms of the Company’s plan. Commissions for this position are estimated to be based on individual performance. Additionally, this role is also eligible for a bonus based on the achievement of mutually agreed KRAs.

title: Power BI Administrator
description:
Calling all innovators - find your future at Fiserv.
We're Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another millions of times a day - quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we're involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.
Job Title
Power BI Administrator
What does a successful Power BI Administrator do at Fiserv?
You will be an integral part of our Contact Service Technology team, responsible for configuring and automating the management of Power BI gateways. You will work directly with business partners, external clients, and various development resources to ensure optimal data management and analysis. Your role will require expertise in an environment that includes Azure Services, Azure SQL, Snowflake, SSRS, ADF, SSIS, Cognos, Power BI, Python, and other data-related technologies.
What you will do:
Configure and automate the management of Power BI gateways to ensure seamless data flow and access.
Collaborate with business partners, external clients, and development resources to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Manage and optimize the Azure Services environment to support data-related programming and analytics.
Oversee the integration of various data sources, including Azure SQL, Snowflake, SSRS, ADF, SSIS, Cognos, and Python, into Power BI for comprehensive reporting and analysis.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for Power BI gateways, ensuring high availability and performance.
Develop and maintain documentation for Power BI configurations and processes.
Ensure data governance and compliance with industry standards and best practices.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in Power BI and related technologies to continuously improve our systems.
What you will need to have:
6+ years of experience in Power BI administration and configuration.
6+ years of experience with Azure Services, Azure SQL, Snowflake, SSRS, ADF, SSIS, and Cognos.
3+ years proficiency in Python and other data-related programming languages.
Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or an equivalent combination of education, work, and/or military experience.
What would be great to have:
1+ years of experience supporting Fiserv products.
Experience managing and optimizing Azure Services environments.
Knowledge of data governance and compliance standards.
Ability to develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for data-related processes.
#LI-RM1
Salary Range
$86,300.00 - $147,900.00
These pay ranges apply to employees in New Jersey, New York and California. Pay ranges for employees in other states may differ.
It is unlawful to discriminate against a prospective employee due to the individual's status as a veteran.
For incentive eligible associates, the successful candidate is eligible for an annual incentive opportunity which may be delivered as a mix of cash bonus and equity awards in the Company’s sole discretion.
Thank you for considering employment with Fiserv. Please:
Apply using your legal name
Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable).
Our commitment to Equal Opportunity:
Fiserv is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law.
If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation in completing a job application or otherwise participating in the overall hiring process, please contact AskHR.US@fiserv.com. title: AI / BI Developer
description:
AI / BI Developer Job Summary
We are currently seeking an AI/BI Developer with a strong blend of AI engineering and business intelligence expertise. This role is responsible for designing and delivering AI-powered analytics solutions using cloud platforms, with an emphasis on large language model (LLM) integration and data visualization.
The ideal candidate will design and optimize end-to-end AI workflows while developing impactful dashboards and reports in tools like Power BI and Spotfire, transforming complex data into actionable insights.
AI / BI Developer Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and deploy generative AI solutions in cloud environments
Implement prompt engineering techniques to enhance LLM performance and tailor output to business needs
Build and maintain interactive dashboards and reporting tools using Power BI, Spotfire, or Looker
Work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to define business requirements and translate them into scalable AI/BI solutions
Support data ingestion, transformation, and preparation pipelines for both model training and business reporting
Participate in code reviews, technical documentation, and team knowledge sharing

title: Power Platform Developer
description:
Power Platform Developer
Location: Plano, TX (Onsite from Day 1)
Long Term
Technical Skills:
3-5 years developing on Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
Hands-on experience integrating Power Platform with SharePoint, Dynamics 365, Azure services, REST APIs.
Solid understanding of relational databases (SQL Server) and proficiency writing SQL queries/stored procedures.
Experience building custom controls using Power Platform Component Framework (PCF) and JavaScript/TypeScript.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps, Git version control, and CI/CD pipelines for ALM.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and stakeholder-management skills.
Ability to work full-time, Monday–Friday, overlapping US Eastern Time business hours.
Responsibilities:
Collaborating closely with business stakeholders and fellow developers to design, build, and maintain solutions on Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Dataverse.
Design, develop, and deploy model-driven and canvas apps in Power Apps to automate business processes.
Create and maintain complex Power Automate (Flow) processes, integrating with a variety of data sources (SharePoint, Dynamics 365, SQL Server, third-party APIs).
Develop interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI; optimize data models in Dataverse and Azure SQL.
Implement governance, security, and ALM best practices for the Power Platform environment.
Collaborate with product owners and business analysts to translate requirements into scalable solutions.
Troubleshoot and resolve production issues, perform performance tuning, and ensure high availability.
Write clean, maintainable code using JavaScript/TypeScript, C#, and Power Platform component framework (PCF) when required.
Document solution designs, data schemas, and support handover materials for end-users and support teams.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $103,043.92 - $124,095.91 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Work Location: In person

title: Bi Developer
description:
Who are we:
We are part of the Wonderfield Group which includes the YO!, Taiko, Bento, AFC Sushi, and SNOWFOX/SNOWFRUIT brands – we operate more than 1500 kiosks, 60 restaurants, our grab and go sushi is available in over 3,700 locations and we have 50 major retail partners.
Our key markets are the USA, Canada, and the UK with additional geographic presence in Europe and Australia. Our JFE Franchising, Inc brands are:
SNOWFOX - the franchisor of over 1,000 full-service sushi kiosks in 25 states throughout the continental U.S., Hawaii, and Alaska
SNOWFRUIT – the franchisor of over 1,000 fresh cut fruit and Vegetable throughout the U.S. – Refreshingly, Crips and Flavorful!
We Believe in Better Food For Everyone, The Japanese Way…
We continue to capitalize on consumer trends, spearheading category growth by bringing our proposition to more people around the world across more channels, in more locations, on more occasions and in more innovative ways. We are committed to purposeful progress and profit for the benefit of our people, our communities and our planet and we have a clear ESG strategy that delivers progress against nine UN sustainability development goals.
Our Purpose:
We Believe in Better Food For Everyone, The Japanese Way…
We continue to capitalize on consumer trends, spearheading category growth by bringing our
proposition to more people around the world across more channels, in more locations, on
more occasions and in more innovative ways. We are committed to purposeful progress and
profit for the benefit of our people, our communities and our planet and we have a clear ESG
strategy that delivers progress against nine UN sustainability development goals.
Our Values:
Own it
We are accountable and make no excuses.
We always look to improve
We take the initiative and are courageous and confident
Care about it
We do the right thing, avoiding unnecessary shortcuts
We act with integrity and respect our communities, people and our plant
Make it Exceptional
We build relationships and make people smile
We say thank you
We’re positive and kind
Win Together
· We’re open minded an inclusive · We communicate with clarity · We take time to look out for others and to celebrate the good stuff
Overview of the role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Azure Senior BI Developer to join our
dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Power BI and extensive
experience in developing data warehouses. As a Senior BI Developer, you will be responsible
for designing and implementing robust BI solutions on the Azure platform, ensuring data
accuracy, and delivering actionable insights to drive business growth.
If you are a passionate and dedicated BI Developer with a deep knowledge of Azure and
Power BI, we would love to have you join our team. Apply now and contribute to driving
data-driven decision-making processes and enhancing business intelligence capabilities.
Key Accountabilities:
Develop and maintain data warehouses on the Azure platform, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
Design, develop, and deploy end-to-end Power BI solutions, including data modelling, report creation, and dashboard development.
Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to understand and gather requirements for BI solutions.
Transform complex data into actionable insights, implementing best practices for data visualization and analytics.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Work closely with data engineers to optimize data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.
Develop and maintain data quality processes to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in BI development, power BI, and Azure services.
Conduct performance optimization, tuning, and troubleshooting of BI solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project implementation and timely delivery.
What you’ll need:
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in developing BI solutions, with expertise in Power BI and Azure services.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, including data modelling, ETL/ELT processes, and dimensional modelling.
Experience in developing and maintaining data warehouses on the Azure platform, using technologies such as Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, etc.
Proficient in Power BI development, including data modelling, report creation, and dashboard development.
A strong understanding of DAX functions and expressions to derive valuable insights.
Proficiency in Power Query is essential for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) operations. Power Query allows developers to connect to various data sources, perform data cleansing, and shape the data for reporting purposes.
Strong SQL skills and experience with SQL Server, Azure SQL or similar databases.
Experience working with business stakeholders to gather and understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and a keen eye for creating visually appealing and insightful dashboards.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Azure certifications (e.g., DP-200, DP-201, DA-100) will be a plus.
What’s in it for you?
We’re committed to building inclusive Teams and giving our People the opportunity to grow their careers alongside us
Group Personal Pension: 4% of basic monthly salary (matched by YO!)
Group Income Protection Scheme: up to 75% of your basic monthly salary after 26 weeks’ continuous absence from work due to serious injury or illness
Private Medical Cash Plan: including dental, GP access, physiotherapy, money back on contact lenses and 24/7 Employee Assistance Line
Brilliant support services designed to enhance mental and financial wellbeing including mental health first aid courses, access to Wagestream and our mental health Partner Minding Minds
Bespoke reward platform including access to retail, cinema & gym discounts
50% off your food every time you dine with us for you and 3 friends
Annual Awards ceremony celebrating our success and offering winning Managers free trips to Japan and lots more
We’re committed to building inclusive Teams and giving our People the opportunity to grow their careers alongside us

The SNOWFOX Group is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all
backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and
accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour,
national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age,
genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family
status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Sr. BI Developer
description:
Join our Information Technology team at Helen of Troy and make an immediate impact on our trusted brands: OXO, Hydro Flask, Osprey, Honeywell, PUR, Braun, Vicks, Hot Tools, Drybar, Curlsmith, Revlon and Olive & June. Together, we build innovative and useful products that elevate people's lives everywhere every day.
Look around your home, and you'll find us everywhere, in your kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. We are already making your everyday lives better. We are powered by knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and forward-thinking people committed to developing a culture of inclusion. Whether you are just starting your career or in need of a challenge, we recognize, develop, and empower talent!
Position: Sr. BI Developer
Department: Information Technology
Work Location: Hybrid (work 3 days onsite)
Dallas, TX (Plano, TX)
El Paso, TX
Arlington, TN
Marlborough, MA
Hybrid Schedule: Helen of Troy associates enjoy the advantages and flexibility of a hybrid working model, allowing for in office 3 days minimum, and remote 2 days. Any changes to this working model would be communicated accordingly.
What you will be doing:
The Sr. BI Developer will be responsible for elevating the lives of each Helen of Troy employee by crafting analytical tools that drive decision-making at every level of the organization and using our data assets to drive actions and insights.
Understand HELE's vision, strategies, and organizational priorities.
Develop a deep understanding of customer needs.
Build/Propose solutions that enable data-driven decision-making within HELE.
Understand business models, data sources, system infrastructure.
Design and implement robust Power BI Architectures that empower organization-wide self-service reporting and ad-hoc data exploration.
Design and Implement a Power BI COE in partnership with key partners within different business departments and functions.
Apply a hands-on approach to build and lead the key analytical assets needed for the organization.
Develop scalable Power BI data models that drive strategic decision-making and deliver measurable business value.
Optimally delegate and use repartees and other individuals (consultants/onsite/offshore) and ensure accountability to delivering timely solutions.
Ensure solutions are adequately embraced and used by the business groups.
Ensure accountability with various partners who are contributing to building Power BI solutions.
Adoption and use of agile methodologies for all activities.
Design and implement proven methods for DevOps and project management including vital metrics and measures.
Incorporate proven methods for governing Power BI solutions including the use of a business glossary, standard KPI, business definitions, etc.
Guide and support team members and business users in building their own reports on top of scalable Power BI models.
Stay updated with the latest data trends and technologies to enhance our BI capabilities continuously.
Skills needed to be successful in this role:
Ability to connect with various audiences with varying degrees of technical expertise.
Strong planning, priority setting, and project management skills to balance multiple projects and resources in a fast-paced environment.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or relevant field.
Over 7 years of experience in Business Intelligence, including at least 2 years of hands-on experience with Power BI as an enterprise platform.
Proven experience designing and implementing end-to-end Power BI solutions within a complex Enterprise IT ecosystem, including integration with centralized data platforms, ERP systems (e.g., Oracle), and governed data models.
Prior knowledge of a domain such as Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain, Finance, etc.
Experience working within Agile Methodology.
Experience with innovative solutions, problem-solving, and working across diverse groups and domains.
Excellent written and communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree/MBA.
2+ years leading BI teams or managing cross-functional BI initiatives.
Related Experience in CPG/Hard Goods/Retail Industry.
Knowledge and experience in crafting and building a scalable BI infrastructure.
Experience with Snowflake or similar cloud data platforms.
Experience with designing and implementing a modern data platform architecture.
Experience in creating and managing a Power BI CoE.
In Massachusetts, the standard base pay range for this role is $111,791- $167,687 annually. This base pay range is specific to Massachusetts and may not be applicable to other locations. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to location, experience, skill level, and performance. The range listed is just one component of the total compensation package for employees.
Benefits: Salary + Bonus, Healthcare, Dental, Vision, Paid Holidays, Paid Parental Leave, 401(k) with company match, Basic Life Insurance, Short Term Disability (STD), Long Term Disability (LTD), Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Charitable (volunteer) Leave, and Educational Assistance.
Wondering if you should apply? Helen of Troy welcomes people as diverse as our brands! Have the confidence to come as who you are because your point of view, skills, and experience will make us stronger. If you're eager to share new ideas and try new things, we want to hear from you.

title: Power BI Technical Lead
description:
Company Overview:
Req ID: 326224
NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.
We are currently seeking a Power BI Technical Lead to join our team in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania (US-PA), United States (US).

Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced and hands-on Power BI Technical Lead to drive the design, development, and delivery of enterprise-level financial reports and dashboards. You will lead a team of BI developers and SQL Developers, collaborate with QAs, business analysts, and other stakeholders, and ensure robust, scalable, and insightful reporting solutions using Microsoft Power BI. This role requires deep expertise in Power BI, data modeling, DAX, and SQL, along with a strong understanding of financial data and reporting processes. Knowledge and hands-on experience with Power BI integration with Snowflake would be preferred.

Location: Oaks/Hybrid

Bachelor’s (or above) degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
At lease 7-9 years of experience with at least 4 years of experience as a Technical Lead.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Technical Skills:
Proven track record of designing, implementing, and optimizing Power BI solutions.
Strong understanding of data modelling, data visualization, and DAX.
Experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Familiarity with data warehouse concepts.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Certifications: Power BI certifications are a plus.
Responsibilities:
Develop data models, reports, and dashboards that align with business objectives.
Define and manage data architecture based on business reporting needs.
Ensure the Power BI environment can handle large datasets and user loads efficiently.
Gather and analyse requirements, translating them into technical specifications.
Work with data engineers and other teams to integrate Power BI with existing infrastructure and analytics platforms.
Provide guidance and mentorship to development teams on best practices for Power BI development.
Create documentation like solution architecture, design, etc.

title: Senior BI Engineer
description:
Job Description
Location: Lewisville, TX
Position Type: Full-Time
Hours: 9:00am to 5:00pm Weekdays (Monday – Friday)
The Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions that help organizations make data-driven decisions. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide analytical insights through dashboards, reports, and data models. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes, and BI tools, as well as strong problem-solving skills and a passion for data analytics.
Minimum Degree Requirement: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering or closely related field.
Minimum Work Experience: 2 years of experience
Key Responsibilities
BI Solution Development & Maintenance
Design and develop robust BI solutions using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
Create interactive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights for business users.
Optimize and maintain existing BI solutions to enhance performance and usability.


Data Management & ETL Processes
Design, develop, and implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for data ingestion from multiple sources.
Develop and maintain data pipelines and workflows to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
Work with cloud-based data solutions such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.


Data Warehousing & Modeling
Design and maintain data warehouse structures and relational database schemas.
Develop efficient data models that support reporting and analytical needs.
Optimize database performance by writing efficient queries and indexing strategies.


Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement
Partner with business stakeholders to understand reporting and analytics needs.
Provide technical guidance and support to junior BI engineers and analysts.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to ensure consistency in data reporting.


Performance Monitoring & Optimization
Continuously monitor and improve BI tools, dashboards, and reporting solutions.
Implement automation techniques for BI processes to improve efficiency.
Ensure data security and governance best practices are followed.
Technical Experience
2 years of experience in BI development, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
2 years of proven expertise in using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
1 year of Hands-on experience with cloud-based data solutions like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
1 year of experience in designing and maintaining data warehouse structures and relational database schemas.
1 year of proficiency in SQL for writing efficient queries and optimizing database performance.
1 year of experience with ETL tools and processes for data ingestion and transformation.
1 year of knowledge of data modeling techniques to support reporting and analytics.
1 year of knowledge with automation techniques for BI processes.

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
This position has a future anticipated start date of September 2025.
The Challenge
As the United States Marine Corps expands its data-centric operational capabilities, the need for expert data visualization and analytics is paramount. What if you could directly support mission-critical decisions by transforming raw data into powerful insights? At JCTM, we’re seeking a Senior Power BI Developer with USMC and DoD expertise to play a leading role in shaping operational readiness through advanced analytics.
Build Your Career
At JCTM, we value knowledge, experience, integrity, and commitment. Joining our team means becoming part of an organization that empowers individuals, prioritizes ethical practices, and fosters a culture of collaboration and growth.
Challenging Projects
As a Senior Power BI Developer, you’ll be the primary visualization lead on strategic data initiatives supporting the Marine Corps and other Department of Defense partners. Your dashboards and data models will directly inform operational planning, resourcing, and readiness across multiple echelons—driving visibility at the AO, O-6, and GO/SES levels.
Key Responsibilities
Lead the development of scalable Power BI solutions, including role-based dashboards, paginated reports, and embedded analytics.
Translate user requirements and client vision into database improvements for enhanced data correlation and visualization
Synthesize multiple disparate data streams from USMC operational units and partnering agencies into interactive and actionable visualization
Design and implement robust data models using DAX and Power Query.
Integrate structured and unstructured data sources across secure networks, ensuring alignment with IL5/IL6 compliance standards.
Collaborate closely with functional and technical teams to enhance data accessibility and fidelity across the enterprise.
Mentor junior analysts and provide expert technical guidance to cross-functional stakeholders.
Act as a key liaison between JCTM and USMC leadership to ensure timely delivery of data products.
Ensure all analytics outputs align with DoD cybersecurity requirements, data governance standards, and STIGs.
State-of-the-Art Technology
Harness a full Microsoft and Azure ecosystem—Power BI, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, and Cognitive Services—within a secure, mission-driven environment.
New Skills
Work side-by-side with senior data strategists, analysts, and mission partners across the USMC and DoD. Build domain knowledge in readiness metrics, command-level data ecosystems, and defense-specific tools such as eDST and DRRS.
Room to Grow
Take ownership of high-visibility projects with strategic importance to national defense. At JCTM, you’ll have the opportunity to broaden your skillset, take on greater responsibilities, and strengthen your expertise through collaboration with senior leaders, mission partners, and cross-functional teams. We foster an environment that supports continuous development and recognizes individual contributions to team success.
You Have
Active TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline (or equivalent experience)
6+ years of experience in Power BI development, including:
Advanced data modeling, DAX, and Power Query
Paginated reporting and role-based visualization
Expertise in data integration (Azure Data Factory, SSIS), ETL, and data governance
Experience working in IL5/IL6 environments and familiarity with DoD compliance frameworks
Proven ability to communicate complex data insights to senior-level military audiences
Nice to Haves
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate
ITIL, PMP, or other project management credentials
DISA Cyber Awareness or DoD 8570 certifications (e.g., Security+)
Prior experience with Marine Corps networks, data workflows, and systems (eDST, DRRS, etc.)
Clearance
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. TS/SCI clearance is required.
Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
JCTM is an Equal Opportunity Employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive internal and external change while supporting the safety and security of our great nation.

title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Headquartered in New York City with offices throughout the U.S. and in Vancouver, Canada, Hudson is a market-leading specialty insurer that offers a wide range of property and casualty insurance products to corporations, professional firms and individuals through retailers, wholesalers and program administrators.
Hudson underwrites specialty primary and excess insurance on an admitted basis through Hudson Insurance Company and on a non-admitted basis through Hudson Specialty Insurance Company and Hudson Excess Insurance Company. Hudson Insurance Company is admitted in all U.S. jurisdictions. Hudson has surplus lines eligibility in all U.S. jurisdictions through Hudson Specialty Insurance Company and Hudson Excess Insurance Company.
Collectively known as Hudson Insurance Group, its companies are rated A+ (Superior) by A.M. Best, Financial Size Category XV. Hudson Insurance Group is the U.S. Insurance Division of OdysseyRe, a leading worldwide underwriter of reinsurance and specialty insurance and wholly-owned by Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited.

Position Summary:
The Junior Business Intelligence Analyst will be a motivated self-starter, joining a high-performing, highly-visible, cross functional team of BI Analysts and SQL developers. Operating in a fast-paced environment, they will have the ability to make a substantial impact on day-today operations and strategic initiatives. Operating across multiple disciplines, they will play a role in projects directly for the executive team and senior leaders and will gain exposure to a variety of business units, systems, and processes. In addition, they will be responsible for helping complete all Statistical and Surplus lines reporting and will be expected to oversee/guide other team members to facilitate project completion.

Essential Duties
Contribute to meetings with the business users and stakeholders to determine scope, requirements and proposes solutions
Analyzes and converts business requirements to technical requirements, designs and implements solutions, and works with report developers on the team to deliver information in the most effective way
Turns data into actionable insights for stakeholders
Will receive exposure to existing SQL (e.g. stored procs, functions, scripts) and learn to make simple modifications
Contribute to a high functioning team completing ad-hoc tasks for multiple departments and levels of leadership

Qualifications:
Beginner knowledge of excel (Vlookups, Basic Formulas)
Any level of exposure to PowerBi designing dashboard visualizations, building semantic layers, writing Dax/M Code or Tableau is a plus.
Resourceful and appetite to become a strong problem-solver
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities and timelines
Strong inter-personal and communication skills with a high level of engagement
Displays strong work ethic and motivation to consistently improve processes

Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics or other Business practices, computer science, information technology, math, statistics, or data science preferred
Prior work or internship experience is a plus, but not required

Office Requirements
This role offers a hybrid work schedule. Candidate is required to attend New York City office at least 3 times a week.
In New York City, NY the pay range for this role is 70,000-95,000. This role may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program. The specific offer will depend on an applicant’s skills and other factors. This range is specific to New York City, NY and may not be applicable to other locations.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Position Overview
We are seeking a Power BI Developer with a deep understanding of the Power BI platform and its capabilities. This role will focus on creating impactful visualizations, managing the integration of Power BI within enterprise environments, and driving user adoption. While a foundational understanding of data engineering processes is important, this role is centered on Power BI development, integration, and optimization.
Key Responsibilities
Develop dynamic and interactive Power BI dashboards, reports, and KPI scorecards that meet business requirements.
Utilize advanced Power BI features, including:
- Subscriptions and data alerts for automated notifications.
- Integration with Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, and SharePoint for collaboration and workflow automation.
- Row-Level Security (RLS) to enforce data access policies.
- Power BI Service and Premium capabilities such as shared datasets, app workspaces, and dataflows.
Optimize report performance through effective data modeling, DAX optimization, and Power Query transformations.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, translate business needs into technical solutions, and provide best-practice guidance.
Configure and manage Power BI environments, ensuring alignment with governance policies and enterprise standards.
Integrate Power BI with external data sources, APIs, and third-party tools as needed.
Promote Power BI adoption by conducting user training and creating documentation for self-service BI users.
Required Skills
3-5 years of hands-on experience with Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service.
Expertise in DAX, Power Query (M), and creating calculated measures, columns, and hierarchies.
Strong knowledge of Power BI's capabilities, including data alerts, subscriptions, dataflows, and app workspaces.
Familiarity with integrating Power BI into broader Microsoft ecosystems such as Teams, SharePoint, and Power Automate.
Solid understanding of data modeling concepts, including star schemas and relational data models.
Proficiency in managing Power BI environments, including tenant administration and Row-Level Security (RLS).
Preferred Skills
Experience with Power BI Paginated Reports and Report Builder.
Knowledge of Power BI Premium capacities, including large dataset management and XMLA endpoints.
Familiarity with data warehouse principles and how data engineers' structure and persist data.
Azure certifications (e.g., Azure Fundamentals, Power Platform certifications).
Why Join Oakwood?
Competitive compensation with bonus potential.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision benefits.
Generous PTO and paid holidays.
Professional development opportunities, including certification support and training programs.
Flexible work environment with remote and hybrid options.
This position does not provide immigration-related sponsorship. Please don’t apply for this role if you will need sponsorship now or in the future. Thank you.

title: Power BI Lead (CPG)
description:
Tiger Analytics is a fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.

The right candidate will have broad skills in database design, be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, have experience building self-service dashboards, be comfortable using visualization tools, and be able to apply your skills to generate insights that help solve business challenges. We are looking for someone who can bring their vision to the table and implement positive change in taking the company's data analytics to the next level.
We are also market leaders in AI and analytics consulting in the CPG & retail industry with over 40% of our revenues coming from the sector. This is our fastest-growing sector and we are beefing up our talent in the space.
We are looking for someone with a good blend of business consulting skills and a data analytics background to add to our team.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
10+ years of experience in a Business Intelligence space
Knowledge of Power BI Business intelligence reporting tool is a must
Knowledge of SQL is a must
Deep knowledge and understanding of the CPG space in Sales, marketing and Supply chain.
Experience and knowledge with Data Warehouse ETL process using SSIS packages is preferred
Ability to engage with executive/VP-level stakeholders from the client’s team to translate business problems into high-level analytics solution approaches.
Consulting experience is highly preferred

title: Sr Engineer, Business Intelligence
description:
Thank you for considering a career at Ensemble Health Partners!
Ensemble Health Partners is a leading provider of technology-enabled revenue cycle management solutions for health systems, including hospitals and affiliated physician groups. They offer end-to-end revenue cycle solutions as well as a comprehensive suite of point solutions to clients across the country.
Ensemble keeps communities healthy by keeping hospitals healthy. We recognize that healthcare requires a human touch, and we believe that every touch should be meaningful. This is why our people are the most important part of who we are. By empowering them to challenge the status quo, we know they will be the difference!
O.N.E Purpose:
Customer Obsession: Consistently provide exceptional experiences for our clients, patients, and colleagues by understanding their needs and exceeding their expectations.
Embracing New Ideas: Continuously innovate by embracing emerging technology and fostering a culture of creativity and experimentation.
Striving for Excellence: Execute at a high level by demonstrating our “Best in KLAS” Ensemble Difference Principles and consistently delivering outstanding results.
The Opportunity:
The Senior Engineer, Business Intelligence plays a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights. This position involves developing and optimizing Power BI reports, building and maintaining data pipelines, and implementing automation tools.
This role will require both analytical depth and technical expertise in data engineering, business intelligence, and automation. The Senior Engineer, Business Intelligence will develop scalable analytics solutions, automate business processes and reports, and act as an administrator for our Power BI and Azure resources.

Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports with complex data models to meet business requirements.
Develop, test, deploy, monitor, and maintain scalable data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Python to ingest, transform, and store data efficiently.
Perform root cause analysis on data discrepancies and production issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Create, manage, and optimize tables within Azure Databricks for use across BI platforms.
Leverage Power Automate to design and deploy automation solutions for routine business tasks and data workflows.
Automate recurring report generation and business processes to improve operational efficiency.
Serve as a Power BI platform administrator, managing permissions, workspace governance, and capacity optimization.
Utilize advanced SQL, DAX, and M language skills to manipulate and analyze large datasets.
Provide mentorship to junior engineers by providing technical guidance on best practices and contribute to knowledge sharing and process improvement initiatives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure requirements are clear and deliver data-driven solutions.
Implement and follow standard SDLC processes and agile methodologies.
Engage in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance reporting capabilities and data quality.
Leverage Databricks and Visual Studio Code for data engineering tasks and workflow automation.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience with relational databases and advanced T-SQL.
3–5 years of experience developing Power BI reports with proficiency in DAX and M languages.
3+ years of experience with ETL processes and best practices and Azure data warehouse concepts, including Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory.
2+ years of experience with Power Automate and automation tools.
Hands-on experience in Visual Studio Code, Git, and CI/CD pipelines.
Experience in platform administration (Power BI and Azure) including provisioning, monitoring, and policy enforcement.
Proficiency in Python for data engineering tasks.
Experience with tools such as DAX Studio, Performance Analyzer, and Vertipaq.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Healthcare or revenue cycle management experience is strongly preferred.
Essential Job Functions:
Manage big data and create solutions for reporting requirements provided by stakeholders.
Solve problems and perform root cause analysis on production bugs.
Follow standard SDLC process and agile practices within a team.
Develop internal and external partnerships to provide opportunities for efficient solutions to various data, system, and application uses.
Serve as a technical resource and mentor to other developers/engineers and aid in troubleshooting and resolving issues.
Actively review new bugs reported and complete grooming and sprint planning.
Complete bug root cause analysis and work with other teams as needed to resolve issues and complete documentation and notification to the bug reporter at least twice per week.
Be a subject matter expert (SME) of report data modeling, knowledgeable about what each field is used for, and able to determine appropriate uses of data fields to create reporting.
Have advanced knowledge and skills for secondary tools such as Microsoft Azure, SQL data warehouse, Visual Studio, etc.
Possess advanced programming and optimizing skills in DAX, Dax Studio, Performance Analyzer, Vertipaq, SQL, and M languages.
Collect, organize, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy through Power BI report development.
Responsible for data mining, manipulation, and delivery to key stakeholders and executives in accordance with priorities and deadlines.
Form key relationships with and deliver professional, customer-focused service to key stakeholders and executives.
Lead the evaluation of current and future data needs and translate needs to stakeholders and product owners to support all lines of business.
Lead high-level discussions with a focus on making recommendations and identifying how data can support key business decisions.
Identify report requirements and determine how the desired results can be achieved.
Develop and maintain strategic reports from multiple databases and systems.
Complete systems validation for client data, identifying discrepancies in data totals or PKs.
Work with team members as a mentor and provide opportunities for open collaboration to problem-solve or optimize reports.
Have practical application experience with Dax Studio and Performance Analyzer and can optimize reporting based on analysis findings.
Complete code review/peer review of completed work by co-developers and provide feedback identifying issues or required report updates to meet requirements ahead of the report moving to UAT.
Present and/or publish completed reports in accordance with publishing guidelines.
This position pays between $91,400-175,200 based on experience
