title: Admissions Reader
description:
Admissions Reader
All Temps - Pennsylvania-Pittsburgh - (25003148)

The Admissions Reader will be responsible for reviewing first-year undergraduate applications for the University of Pittsburgh – Pittsburgh campus. The ideal candidate will have a strong belief in the value of higher education, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to work both efficiently and accurately in a fast-paced environment. Readers must also be able to make independent decisions and maintain the highest levels of confidentiality regarding the admissions process, application materials, and applicants’ personal information.
Candidates should demonstrate sound judgment, a commitment to fairness, and the ability to thoughtfully evaluate a wide range of student experiences and backgrounds. This approach aligns with the University’s mission to enroll a well-rounded and representative student body through a holistic admissions review process.
This is a part-time, seasonal position with the option to work up to 37.5 hours per week during peak volume periods. The role is hybrid (remote and on-campus) and runs from September 22, 2025, to March 22, 2026. Reappointment is required annually.
Please note that certain individuals are not eligible for this position. This includes current college admissions professionals, high school counselors, independent college counseling consultants, and employees or volunteers at other undergraduate institutions. Additionally, individuals who are immediate family members of a current high school junior or senior are not eligible to apply.

Must be organized and detail oriented, must be able to work under pressure and manage a high volume of files. Quality and quantity are measured by established guidelines. Responsible for knowing and utilizing a variety of tools including, but not limited to PeopleSoft, Tableau, Perceptive Content, as well as all relevant University policies and procedures. During peak periods, overtime may be required with little or no advance notice.
The candidate will spend a majority of their time reviewing applications for admission. This includes, but is not limited to, reviewing academic records including Common Application, transcripts, letters of recommendation and essays, and standardized test scores. Incumbent will utilize established university guidelines to make autonomous decisions on admission applications for first-year undergraduate students. In consideration of the aforementioned duties, the incumbent must be adept at reading, analyzing, and synthesizing information from academic records. Experience with the Common Application is preferred. Applications are reviewed online. Candidates must have reliable internet access and access to a private, secure location in which to work.

The University of Pittsburgh is committed to championing all aspects of diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility within our community. This commitment is a fundamental value of the University and is crucial in helping us advance our mission, which includes attracting and retaining diverse workforces. We will continue to create and maintain an environment that allows individuals to discover, belong, contribute, and grow, while honoring the experiences, perspectives, and unique identities of all.

The University of Pittsburgh is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and values equality of opportunity, human dignity and diversity. EOE, including disability/vets.

title: Data Analyst (Remote)
description:
Resp & Qualifications
PURPOSE:
The main purpose of a data analyst is to find meaning in data so that the derived knowledge can be used to make informed decisions and assist the organization in making better business decisions.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Engages in data exploration using various programming languages (reading and writing code), requiring knowledge of multiple database structures
Supports stakeholder in gathering business and technical requirements to deliver data driven solutions
Produces technical documentation that is consistent with professional standards.
Research and analyze data flow across data ecosystem including operational and analytical data platforms
Serve as a knowledgeable resource supporting data questions and issues from stakeholders.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data to glean insights, and suggest business appropriate recommendations
Participate in the design, development, validation and delivery of data to provide insight into business decisions.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Business or related field OR in lieu of a Bachelor's degree, an additional 4 years of relevant work experience is required in addition to the required work experience.

Experience: 3 years of data analysis or relevant work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
Hands on experience with Big Data/NoSQL Platforms with experience delivering production projects at scale.
Experience in health care industry
Bachelors degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or related field
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar analytical role
Proficient in:
SQL (Snowflake, SQL Server, or equivalent)
Microsoft Power BI and Power BI Report Builder
Microsoft Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, Power Query)
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric (e.g., dataflows, OneLake)
Basic experience with Python for data exploration and transformation
Understanding of data visualization best practices and storytelling with data
Exposure to analytical modeling methods (e.g., trend, cohort, segmentation)
Strong communication and data documentation skills
Curiosity and problem-solving mindset with attention to data quality and integrity
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)
Quantitative ,analytical and problem solving skills.
Knowledge and understanding of analytical tools , languages ,applications, platforms.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Ability to learn quickly and take direction.
Must be able to meet established deadlines and handle multiple customer service demands from internal and external customers, within set expectations for service excellence. Must be able to effectively communicate and provide positive customer service to every internal and external customer, including customers who may be demanding or otherwise challenging.
Salary Range: $73,656 - $146,289
Salary Range Disclaimer
The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the work is being performed. This compensation range is specific and considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilites of the position, the candidate's work experience, education/training, internal peer equity, and market and business consideration. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at the top of the range, as compensation decisions depend on each case's facts and circumstances, including but not limited to experience, internal equity, and location. In addition to your compensation, CareFirst offers a comprehensive benefits package, various incentive programs/plans, and 401k contribution programs/plans (all benefits/incentives are subject to eligibility requirements).

title: Associate BI Developer
description:
About Our Company:
Lids Sports Group, operating within Lids Holdings, Inc. is the largest licensed sports retailer in North America, selling fan and fashion-oriented headwear and apparel across North America and Europe. Operating out of Indianapolis, IN, Lids retail stores and affiliated concepts offer officially licensed headwear from collegiate teams and major professional sports teams, as well as branded headwear and other specialty fashion categories in the latest styles and trends in over 1,200 locations and counting. Lids is currently in growth mode with the goal to open a significant number of stores, both domestically and internationally, as well as with the goal to help grow Lids to be the largest brick-and-mortar licensed sports retailer globally.

General Position Summary
Lids is striving to become a data driven company and requires talented individuals to fulfill the Associate BI Developer role. The role will support BI initiatives across different business areas by ensuring information is delivered in a timely and accurate manner that is easily understood by all end users. Lids is predominantly using Microsoft Azure technologies with an Enterprise Data Warehouse architecture but looking to transition to Microsoft Fabric.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities
Provide reliable source of ownership for our Business Intelligence and Reporting systems.
Technical, strategic, tactical, operational responsibilities associated with the following BI and BI-related functional areas:
Data preparation (sourcing, acquisition, integration)
Data warehousing
Reporting, analytics, data exploration
Information delivery (portals, mobile)
Developing and maintaining Azure Data Factory ETL packages for the importing and organization of the BI data.
Ensuring the accuracy of data.
Identifying data sources, constructing data decomposition diagrams, providing data flow diagrams, and documenting the processes.
Designing and developing Business Intelligence and Reporting system effectively.
Help to identify and connect additional data sources (i.e. business critical database systems, outside data sources, etc.) to the Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence system environment.
Help to identify and add additional data fields from existing data sources into the Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence system environment.
Translate business requirements into data models, develop/schedule ETLs, build data cubes, and validate results.
Support already implemented BI solutions by: monitoring and tuning queries and data loads, addressing end user questions concerning data integrity, monitoring system performance and communicating functional/technical issues.
Provide On-Call support when issues arise off hours.
Participate in change control activities
Create and maintain documents such as operational information, installation procedures, troubleshooting techniques, and knowledge-base information.
Expand technical knowledge of the systems and tools utilized by the Lids IT.
Support and adhere to all company policies, procedures, and guidelines.
Manage the goals and objectives established with the supervisor.
Communicate with employees at all levels of the company.
Other duties as assigned.

Job Required Knowledge, Skills and Education
Bachelor’s Level Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, or equivalent degree
1 to 3 years of business experience in moderate to large-sized corporate environments.
1 to 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or higher.
Database system knowledge, database theory, database security, database design, capacity planning, performance analysis, and change management.
Proven track record in the following areas:
Azure SQL /Microsoft SQL Server
Transact SQL
Power BI /Tableau
Entity Relationship Diagram development
Presents initiative and a positive attitude.

Preferred Job Knowledge, Skills and Education
Programing experience in Python or .NET, SSRS, or SSIS is a plus
Strong working knowledge of the retail and distribution industry and its functions including the following areas: Finance, Retail Sales, Manufacturing, Purchase Order Entry, Supply Chain Management, Inventory Management, and Merchandising.
Experience with agile software development.
Expertise in data modeling, both logical and physical.
Experience in and understanding of a wide variety of analytical processes (governance, measurement, etc.).

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
About Peraton
Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.

Program Overview
Encompasses technical, engineering, data analytics, cyber security, management, operational, logistical, and administrative support for Bureau of Diplomatic Security, Cyber and Technology Security Directorate in three key offices/functional areas: Cyber Monitoring and Operations, Cyber Threat and Investigations, and Technology Innovation and Engineering State.

About The Role

Peraton is looking for a Senior Power BI Developer to become part of Peraton's Department of State (DOS) Diplomatic Security Cyber Mission (DSCM) program providing leading cyber and technology security experience to enable innovative, effective and secure business processes.

Location: Arlington, VA

We are currently seeking a Senior Power BI Developer with experience in SharePoint Development and Administration to join our team. As the ideal candidate, you will need to be skilled in creating data visualizations with various backend data sources, designing data models, and writing complex queries. Additionally, you will need to be proficient in designing SharePoint spoke and hub sites using SharePoint lists and metadata. If you are a motivated and experienced professional with a passion for Power BI and SharePoint, we encourage and invite you to apply to this exciting opportunity.

In this role, you will:

Develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards, ensuring data accuracy and performance.
Integrate Power BI with Dataverse and SharePoint to create comprehensive data solutions.
Write and optimize complex DAX queries for advanced data analysis.
Design, create, and manage SharePoint hub and spoke sites.
Manage SharePoint metadata and permissions to ensure proper access and organization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Provide technical support and training to end-users as needed.
Lead SharePoint migration projects, including planning, execution, and post-migration support.
Develop and implement customized SharePoint-based configurations using best practices.
Create and manage workflows to improve process efficiency and guide business teams on best practices.

General:

Need to have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Diagnose and resolve issues within Power BI solutions, ensuring data integrity and performance
Have excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Have the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Possess strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
Have experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe) development.
Have experience in preparation of business requirements documents, functional requirements documents, governance documents, test plans, training documents, and user guides.
Have experience with other Microsoft 365 tools and services (e.g., Teams, OneDrive).
Possess knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
Have a strong understanding of the relationships between operational needs and business processes, ensuring alignment of technical architectures with business strategies.
Have a strong understanding of data modeling, data visualization, and business intelligence concepts.
#DSCM

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 9 years' of relevant experience. An additional 4 years of experience will be considered in lieu of degree/education.
Either possess or obtain prior to start date ONE of the following certifications:
CASP+ CE, CCNA Cyber Ops, CCNA-Security, CCNP Security, CEH, CFR, CISA, CISSP (or Associate), Cloud+, CySA+, GCED, GCIA, GCIH, GICSP, SCYBER, VCA DCV, PPDA, Agile IC, SNOW App Dev
Power BI Skills:
Proficiency in designing and building data models that accurately represent business needs and facilitate efficient analysis.
Proficiency in building interactive and dynamic dashboards and reports to present data insights and enable data-driven decision-making.
Experience with Power BI integration with Dataverse and SharePoint.
Experience utilizing DAX to create custom calculations, measures, and filters within Power BI models.
Ability to optimize Power BI performance and troubleshoot issues.
Experience connecting Power BI to various data sources, including databases, Excel files, and cloud services.
Familiarity migrating dashboards using deployment pipelines
SharePoint Skills:
Experience in creating and managing hub and spoke sites.
Proficiency in managing SharePoint metadata and permissions.
Knowledge of SharePoint Online, Teams and SharePoint Server
Ability to design and implement SharePoint workflows and custom solutions.
Experience with SharePoint Designer and workflows development.
Microsoft 365 Skills:
Experience with Microsoft 365 apps and services such as Teams, OneDrive, Power Platform (Power BI, PowerApps, Power Automate).
Experience with Azure Active Directory, Azure DevOps, and Azure integration with Microsoft 365.
U.S. citizenship required.
Active Secret security clearance.
The ability to obtain a final Top Secret security clearance.

Desired:

Experience with Power BI Desktop, Service and Power BI Embedded.
Knowledge of Power Query, DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M (Powe Query Formula) languages.
Familiarity with Power BI security and governance best practices.
SharePoint Skills:
Experience with SharePoint Framework (SPFx) for custom development.
Experience integrating Power Apps and Power BI into SharePoint sites
Knowledge of Power Automate (formerly Microsoft Flow) for automating workflows.
Familiarity with SharePoint migration tools and processes (e.g., Sharegate, MetaLogix).
Proficiency in SharePoint Designer, InfoPath forms, workflows development, and customization using jQuery, Java, and Query String.
Proficiency in C#, VB, Visual Studio, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, ASP, JavaScript, XML, CSS, HTML, AJAX, and web services.
Experience with PowerShell commands for backup and restore operations.

Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate

title: Microsoft 365 Power Platform Developer [Hybrid]
description:
Scope of Position:
About Us:

EDF power solutions North America has been providing clean energy solutions throughout the U.S., Canada, and Mexico since 1987. We are a market-leading independent power producer and service provider, serving utilities, corporations, industries, communities, institutions, and investors with reliable, low-carbon energy solutions that help meet growing demand.

From developing and building scalable wind (onshore and offshore), solar, storage (battery and pumped storage hydro), smart EV charging, microgrids, green hydrogen, and transmission projects, to maximizing performance and profitability through skilled operations and maintenance and innovative asset optimization, our teams deliver expert solutions along the entire value chain—from origination to commercial operation.

Be a part of an innovative and collaborative team environment that fosters our goal of delivering renewable solutions to lead the transition to a sustainable energy future.

Benefits & Perks:

EDF power solutions offers best-in-class employee benefits, including the following:

Competitive bonus incentives. This position is eligible for our annual bonus program.
Comprehensive health coverage. EDF power solutions USA provides low-cost health & wellness coverage for employees and their eligible dependents.
Rewarding 401k. EDF power solutions provides a generous matching contribution.

We are also proud to offer:

Favorable paid time off programs, including paid parental leave after one year of service.
Rewarding learning & career development and advancement opportunities.
Supportive mentorship & buddy programs.

Salary Range: The full pay range for this role is $118,400 - $197,300 annually. We generally base our salary decisions on factors such as internal equity, candidate work and/leadership experience, educational credentials, and in some cases, candidate work location.

Scope of Job: Designs, develops, implements, and maintains solutions using M365 tools and Microsoft Power Platform suite, including Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI and SharePoint. Collaborates with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to gather requirements and translates them into scalable solutions to effectively address business needs. The Microsoft 365 Power Platform Developer role involves using best practice architecture for M365 solutions to ensure scalability, security, and efficiency. The Microsoft 365 Power Platform Developer utilizes M365 tools to design, develop, and maintain automated solutions to streamline operations using best practices. This role also innovates and enhances applications based on industry trends and client expectations, as well as optimizes solutions for performance and security while providing suggestions for process and tool improvements.
Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:
Solution Development
Designs, develops, and implements solutions using M365 tools that align with defined requirements and meets users' needs
Conducts peer reviews of teammate solutions and provides constructive feedback to ensure adherence to team-defined standards and best practices
Tests and troubleshoots applications to ensure optimal functionality and performance
Implements UI/UX best practices to create user-friendly, intuitive solutions
Innovates and enhances current solutions and processes to improve usability and productivity
Automates processes where feasible to minimize human error and boost efficiency
Optimizes both new and existing solutions to meet performance, security standards, and industry best practices
Manage M365 Services
Implements, configures & manages M365 services
Manages user accounts, permissions, and security settings
Performs patching and deployment activities
Conducts diagnostics and troubleshooting within the M365 environment
Power Platform Center of Excellence (CoE)
Leads COE events and trainings
Provides technical support and training to end-users as needed
Documentation & Support
Creates and maintains detailed documentation for all developed solutions, including design specifications, user guides, and technical documentation
Provides training and support to end-users on how to use and maintain the solutions effectively
Provides M365 support to end-users on M365 tools
Maintain Proficiency in Technical Tools
Stays current with the latest trends and features in the M365 ecosystem and related Microsoft technologies
Other duties, as assigned
Supervision of Others: None

Working Conditions: 80% of time is spent in the office environment. 20% of time is spent outside of the office comprised of national and international travel for meetings and collaboration with global counterparts, as well as travel to conferences and trade shows to understand new and emerging technologies and changes to the renewable energy industry.

Fiscal Responsibilities: None
Qualifications:
Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field
6+ years of experience working with M365
Experience in low-code/no-code development and business process automation.
Proven proficiency developing Canvas Apps, Power Automate flows, and Power BI reports and dashboards
Experience with Copilot Studio or other AI-driven tools for chatbot or agent development
Power Platform certifications is a plus
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Excellent communication & collaboration skills to interact with Product Management, business stakeholders, and technical teams
Strong understanding of solution lifecycle management (ALM) for Power Platform (e.g., environments, pipelines, versioning).
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
M365 Service Management (user administration, security, patching, services)
Achieves results through individual and team efforts.
Knowledge of Power Platform Development: Power apps, Power Automate, Power BI
SharePoint Development: Sites, lists, libraries, and permissions for the purpose of integrating with Power Platform
Copilot Studio: Agent Development
Technical Troubleshooting & Debugging
API integrations
PowerShell & other scripting languages
Azure automation
M365 Domain knowledge
Physical Requirements: Must be able to sit or stand at computer for a reasonable length of time typing and reading. Regularly required to walk or stand. 100% of time is spent in the office environment, utilizing computers (frequent use of various Microsoft software/programs), phones, and general office equipment.

title: BUSINESS ANALYST
description:
Business Analyst

Position: Full-Time I Competitive Pay & Benefits
Location: 1515 E 4th Street, Little Rock, AR 72202

About Us: At O’Connor Distributing, we:
Build brands for our suppliers.
Operate with urgency for our customers.
Create long-term sustainable equity for our owners and employees.

Founded in 1993, we’ve grown from one distributorship with annual sales of 256,000 cases to three divisions- Three Rivers, Three Lakes, and White River Beverage- with annual sales exceeding 2.7 million cases. We proudly serve over 1,400 retailers across 35 counties.

Our Core Values- Excellence, Humility, Integrity, Accountability, and Customer-Focused Teamwork- guide everything we do.

Position Summary:
The Business Analyst I will play a critical role in analyzing data and providing insights to drive operational and sales performance. This entry-level position is ideal for someone with strong analytical skills, a passion for solving problems, and an interest in the beverage distribution industry. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify trends, streamline processes, and support data-driven decision-making.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting
Analyze sales, inventory, delivery, and payment data across systems.
Build dashboards and reports highlighting key performance indicators (KPIs).
Conduct gross margin analysis, factoring in freight, promotions, and rebates.
Serve as primary contact for reporting requests and system-related issues.
Administrative Support
Monitor and report on pricing discrepancies to ensure timely, accurate updates across all channels to maintain market competitiveness and profitability.
Prepare and distribute detailed product and pricing requests to chain customers.
Support communication between pricing, sales, and customer service teams to ensure alignment on pricing strategies.
Systems Integration & Data Management
Extract and integrate data from multiple platforms for reporting and analysis.
Support EDI processes with retail chains and key customers.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting platforms.
Collaboration & Communication
Partner with sales, operations, finance, and IT teams to support cross-functional business needs.
Present clear, actionable insights and data-driven recommendations to leadership and business teams.
Serve as a point of contact for ad hoc reporting requests and system-related inquiries.
Process Improvement
Identify and recommend ways to boost efficiency and reduce costs.
Help implement tools to streamline workflows.
Document standard procedures for data analysis and reporting processes.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Supply Chain, or related field preferred; equivalent experience or training will be considered
Experience: 1-2+ years in business or operational analytics preferred.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP, Macros, formulas, charts).
Experience building dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, or similar a plus).
Familiarity with SQL or other data query languages is a plus.
System Knowledge (Preferred but not required): Encompass, VIP, SAP, EDI platforms, and ShareFile.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Industry Knowledge: Experience in beverage distribution or consumer goods is a plus.
What we Offer
Competitive salary
Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, vision, 401K profit sharing, vacation, and performance bonuses.)
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
A chance to lead and shape the culture of a thriving beer distribution organization.

How to Apply
Careers - O'Connor Distributing
Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your experience to OConnorHR@OConnorDistributing.com

General Statement
All successful applicants must share a commitment to O’Connor Distributing goals and an ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results oriented environment. In exchange we offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package.
We have sought to create an environment in which the contributions of each employee at O’Connor Distributing are fully valued. This means more than simply treating one another with respect; it also means giving full consideration to how all our people who have many diverse racial, cultural, and social backgrounds can positively impact the quality of the decisions we make about our business.
Here at O’Connor Distributing we recognize that our workforce reflects the increasingly diverse nature of our society, and we want to do all we can to take advantage of that diversity with both our external and internal customers. We believe our differences are also our strengths, and we want to do all we can to use those strengths to find more creative solutions for the business challenges we face. O’Connor Distributing is an equal employment opportunity, affirmative action employee.
For more information, visit: www.oconnordistributing.com

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Greenwood Village, CO

Who We Are:
Excelacom has a global presence in the consulting and technology solutions industry with a focus on Communications and Media providers. We collaborate with our clients to solve their complex business, technology and operational challenges through a combination of consulting expertise and telecom-focused solutions and products. Excelacom provides extensive experience in product development, IT consulting, telecom-focused software and managed services, as well as strategic management and thought leadership to steer our clients towards a successful business and technology transformation.

At Excelacom, we recognize that our most valuable asset is our people. We strive to create an environment where our employees can contribute their unique perspectives and grow individually and collectively. Our diverse and inclusive culture empowers our people to embrace their ideas and transform them into innovative solutions.

Who You Are:
The Business Intelligence / Data Analyst will support the Product WiFi Data Intelligence team by performing data analysis and reporting tasks, while also helping to manage projects, stakeholder relationships, and prioritization efforts with Product Owners across the WiFi Product organization.

At the Consultant-level, you will be expected to independently contribute ideas, recommendations, and solutions toward solving business challenges, construct key components of deliverables/presentations, and contribute to the development of Intellectual Capital (IC) and Marketing Collateral. You will serve as a team leader for individual work streams and acquire a comprehensive understanding of the firm’s expertise, product set, and capabilities. Most importantly, you will embrace our firm’s brand and core values.

Role and Responsibilities:
You may work on various projects throughout your career with Excelacom. The roles and responsibilities noted below pertain to the specific role listed above.
Decompose key business problems to identify value areas and structure and implement complex technology solutions for the client.
Deliver advisory services to Senior Management and above in support of technology-enabled business changes.
Meet with client staff on a daily basis to understand key issues with how they operate today and identify opportunities for improvement in their operations and technology landscape.
Identify and qualify additional business opportunities
Prepare solutions and proposals and present to clients
Strong relational database skills are required utilizing SQL within an AWS environment.
In addition to they may be working with external sources, including other databases, manual files, and external websites.
Candidate may also be tasked to analyze data and reports to monitor trends, product and feature launches and work with product owners to identify areas of improvement through data and reporting.
Position will also assist in investigating issues with operations teams identifying metrics and KPIs to foster improvements our products and services.

Required Qualifications:
7+ years of previous Business Intelligence or Data Analysis is required
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science or related field
Prior consulting experience –in an agile environment – with a leading strategy firm, consulting practice, or consulting technology firm
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) including formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis features within Excel
Highly collaborative, team-oriented with strong stakeholder management skills
Ability to lead project working groups and possesses strong facilitation and data gathering skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with technical and non-technical personnel
Working in Jira and Confluence tools is required to help manage projects, prioritize work and document requirements.
Familiarity and experience within the Internet/ WiFi technologies and or Telecom domain a plus
Proficient in SQL / AWS Athena environment
Ability to write complex SQL queries, table joins and common table expressions (CTE)
Proficiency in statistical methods, including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and probability, to draw meaningful conclusions from data. Can identify important metrics and KPIs related for business and or WiFi technology performance
Proficient with project lifecycles - Participates in projects from inception to end, working with project stakeholders to write detailed reporting requirements and delivers reporting milestones during the project lifecycle.
Proficient with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Pivot or other reporting/visualization tools
Familiarity with Atlassian tools such as Jira and Confluence

Preferred Qualifications:
Prior experience in Telecommunications, Media, or Cable is highly preferred
Experience in Internet and WiFi domain a plus.
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python and R for statistical and data analysis a plus
Past success in generating new business with existing clients
Good time management skills

Compensation and Benefits:
For individuals assigned to work in Colorado, Excelacom is required to include a reasonable estimated compensation range for this role. However, final salaries will vary based on several factors, such as candidate’s level, qualifications, skills, competencies and proficiency for the role. An individual may be hired at the Analyst, Consultant, or Manager level for this role with each level requiring an increasing set of responsibilities. For regular full-time employees, the estimated salary range is from $70,000 to $85,000.

Our competitive salaries are just one component of Excelacom’s total compensation package for our regular full-time employees. Other rewards and benefits include: health, vision, and dental insurance, ancillary benefits, Life and AD&D insurance, 401k, and generous paid time off policies.

EEO Statement:
Excelacom, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Any decision affecting employment, compensation, promotion, or transfer will be based solely on personal qualifications and merit, regardless of sex, race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, disability, age, results of genetic testing, service in the military, pregnancy, childbirth or other related medical conditions or any other factor protected under applicable law.

title: Dynamics 365 Administrator (Remote)
description:

Location: Remote
Job Description
Job Description for D365: The Dynamics 365 Administrator will be responsible for the overall administration, configuration, maintenance, and support of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform (including Finance and Operations, Sales, or other modules, as applicable). The role will also involve managing system integrations with other enterprise platforms such as Salesforce, ADP, Snowflake, Mulesoft, and Azure services. The ideal candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, Finance, Operations, and vendors, to ensure the stability, performance, and scalability of D365 systems and integrations.

Dynamics 365 Finance focuses on managing an organization's financial operations, including general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and financial reporting.
Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management focuses on managing inventory, procurement, sales, production, and logistics.
Key Responsibilities:
Dynamics 365 Administration:
Manage user accounts, roles, and security permissions across the Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform.
Monitor system performance, perform routine maintenance, troubleshoot issues, and coordinate with Microsoft support when needed.
Manage updates, patches, and hotfixes through Lifecycle Services (LCS).
Manage document management configurations within D365 F&O, ensuring the handling of records and document templates.
Configure entities, workflows, business rules, forms, and dashboards as required.
Troubleshoot and resolve application issues and support user requests.
Maintain system documentation, including configurations, processes, and customizations.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
focuses on managing inventory, procurement, sales, production, and logistics.
Integration Management:
Oversee and support integrations between D365 and other enterprise systems (e.g., Salesforce, ADP, Mulesoft, Snowflake, Azure Active Directory, Power BI).
Work with middleware platforms (such as Mulesoft or Azure Logic Apps) to ensure reliable data flow and synchronization.
Collaborate with integration developers to design and troubleshoot APIs, web services, and batch interfaces.
Manage and monitor data pipelines and automated jobs to ensure optimal performance, accuracy, and timely execution.
Participate in data mapping, transformation, and validation efforts during the integration design and deployment process.
Project Support and Enhancements:
Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into system configurations or enhancements.
Participate in system upgrades, module deployments, and change management activities.
Support UAT testing, documentation, and training efforts for new features or integrations.
Security and Compliance:
Implement role-based security and ensure proper audit logging and monitoring.
Support internal and external audits by providing access logs, user role reviews, and system control documentation.
Maintain awareness of D365 platform changes and evaluate potential impacts on existing integrations and configurations.
Qualifications:
Required:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
4+ years of experience administering Microsoft Dynamics 365 (F&O, CE, or both).
Experience with system integrations (REST/SOAP APIs, webhooks, middleware like Mulesoft or Azure Logic Apps).
Strong understanding of data structures, entity relationships, and security models in D365.
Proficiency in Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps, Power BI) is a plus.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and documentation skills.
Required Skills & Qualifications:
Proven experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O administration.
Strong understanding of security roles, workflows, and system architecture.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Experience with system upgrades, data migration, and performance tuning.
Background in Finance and Accounting, ERP with D365 F&O.
Ability to analyze support trends and recommend system improvements.
Target Base Salary Range: $90,000-$110,000
This position can be remote (US Only) for the right candidate.

title: Sr.Business Analyst (Power BI)
description:
Job Title: Business Analyst (Power BI Expertise)

Location: Houston,TX

Duration: Long Term

Job Summary:
We are seeking a Business Analyst with a strong background in Power BI development to drive data analysis, visualization, and business insights. The ideal candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret business needs, develop technical solutions, and ensure high-quality reporting that supports strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with BI developers, Data and ETL teams, and other stakeholders to define business requirements and optimize reporting solutions.

Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and data visualizations using Power BI, DAX, and Power Query to communicate insights effectively.

Interpret and write native SQL queries to analyze and retrieve data from relational databases (Snowflake, SQL Server).

Ensure the quality, accuracy, repeatability, and sustainability of reporting, leveraging best practices in data management.

Work within an Agile methodology to deliver iterative improvements to reporting solutions.

Provide clear and concise documentation for Power BI solutions and business analysis processes.

Communicate findings effectively to stakeholders, ensuring that technical solutions align with business goals.

Required Qualifications:
10 plus years experience

Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role, with a team-oriented approach to collaboration.

Advanced Power BI skills with expertise in DAX and Power Query.

Strong understanding of data visualization principles and cohesive report design.

Experience with relational databases and data warehouses, preferably Snowflake and SQL Server.

Ability to interpret business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.

Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Commitment to data accuracy, quality, and sustainability in reporting.

Familiarity with Agile methodology.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with other Microsoft Power Platform applications such as Power Automate, Power Apps, and Dataflows.

8+ years of overall professional experience with 3+ years of hands-on Power BI development.

Experience with sales performance reporting and metrics-driven analytics.

title: Power BI Developer (Senior)
description:
Job Title: Power BI Developer (Senior)
Location: Redstone Arsenal
Position Type: Full-Time

Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Power BI Developer to lead the design, development, and deployment of business intelligence and data analytics solutions. This role demands expertise in Power BI, ETL processes, data warehousing, and data visualization, with the ability to transform raw data into meaningful insights to support critical business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in big data technologies, SQL development, and experience with multiple business intelligence environments. An active Top Secret clearance is required.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and develop visually compelling Power BI dashboards and reports to support business operations and decision-making.
Perform advanced data analysis, data modeling, and data visualization using Power BI and other BI tools.
Create, optimize, and maintain complex SQL queries, stored procedures, triggers, views, and scripts.
Implement Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to move and transform data from source systems to target data warehouses or reporting systems.
Develop ETL mappings to extract data from various sources (databases, flat files, APIs), transform it according to business rules, and load it efficiently into target systems.
Conduct performance tuning of ETL jobs and BI reports to ensure optimal load and rendering times.
Participate in all phases of the development life cycle, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and documentation.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting needs, gather requirements, and translate them into technical specifications and actionable solutions.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all reporting layers.
Apply best practices in data management, data warehousing, and data governance.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior BI developers and analysts.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Minimum 8 years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or data engineering.
Active Top Secret clearance is required.
Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
Strong experience with SQL development and database technologies (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Expertise in ETL tools and frameworks, with a solid understanding of data transformation and integration practices.
Hands-on experience with data warehousing concepts, architecture, and performance tuning.
Familiarity with big data platforms and technologies is a plus (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Strong communication and documentation skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with government or defense data environments.
Knowledge of cloud-based BI platforms and data services (e.g., Azure Synapse, AWS Redshift).
Experience with DevOps, version control (e.g., Git), and agile methodologies.
Familiarity with additional BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik, Cognos) is a plus.

ABOUT CINTEL, INC:
Cintel Inc. is a Small Business providing strategies and services to support an array of Government clients in Software Development, Operational/Tactical and Installation/Facilities Energy, Cyber Security, Modeling and Simulation, Data Science, and Programmatic support.

We offer our clients nimble, unique, and value focused solutions with an emphasis on people, connectivity, communication, and teamwork. Our team believes that people drive solutions. By connecting people, information, teams, and experience we deliver solutions that respond to customer needs.

It is the policy of Cintel that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity regardless of their race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, genetic information, or veteran status. These policies shall ensure that the practice of nondiscrimination will be applied in the employment, promotion, upgrading, demotion, transfer, layoff, termination, recall or rehire of personnel. Equal employment opportunity applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training.

Cintel, Inc. expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment or discrimination based on any of the characteristics mentioned above. Improper interference with the ability of other employees to perform their expected job duties is not tolerated.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description:
The Business Intelligence Developer is a key contributor to True Homes’ data-driven decision-making strategy. This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining intuitive, high-impact data visualizations and analytics solutions primarily using Power BI and the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem. The BI Developer will partner with business stakeholders, data architects, and engineers to translate business needs into scalable, cloud-native BI solutions aligned with enterprise standards and strategic objectives.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate business questions into actionable insights using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric
Design and maintain semantic models, dataflows, and Power BI datasets within Microsoft Fabric
Build robust, intuitive dashboards, paginated reports, and self-service analytics tools for internal business units
Integrate data from multiple sources (on-prem and cloud) and ensure data models are optimized for performance and usability
Partner with Data Architects and Engineers to define and evolve cloud-first data architecture within Azure Synapse, Data Lake, Delta Lake, and OneLake
Support and contribute to governance and security models, including data access, row-level security (RLS), and usage monitoring
Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and stakeholder walkthroughs to validate report functionality and ensure alignment with business needs
Provide Power BI and self-service training, documentation, and mentorship to analysts and end-users
Troubleshoot production issues and manage report lifecycle in collaboration with IT support and DevOps
Stay current with emerging technologies in the Microsoft Data Platform and proactively recommend improvements
Communicate progress and key metrics to the Operations Partner of Enterprise Technology or assigned executive sponsor
Performs other duties as needed or required
Results/Accountability:
Consistently delivers accurate, timely, and high-performance BI solutions aligned with project and business timelines
Builds trust and credibility with stakeholders through integrity, reliability, and transparency
Encourages data-driven culture through collaboration, training, and evangelism of BI best practices
Demonstrates ownership and follow-through, resolving issues proactively and independently
Drives innovation by embracing new tools within Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Power BI
Promotes consistency in design patterns, naming conventions, and data practices across BI assets
Maintains compliance with internal data policies, quality standards, and security protocols
Delivers Power BI solutions on time that meet business objectives
Communicates effectively by developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
Drives engagement by creating a climate where people are motivated to their best to help the organization achieve its objectives
Drives results by consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances
Ensures decision quality by making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward
Plans and aligns by planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
Ensures accountability by holding self and others accountable to meet commitments
Manages conflict by handling conflict effectively, with a minimum of noise
Exemplifies organizational savvy by maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process, and people-related organizational dynamics
Focuses on action by taking on new opportunities/tough challenges with a sense of urgency, energy/enthusiasm
Qualifications:
High school diploma or GED required
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field — or equivalent relevant experience
Proven experience with Power BI, including DAX, M, Power Query, and deployment pipelines
Strong experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Synapse Dedicated Pools
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric, including Data Factory, Notebooks, and Lakehouses
Understanding of cloud data architecture, ETL/ELT processes, and semantic modeling
Knowledge of DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and source control (Git) for BI assets is a plus
Experience with Power BI capacities, performance tuning, and large dataset management is a plus
General Requirements:
Exceptional attention to detail
Strong communication skills, written, and verbal skills
Strong organizational skills
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into business-friendly insights
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Highly organized, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple priorities
Complies with all company policies and procedures
Demonstrates the qualities and character traits as defined in the True Difference
Physical Requirements
Must be able to remain in a stationary position 75% of the time
Associate needs to occasionally move about the office to access file cabinets, office equipment, etc.
Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment

title: BI Engineer
description:
Bitsight is a cyber risk management leader transforming how companies manage exposure, performance, and risk for themselves and their third parties. Companies rely on Bitsight to prioritize their cybersecurity investments, build greater trust within their ecosystem, and reduce their chances of financial loss.
Built on over a decade of technological innovation, its integrated solutions deliver value across enterprise security performance, digital supply chains, cyber insurance, and data analysis.
We invented the cyber ratings industry in 2011
Over 3000 customers trust Bitsight
Over 750 teammates are dispersed throughout Boston, Raleigh, New York, Lisbon, Singapore, and remote
Applicants for this role must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. and not require sponsorship of an employment visa now or in the future.
Company: Bitsight Technologies, Inc.
Location: 111 Huntington Avenue, Suite 400, Boston, MA 02199
Position Title: BI Engineer

Job Description:
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for optimal extraction, loading, and transformation of data from various sources using a modern data stack. Collaborate with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization. Work with stakeholders including the executive, product, sales, and engineering teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues. Implement processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it. Analyze data sets using statistical techniques and effectively communicate trends and patterns that enhance the opportunities for the business. Perform data analysis required to troubleshoot data-related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues job requirements. Position is fixed location based in Boston office; however, telecommuting from a home office is allowed up to 100%.
Job Requirements:
Requires a Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Information Systems or a directly related field plus three (3) years of experience as data analyst, business intelligence analyst, software analyst, or similar role. Experience must include:
Three (3) years of experience in the following (experience may be gained concurrently):
SQL experience working with relational databases experience in snowflake and redshift.
Data warehouse solutions experience with dimensional modeling experience building reports and dashboards using tools: tableau, looker and power bi.
Code management tools bitbucket or github.
Agile software development methodologies with fivetran, stitch, matillion, or rivery.
40 hours/week, 9:00am-5:00pm.
Diversity. Bitsight is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind and are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of your gender identity, race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability.
Culture. We put our people first. Bitsight offers best in class benefits. We devote the same energy to nurturing our company's inclusive culture as we apply to serving our customers' needs. Working at Bitsight will give you the opportunity to fulfill your professional goals and expand your skills.
Open-minded. If you got to this point, we hope you’re feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don’t feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We’re eager to meet people that believe in Bitsight’s mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways.
Additional Information for United States of America Applicants:
Bitsight also provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. recruiting@bitsight.com

title: BI Administrator
description:
Who We Are:

At Avnet, relationships matter. We are a global, FORTUNE ® 500 technology distributor and solutions company that delivers design, supply chain and logistics expertise to customers at every stage of a product’s lifecycle. Our employees have a front row seat to the latest innovations shaping the world we live in and the future we share. We’re driven to help our customers around the world succeed and we do so by earning the trust of some of the biggest names in technology.
Working at Avnet means being a part of a global team. We work collaboratively and with integrity, doing business the right way. For more than a century, we have partnered together to help our customers, suppliers and teammates realize the transformative possibilities of technology. Experience what’s next at Avnet!
Summary:
Provides actionable business intelligence used to make informed decisions that support strategic initiatives and drive increased revenue, profit, and market share. This role is responsible for the end-to-end delivery of analytics, from managing and optimizing the Power BI platform to conducting in-depth industry research and presenting findings to senior leadership. You will ensure the technical environment is robust and efficient while also using its data to evaluate the organization’s competitive position and identify emerging trends.
Principal Responsibilities:
BI Platform Management & Governance:
Manage and administer all Power BI assets, including workspaces, semantic models (datasets), dataflows, and gateways to ensure stability and security.
Utilize the Power BI Admin Portal to configure and enforce tenant-level settings, policies, and best practices.
Oversee Power BI licensing models, providing expertise on Premium (P2) capacity management and cost optimization.
Development, Monitoring & Optimization:
Develop and troubleshoot complex reports, dashboards, and semantic models using strong data modeling best practices and advanced DAX.
Proactively monitor and troubleshoot data refresh failures, usage metrics, and performance bottlenecks to ensure reliability.
Use the Power BI Premium Capacity Metrics App for capacity planning, performance tuning, and resource management.
Integration & Automation:
Integrate Power BI with other services, including Power Automate, Power Apps, and Azure services (e.g., Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake).
Leverage APIs and PowerShell to automate administrative tasks, streamline workflows, and manage the platform at scale.
Promote the use of analytical tools and modern methods to improve the business decision-making process.
Strategic Analysis & Competitive Intelligence:
Analyze information from multiple external sources regarding company financial performance, customer insights, competitor profiles, and industry trends.
Gather, aggregate, and model critical industry data to forecast changing market variables and identify business risks and opportunities.
Organize research and analytical results into concise presentations, narratives, and consultative opinions for senior executives.
Job Qualifications & Specifications:
Work Experience: Typically 5+ years of experience in a business intelligence, data analytics, or platform administration role.
Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience from which comparable knowledge and job skills can be obtained.
Technical Skills:
Proven experience managing Power BI assets (Workspaces, Semantic Models, Dataflows, Gateways).
In-depth knowledge of the Power BI Admin Portal, tenant-level settings, and Premium Capacity management.
Strong proficiency in DAX for complex calculations and troubleshooting.
Strong understanding of data modeling best practices for analytics.
Experience using PowerShell and APIs for automation and administration.
Familiarity with integrating Power BI with Power Platform and Azure data services.
Analytical & Professional Skills:
Extensive knowledge of business intelligence principles and the ability to develop solutions for complex problems.
Demonstrated ability to analyze external market data, conduct industry research, and perform competitive analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex analytical results to senior management.
Works independently, exercising considerable judgment and discretion in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
Acts as a primary contact on projects, effectively coordinating work between departments.
#LI-HYBRID
What We Offer:
Our employees work hard to live our values and help us grow. Our total rewards strategy supports Avnet’s ability to attract, engage, develop, and reward our employees, while promoting a diverse and inclusive environment. We offer competitive compensation and benefit programs — from time away and flexible working arrangements to programs supporting employee well-being and opportunities to give back to your community.
Generous Paid Time Off
401K and Pension Plan
Paid Holidays
Family Support (Paid Leave, Surrogacy, Adoption)
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
Long-term and Short-term Disability Insurance
Health Savings Account / Flexible Spending Account
Education Assistance
Employee Development Resources
Employee Wellness, Leadership Development and Mentorship Programs
Benefits listed above may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Avnet.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills.
Avnet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy of non-discrimination also applies to religious dress and grooming practices. Avnet will accommodate employee religious dress standards and grooming practices that do not result in undue hardship for the Company. If you are interested in applying for employment with Avnet and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position contact our Human Resources Service Center at (888) 994-7669.

title: Tableau Specialist
description:
Tableau Specialist
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Tableau specialist who possesses strong reporting and analytics skills, with experience preferably in the retail and/or grocery business. In this position you will be assisting in creating new reports and maintaining current reports related to Net Cost Market sales analysis and category performance. As a Tableau specialist, you will significantly contribute to our business analysis and supply chain operations.
Tableau Developer Responsibilities:
Work closely with sales and operational teams to ensure data sources are accurate, available and analyzable.
Hands on with Tableau Desktop (dashboard creation, report authoring and troubleshooting, data source management).
Create and edit SQL queries within Tableau to build calculated fields.
Create interactive filters, parameters and calculations for preparing dashboards and worksheets in Tableau.
Build and publish interactive dashboards on Tableau Server. Collaborate with internal team-leads and analysts to test, clean, and standardized data to meet the business requirements.
Have the confidence to work cross-functionally with various departments including business stakeholders and technical personnel to exchange ideas and analyze data to better extract and represent the information.
Tableau Developer Requirements:
At least two years of experience designing and developing business intelligence dashboards using Tableau.
Strong knowledge and experience with MS SQL Server.
Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft Visual Studio.
At least two years in UI/UX field, with experience using a combination of user interface tools such as wire frames, prototypes, mock-ups, or white boarding to illustrate product usability.
Experience working with large and complex data set able to write simple queries to create calculated fields.
Empirical understanding of data systems (BI analytics, data blending, data warehousing, data ETL, etc.) on process automation and standardization.
Experience working on a support team environment by documenting, researching, solving problems via phone calls or email ticketing system.
Exceptional verbal communication and documentation skills are essential for maintaining workflows and ensuring dashboard functionality.

title: Amazon Reporting and Analytics Lead (Applicants from all over the world are welcome to apply.)
description:
Position Type: Full-time
Location: Applicants from anywhere in the world are welcome to apply. (Remote)
Schedule: Flexible EST
About the Company
Our client is a growth-focused firm that builds and scales high-performing e-commerce brands across Amazon, Shopify, and Walmart. With a strong track record of launching and operating successful consumer product brands, they bring a data-driven approach to brand building, combining performance marketing, operations excellence, and strategic innovation. Their team is fully remote, collaborative, and passionate about driving results in a fast-paced digital commerce environment.
About the Role
We’re looking for a skilled and forward-thinking Amazon Reporting and Analytics Lead to design and manage robust data reporting systems across Amazon, Shopify, and Walmart platforms. This role involves building scalable dashboards, automating data flows, and translating business needs into actionable insights. The ideal candidate is both technical and business-minded, comfortable working cross-functionally, and eager to grow into a leadership role within six months with mentorship from the current Head of Analytics.
Responsibilities
Build and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly ecommerce performance reports using Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, and similar tools.
Create user-friendly dashboards in tools such as Looker Studio or Power BI to visualize key performance metrics.
Integrate and analyze data from platforms like Amazon, Shopify, Walmart, Meta Ads, and Google Ads.
Develop and manage systems for data storage and organization using tools like BigQuery, Snowflake, or AWS.
Automate reporting processes using scripts and APIs to streamline workflows and reduce manual effort.
Collaborate with marketing, operations, and executive teams to deliver insights and answer key business questions.
Maintain clear and up-to-date documentation for all reports, systems, and dashboards.
Lay the groundwork for a high-performing analytics function, with the opportunity to grow into a leadership role.
Competencies and Qualifications
Must-Have
4-5+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or data engineering roles.
Direct experience with ecommerce analytics from platforms like Amazon Seller Central and Shopify.
Proficient in building automated reports and dashboards using tools like Looker Studio, Power BI, SQL, and Google Sheets.
Strong experience with data storage and pipeline tools (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS).
Excellent communication skills, able to explain data to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Self-starter with a proven ability to manage multiple projects independently in a remote setting.
Experience working with US or UK-based ecommerce or DTC companies.
Experience with API integration and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Apps Script).
Effective communicator who can translate data into meaningful narratives and influence decision-making at all levels.
Nice-to-Have
Prior experience in a fast-growing startup or analytics leadership role.
Background in consumer product goods (CPG) or digital marketing analytics.
Familiarity with tools like Segment, GA4, or Supermetrics.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or technical field (e.g., Statistics, CS, Business Analytics).
Demonstrated stability in career progression—ideally someone who has grown within organizations and been promoted through performance.
Key Qualities
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and clearly communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Goal-oriented with a strong focus on driving measurable results aligned with business objectives.
Action-oriented, taking initiative to turn insights into execution and moving projects forward with urgency and ownership.
What We Offer
100% Remote Work – Work from anywhere in the Philippines.
Career Growth Opportunities – Gain hands-on experience, and continuous learning.
Collaborative & Innovative Team – Work alongside skilled professionals who value excellence.
Application Process
We understand that searching for a new job can be challenging, and we’re here to support you every step of the way. Our goal is to make the process as transparent and respectful as possible.
The interview process includes a Recruiter Interview, Client Interview, and Assessment. As part of the process, candidates complete a hands-on task during the technical interview. Throughout each stage, we keep you informed and provide feedback as quickly as possible, ensuring you feel valued and supported throughout your journey with us.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $1,405.00 - $2,600.00 per month
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Application Question(s):
Do you have experience integrating and analyzing data from platforms like Amazon or Shopify? If so, briefly describe.
Work Location: Remote

title: BI Sr ETL Developer
description:
POSITION PURPOSE
The Cellular Connection (TCC) is looking for full-time resource who has solid experience in Business Intelligence solution development and support, specifically focused in Data Profiling, Data Warehouse, and ETL using Microsoft toolset.

The successful candidate will embody and work to reinforce our company’s mission. At TCC we believe our communities need more than just a wireless retailer, and our employees want more than just a job. We are committed to making a positive and sustainable impact on the lives of our employees, customers and communities. The foundation of TCC’s business is built around 5 promises –Care, Drive the Business, Connect, Inspire, Be Authentic. We will Care about the people around us and the world. We will Drive the Business to greater success so that we can do more good. We will Connect with the people around us. We will Inspire others to join us in doing good. We will Be Authentic in our words and actions.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

Design, develop and optimize data integration – ETL/ELT solutions using Microsoft technologies.
Build and manage scalable data workflows using Azure Data Factory and Fabric Data Factory and integrate with OneLake, Dataflows Gen2
Expertise in Azure tools, specifically Data Factory, Azure Automation - Runbooks/Workbooks and DevOps
Expertise in SQL creation and optimization – Queries, Stored Procs, Performance Tuning, Data Profiling
Experience in implementing Logic Apps, Stored Procedures, ETL, Cube, Reports
Ensure data accuracy, data quality, and data governance across all ETL processes.
Maintain documentation related to ETL processes, support procedures, data dictionaries, and business logic.
Document & maintain Production Support Runbook.
Create and maintain documentation for ETL processes, data mappings, and workflow schedules
Translate business and functional requirements into technical requirements
Interact with business users and customers to gather requirements, understand issues, and communicate resolutions clearly.
Handle production support for BI and ETL systems, ensuring high availability and quick resolution of data issues.
Monitor daily ETL jobs, identify failures or performance bottlenecks, and resolve issues in a timely manner.
Handle and resolve support tickets related to data discrepancies, report issues, job failures, and user queries.
