title: Power BI developer w/python
description:
Long term contract position with a major financial firm.
Hybrid 3 days/week in Newark, NJ.

Looking for a senior business intelligence resource to support senior leaders in building all new visualization and data analytics within the various departments in Fixed Income. Our ideal candidate will have proven experience in building dynamic analytics report/dashboards for financial end-users. The right candidate for this role will identify this challenge as a unique and valuable opportunity to help drive our global technology transformation.

What You Will Do:
Create Power BI and Tableau Dashboards to meet complex user requirements and demand.
Performance tuning and aesthetics customization to meet user expectations.
Develop and implement design best practices to ensure a seamless user-experience for business stakeholders.
Transform complex reporting needs into technical specifications, including calculations, custom groups, parameters, filtering criteria, aggregations etc. Breakdown complex requirements into user stories, and drive delivery with the product team
Work with the business on managing Power BI & Tableau user permissions, performance troubleshooting, and managing general help inquiries.
Develop and Test Python and Custom API-related Workflows to build on the capabilities of the Power BI and Tableau Platform.
Work with Tableau for support, ticket resolution, feature requests and defect tracking.
Demonstrate strong backend platform expertise and front-end consultancy capability
Recommend best practices from both a technical and process perspective as related to Power BI and Tableau development.
Groom large datasets for optimal performance and maintainability
Troubleshoot issues as they occur, identify criticality and impact, and provide appropriate workarounds
What You Will Need:

General Skill Profile in order of preference: Power BI, SQL, Python, Power Automate, Tableau
5+ years of Power BI application development experience including visualizations, parameters, and report optimization
3+ years of Tableau application development experience, including visualizations, parameters, and report optimization
5+ years of hands-on SQL Experience
3+ years of working on Power BI or Tableau Administration Responsibilities (Permissions, Server Maintenance and upgrades, Monitoring)
3+ years working in Python, Pandas Data Frames, API-driven workflows.
Expertise across multiple BI platforms and data visualization tools include Tableau and Power BI
Strong experience with performance tuning business intelligence and database platforms for maximum performance in each technical configuration
Expertise with multiple database platforms including relational databases (ie. SQL Server and Oracle) as well as cloud-based data warehouses such as Microsoft Fabric and Snowflake
Experience with both server and desktop-based data visualization tools
Expertise with managing and mining very large internal and external data sets
Experience with sourcing external data sets to meet business needs
Demonstrated experience with testing business hypotheses, asking the right questions to provoke thoughts from business users and ultimately using data to test and validate hypothesis
Very strong experience with quickly building data visualization worksheets and dashboards to analyze, view and interpret data sets
Hands-on experience with Python for building automations for business processes
Demonstrated experience with using predictive, prescriptive and descriptive data analytics to test, question and solve business problems
Have a consulting mindset when working with internal clients across multiple departments of the organization
Ideally familiar with financial services datasets across investment, product and distribution functions - not essential but highly desirable
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent, with a strong preference in a Data-centric major.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Snowflake/SQL/Tableau exp REQUIRED) Hybrid - Reston, VA
description:
About Ellucian:
Ellucian is a global market leader in education technology. We power innovation for higher education, partnering with more than 2,900 customers across 50 countries and serving over 20 million students. Ellucian's AI-powered platform, trained on the richest dataset available in higher education, drives efficiency, personalized experiences, and strengthened engagement for all students, faculty and staff. Fueled by decades of experience with a singular focus on the unique needs of learning institutions, the Ellucian platform features best-in-class SaaS capabilities and delivers insights needed now and into the future. These solutions and services span the entire student lifecycle, from student recruitment, enrollment, and retention to workforce analytics, fundraising, and alumni engagement. Ellucian's innovative solutions, vast ecosystem of partners, and user community of more than 45,000 provide best practices leading to greater institutional success and achieving better student outcomes.

Values Rooted in Purpose

We embrace the power to lead, the courage to innovate, and the determination to grow. At our core, we believe in humanizing our approach, recognizing that our people are our greatest strength. With a shared vision of transformation, we endeavor to shape a brighter future for higher education.
About the Opportunity:
Ellucian is seeking a passionate and analytical Business Intelligence Analyst (Snowflake/SQL/Tableau exp REQUIRED) to join our Enterprise Data and Analytics team. In this role, you will develop enterprise-level insights to support high-impact decision-making and strategic planning. The ideal candidate brings a consultative, problem-solving mindset, thrives in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, and embraces a self-starter attitude to drive initiatives that support the organization’s digital evolution.
Where you will make an impact
Assist with the definition and creation of executive or summarized-level reporting compiling metrics across different business domains, including board of director level reporting.
Build automated reporting at scale using SQL, Tableau, and PowerBI for strategic programs including cloud modernization, partner ecosystem, and additional business development.
Review and streamline data workflows to enable more seamless cross-functional reporting that provides overviews of company-wide performance.
Partner closely with a variety of stakeholders to validate metrics relevant to their domains to compile, create, and best represent organizational performance metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders, cross-functional teams, and executives to design, develop, and implement data assets and reporting tools that enhance performance transparency and improve outcomes.
What you will bring
2-3 years experience in a similar role
Experience related to data analytics leveraging any software tools such as: Snowflake, Tableau, SQL Queries, Microsoft Excel, PowerBI, etc
Experience researching source systems and interpreting/tracing results back to inputs
Demonstrated interest in handling ad-hoc analysis by querying large databases to deliver insights and answer key business questions
Skilled in translating analytics and KPIs into clear, actionable stories for end-users.
Experience using quantitative and qualitative analysis to deliver actionable insights and recommendations to sales teams and leadership
Knowledge of data analytics methods, structures, and techniques (data extraction, analysis, queries, data blending)
Structured thinker with a high level of attention to detail and organizational skills
Results oriented with thoughtful actions, flexible and collaborative
Creative problem solver with a healthy mix of intellectual agility and curiosity
Interest in data storytelling through qualitative and quantitative data analytics
Communication & presentation skills
Proven ability to drive projects, lead BI demos, and manage stakeholders across departments and organizational levels
Foundational Excel and PowerPoint skills
Demonstrated experience or interest in data management and workflows is a plus
Experience with Salesforce and/or ServiceNow is a plus
What makes #Ellucianlife:
Comprehensive health coverage: medical, dental, and vision
Flexible time off
Thrive Flex Lifestyle Account (LSA) that allows you to contribute towards your health, financial or learning interests
401k w/ match & BrightPlan - to help you save for the future
Parental Leave
5 charitable days to support the community that supports us
Telemedicine
Wellness
Headspace Care (mental health)
Wellbeats (virtual fitness classes)
RethinkCare & Wellthy– caregiver support
Diversity and inclusion programs which provide access to internal employee resource groups
Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team
We Foster a learning culture with:
Education Assistance Program
Professional development opportunities

#LI-HYBRID

title: Senior Analyst, Delivery Excellence – Data Analytics
description:
WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH
You will be positioned as a key pivot role supporting two of five global Delivery Excellence organizations (the function is headquartered in Nike Singapore office and has additional locations in China and Vietnam) – Americas Delivery Excellence (supporting strategic inline apparel and accessories factory partners in the Western Hemisphere) and Uniform Operations (supporting NA Team and on-field / Promo uniforms delivery, including through a domestic / US-based factory partners) teams. Along with building critical relationships with WHQ-based Delivery Excellence teams, you will also work closely with a wide range of Nike functional teams including Global Sports Marketing, Partner Management, Global Sports Apparel teams, Product Creation Center, Factory Partners, Global/Geo Supply & Inventory Planning, Marketplace Operations, Sourcing, and others.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our Delivery Excellence team in Apparel / Accessories Manufacturing organization (part of Product Supply Chain) to enable on-time Nike delivery from regional partners, while supporting Uniform Operations business. We’re looking for some length of experience with data analytics and related suite of tools and practices, enabling rapid data governance and exploration - someone who is comfortable around data and can extract, digest, and visualize it based on the needs of the business. You’ll work independently coordinating process and data priorities across two teams you’ll support, through becoming intimately connected to the teams’ full value chain. We’ll expect you to balance multiple fast-shifting priorities with critical thinking & out-of-the-box digitally forward solutions for key issues, to drive process clarity, to balance Nike and partner needs, and to develop strong agency and a good sense of prioritizing most business-critical tasks. If you’re a well-organized data-driven digital citizen, are ready to make a real impact on the operational and business health of both Nike and our partners, and can easily make complex things simple and scalable while working with a global network of Nike and partner teams, we’d love to speak with you.
Bachelor’s degree in Business / Marketing, Sports Management, Product Creation, Supply Chain, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field. Will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training.
3-5+ years of experience in retail, project management, supply chain operations, product creation, planning, customer service, or similar fields strongly preferred.
2+ years in data manipulation & visualization; familiar and experienced with data flow management and tool design.
Seasoned technical acumen in Nike suite of tools (Tableau, Alteryx, SQL Server, Snowflake); thought leader able to influence what tools we build and how we use and generate the data.
Experience in apparel manufacturing a plus.
Able to organize, research, analyze and integrate large amounts of information accurately and quickly
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization, including both tactical and executive comms, converting process and data outputs into influence and storytelling.
WHAT YOU’LL WORK ON
The role has process and data accountabilities for Americas DEC; and requires data support for our Uniform Operations team.
Within Americas DEC, the role focuses on leading the global Sports Marketing deliveries, Americas data maintenance, analysis, and governance, and factory partner support in day-to-day operations as needed. On the Sports Marketing side, you’ll implement and maintain best practices and process discipline for Promotional product deliveries and drive SOP (standard operating procedures) compliance / training with our delivery excellence team and factory partners. You’ll also maintain and own all Promo stakeholder communications to global and regional leadership. For data analytics, you’ll provide support to our for intra-team and factory-facing activities, validating that our dashboards and reporting are accurate and aligned, troubleshooting reporting issues, optimizing/ reducing redundant manual data intervention by our teams, and creating new tools. You will also liaison to the Global DEC Center of Excellence team working in lockstep on dashboard governance, data cleansing, and ad-hoc projects as needed. Finally, you’ll know the factory-facing responsibilities of our office which include capacity management, delivery management, and delivery operations - this will allow you to provide process support for the team as needed and help the team iterate on ways to make their work more efficient and data-friendly.
In addition, you will be a key partner with the Uniform Operations team providing data and BI support for the team delivering product for our most visible assets – on-field and Team apparel. Those needs include data cleansing, dashboard creation, task automation, and creating executive level reporting.
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.
We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

title: M365 Power Platform Developer
description:
Job #: R-00161524
Location: Remote, US
Category: Software Development
Schedule (FT/PT): Full Time
Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the time
Shift: Day
Remote Type: Remote
Clearance: Public Trust
External Referral Program: Ineligible
Sector: Digital Modernization

Description
Leidos Digital Modernization Group in Windsor Mill, MD in support of the End User Centric IT Support (ECIS) Contract for Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) is looking to improve and advance the organization. Our program is focused on the delivery of end-user centric IT technology solution to our customer CMS where we are challenged to provide ongoing innovative and seamless experience while using CMS systems, applications and solutions, provide proactive secure development of IT integrations, concepts, and designs across the CMS enterprise and integrate end-user computing devices, conference room technology, infrastructure hardware and software, and user applications into a streamlined and seamless experience across the CMS user base. We foster a positive end-user experience while ensuring protection of the data.
Primary Responsibilities
The successful candidate under the direction of the Development and Engineering Lead, Product Manager, Program Manager and Deputy Program Manager will work within an Agile ITIL environment with a large focus on DevOps. The candidate will be a member of the ECIS Development Team providing Subject Matter Expert support for the M365 Power Platform. You will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and delivering innovative software solutions that enhance user experience across various Microsoft products and services. You will independently develop solutions, approaches, or recommendations to resolve a wide range of complex issues for both internal and external customers, including vendors. These tasks often require a flexible work schedule.
The candidate may need to deliver presentations and produce well-written technical documents tailored to the customer's environment and objectives. Participation in scrum sprint activities related to M365 Power Platform solutions will be required as necessary. The candidate must possess strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with the customer's technical staff.
The role is focused on Power Apps backed with modern PP components (including AI components, power pages and especially Dataverse.
Additional responsibilities include troubleshooting and collaborating with other technical functional groups such as Service Desk, Datacomm, EUA, Security, and Engineering Teams for all supported technical issues. Other duties will encompass, but are not limited to:
Application Development: Design, develop, and deploy custom applications using Power Apps to meet business requirements.
Workflow Automation: Create, configure, and maintain workflows using Power Automate to automate business processes.
Data Visualization: Develop interactive and insightful dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Solution Design: Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Integration: Integrate Power Platform applications with other Microsoft and third-party applications.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, secure, and aligned with business objectives.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest features and updates in the Power Platform and propose improvements to existing applications.
Assist with customer workshops to identify pain points and design effective Power Platform solutions.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for developed solutions.
Support: Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power Platform applications, providing ongoing support and maintenance.
Technical Leadership: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers, ensuring best practices and high-quality deliverables.
Work closely with other support teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment.
Champion a collaborative culture, sharing knowledge and fostering innovation.
Optimize performance, scalability, and reliability.
Assist in the development of concise and accurate engineering documentation on current and proposed cloud environments including Visio Diagrams, As-Built documents, recommendations for solutions, run books, knowledge guides, and other operations guides.
Work with little or no supervision, provide guidance to the team when necessary, and be able to adapt to changing requirements.
Participate as required with Agile Scrum sprints and other Agile ceremonies.
Stay abreast of current and emerging technologies, regularly analyzing and evaluating their impact and benefit to the customer by providing recommendations to management
Provide guidance to address risks related to data privacy, ethics, and compliance.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree and 8+ years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Dataverse.
Strong understanding of Microsoft 365 services, including SharePoint, Teams, and OneDrive.
Familiarity with Azure services, including Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Azure DevOps.
Proficiency in programming languages such as JavaScript, C#, and SQL.
Knowledge of REST APIs, JSON, and OAuth.
Knowledge of Azure services and how they integrate with Power Platform.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or higher security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong understanding of Microsoft Dataverse (formerly Common Data Service).
Experience with API integrations and custom connectors.
Knowledge of data management and governance.
Experience with SharePoint, Dynamics 365, and other Microsoft 365 services.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Previous experience working in an agile scrum environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Detail-oriented and highly organized.
Proactive and able to adapt to changing project requirements.
Previous experience employing DevOps methodologies.
Strong leadership experience and willingness to embrace change.
Experience with change control principals and ticket with Service Now (SNOW).
Understanding of agency Capstone and NARA data retention compliance principles.
Experience with design, planning and implementation in environments with 10,000+ users.
Experience in Agile development methodologies.
Knowledge of data modeling and relational databases.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and version control systems.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered.
Original Posting:
June 24, 2025
For U.S. Positions: While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $104,650.00 - $189,175.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.
#Remote

title: Analyst, Analytics
description:
Overview
Who we are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
An important part of the Toyota family is Toyota Financial Services (TFS), the finance and insurance brand for Toyota and Lexus in North America. While TFS is a separate business entity, it is an essential part of this world-changing company- delivering on Toyota's vision to move people beyond what's possible. At TFS, you will help create best-in-class customer experience in an innovative, collaborative environment.
To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position currently.
This position is based at the Toyota Headquarters in Plano, TX with onsite work Monday-Thursday and remote work on Fridays

Analyst – Analytics @ Toyota Financial Services (Multiple Open Roles – please see below)
These positions are based at the Toyota Headquarters in Plano, TX

Who we're looking for

Toyota Financial Services is looking for highly motivated people to fill multiple openings as an Analyst in one of our Analytics teams. The primary focus of our Analytics teams is to generate actionable insights by leveraging data and using effective data storytelling to help our company make better data-driven decisions.

Find out more about our various Analytics teams here: Analytics @ TFS (toyota.com)

What you'll be doing
Uncover business needs and the true questions that the company is trying to answer in order to properly frame your analysis
Leverage your SQL/Python/R coding skills to pull and organize data that is needed for your analysis
Find insights buried in the data by applying your arsenal of creative problem-solving, data exploration, and quantitative analytical skills (including statistical methods)
Assess the quantitative and qualitative impacts of possible actions based on your insight, taking into consideration our customers, our employees, and our company
Recommend actions based on your insights by effectively telling the story that is supported by data through presentations (PowerPoint), data visualizations (Tableau), and clear and concise verbal and written communications skills
Coordinate with various stakeholders to help implement and measure recommended actions
Build relationships with key stakeholders across Toyota such as Sales, Marketing, Servicing, Insurance, Risk, Technology, Legal/Compliance, Finance, Treasury, etc.
Continuously improve your analytical, technical, communication, and people skills through offered training and on-the-job experience to prepare for advancement into analytical leadership roles.
Become a subject matter expert for your business area by developing a comprehensive understanding of its strategies, processes, policies, and data
Guide/mentor other analysts on best practices for analysis and data storytelling.

Current openings
Analyst, Data Analysis
Leverage technical skills, business knowledge, and problem-solving skills to provide analytical insights and reporting to help the business make better data-driven decisions
Provide value by answering business questions and drive efficiency gains with a focus on the following areas: Servicing, Voluntary Protection Products, Sales, Legal and Compliance, Accounting, Risk, Fraud, and other areas.
Senior Analyst, Pricing Analytics
Perform pricing simulations within an optimization system and analyze the impacts of various pricing scenarios on unit conversion, profitability, and risk. Collaborate with colleagues to maintain system of pricing models and regularly monitor performance.
Utilize external data sources to develop insights into the competitive dynamics of the auto finance industry including vehicle sales, interest rate environment, auto loan rates, dealer compensation, credit performance, and competitor loan origination patterns.
What you bring
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering or similar analytical / STEM field
Demonstrated relevant experience coding in SQL, Python and/or R (this will be tested during interviews)
Experience with Excel and Powerpoint, and Tableau experience
Creative and quantitative problem-solving skills with strengths in Data Acquisition, Manipulation, Cleaning, Analysis and Presentation of Results
Basic statistics knowledge
Presentation skills including proposing strategic recommendations to management and clearly articulating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Intellectual curiosity – always making an effort to understand and find the truth in the data
Ability to collaborate with others
Added bonus if you have
MBA or Master’s degree in an analytical field
Background in Auto Finance or Consumer Lending industries
Professional experience in one or more areas covered by the Analytics Job Family (see list above)
Intermediate to advanced statistics knowledge

What We’ll Bring
During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility and respect.
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.
Team Member Vehicle Purchase Discount
Toyota Team Member Lease Vehicle Program (if applicable)
Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.
Paid holidays and paid time off
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools and more.
Tax Advantage Accounts (Health Savings Account, health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA)
Belonging at Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace all perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Have a question, need assistance with your application or do you require any special accommodations? Please send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Overview
Who we are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for transforming data into insights that drive business value. This position works closely with stakeholders across departments to identify trends, develop dashboards, and support data-driven decision-making.

This role is expected to work with information digital solutions, Risk team members, Enterprise D&A, business stakeholders, and vendors to help formulate strategies that support the Company’s strategic vision, maximize revenue, client retention and reducing risk. All solutions must meet Toyota’s technology standards.
Primary Job Accountabilities
Data Management: Extraction, Analysis, and Reporting:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from internal and external sources.
Partner with the business to identify data and reporting needs.
Manage SQL, query, and other related databases for data analysis.
Perform data modeling using Python and/or other relevant programming languages.
Develop, manage, and communicate data analysis and reports.
Manage and maintain process documentation and reports within Power BI.
Perform proof of concept for reports and other business solutions.
Support the Company’s vision for cloud-based data and reporting strategy.
Oversee the development of reports (dashboards, views), from discovery through implementation, and ensure alignment with BI data and reporting governance practices.
Facilitate and participate in project status meetings to identify and resolve issues and mitigate risks.
Business Support:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions.
Lead the business requirements/user stories gathering sessions with stakeholders and IT to understand what data is required to support projects or initiatives.
Ensure business needs and requirements are communicated, understood and documented. Translate the business and user requirements into system requirements.
Leverage the understanding of our business and system processes to propose data solutions that are aligned with the business’ needs.
Analyze programming requirements using business knowledge, subject matter experts (SMEs), and programming languages.
Develop new tools to support the automation of current manual processes and reports.
Apply problem-solving and analytical skills to uncover insights buried in data.
Evaluate effects and implications of possible actions based on data insights, feedback provided by customers, employees, policies, SOPs and regulations.
Support data stewardship.
Risk Management:
Support the Enterprise Risk Management Committee (ERMC); including assisting with analysis, reports and recommendations.
Monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRI’s) continuously.
Develop and enhance reports for Portfolio Management.
Conduct data segregation to understand the root cause of issues.
Build data-driven presentations and reports for TCPR Executives and business stakeholders.
Database Management:
Ensure calibration of models while enhancing controls (Auto Approval, CDX, Pricing, etc.)
Assist in the development of applications with a focus on data classification, data privacy, data protection, and security controls aligned to compliance regulations.
Assess local databases to propose alternatives for standardization and optimization.
Ensure database fields are well documented.
Assist the IT Department in defining and designing different components for local databases.
Write scaling secure code and maintain appropriate programming documentation, including workflows.
Update and validate the reports used for decisioning (i.e., Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge and Skills
Required:
Four-Year College Degree (BA or BS): Business administration, Information Technology
Preferred:
Advanced Degree. Specify: Data Science, Analytics, or Data Management related.
Experience – Subject Matter Expertise
Required
2-5 years of relevant / progressive work experience (in a similar field and/or industry)
Expertise in SQL and querying related databases to acquire the necessary data for analysis.
Ability to interpret and present findings in a clear, concise manner, including the creation and use of charts and graphics to summarize results.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Spanish
High degree of organization skills, able to work in a deadline-driven environment
Proficiency in Microsoft Office software: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Outlook
Skilled in data mining and analysis for patterns and trends identification by applying quantitative and analytical tools.
Preferred:
5-10 years of relevant / progressive work experience (in similar field and/or industry)
Python and other relevant programming languages for data modeling.
Expertise in Tableau, Power BI, or other reporting tools
Kaizen, Lean, Agile, Six Sigma
Financial Services, banking, or automotive industry experience
Knowledge and understanding of Portfolio Management
Project management knowledge
Additional Comments, Including Unique Circumstances
Work schedule: Monday-Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. However, there could be instances in which working overtime, weekends and/or during holidays could be required.
Travel could be required up to 5% of the time.
This position is based out of San Juan, Puerto Rico. This position does not offer relocation assistance.
Belonging at Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace all perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Have a question, need assistance with your application or do you require any special accommodations? Please send an email to tcpr_human_resources@toyota.com.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Equity Residential, we're dedicated to creating thriving communities, and we invite you to be part of our team. Embracing values like Diversity, Sustainability, and Total Wellbeing, we foster a workplace culture of authenticity and collaboration.
How We Deliver a Winning Performance:
Question Authority
Walk the Talk
Share Knowledge
Listen, not just Hear
See the Glass Half Full
Take Educated Risks
Enjoy the Ride
Share the Spotlight
Do the Right Thing
Test Your Limits
What You’ll Be Doing:
We are currently seeking a BI Developer to join our team in our Chicago corporate office. You will play a crucial role in supporting Equity Residential’s centralized operations by building robust reporting and analytics solutions to enable strategic decision-making. This role involves working with stakeholders across the organization to understand business problems, develop the right reporting and analytics solutions, and provide insights that drive operational excellence. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining SQL-based reporting, leveraging business intelligence (BI) tools, and advising on strategies based on your findings. Your work will support both major initiatives and day-to-day execution, ensuring operational efficiency and continuous improvement.
Collaborate with stakeholders across centralized operations to understand business challenges and develop reporting solutions that drive execution and efficiency.
Design, build, and maintain SQL-based reporting to support major operational initiatives and ongoing business needs.
Develop and maintain insightful dashboards and reports that provide actionable intelligence, enabling the operations team to monitor performance, pinpoint areas for optimization, and achieve measurable reductions in operational waste.
Perform UX design activities and Power BI navigation features (e.g. bookmarks, drill-throughs) to guide end-users through a data-driven story
Develop calculations in SQL, DAX and Power BI measures which are accurate and performant on large datasets
Proactively analyze operational data to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities for process improvement, driving data-driven decisions that minimize waste and maximize resource utilization.
Provide strategic recommendations based on data findings, helping business leaders make informed decisions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability in all reporting outputs.
Proactively monitor and evaluate the impact of monthly Power BI releases
Act as a technical resource for business teams, helping them interpret data and improve data-driven decision-making processes.
What You’ll Need to Thrive:
Experience with Power BI development, visualizations and deployment (3+ years) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Design, Statistics, or equivalent
Experience with configuration / management of Microsoft Power BI Service
Demonstrated experience in working with relational databases: SQL Server (3+ years) Demonstrated SQL development experience by writing queries and procedures and also using functions to create curated data for use in reporting
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation is preferred.
Experience documenting business requirements, processes and workflows (1-2 years) Advanced level of MS Excel skills with knowledge of functions, macros, and VBA programming is preferred.
Must be detail oriented, and able to work independently and self-prioritize tasks
Ability to work cross-functionally with business and technical teams to drive reporting and analytics initiatives.
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
Salary: $96,142 - $132,195 / year; in addition to base salary, a discretionary annual bonus is provided.
The successful candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, and qualifications.
WORKING ENVIRONMENT: In-office and remote, in alignment with the company’s hybrid attendance policy.

ABOUT US
Working for Equity Residential (EQR), a leading multi-family real estate investment trust (REIT), means living our purpose: creating communities where people thrive. It means striving to provide the best in apartment living, speaking boldly about new ideas for innovation, and inspiring creativity in the ways we work together.

Our portfolio of high-quality properties in urban growth markets – New York City, Boston, Washington DC, Seattle, San Francisco, Southern California, and Denver – provides homes where people most want to live, work and play. We've got the best people in the business, as evidenced by our employee engagement scores and customer loyalty ratings. That’s why our employees say they are proud to work at Equity, a company that gives our residents a place where they can Live Remarkably, and offers a culture where our employees have the opportunity to thrive.


Equity Rewards
When you join Equity Residential, you won’t be treated as simply another employee — you will be considered a partner in our shared success. As such, we are committed to investing in your personal success through a benefits program that supports your Total Wellbeing.
We recognize that everyone has different needs outside of work. That’s why, in addition to a competitive benefits package (medical, dental, vision and paid time off), we offer many unique benefits options to employees, like a comprehensive wellness program, pet insurance, new parent benefits, and paid time off for community service projects. In addition to your next job, you can also find your next home with us! Rent discounts on Equity Residential apartment homes are available to our benefits-eligible employees. The amount of the discount offered is determined based on the market, ranging upwards from 20%.


Equity Values
At Equity Residential, like our residents, our employees come from everywhere. A richly diverse work environment captures top talent, cultivates the best ideas, and creates the widest possible platform for success. By focusing on inclusion, these differences are harnessed to create value — in ideas, business practices, relationships, and employee engagement. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to maintaining a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment where our employees can thrive.
All aspects of the employment process are merit-based. Every Equity employee is expected to maintain a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. Equity Residential does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, sexual/gender identity/expression, age, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation or related medical conditions), physical or mental disability, national origin, citizenship status, military (including uniformed service member or protected veteran) status, marital status, genetic characteristic or information, ancestry or any other characteristic protected by law. Equity Residential also prohibits retaliation against individuals who report harassment or discrimination, or participate in investigations into such conduct.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Location
San Francisco-Onsite, San Francisco-Hybrid
Employment Type
Full time
Department
Builder
Product
Compensation
Base Salary Range $160K – $190K • Offers Equity • Will reimburse up to $10,000 USD for relocation expenses for candidates willing to relocate to the San Francisco Bay area.
Based on pay transparency guidelines, the salary range listed reflects the pay scale estimated for candidates residing in the San Francisco and New York City metro areas. Actual base salary will be dependent on location, relevant experience, skills, qualifications, and/or other job-related factors. As a part of the total compensation package, this role may be eligible to participate in a company stock option plan.
Overview
About Abridge
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.
Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.
We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense. We have offices located in the SoHo neighborhood of New York, the Mission District in San Francisco, and East Liberty in Pittsburgh.
The Role
Our generative AI-powered products are revolutionizing the practice of medicine, and we’re looking for a highly motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our growing US-based Data Science & BI team. Your work will be instrumental in driving product strategy, directly influencing how healthcare professionals engage with patient data.
What You'll Do
Data Analysis and Insight Generation
Extract meaningful insights and identify trends and patterns relevant to our business and product, by collecting, cleaning, and analyzing internal and external data
Ensure end-to-end visibility and understanding of our AI generation pipelines, from internal quality metrics to automated assessment in production.
Investigate and correct issues identified through data operations monitors, tools, and reports.
Cross-Functional Leadership and Collaboration
Effectively communicate trends and patterns to internal and external stakeholders, by developing and maintaining live dashboards
Serve as a domain expert for the business context of our analytics data, sharing your understanding of the assumptions and limitations of our business metrics.
Continually enhance our understanding of the business and product, by identifying and filling gaps in our data sources. This includes working closely with multidisciplinary teams such as product, engineering, partner success, and the executive team.
What You'll Bring
8+ years of experience in Data Analytics, BI or a related field, ideally at a product-focused software company.
Expert-level SQL skills with proficiency in writing efficient queries on large and complex data sets.
Understanding of database technology and experience with a cloud SQL data warehouse (e.g. BigQuery, Postgres, Snowflake)
Experience in analytical data modeling and schema design
Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Sigma)
Data Advocate
Excellent communicator capable of effectively delivering quantitative findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and compelling fashion.
A team player, comfortable assisting others across the organization in solving data problems and answering questions with data
Passionate about data quality, with a keen interest in data drill down and problem-solving
Ability to prioritize amidst changing priorities in a fast moving environment
Domain-relevant Knowledge
Knowledge of healthcare settings, electronic health records (EHR), and healthcare billing are all a plus
Experience with common approaches to measure and drive user engagement is a plus
Must be willing to work from our SF office at least 3x per week
This position requires a commitment to a hybrid work model, with the expectation of coming into the office a minimum of (3) three times per week. Relocation assistance is available for candidates willing to move to San Francisco.
We value people who are eager to learn new things and recognize that great team members might not perfectly match a job description. If you’re interested in the role but aren’t sure whether or not you’re a good fit, we’d still like to hear from you.
Why Work at Abridge?
At Abridge, we’re transforming healthcare delivery experiences with generative AI, enabling clinicians and patients to connect in deeper, more meaningful ways. Our mission is clear: to power deeper understanding in healthcare. We’re driving real, lasting change, with millions of medical conversations processed each month.
Joining Abridge means stepping into a fast-paced, high-growth startup where your contributions truly make a difference. Our culture requires extreme ownership—every employee has the ability to (and is expected to) make an impact on our customers and our business.
Beyond individual impact, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of curious, high-achieving people in a supportive environment where success is shared, growth is constant, and feedback fuels progress. At Abridge, it’s not just what we do—it’s how we do it. Every decision is rooted in empathy, always prioritizing the needs of clinicians and patients.
We’re committed to supporting your growth, both professionally and personally. Whether it's flexible work hours, an inclusive culture, or ongoing learning opportunities, we are here to help you thrive and do the best work of your life.
If you are ready to make a meaningful impact alongside passionate people who care deeply about what they do, Abridge is the place for you.
How we take care of Abridgers:
Generous Time Off: 13 paid holidays, flexible PTO for salaried employees, and accrued time off for hourly employees.
Comprehensive Health Plans: Medical, Dental, and Vision plans for all full-time employees. Abridge covers 100% of the premium for you and 75% for dependents. If you choose a HSA-eligible plan, Abridge also makes monthly contributions to your HSA.
Paid Parental Leave: 16 weeks paid parental leave for all full-time employees.
401k and Matching: Contribution matching to help invest in your future.
Pre-tax Benefits: Access to Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Commuter Benefits.
Learning and Development Budget: Yearly contributions for coaching, courses, workshops, conferences, and more.
Sabbatical Leave: 30 days of paid Sabbatical Leave after 5 years of employment.
Compensation and Equity: Competitive compensation and equity grants for full time employees.
... and much more!
Diversity & Inclusion
Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).
Staying safe - Protect yourself from recruitment fraud
We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @abridge.com email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to this article. Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.

title: Sr. Data Analyst - Power BI
description:
Sr Data Analyst – Power BI
Status: Full Time / Hybrid (2 days on-site)
Location: Washington, DC
Experience: 9Years
Professional Services
Reports To: The Project Manager
Benefits: Competitive Pay, Generous PTO, and Holiday Schedule, Outstanding Health Plan, 401(k), Collaborative Team Atmosphere.
Summary: Assurety Consulting, a leader in the postal/parcel ecosystem, seeks highly qualified applicants for a Data Analyst position. This is a full-time position in Washington, D.C., with a hybrid working opportunity 2-3 days a week remotely. This position requires a US Postal Service (USPS) security clearance, and the applicant must be either a US Citizenship or a Green Card holder.

The Sr. Data Analyst-Azure Power BI must have a minimum of 6 years of professional experience analyzing data needs and will work under the guidance and direction of a Lead Analyst and Project Manager. In addition, the Data Scientist will be responsible for using applied statistics to develop solutions, data mining, data analysis, data summarization, and developing client presentations.
Conditions of Employment (REQUIRED):
US Citizenship or Green Card.
The position requires security clearance.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6-9 years of proven experience as a Data Scientist/Analyst/Engineer, preferably with a focus on Azure technologies.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python
Experience with Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, and Azure Data Lake.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Solid understanding of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency in data visualization in Power BI along with hands-on experience with SQL and DAX
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data-related issues and propose effective solutions.
Strong communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Experience Needed:
Develop and implement machine learning models using Azure Machine Learning and other Azure services.
Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that drive business strategies.
Interact with business stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand their data visualization and business intelligence needs
Design, develop, test, and deploy Power BI scripts and generate visually appealing and insightful reports
Use advance level calculations on the data set using DAX functions in Power BI
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and feature engineering to enhance model performance.
Create and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and related tools.
Write optimized SQL & DAX for data transformation and calculation within reports
Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and other visualization tools.
Collaborate with end users to gather reporting and data analysis requirements
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous data validation processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data science and machine learning technologies.
Document processes, methodologies, and best practices for reproducibility.

title: Power BI/SQL Developer
description:
Role : Power BI/SQL Developer
Location: Richmond, VA(Hybrid) Need candidate 2hr drivable distance to Richmond
Job ID: 752478
Interview Mode: Both Web Cam and In Person Interview

ON SITE REQUIRED: VRS Hybrid 2 days onsite per week (Tues and Wed/ each week required - NO Exceptions!)
Contract: VA-210625-CAI
Will start with Virtual IVs but may request IN PERSON follow up IVs
ON SITE REQUIRED: VRS Hybrid 2 days onsite per week (Tues and Wed/ each week required)

ABOUT THE ROLE
The individual will follow the VRS Hybrid work schedule including 2 days onsite per week (Tuesday and Wednesday). The individual may also be called to be onsite for critical meetings and data related discussions. Onsite work will be at the VRS central office at 1200 East Main Street, Richmond, Virginia 23219

ABOUT THE ROLE
The Virginia Retirement System (VRS) Data Office team is seeking up to two (2) senior level Power BI/SQL Developers with strong problem solving, organizational, and communication skills. This role will be expected to collaborate with the Data Office, Business, IT and other stakeholders and play an active role in the Data Quality Enhancement initiative. The individual is expected to be a self-starter who is comfortable prioritizing and effectively managing their daily workload.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist with overall Power BI/SQL Support (development, performance, process, documentation) related to the Data Quality Enhancement initiative and other development efforts as needed. Activities include:
Maintain the confidentiality of all business data and adhere to VRS data security policies.
Meet all deliverables withing the agreed upon timeframe.
Provide regular status updates and attend various meetings as required.
Develop, design, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards based on business requirements.
Create interactive visualizations, reports, dashboards that assist with effective monitoring of Critical Data Elements.
Advise on best practices in data visualization and report optimization.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate into actionable reports.
Develop, optimize and maintain SQL queries and stored procedures for data retrieval and manipulation.
Develop DAX queries to enhance the performance and functionality of reports.
Develop reports to support KPIs and other performance indicators.
Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI and SQL tools.
Review existing SQL Queries, Execution Plans, Partitions, and Index(s) to determine performance enhancements for long running queries.
Provide alternative options to existing data manipulation techniques. Examples would be converting Excel manipulation activities into solutions that reduce process/cycle time of data preparation.
Special projects at the direction of the Chief Operating Officer or Data Officer.

Required Skills and Experience:
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Power BI.
Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in SQL Server SQL development, including writing complex queries, stored procedures, and performance tuning.
Experience in writing complex DAX queries.
Experience with MS SQL Server data modelling and schema design.
Experience working in an Agile development environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team that includes business and technical stakeholders.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Desired Skills:
Experience in Pensions Benefit Management programs.
Experience with other BI tools (e.g., Tableau, QlikView).
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).
Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or equivalent.
Other relevant certifications in SQL, Data Analysis and database management.

Education and/or Experience
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university preferred and 5+ years’ experience with technology or data organizations required.

This will be a contract position starting with a period of at least 6 months. To be effective, this resource would need to be available within the next 6 weeks. VRS desires to interview proposed individuals before final approval.

title: BI Analyst
description:
How to Maximize
your opportunity to do rewarding work,
your future leadership potential,
and your career growth?

Join an Industry Leader
[Become one, too!]
Octapharma Plasma offers professional opportunities that make a meaningful difference. We enhance the lives of patients who need our life-saving medicines. We reward the donors who provide the plasma we collect to make them. And we inspire growth and development in the teams at our donation centers, offices, and labs. We invite you to do the same in this role:
BI Analyst
This Is What You’ll Do:
Analyze business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Design, develop, and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Develop and maintain data models that effectively support business requirements.
Ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data presented in the dashboards and reports.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to identify and prioritize business requirements.
Communicate complex data insights clearly and understandably.
This Is What It Takes:
Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Technology or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience creating, editing, revising and publishing Power BI production level reports and dashboards.
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: business analysis, data analysis, project management, business operations, or business intelligence analysis.
Analytical and inquisitive with the ability to solve practical problems and handle a variety of concrete variables and interpret information furnished in written, oral, and/or diagram form.
Demonstrated ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously across all levels in an organization.
Experience developing DAX and/or incorporating R or Python scripts in Power BI is a plus.
SQL, R or Python knowledge is a plus.
H1B sponsorship not available.
This is an onsite position M-F
Do Satisfying Work. Earn Real Rewards and Benefits.
We’re widely known and respected for our benefits and for leadership that is supportive and hands-on.
Formal training
Outstanding plans for medical, dental, and vision insurance
Health savings account (HSA)
Employee assistance program (EAP)
Wellness program
401 (k) retirement plan
Paid time off
Company-paid holidays
Personal time
More About Octapharma Plasma, Inc.
With donation centers and team members throughout the U.S., Octapharma Plasma, Inc. collects plasma to create life-saving medicines for patients worldwide. We are growing at an impressive pace, and so is the positive impact of our work. Our community relies on teamwork, compassion, and expertise to get things done the right way, while making a meaningful difference in the lives we touch.
INNER SATISFACTION.
OUTSTANDING IMPACT.

title: Business Operations Associate
description:
Business Operations Associate
Work Model: Hybrid, Framingham,MA

Staples is business to business. You’re what binds us together.
Our world class sales and sales support teams work directly with businesses of all sizes to offer products and services to meet our customers’ unique needs. We are committed to understanding our customers and use best-in-class sales tools and technology to find the best solutions. We’re constantly discovering new ways to reach our goals, taking time to develop our skills and investing in our career growth, so we can enjoy lucrative opportunities and grow our careers both within and beyond sales.
The Business Analyst will support the Operational Excellence team in driving eProcurement solutions, partnership management, and operational efficiency projects. This role involves analyzing business processes, developing strategic solutions, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to enhance revenue opportunities and operational performance.

What you’ll be doing:
Support eProcurement (3PP) business and GTM strategy between Staples Business and customer eProcurement platforms (e.g., Ariba, Coupa, Oracle).
Support partnerships with eProcurement platforms to ensure alignment with business objectives.
Identify and develop new creative partnerships and business development opportunities, including private marketplace integrations, incubation projects, and proof-of-concept (PoC) initiatives to drive incremental revenue.
Contribute to operational excellence projects, such as reducing cancelled web order line items to improve Delivery by Date Promised (DbDP) performance.
Analyze and proactively manage customer closure exceptions to optimize delivery schedules.
Evaluate efficiency project opportunities from various departments, proposing logical solutions through cross-functional collaboration, process changes, or developing new solutions when optimal.
Design and implement solutions for operational and efficiency challenges, leveraging data analysis and collaboration with internal stakeholders.
What you bring to the table:
Proactively identify and pursue innovative business opportunities, such as new partnerships and PoCs, to drive revenue and growth.
Tackle complex operational challenges with creative, data-driven solutions that enhance efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Work seamlessly with cross-functional teams and external partners to align on goals and deliver impactful results.
Contribute insights that shape short- and long-term strategies, positioning the company for sustained success.
Bring ambition and adaptability to evolve with the company, taking on increasing responsibility in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Entrepreneurial mindset.
What’s needed- Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, related field, or equivalent work experience.
0-2 years of relevant experience in Business Analysis.
What’s needed- Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with eProcurement platforms (e.g., Ariba, Coupa, Oracle).
Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) or process improvement methodologies.
Ideal for recent graduates.
We Offer:
Inclusive culture with associate-led Business Resource Groups
Flexible PTO (22 days) and Holiday Schedule (7 observed paid holidays)
Online and Retail Discounts, Company Match 401(k), Physical and Mental Health Wellness programs, and more!

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

title: BI Developer
description:
BI Developer
Transform Data Into Meaningful Impact
Grow your BI expertise while helping people find connection in life’s most important moments.

At Precoa, our mission goes beyond data. It’s about providing clarity, comfort, and connection for families during their most difficult times. As a Business Intelligence Developer, you’ll be part of that mission—transforming complex data into powerful insights that guide business decisions and deepen our impact.

This is your chance to step into a more strategic BI role where you’ll design elegant solutions, shape data stories, and collaborate with a purpose-driven team. Your work will drive smarter decisions across the business and help more families find healing when they need it most..
What you’ll do (and why you’ll love doing it)
Sharpen your strategic thinking, elevate your technical toolkit, and make your mark through data. You’ll drive key initiatives while learning and contributing in meaningful ways.
Design and deliver BI solutions: Build scripts, dashboards, and ETL processes that align with business needs and ensure data integrity.
Turn data into action: Develop compelling visualizations and narratives that influence decisions at every level.
Collaborate and communicate: Work with stakeholders to gather clear requirements and refine them into user-friendly solutions.
Test and improve: Validate your own work, participate in peer reviews, and recommend improvements to strengthen our analytics ecosystem.
Grow your impact: Offer insights, tackle challenges, and help build a data culture that drives business outcomes.
What we offer you as part of #PrecoaLife
Competitive salary based on experience
Hybrid flexibility: work remotely or from our office
18 days PTO and 10 paid holidays annually
6+ weeks paid parental leave
Health, Dental, and Vision benefits
401k, with company match
$25,000 AD&D Policy and $25,000 Life Insurance Policy
What will make you successful
3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or software development
Strong skills in SQL, Python, Tableau, and data warehouse platforms like Snowflake or Azure
Experience in Agile or iterative development practices
A knack for visual storytelling and user-focused dashboard design
A collaborative, curious mindset and drive to turn data into decisions

If you’re ready to wrangle data and wow stakeholders, we want to hear from you!

For a full job description, please see the Dropbox link here.
About Precoa
At Precoa, our people are the heart of our success. Core Employees strive to live our values of kindness, progression, and craftsmanship every day — bringing emotional intelligence, common sense, positivity, and authentic connection to everything they do.

If you love solving challenges, building real relationships, and driving meaningful results, you’ll feel right at home here.

We’re a national leader in the preneed industry. Our passion is helping people plan today so their families can focus on connection when they need it most. Recognized as one of The Oregonian’s Top Workplaces for 13 consecutive years, we’re committed to creating a place where you can live a fulfilling life, do meaningful work, grow your potential, and enjoy the journey along the way.

Headquartered in Portland, OR, with a satellite office in Utah, we’re a team driven to make a difference — every day, through every connection.

title: Data Visualization / BI Engineer
description:
Are you ready to make a significant impact in Apple Services? At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly! If you are passionate about telling compelling data stories with creative and insightful visualizations we would love for you to apply! The Apple Services Data Science & Analytics team drives decisions that improve the customer experience, accelerate growth, and uncover new business opportunities while respecting user privacy. We work on some of the largest e-commerce and media streaming businesses in the world and have an incredible team collaborating on the best way to improve these services for our customers. Our team’s culture is centered around rapid iteration with open feedback and healthy debate to curate the best outcomes. We encourage independent decision-making and taking calculated risks. Our team collaborates as an analytical advisor with partners across product, design, engineering, marketing, editorial, and business teams.

Description

As a BI Engineer on the Services Data Science & Analytics team, you will work with massive internet-scale data across numerous product and customer touch-points, undertaking in-depth quantitative analysis, and distilling data into actionable and intuitive visualizations to drive informed decision-making. A great fit for this role is someone that can communicate and collaborate across different teams, has an agile approach to solving challenging problems quickly, and stresses the details. We are looking for you to design and build executive reporting solutions, highly polished dashboards, and exploratory self-service tools. Often you will closely partner with our Data Science peers to define metrics, design datasets, and develop the automation strategy. Extensive collaboration with Product, Business, Engineering, and Marketing teams is vital to our success. In this role, you will iterate with these teams on key business outcomes, influence how our services are measured, and craft world-class tools and insights to support them at scale. As your ideas take shape, you will support and a comprehensive roadmap to communicate and manage stakeholder expectations while enabling org-wide transparency on progress. In this role, you will gain experience working on complex, cross-functional projects and supporting their execution from planning through to delivery. Ideally, you have a curious business mindset with the ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action. We’re looking for someone known for effectively bridging analytics and business teams, with an ability to speak the language of both.

Minimum Qualifications
5+ years of experience in a Data Visualization, Data Scientist, or Data Analyst role
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau / PowerBI / MicroStrategy / etc. for analysis, insight synthesis, reporting deliverable design & development, and executive presentation.
Familiarity with data engineering tools and concepts, data pipeline development, data model design, and aggregation strategies, in support of responsive and highly interactive data products.
Familiarity with SQL and writing adhoc queries.
Excellent communication, social, and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Strong time management skills with the ability to balance multiple projects with tight deadlines and executive visibility.
BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics, or a related field.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a digital subscription business or large-scale e-commerce platform
Familiarity with Python & Spark and experience using those skills with very large datasets.
MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, Engineering, Economics or a related field.

Pay & Benefits

At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $141,800 and $258,600, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

Submit Resume

title: Power BI Report Developer
description:
As the Power BI Report Developer, you will be responsible for implementing and maintaining reports, ensuring accurate and timely delivery. You will collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, develop Power BI reports, and optimize performance and user experience. This role involves strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to troubleshoot and enhance report functionality. This role offers an opportunity to stay current with Power BI advancements and contribute to continuous improvement in report development processes.

This is a hybrid role from our office in Peabody, MA. Remote candidates will also be considered.

Moore is a data-driven constituent experience management (CXM) company achieving accelerated growth for clients through integrated supporter experiences across all platforms, channels and devices. We are an innovation-led company that is the largest marketing, data and fundraising company in North America serving the purpose-driven industry with clients across education, association, political and commercial sectors.

Check out www.WeAreMoore.com for more information.

Your Impact:

Strong understanding of data visualization principles and ability to translate business objectives into visual formats.
Work closely with the Senior Report Developer to understand project requirements and technical solutions.
Develop Power BI reports according to established standards and best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical expertise.
Perform testing and troubleshooting to ensure report accuracy and functionality.
Assist in optimizing report performance and user experience.
Promote best practices in dashboard design and data visualization within the team.

Your Profile:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
3+ years of experience developing Power BI reports.
Strong understanding of report development principles and best practices.
Proficiency in Power BI desktop and Power BI service.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Good communication skills and attention to detail.
Power BI certification preferred.
Familiarity with other report development tools, such as Tableau and Microsoft Reporting Services preferred.
Experience with Jira for workflow tracking preferred.
Experience using GitHub for report change management preferred.

How We’ll Support You:

Join the largest marketing and fundraising company in North America serving the nonprofit industry where we prioritize innovation and professional growth.
Collaborate with industry subject matter experts with over 5,000 employees across the enterprise.
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including comprehensive healthcare, paid holidays and generous paid time off so you can have the time and space to recharge and pursue your other passions and be with the people you care about.
Moore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
