title: Associate, Data Analytics & Reporting
description:
Description


Corient does not offer employment sponsorship. All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without current or future visa sponsorship.

At Corient, we help high- and ultra-high-net-worth individuals and families to enjoy a full life, while enabling them to preserve their wealth for future generations, and provide for the people, causes and communities they care about. We focus on exceeding expectations, simplifying lives, and establishing legacies that last for generations. We are always looking for talented and motivated individuals to join our team. If you want to work for a company that values your contributions and supports your growth, we would like to meet you.
Responsibilities
Drive Enterprise Data Analytics and Reporting roadmap, aligning initiatives with company-wide strategy and objectives
Provide strategic and operational insights backed by data to functional teams across the company
Define requirements for analytics and reports as well as for data layer and any necessary source data that underpin them
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and prioritize data and reporting needs (e.g., business KPIs, client segmentations, financial reporting, forecasting)
Lead data analysis projects, ensuring high-quality, relevant insights and reports
Generate reports and dashboards to analyze/track business performance and support business decisions
Ensure enterprise data quality through automated data audits and other mechanisms, following business requirements
Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of data standards (e.g., sources, models, pipelines, etc.)
Follow best practices in data analytics/engineering, including version control, security, and change management procedures
Qualifications & Requirements
Distinguished academic track record in quantitative discipline
Minimum 1-3+ year work experience in data-related roles
Demonstrated proficiency in a data analytics tooling (e.g., SQL, DBT, Python, Tableau, Excel)
Ability to analyze structured/unstructured data and derive actionable insights
Experience managing end-to-end analytics projects
Ability to synthesize and present data insights in a way that drives decision-making
Deep experience working with and joining disparate data sources
Preferred - experience in applying advanced analytical approaches to deliver on key business objectives (e.g., forecasting, client segmentations, etc.)
Preferred - data analytics or reporting-related experience with Databricks, Salesforce, Addepar, and/or Workday
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills
Comfort with ambiguity and proven ownership mindset
Effective communication, both orally and in writing
Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy and consistency
Ability to lead projects end-to-end, in a structured way, and with minimal supervision
High standards of professionalism and confidentiality
This position description is intended to provide a general overview of the expectations and responsibilities of this position and may not include all tasks that may be assigned. As the nature of business demands change, so may the functions of this position. Additional duties and responsibilities may be assigned with or without notice.
Pay Information
This position is exempt and is paid according to the laws of the State of Florida. The pay range for this position is $100,000-140,000 USD per year. We are required to provide a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. It is not typical for an individual to be offered a salary at or near the top of the range for a position. Salary offers are determined based on final candidate qualifications and experience.

Physical Requirements
This position requires the physical capabilities to work in an office environment, which may include prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Corient seeks to make reasonable accommodations that enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential duties when possible.
This position may require the ability to lift up to 15 pounds.
This position is required to work onsite 4 days per week.

U.S. Eligibility Requirements
Must be 18 years of age or older.
Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation.
Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States. For U.S. employment opportunities, Corient hires U.S. citizens or permanent residents. Exceptions to these requirements will be determined based on shortage of qualified candidates with a particular skill. Corient will require proof of work authorization.
Corient participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9.
Must be willing to execute Corient's Employee Agreement or Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement, which require, among other things, post-employment obligations relating to non-solicitation, confidentiality, and non-disclosure.

What You can Expect from Us
Our dedication to the Employee Experience at Corient is aimed at supporting, empowering, and inspiring our talented team through:
401(k) Plan with Employer Matching
Four Medical Plan options that is generously subsidized by Corient
Employer paid Dental, Vision & Life and AD&D Insurance
Employer paid Short-term & Long-term Disability
Paid Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible Spending Accounts & Health Savings Accounts
Dependent Care FSA
Commuter & Transit FSA
Corporate Discount Program - Perkspot
Training Reimbursement
Paid Professional Designations
Giving back to the community - Volunteer days

Corient is one of the fastest-growing wealth management platforms in the United States. We serve more than 10,000 clients and manage over $100 billion of assets through offices located across the country. We combine a boutique's personal service, creativity and objective advice with the extensive resources and vast intellectual capital of an innovative industry leader to create a profoundly different wealth management experience for our clients.

Full participation of all employees in a safe, healthy and respectful environment is key to individual and company success. We are committed to fully utilizing the abilities of all our employees and expect each of our employees to honor this commitment in their daily responsibilities.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All candidates will be recruited and, if applicable, selected and employed without regard to sex, race, religion, marital status, veteran status, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, color, creed, ancestry, disability, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Power BI Service Engineer
description:
About Infinitive:
Infinitive is a data and AI consultancy that enables its clients to modernize, monetize and operationalize their data to create lasting and substantial value. We possess deep industry and technology expertise to drive and sustain adoption of new capabilities. We match our people and personalities to our clients' culture while bringing the right mix of talent and skills to enable high return on investment.
Infinitive has been named “Best Small Firms to Work For” by Consulting Magazine 7 times most recently in 2024. Infinitive has also been named a Washington Post “Top Workplace”, Washington Business Journal “Best Places to Work”, and Virginia Business “Best Places to Work.”

We are seeking a Power BI Service Engineer to support our migration efforts during an enterprise domain split and separation. This role will focus specifically on identity repointing, workspace integrity, and data source continuity in the Power BI environment as we split a shared Microsoft 365 tenant into two.

This is not a dashboard development or BI analyst role—this is a backend-focused opportunity for someone with hands-on experience maintaining Power BI Service in enterprise environments where identity and access governance is the focus.

Responsibilities:
Audit and remap Power BI workspace roles and ownership during UPN/domain migration
Ensure seamless continuity of:
Dataset refresh schedules
Gateway configurations
OAuth-based and service principal–based data source connections
Coordinate with identity teams to:
Migrate or repoint Azure AD/Entra ID users and groups
Validate SCIM/SAML/SSO mappings as needed for Power BI access
Reassign ownership of:
Reports and dashboards
App workspaces
Datasets and pipelines (if in use)
Prevent and remediate broken:
Scheduled refreshes
Row-level security (RLS) policies tied to old user identities
Embedded or shared content

Required Experience:
3+ years administering Power BI Service in enterprise environments
Strong understanding of dataset refresh behavior, gateway configuration, and OAuth token security
Deep familiarity with Azure AD/Entra ID identity structure and how it ties to Power BI access
Experience with domain migrations, UPN changes, or identity provider transitions
Ability to navigate Power BI Admin Portal, audit logs, and tenant-level settings
Experience working with IT/Security teams to validate group and role mapping
Strong troubleshooting skills in access loss, broken reports, and dataset failures

Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with PowerShell scripts for bulk repointing users or managing API-driven workspace configuration
Comfort working alongside Okta or hybrid Entra/Okta SSO configurations
Prior involvement in tenant splits, M&A work, or regulated data environments

title: Logistics Analyst II, CASA
description:
We will be using this posting to hire ONE Logistics Analyst II
Are you ready to combine your love for supply chain, and teamwork? Join the Central and South America (CaSA) Territory in APLA and become our new Supply Chain Analyst. Working within our organization will be rewarding, exciting and most definitely not be just another job!
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Central and South America Operations is looking for outstanding teammates to join us! Logistics Analyst II strives for customer and consumer satisfaction with KPI’s around capacity, cost, and sustainability via leveraging the Nike supply chain network to ensure on-time delivery of innovative products to our marketplace. You will act as the voice of your function in x-functional meetings, interact with different team members and leverage tools, reports, and systems to facilitate movement of goods.
We’re searching for extraordinary colleagues capable of learning and growing with us in our exciting business model!
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
In this role, you'll get the opportunity to support end-to-end movement of product from origin to destination, partnering with many internal and external stakeholders throughout the process. We support a highly complex business model, so there are always opportunities to grow and develop while making contributions to a winning team!
Here are some additional responsibilities of this position:
Track orders, shipments and managing data in SAP, Tableau, and other reporting solutions.
Maintain billing document and import documentation to external customers. Collaborate cross functionally to handle exceptions.
Facilitate international trade by ensuring that goods comply with customs regulations and requirements. Maintain product attributes entry in the system. Understand material composition and attributes needed for specific materials.
Use data analysis in support to process improvement to provide guidance to the business and leadership.
Build and maintain strong relationships with cross-function partners to facilitate continuous end to end business process improvement, align new businesses requirements, create/revise standard operating procedures for logistics processes, and implement new operations’ processes and activities.
Communicate, collaborate and measure performance with service providers such as ocean carriers, air freight forwarders, and global consolidators.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
You will collaborate with different teammates within our GEO, territory teams, carriers, and partners, building on strong trust, partnership, and collaboration to achieve results in a fun, energetic, and professional work environment.
WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Operations, Computer Science, will accept any suitable combination of relevant education, experience, and training.
2+ years of progressive analytics experience in the field of operations and logistics
Strong verbal and written communication skills with an interest in data-focused storytelling
Ability to conduct root cause analysis to pinpoint variances, and recommend solutions to avoid variances in the future
Ability to thrive in a fast paced and ambiguous environment.
Ability to work autonomously. Attention to details. Ability to problem solve and manage multiple competing priorities.
Experience with SAP or other ERP’s

Bonus Qualifications:
2+ years of Supply Chain analytics experiences
Experience with common coding languages and ETL applications (i.e. SQL, Python, R, Alteryx)
Experience building visualization in Tableau or PowerBI
Consulting or Finance experience
Customs and trade experience
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company, and we would like you to grow with us! Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission:
To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world!
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.
We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

title: BI Analyst II
description:
About Us:
Mid-States Distributing is the leading Farm, Ranch, and Home Retail Organization. Our 71+ year old company is owned by 29 independent Farm, Ranch & Home retailers (“Members”) who operate approximately 700 stores across the US and Canada with combined annual sales in excess of 7.5 billion dollars. Our member/owners retail items such as agriculture parts & supplies, petroleum products, hardware & tools, pet food, lawn & garden, animal health supplies, apparel & footwear, sporting goods, and various other products for the Farm, Ranch, and Home.
We are looking for enthusiastic people who like to win! We place a tremendous amount of emphasis on creating a dynamic and positive company culture. Most of our employees will tell you that Mid-States is the best place they’ve ever worked. We value high-energy people with positive mental attitudes who believe in the concept of “serving to wow”! Our consumers are primarily rural people raising kids, pets, cows, and crops so traditional values like God, family, and patriotism are important virtues. So, if you are enthusiastic, competitive, have a great attitude, have excellent written and verbal communication skills, like to build strong relationships, like to win, and refuse to eat meat grown in a lab – Mid-States may be the place for you! If you are not, please apply with our competitors!
POSITION OVERVIEW:
The BI Analyst II is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing scalable business intelligence solutions that empower data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role involves collaborating with stakeholders to translate business requirements into robust data architectures, ensuring data integrity, availability, and optimal performance for BI systems. They ensure that a formal data standard is adhered to and that the company’s data assets align with the business's goals, establishing and maintaining a cohesive data strategy for both internal and external data.
The BI Analyst II is expected to partner with the BI team, senior leaders, and product teams to create scalable, flexible, and reporting solutions that address customer business problems, leveraging Domo as our primary platform for data ingestion, transformation, and visualization.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and maintain data models and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure efficient data storage, integration, and retrieval.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into technical specifications and actionable BI solutions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability across all BI systems and reporting environments.
Create and maintain connections to various data sources in Domo via API, direct query, no code JSON, etc.
Identifies opportunities for standardization of existing workflows and developing more efficient processes to support maximum efficiency and productivity.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
Establish and enforce best practices, standards, and guidelines for BI development and implementation.
Continuously evaluate and recommend improvements to existing BI solutions, staying current with emerging BI technologies and trends.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent work experience will be considered.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence, and/or other related roles.
Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Domo, Power BI, Tableau) and knowledge of ETL processes. Experience with Domo and D365 is a plus.
Have used programming languages such as SQL for data manipulation. R, HTML, CSS, Python, and JavaScript would be a plus.
Demonstrated experience in data visualization, creating reports and dashboards, and working with large and complex datasets.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Strong understanding of data security and compliance best practices.
Proven experience leading BI projects and managing stakeholder expectations.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Generally, the job requires 80% sitting, 10% walking, and 10% standing. This job is performed in a generally clean environment. The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: some lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling, some stooping and significant fine finger dexterity.
TRAVEL:
Some travel involved
OTHER DUTIES:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this position. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Reasonable accommodations may enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
A few words from our COO:
I have had the pleasure to work for some incredible companies during my career, but Mid-States is truly the best company I have ever worked for. Lead by our dynamic CEO, Tom Mahlke, our team strives to provide a unique, exciting, fun, and fulfilling work environment for our staff. Things like drama, laziness, and entitlement have no place in Mid-States, which makes Mid-States a refreshing place to work. We offer competitive salaries, have a fantastic benefits package, and believe in rewarding those who produce. We serve a wonderful industry, and we are financially sound and growing rapidly. If you are an enthusiastic, high-energy person with a positive attitude and the skills described above, you may have just found the last job you will ever apply for! I look forward to meeting you. – Jeff Rash, COO

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking a meticulous and collaborative Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will thrive in a structured environment, adhering to established frameworks for data analysis and reporting. This role emphasizes working with existing data structures, ensuring alignment with organizational goals, and fostering effective communication across departments.
Responsibilities
Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze, interpret, and present insights derived from existing data systems to support informed decision-making across the organization.
Dashboard Maintenance: Ensure accurate and consistent use of current data dashboards and tools, adhering strictly to predefined criteria.
Presentation of Insights: Prepare and deliver clear, actionable reports and visualizations to stakeholders to ensure the effective use of data.
Maintain Data Integrity: Uphold the consistency and reliability of data by working within established processes and frameworks.
Reporting Structure
This role reports directly to the IT Director and will collaborate with key internal teams. The position is distinctly operational, ensuring focus remains on actionable insights within the company’s data framework.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Information Systems, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in a data analysis role within structured environments.
Proficiency with data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Power BI) and a strong understanding of data visualization principles.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining data accuracy and consistency.
Ideal Candidate
Thrives in environments with clearly defined expectations and workflows.
Demonstrates professionalism and discretion, with the ability to navigate complex organizational dynamics effectively.
Exhibits strong analytical thinking and the ability to translate data into meaningful insights without deviation from existing structures.
Benefits:
401(k) 3% Match
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid sick time
Paid time off
Retirement plan
Vision insurance

title: SharePoint & Power BI Developer
description:
EnTech Engineering, PC is a multidisciplinary engineering and construction management firm devoted to delivering best-in-class design and construction support services for infrastructure and facility projects that strengthen communities nationwide. Based in New York City, our firm is made of engineers, technologists, environmental scientists, construction professionals, and consultants who are passionate about improving the infrastructure, buildings, and communities that surround us.

About the Role:
EnTech is hiring a SharePoint & Power BI Developer to lead the development of our client-facing portal and data visualization tools. This role requires expertise in SharePoint Online and Power BI (including Report Server) to enhance collaboration, document management, and real-time insights for clients and internal teams.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
SharePoint
Design and implement SharePoint Online solutions tailored to client and team collaboration
Build secure document libraries, modern sites, workflows, and web parts.
Integrate with Microsoft 365 tools (Power Automate, OneDrive, Outlook, etc.)
Configure access controls and security groups using Azure AD and SharePoint permissions
Provide end-user documentation and training materials
Power BI
Develop dashboards and reports in Power BI Desktop and deploy them to Power BI Report Server
Build and manage secure, role-based reports for internal departments
Automate data refreshes and improve the performance of existing reports
Work with SQL Server, SharePoint lists, and other data sources for report creation
Help establish Power BI governance standards and publishing workflows

Required Qualifications:
3+ years of experience with SharePoint Online in a design/development role
Hands-on experience with Power BI Desktop, DAX, and Power BI Report Server
Proficiency in Power Platform tools: Power Automate, Power Apps, Microsoft Lists
Understanding of security, permissions, and site architecture within Microsoft 365
Strong UI/UX sensibility and ability to build intuitive portal experiences

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience deploying and maintaining Power BI Report Server in on-premises or hybrid environments
Working knowledge of SPFx, JSON formatting, and front-end customization
Familiarity with SQL, Azure AD, and Microsoft Teams integration
Experience in AEC or engineering project environments is a strong plus
Microsoft certifications (PL-300, MS-600, PL-900, etc.) are a bonus

Estimated Annual Compensation:
$95,000 - $120,000

Location:
New York, NY

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal opportunity for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other legally protected status. title: Power BI Developer
description:
Qualifications (Must Have’s):[skills, knowledge, and expertise required]
PowerBI developer will have extensive PowerBI experience and exceptional data modelling and SQL skills. He or she will have previously used Bookmarks, Custom Visuals, and Field parameters to create flexible user-defined PowerBI experiences.

SQL skills will also be extensive. The developer will have modelled numerous situations and be able to understand and adapt to data needs quickly. He or she will be creative and by able to apply his or her experience on a regular basis.

8-12 Years of overall development experience
5+ Years of PowerBI Development that demonstrates advanced skills
8+ Years of SQL experience modelling data and writing complex queries
GIT for version control
Nice to Haves: [Skills that would be a plus, but are not mandatory for the role]
Object-Oriented Framework development is a plus
Miro is a plus.

Tasks & responsibilities -
The Senior End-to-End PowerBI Developer will work independently under the Product Manager to deliver internal projects by turning requirements into data models, reports, and dashboards with proper performance and security.
End-to-end dashboard creation, product owner communication, tracking the development timeline and RAID log, and confidently testing his or her work.
Participate in knowledge transfer sessions with Product Manager to quickly learn and apply our data schemas, metrics, and visual standards.
Collaborate with BAs and Product Manager to refine technical requirements.
Work with the data engineering and data architecture team to ensure data flows and data availability.
Design and implement interactive reports and dashboards in PowerBI, following NT best practices and standards for development.
Include drill-through, drill-down, and tool-tips as required for end user interaction.
Ensure reports meet performance benchmarks.
Configure appropriate refresh schedules.
Perform data validation to ensure accuracy.
Conduct unit tests, work with QA/QC, conduct UAT.
Document data models, report structures, and logic used in the data product development.
Participate in daily stand-ups.
Benefits
Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging, and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

title: Associate Data Analyst
description:
Posting Description
ASSOCIATE DATA ANALYST, Credit Union, supports organization business and department objectives through collecting, evaluating and reporting member and sales data. With guidance from AVP, Data Analytics and Program Support the ADA will help maintain Arkalytics (DataLake), DNA CRM/BI tool and all data related systems to help research trends, support opportunities and measure program effectiveness; proactively support outreach programs through any type of list generation and providing ad-hoc analysis; ensure consistency within the organization in applying a set of projects and process improvement standards; and share knowledge, provide, and serve as resource to project teams and management on tools, methods and best practices.
The full job description is available here.

REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree; a minimum of two years of administrative and/or project/program management experience; effective mathematical, language, problem solving, reasoning, writing and basic to complex numeric skills; intermediate to advanced SQL skills for data extraction and analysis; experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel (pivottables, macros, advanced formulas); ability to handle multiple projects and work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment; and excellent typing, interpersonal and organizational skills. Job #25065-6
This hybrid role requires on-site presence. Employees are expected to work 3 days in the office and 2 days remotely each week.

title: Consultant-Business Strategy
description:
When you join Verizon
You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the #VTeamLife.
What you’ll be doing...
The Verizon Business Group Strategy team holds a key role in helping shape this new path. As a key member of the VBG Strategy team’s Analytics Center of Excellence, you will be finding and analyzing data to answer a number of strategic questions to support our executive team in the Verizon Business Group. Your analyses will form the basis of recommendations that shape the way Verizon goes to market, services our customers, builds new products, and much more! These requests will come from all corners of the organization including Global Enterprise, Business Markets, Product, and Strategic Governance. You will support these strategy professionals across our organization in the development of their strategic recommendations when it comes to everything from data sourcing to query formulation to data stitching to analytical modelling. In order to succeed, you will become an expert in Verizon’s data architecture and ecosystems as well as developing and maintaining strong relationships with the key data stakeholders in the company.
Collaborating with stakeholders, data engineers, developers, and business leaders on initiatives that require an analytical expertise and/or an analytical solution
Sourcing data from key stakeholders, company systems, surveys, and external 3rd party sources
Efficiently joining and manipulating numerous large, disparate datasets, ensuring data integrity and accuracy
Identifying and implementing opportunities for parallel processing and query optimization to improve data retrieval times
Contributing to the development and enhancing of data warehousing solutions
Investigating data issues to resolve inconsistencies and ensuring high quality
Finding answers to difficult strategic questions through deep analysis and formulating actionable recommendations
Socializing solutions and gathering feedback to ensure accuracy and actionability of analysis and recommendations
Visualizing data and building presentations to help stakeholders, leaders, and executives understand the analysis
Leveraging advanced analytics/modeling to examine word frequency and sentiment, cluster natural groupings, and predicting key phenomena to help us prioritize the right things
Asking good questions and probing deeply to learn more every day about important business processes and opportunities
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
A Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience
Four or more years of relevant experience required, demonstrated through work experience and/or military experience
Proficiency using SQL
Understanding of advanced data engineering (e.g., building data pipelines, data cleansing, fuzzy matching, etc.)
Understanding of advanced statistical methods (e.g., regression, classification algorithms, gradient boosted ensembles, etc.) and experience in data analytics platforms and visualization software tools
Ability to translate complex ideas and express them in concise, simple to understand ways
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, meet deadlines, and simultaneously work on multiple projects
Comfortable working across all levels of an organization, leveraging organizational, interpersonal, presentation, and time-management skills
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
Advanced degree in a technical field (in particular, Data Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics) or MBA
Two or more years of experience in a quantitative/technical role (e.g., data engineering, data science, applied analytics, mathematics, engineering, etc.), even better for a tier 1 management consulting firm
Proficiency using Python or R
Knowledge of data engineering and data science tools (e.g., Alteryx, Knime) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
Experience with business problem definition, insight synthesis, and executive communication
If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.
Where you’ll be working
In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40
Equal Employment Opportunity
Verizon is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to veteran status, disability or other legally protected characteristics.
Benefits and Compensation
Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefit options including: medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability, basic life insurance, supplemental life insurance, AD&D insurance, identity theft protection, pet insurance and group home & auto insurance. We also offer a matched 401(k) savings plan, stock incentive programs, up to 8 company paid holidays per year and up to 6 personal days per year, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. Depending on the role, employees have the opportunity to receive compensation in the form of premium pay such as overtime, shift differential, holiday pay, allowances, etc. Newly hired employees receive up to 15 days of vacation per year, which grows with additional service. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.
The annual salary range for the location(s) listed on this job requisition based on a full-time schedule is: $105,500.00 - $184,000.00.

title: Six Sigma Black Belt
description:
Career Area:
Strategy
Job Description:
Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.
When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.
As a Lean Six Sigma Blackbelt, you will lead projects and initiatives located at our prime product facilities in North America as well as the remaining Paving facilities outside of North America. Your primary focus will be to identify waste within the Paving Product Development and Maintenance areas and execute projects to eliminate that waste. This involves collaborating with the global extended Paving team including business resources, engineering, manufacturing, purchasing, and supply chain to develop targets, identify projects to close gaps, and report out to leadership.
What You Will Do:
Lead the effort to identify both Lean and Cost opportunities for Cat Paving. This includes working with cross-functional leadership as well as the working teams to charter projects and get them piloted and in-place.
Lead the effort at Paving to simplify our products to achieve both cost reduction and development efficiency.
Lead the effort to drive efficiency in the Paving product maintenance space. This includes current product updates, quality fixes, component source changes, and other maintenance activities.
What You Have:
Bachelor's degree in engineering or business, coupled with extensive and progressive experience in product development, with a foundational understanding of product cost inputs, accounting methodologies, and tracking metrics.
Proven experience in project management, with a track record of leading cost projects and initiatives, particularly in a manufacturing or engineering environment.
Demonstrated ability to influence through expertise, effectively guiding and mentoring teams and stakeholders to achieve long-term competitive cost structure goals without direct leadership responsibilities.
Strong skills in requirements analysis, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams (including business resources, engineering, manufacturing, commercial, and supply chain) to develop targets, identify projects to close gaps, and report progress to leadership.
Top Candidates Will Have:
Master’s degree in business or engineering.
Six Sigma BB Certification
High level of verbal and written communication skills; an ability to see the big picture; the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects concurrently with a diverse global team.
Experience with data analysis, manipulation, and relevant tools (Excel, PowerBi, Tableau, etc.).
Additional Info:
Caterpillar operates in a in-person work environment, requiring 5 days per week of onsite, in office work.
Domestic relocation is available to those who qualify.
15% international and domestic travel is expected.
ISE is not available.
Visa sponsorship is not available.
Summary Pay Range:
$110,520.00 - $165,840.00
Compensation and benefits offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, job level, market location, job-related knowledge, skills, individual performance and experience. Please note that salary is only one component of total compensation at Caterpillar.
Benefits:
Subject to plan eligibility, terms, and guidelines. This is a summary list of benefits.
Medical, dental, and vision benefits*
Paid time off plan (Vacation, Holidays, Volunteer, etc.)*
401(k) savings plans*
Health Savings Account (HSA)*
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)*
Health Lifestyle Programs*
Employee Assistance Program*
Voluntary Benefits and Employee Discounts*
Career Development*
Incentive bonus*
Disability benefits
Life Insurance
Parental leave
Adoption benefits
Tuition Reimbursement
These benefits also apply to part-time employees
Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.
Posting Dates:
July 15, 2025 - July 29, 2025
Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.
Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Including Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Qualified applicants of any age are encouraged to apply.
Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community.

title: Finance BI Analyst
description:
BRIEF DESCRIPTION:
We are seeking a Finance Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with a strong focus on full-stack BI development to join our finance team. In this role, you will play a key part in designing and delivering end-to-end BI solutions that drive financial performance and strategic decision-making. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements, design data models, build robust SQL-based data pipelines, and develop actionable reporting tools. This position requires hands-on technical expertise in SQL Server, BI tools, and report/dashboard development.
Pay Range: $75,000 - $100,000
PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
End-to-End BI Solution Development: Design, build, and maintain complete BI solutions, from data extraction and transformation (ETL) in SQL Server to front-end dashboard development in tools like Power BI or Tableau.
SQL Development & Scripting: Write, optimize, and manage complex SQL queries, stored procedures, views, and data validation scripts to support robust and scalable financial reporting frameworks.
Financial Data Analysis: Analyze structured financial and operational data to identify trends, variances, and key insights that support strategic decisions and business performance improvements.
Business Requirements Gathering: Partner with finance, accounting, and business stakeholders to capture reporting needs and translate them into scalable technical solutions and data models.
Dashboard and Report Design: Create visually compelling, interactive dashboards and reports that convey financial insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ad Hoc Queries and Insights: Support ad hoc data requests by querying financial data systems and delivering fast, accurate analyses to internal teams.
Process Automation & Optimization: Develop automated data pipelines and reporting processes to enhance data accuracy, reduce manual effort, and increase efficiency across the BI stack.
Technology Evaluation & Innovation: Stay current on BI and data engineering trends, tools, and techniques, recommending and implementing improvements to the existing analytics infrastructure.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:
This role has no direct reports.
QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:
Proficient in data modeling, relational databases, data warehousing, and BI architecture.
Experienced in developing and maintaining end-to-end BI solutions, from data ingestion to visualization.
Skilled in analyzing data and translating findings into actionable business insights.
Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on data accuracy, integrity, and presentation.
Effective communicator, able to collaborate across both technical and non-technical teams
Adept at identifying and resolving complex data issues and pipeline inconsistencies.
Experienced in supporting and training a broad analytical user base across functions.
Adaptable and proven in dynamic, fast-paced data environments.
Committed to continuous learning and staying current with BI tools and best practices.
Advanced proficiency in SQL Server development, including T-SQL, views, indexing, and performance tuning.
Skilled in using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar analytics platforms.
Experience integrating data from ERP/CRM systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Salesforce).
Familiar with modern data pipeline tools such as Fivetran, Hevo, Apache Airflow, Matillion, or AWS Glue.
Industry exposure to Restoration or Construction is a plus.
TRAVEL:
Occasional travel. (Less than 25% of time.) Some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected for training or meetings.
WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL JOB DEMANDS:
The work environment characteristics and physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. These must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment can range from quiet to significantly loud. The employee must regularly lift and/or move between 25-50 pounds. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, use hands and fingers to handle material, reach with hands and arms, and talk and hear. The employee is required to regularly move and walk around the office.
COMPENSATION:
BluSky provides a competitive base salary and a comprehensive benefits package that includes: a matching 401(k) plan with guaranteed match, health insurance plans (medical, dental, and vision), paid time off, paid holidays, disability coverage, job-specific equipment (e.g., laptop, smartphone, etc.), and a corporate apparel allowance.
BluSky also offers extended benefits such as an Employee Assistance Program, Accident and Critical Illness Coverage, LegalShield, Professional Development Opportunities, a Paid Employee Referral Program, Vendor discounts, and much more.
EEOC:
BluSky is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity. BluSky prohibits unlawful discrimination against applicants or employees based on age 40 or over, race, sex, color, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other applicable status protected by Federal, State, or local law.
It is and will continue to be the policy of BluSky that all people are entitled to equal employment opportunity based on their individual qualifications, performance, and potential without regard for any protected status, as required by state and federal law.
Application Duration:
To ensure a thorough and fair selection process, we would like to inform you that the application deadline for this position is XX/XX/20XX. Please ensure that your application is submitted by this date for consideration.
To be considered for this position, you must complete the online application by visiting our careers page at www.goblusky.com/careers.
Pay Transparency In order to support the Fair Compensation Strategy by the US Govt., HR Dept., clients are required to adhere to "Pay Transparency Law"; in the impacted states; that have mandated the employers to list the salary ranges in Job advertisements or postings for job opportunities and Job promotions.

title: Customer Experience Project Specialist
description:
Job Summary:
Customer Experience Project Specialist is responsible for leading and executing projects involving the design, implementation, management, and optimization of our automated CS/CX solutions, powered by Generative AI across key channels including chat, email, and phone (voice). Leveraging deep data analysis, this role identifies key friction points, measures project impact against CX and operational goals and drives continuous improvements.

This role will partner closely with the Senior Manager of CS Projects & RMA to define ways to make improvements for CS/CX and ensure that all of our contact channels are aligned to support our iHerb customer-centric vision.

Job Expectations:
GenAI Chatbot - Strategy, Implementation & Optimization of Automation:
Develop automation strategy, define project scope/roadmaps, and lead the implementation of Generative AI across chat, email, and voice channels.
Oversee performance and manage the configuration, testing, maintenance, and integration of GenAI platforms and conversational flows.
Analyze large volumes of interaction data (chat, email, voice), user feedback, and key metrics (KPIs, friction metrics) to measure effectiveness, identify trends/pain points, generate actionable insights, and drive continuous improvement in GenAI performance and customer journey optimization.
Collaborate closely with the Knowledge Base Administrator to ensure content accuracy and address knowledge gaps critical for GenAI effectiveness.
Reporting, Analytics & Insights:
Build, maintain, and enhance comprehensive reporting dashboards tracking key CX automation KPIs (e.g., Bot CSAT, containment and automated resolution rate) and project outcomes.
Transform raw data and analyze CX friction metrics to generate actionable insights, identify trends and pain points, and uncover opportunities to optimize customer journeys and reduce effort.
Present project updates, findings, and data-driven recommendations to stakeholders to influence strategy and operational improvements.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Work effectively with CS/CX, Product and other teams to understand requirements, gather feedback, and manage dependencies for automation projects.
Serve as a subject matter expert on CX automation capabilities, managing project communication and stakeholder expectations.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
2+ years of related working experience with chatbots and automation systems within a customer support organization.
Basic familiarity with programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python) and API integrations.
Advanced Proficiency in Excel/Google sheets, SQL, analytics and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Google Analytics, Looker Studio, Zendesk Explore).
Strong analytical skills to identify trends and areas for improvement from AI interactions and user support systems.
Proven track record in developing and implementing innovative customer strategies within a high-growth environment.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships and influence stakeholders.
Strengths in problem-solving, issue resolution, ability to work in a deadline-driven environment, attention to detail, and ability to multitask.
Strong ownership and a team player, always focused on delivering results with high standards.

The duties and responsibilities described above may provide only a partial description of this position. This is not an exhaustive list of all aspects of the job. Other duties and responsibilities not outlined in this document may be added as necessary or desirable, with or without notice.

Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Analysis, information systems, communications or a combination of education and equivalent experience.

#LI-LR1

iHerb is on a mission to make health and wellness accessible to all. We offer Earth's best-curated selection of health and wellness products, at the best possible value, delivered with the most convenient experience.

title: Senior BI Developer
description:
Overview:
When you join Kyocera Document Solutions America, Inc. you are joining an organization that is deeply rooted in the Philosophy of “doing what is right as a human being”. Through this Philosophy, our employees are passionate about providing best in class customer service through efficiency, accountability, and a sense of urgency all while putting knowledge to work to drive change. Kyocera is a Great Place to Work… and we really mean it! We were officially certified again as a Great Place to Work since 2022.

Unlike your average IT team that simply administers technology, we are looking to transform our IT department into a strategic partner that provides a real impact on the business by delivering innovative analytic and reporting solutions.

This role will be part of our Business Intelligence team, reporting to the Sr. Application Product Manager of Business Intelligence. We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to help lead our enterprise data initiatives and deliver actionable insights across the organization. This role will play a key part in advancing our data platform using Microsoft Fabric and Power BI. You will work closely with business and technical teams to transform complex data from systems like Oracle E-Business Suite into scalable, user-friendly analytics solutions. This position requires a blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and a mentoring mindset to support other developers and elevate our BI capabilities.

To be successful in this position you must have a winning attitude, a positive problem-solving approach, an intellectual curiosity, an aptitude for critical thinking, and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment. You will need to be a self-starter, a team player, a change agent, technically savvy, creative, customer focused, results driven, meticulous about details and have a track record of delivering quality and efficiency. In this role, you will have the ability to make significant and long-lasting impacts for the entire KDA organization by advancing our business intelligence and analytical capabilities to deliver meaningful and transformational IT services and solutions. As a result, you will be one of the critical change agents within KDA.

The chance to do something meaningful, to challenge yourself, to take others where they would not go on their own, to be a part of change in an industry, and to drive change - doesn’t come around every day!

Responsibilities:
+ Translate business requirements into effective BI solutions and technical specifications.

+ Build and manage ETL/ELT pipelines to integrate data from Oracle EBS and other systems, with the help of our engineers.

+ Develop, test, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards that support data-driven decision-making.

+ Ensure data quality, integrity, and security across all reporting and analytics solutions.

+ Optimize data performance, query efficiency, and reporting workflows.

+ Lead code reviews and mentor BI team members on development best practices.

+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure reporting aligns with operational and strategic needs.

+ Maintain technical documentation, including data dictionaries, process workflows, and metadata.

+ Promote the adoption of self-service analytics and contribute to data governance efforts.

+ Stay informed on emerging technologies and promote continuous improvement within the BI function

Qualifications:
+ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field, or equivalent experience.

+ 5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data warehousing, or analytics roles.

+ Strong experience with Power BI including advanced DAX and interactive dashboard development.

+ Proficiency in T-SQL and PL/SQL for querying and data manipulation in MS SQL Server and Oracle databases.

+ Hands-on experience designing and building ETL/ELT pipelines and data integration workflows.

+ Experience working with Oracle E-Business Suite and MS SQL data structures, especially Finance and Supply Chain modules.

+ Strong data modeling skills, including dimensional models and star schemas.

+ Excellent communication skills, able to explain complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

+ Demonstrated ability to lead technical initiatives and mentor other developers.

+ Strong attention to detail, problem-solving mindset, and a drive for quality and efficiency.

+ Attendance at Kyocera’s headquarters office in Fairfield, NJ per current work policies is required.

+ Company paid relocation is not provided to the Fairfield, NJ office. The candidate must self-relocate.

Preferred:
+ Experience working with Microsoft Fabric or similar modern data platforms.

+ Familiarity with DevOps practices and version control tools in a BI context.

+ Exposure to data governance frameworks and metadata management.

+ Certifications related to Power BI, data engineering, or analytics are a plus.

+ Knowledge of financial and sales reporting concepts.

+ Experience with agile development methodologies.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to support our employees’ well-being which includes:
+ Medical, dental and vision plans
+ 401(k) retirement plan with Company match
+ Life insurance and disability coverage
+ Paid time off and holidays
+ Paid parental leave
+ Employee Assistance Program
+ Volunteer Time Off
+ Professional development course reimbursement

The typical pay range for this role is $109,000 -$141,000. This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography, and other relevant factors. This position may include a discretionary bonus based on performance.

Note

This is a general description of the duties and responsibilities most frequently required of this position. The company may from time-to-time request that the incumbent perform other related tasks and assume reasonable responsibilities that have not been specifically included in this description.

Kyocera Document Solutions America, Inc is a group company of Kyocera Document Solutions Inc., a global leading provider of total document solutions based in Osaka, Japan. The company’s portfolio includes reliable and eco-friendly MFPs and printers, as well as business applications and consultative services which enable customers to optimize and manage their document workflow, reaching new heights of efficiency. With professional expertise and a culture of empathetic partnership, the objective of the company is to help organizations put knowledge to work to drive change. Kyocera is looking for enthusiastic and innovative people to help our customers run their businesses more efficiently and more profitably. We offer a generous benefits package including medical, dental and vision plans, a 401k match, flexible spending, disability and life insurance, plus paid time off and holidays.

KYOCERA Document Solutions America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, a VEVRRA Federal Contractor, and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws regarding nondiscrimination. Kyocera provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. Qualified minorities, women, protected veterans and/or individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

title: BI Engineer (Power BI) - Dallas, TX
description:
**Job Description: **

As a BI Engineer specializing in Power BI, you will play a key role in the design, development, and deployment of modern reporting and analytical solutions on the Snowflake and Power BI platform. You will be instrumental in migrating existing reports and dashboards from OBIEE to Power BI, ensuring data accuracy, performance, and user satisfaction. Your expertise in data modeling, ETL/ELT processes, and Power BI development will be critical to the success of this strategic initiative.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with business stakeholders, data analysts, and other team members to understand reporting requirements and translate them into robust Power BI solutions.
Design and develop scalable and efficient data models in Power BI, leveraging best practices for performance and usability.
Participate in the migration of existing reports and dashboards from OBIEE to Power BI, ensuring data integrity and functional parity.
Develop and maintain ETL/ELT processes to load and transform data from Snowflake and other relevant data sources into Power BI datasets.
Create interactive and visually compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI that empower end-users with self-service analytics capabilities.
Implement and maintain data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of reporting data.
Optimize Power BI report performance and troubleshoot any performance bottlenecks.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of technical documentation for Power BI solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Power BI features and best practices and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our reporting capabilities.
Participate in testing, deployment, and ongoing support of Power BI applications.
Work closely with the Snowflake team to ensure seamless integration between the data warehouse and Power BI.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience 6-10+ as a BI Engineer or similar role with a strong focus on Power BI development.
Hands-on experience in designing and developing data models within Power BI Desktop.
Proficiency in writing DAX queries for calculations and data manipulation within Power BI.
Experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL/ELT) processes.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and principles.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases (experience with Snowflake is a significant plus).
Experience migrating reporting solutions from legacy BI platforms (OBIEE experience is highly desirable).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively interact with both technical and business stakeholders.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Preferred Skills:
Experience with advanced Power BI features such as Power BI Service administration, dataflows, and Power BI Embedded.

Understanding of financial services or investment management data.
