BENEFITS:
Texas Parks and Wildlife offers a variety of benefits for employees such as generous paid time off, group insurance, retirement and pension, and frequent training and staff development opportunities. Other benefits include longevity pay, merit pay, deferred compensation, flexible benefit plans, 401K/457 retirement plans, direct deposit, staggered work hours, Employee Assistance Program and a Return to Work Program. For new employees or rehires, health insurance is available the 1st of the following month after a 60-day waiting period. Click HERE to view our Benefits page.

HIRING CONTACT: Thomas (Wayne) Baker, (713) 397-2804

PHYSICAL WORK ADDRESS: IT-Application Development, TPWD Headquarters, 4200 Smith School Road, Austin, TX 78744

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
Under the direction of the Strategy/Business Development Manager, this position performs complex (journey-level) computer programming work including interacting closely with project management and customers to develop requirements, design, build and maintain custom reports and dashboards. The primary focus for this position will be on development of reports, paginated reports, views and dashboards in a Power BI environment. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Performs additional duties as assigned. Complies with all Agency, Division and Branch rules, regulations, and procedures.
NOTE: Required to pass a national fingerprint-based background check to maintain employment.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s degree.
Experience:
Minimum of three years of full-time experience creating enterprise-level reports using business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or comparable platforms.
At least one year of hands-on experience developing interactive reports and dashboards specifically within Microsoft Power BI.
One year of experience designing and generating Power BI paginated reports.
NOTE: Experience may have occurred concurrently.
Background Check:
Required to pass a national fingerprint-based background check prior to employment offer. Potential candidates will be responsible for expenses related to the background check.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science or Data Science.
Experience:
Experience in the Microsoft Power BI platform, including Power BI Service, Power BI Report Builder, and Power BI desktop.
Experience integrating Power BI reports into custom-built web applications with Oracle databases and Dataverse as the data sources
Experience with paginated reports in producing government issued precise placement documents, such as titles, licenses, certificates, etc.
Experience in related Microsoft apps such as PowerApps, Power Automate, RPA, and Power Pages.
Experience with Oracle, SQL, SAS, the Dataverse, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Two years of the required experience performing Power BI report building is from a Texas government agency.
Licensure:
Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate certification (PL-300).

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Knowledge of designing and implementing reports with Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and Power BI Report Builder.
Knowledge of the various Power BI report types and has clear understanding of their use cases.
Knowledge of Power Query, M code, and DAX.
Knowledge of current technological trends in Power BI, report development and business intelligence.
Knowledge of functional, business and architectural aspects of Power BI components for providing solutions.
Knowledge of Power BI best practices.
Knowledge of Power BI datasets, Apps report packages, Dataflow, Datamart, deployment pipelines, and Workspaces.
Knowledge of how to connect to various data sources.
Knowledge of data management and data governance best practices.
Knowledge of Agile, Iterative and Waterfall project methodologies.
Knowledge of developing applications for compliance with Section 508 of the U.S. Rehabilitation Act.
Skill in the Power BI platform and its capabilities.
Skill in creating various types of Power BI paginated reports, such as precise placement fulfillment paginated reports (certificate cards, title documents, coupons, etc.), table layout detail paginated reports, summary paginated reports, and receipts.
Skill in creating different paginated report implementations and printing options, such as ensuring report compatibility with non-standard print sizes and OCR font printing and configuring print tasks to select specific paper trays for output; producing PDF and Excel files for output.
Skill in integrating Power BI reports into custom-built web applications preferably with both Oracle databases and the Dataverse as data sources.
Skill in creating and publishing visually appealing Power BI interactive reports, mobile reports, and dashboards.
Skill in developing ad hoc reports with variable selection criteria and visualizations, such as slicers, charts, graphs, maps, tables, etc.
Skill in designing and developing data models.
Skill in data transformation, data cleanup, data consolidation, etc. using Power Query.
Skill in advanced data transformation tasks using M code.
Skill in creating custom calculations and measures using DAX.
Skill in connecting to a variety of data sources using connectors and creating custom connectors.
Skill in managing real-time and batch fulfillment jobs, including night-time batch fulfillment that updates databases.
Skill in managing data refresh schedules to ensure up-to-date information.
Skill in optimizing data models for faster query performance.
Skill in managing permissions to reports, row level security, and sharing reports with stakeholders.
Skill in using pipelines and version control.
Skill in troubleshooting production issues.
Skill in using MS Excel, Word and Outlook.
Skill in effective verbal and written communication with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Skill in collaborating with other developers and developing in a multi-tier environment.
Skill in establishing and maintaining effective work relationships with co-workers and work-related contacts.
Skill in prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines.
Ability to work independently with little or no supervision.
Ability to integrate Power BI report technologies and methodologies into an existing application development environment.
Ability to understand and analyze requirements and provide solutions.
Ability to develop reports from ground up including designing database tables, user interfaces, and report delivery.
Ability to choose the right type of visualization for different data types and applications.
Ability to manage data and report delivery ensuring data privacy and compliance with agency policies.
Ability to create documentation and user guides for reports and dashboards.
Ability to provide support and training to end-users.
Ability to implement best practices for improving report performance.
Ability to conduct testing, verification, troubleshoot and performing root cause analysis.
Ability to understand statistical concepts, methods, KPIs and metrics.
Ability to perform detailed work accurately.
Ability to maintain flexibility and work with frequent interruptions and multiple changing priorities.
Ability to follow standards for report and software development.
Ability to perform the steps required of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Ability to process information logically.
Ability to manage several projects simultaneously.
Ability to participate in Joint Application Development sessions for requirements gathering.
Ability to conduct work activities in accordance with TPWD safety program.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Required to work from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.
Required to work overtime as necessary.
Required to provide after-hours support as needed.
Required to pass a national fingerprint-based background check to maintain employment.
Must conform to TPWD dress and grooming standards, work rules, and safety standards.
May be required to operate a state vehicle.
Required to travel 5% with possible overnight stays.
Non-smoking environment in State buildings and vehicles.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Responsibilities*
Job Duties
Develop a comprehensive, cross-functional understanding of business processes, production systems, enterprise-wide data warehouses/sources, and departmental databases. Participate in cross-functional teams for increasing the impact/awareness of business intelligence (BI) projects and tools. Assist in the presentation/demonstration of tools and BI solutions. Conduct business analysis and functional design activities for capturing, loading, storing, and extracting data across the organization. Design, model, and build data structures and data mapping routines to support the data and reporting requirements for all areas of the organization. Participate in strategic assessments to identify current/emerging business issues/problems and contribute to defining high-impact business intelligence solutions with a focus on quantitative methods, modeling, and analytical techniques. Develop reports and definitions, graphs, dashboards, and portal interfaces. Hybrid work from home and office.
Required Qualifications*

Master's degree in Business Administration or Management Information Systems + 2 years of related experience to include: development of Business Object (BO) reports, Tableau Dashboard development, Structured Query Language (SQL) scripting experience, experience producing Public University Summary Data, and experience with State of Michigan Higher Education Data Inventory (HEIDI) and federal Department of Education Integrated Postsecondary Education Data Systems (IPEDS) compliance reporting requirements.

Background check required upon offer acceptance.

title: MSB Reporting Analyst
description:
Overview:
The MSB (Money Services Business) Reporting Analyst reports to the Chief Financial Officer, MSB. This role is instrumental in producing accurate and complete financial and transactional reporting to meet compliance obligations related to money transmission licensing. This position will deliver high-quality insights, key metrics, and data visualizations that help mitigate risk and ensure data governance. The ideal candidate will be a strong collaborator, working cross-functionally with Finance, Product Management, Engineering, Legal, and Operations, as well as external consultants, to drive data accuracy, reporting optimization, and strategic insights.
Responsibilities:
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Support reporting initiatives for MSB licensing through accurate classification, tagging, and analysis of financial and transactional data.
Work closely with external consultants and internal stakeholders to develop data strategies, improve reporting processes, and align on compliance needs.
Implement controls to ensure data integrity and compliance with SOX, money transmission regulations, and internal governance standards.
Prepare and deliver financial reports, dashboards, and data visualizations for the CFO, senior leadership, and Board of Directors that provide clear, actionable insights.
Analyze business and transaction trends, identify key risk indicators (KRIs), and support the development of risk mitigation strategies.
Maintain metadata repositories and financial data systems, ensuring reporting accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with project managers, developers, and engineers on initiatives impacting financial systems and reporting workflows.
Qualifications:
QUALIFICATIONS

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting or related field.
7 years of experience working with transactional databases, ledgers, and financial data systems.
7 years of experience using financial and or accounting systems.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES

Required:

Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and other MS Office tools.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and automation platforms.
Prior experience working with cross-functional teams including engineering and project management.
Strong knowledge of financial reporting principles and internal control frameworks.
Effective communicator with the ability to influence and present to senior stakeholders.
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to manage competing priorities and meet tight deadlines in a high-profile environment.
Resilience and composure when working with incomplete or disorganized data.
Experience in the FinTech or Money Transmission industry is a plus.
Experience supporting regulatory or licensing reporting.
Background in financial services, compliance, or MSB environments.
Familiarity with SOX and enterprise data standards.

Physical Demands and Working Conditions
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear. The employee must have the ability to operate a personal computer and express or exchange ideas by means of the spoken word. May be required to sit and/or stand for long periods of time. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. May be required to lift or move 10+ pounds.
Pay Range: USD $85,200.00 - USD $145,200.00 /Yr.

title: Business Systems Specialist- Power BI
description:
We're looking for a Full Time, Business Systems Specialist to join our talented team at Brothers International team in Rochester, NY!

Position Summary:
As a Business Systems Specialist, you will work closely with our cross functional teams located in Rochester, NY, Tampa, FL, and Fort Lauderdale FL. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, evaluating, and implementing comprehensive solutions within our ERP system to support our business model and objectives. Utilizing EDI and API solutions, you'll work with all departments across the company to ensure accuracy of information. Your deep understanding of our systems and technology, will enable you to assist with operational efficiencies, scalability and end-user satisfaction.

The Day to Day:
Manage company ERP, EDI and API Maps to ensure accurate data, systems functioning, and system improvements.
Monitor ERP tickets and EDI transactions, identifying errors or discrepancies, and troubleshooting issues to ensure system accuracy and functioning.
Assist in managing ERP, EDI and API integration projects including implementation and enhancements.
Manage and prioritize open requests, develop a priority system, and maintain reporting on all open requests.
Act as a subject matter expert for ERP (NetSuite), EDI and API on all transactions/modules relating to sales, operations, and distribution.
Work cross functionally to gather business requirements, analyze business processes, and implement effective solutions.
Analyze and systematically improve company data leading to process and performance improvement.
Provide support and training to end users.
Minimum Qualifications:
BS Degree in related field or equivalent work experience
Prior CRM, ERP, EDI and API experience required
Experience with EDI mapping tools and technologies
Experience working with API integrations and web services
Prior NetSuite experience preferred
Prior experience with SQL or PowerBI a plus
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Strong understanding of EDI standards (e.g, ANSI x12, EDIFACT) and protocols (AS2, FTP, SFTP)
Strong analytical skills including data entry, reporting and creative problem solving
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong business acumen
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and influence others
Detail orientation with ability to manage multiple priorities
Proficient in troubleshooting EDI transactions and resolving issues on time
Ability to travel if needed
About Brothers International Food Holdings, LLC:
At Brothers International, we are passionate about creating high-quality food products that enrich lives and bring people together. Our Ingredients division supplies top-quality fruit and fruit juice concentrates to a number of Fortune 100 food companies. Our Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) division includes Brothers-All-Natural, the #1 Freeze-Dried Snack Brand, and also produces private label freeze-dried fruit snacks for some of the leading retailers in the US.

Headquartered in Rochester, NY, with offices in Florida and China, we are an innovative global leader in the food industry. We take pride in our commitment to excellence, sustainability, and the well-being of our communities. If you are interested in becoming part of a fast-growing, dynamic team environment, read on!

Why Brothers International?
Innovation: Be part of a company that values creativity and encourages innovation in the ever-evolving food industry.
Team Collaboration: Join a collaborative work environment where your ideas and contributions are recognized and celebrated.
Global Impact: Contribute to a company with a global presence, making a difference in the lives of people worldwide through our diverse range of food products.
Brothers International is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.

title: Database Reporting Analyst- Virtual Care Institute- Days
description:
This position reports onsite at VCU Health's downtown campus in Richmond, VA and will support the Virtual Care Institute. The Database Reporting Analyst will focus on data infrastructure, analytics, financial modeling, volume projections and strategic integration while also remaining up to date on the ever-changing reimbursement guidelines for virtual care. We are seeking a new team member who is experienced in business operations, preferably in the healthcare setting.

The Database Reporting Analyst job family is responsible for the reporting of operational, financial, clinical, and performance improvement data.

Licensure, Certification, or Registration Requirements for Hire: N/A

Licensure, Certification, or Registration Requirements for continued employment: N/A

Experience REQUIRED:
Three to six years of related experience
Complete understanding and broad application of technical principles, theories and concepts in principal discipline and working knowledge of related disciplines. Intermediate understanding of the system development life cycle, database management languages, relational databases, change management, and testing processes with a fundamental understanding of client-server architecture.
Approaches expert level on the business processes, workflow, and data model of at least one major operational, financial, or clinical area with broad knowledge of other major areas.
General understanding of the interactions between all reporting, scheduling, and data movement applications with the ability to collaborate on design and development efforts with Architects and ETL developers.
Ability to make and coordinate modifications to existing functionality on most reporting platforms as well as the skill to troubleshoot as needed
Strong written communication skills

Experience PREFERRED

Education/training REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of related education and experience.
Basic knowledge of database monitoring and SQL tuning tools and processes.
Intermediate level expertise in at least one major reporting platform (Cognos, Tableau, Informatica) with beginner to intermediate knowledge of the others. Intermediate knowledge of SQL

Education/training PREFERRED:
Independent action(s) required: Independently determines and develops approaches to solutions with work completed with accuracy and sound judgment ensuring objectives are met.

Supervisory responsibilities (if applicable):
Additional position requirements:
Age Specific groups served: N/A

Physical Requirements (includes use of assistance devices as appropriate):
Physical Lifting less than 20 lbs.
Activities: Prolonged standing, Prolonged sitting
Mental/Sensory: Strong recall, Reasoning, Problem solving, Hearing, Speak clearly, Write legibly, Reading, Logical thinking
Emotional: Fast pace environment, Able to handle multiple priorities, Frequent and intense customer interaction, Able to adapt to frequent change

The Database Reporting Analyst will be assigned to the Virtual Care Institute at VCU Health and will be responsible for providing insight-driven, clinical, operational and financial analyses to enhance and inform decision-making across the enterprise and to assess the impact of virtual care delivery. The ideal candidate will be passionate about healthcare digital transformation and will demonstrate a curiosity to understand virtual care's impact on patients and providers as well as learners and researchers.

title: Business Intelligence Developer (Exempt)
description:
Benefis is one of Montana’s largest and premier health systems, and we are committed to providing excellent care for all, healing body, mind, and spirit. At Benefis, we work hard to support our employees in every aspect of their careers by offering outstanding benefits and compensation, state-of-the-art facilities, and multiple growth opportunities. The only thing missing is you!

Assesses, plans, configures, implements, maintains, and documents business intelligence applications. Creates, reviews, and distributes analytics content for end users and third-party applications which require EMR data. Applies basic knowledge of business intelligence (BI) implementation strategies, methodologies, enterprise database schemas, data sources, extraction/transformation/loading, dimensional modeling, data mining, predictive analysis, data quality, report development, and data visualization.
Demonstrates the ability to deal with pressure to meet deadlines, to be accurate, and to handle constantly changing situations. Demonstrates the ability to deal with a variety of people, deal with stressful situations, and handle conflict.
Will perform all job duties or job tasks as assigned. Will follow and adhere to all requirements, regulations and procedures of any licensing board or agency. Must comply with all Benefis Health System’s organization policies and procedures.
Education/License/Experience Requirements:
Two years’ experience in business intelligence or analytics role
Specific technical skills consistent with Benefis technical architecture preferred, including SQL Server and the Microsoft BI stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Power BI)
Must complete all required application course work and obtain applicable EMR certification within three months of assignment
Previous experience with primary healthcare EMR system vendor is preferred
Healthcare related experience preferred

title: Clinl Sys & Outcomes Analyst
description:
General Summary of Position
The Clinical Systems and Outcomes Analyst is responsible for data collection, data management, analysis and dissemination of hospital outcomes data; and, for reporting and analysis of healthcare information obtained from a variety of sources including clinical, administrative, financial and demographic data. Identifies relevant clinical and operational process measures from which to assess outcomes. Provides technical support and serves as an internal consultant to the Quality Resource & Regulatory Department. Develops and prepares data analytics to provide meaningful and actionable information.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Contributes to the strategic functions of the data and analytics team to include identification of data needs, planning, development and implementation of analytic processes. Serves as a mentor and contributes to the successful development of the Quality and Outcomes Department.
Is highly skilled in building, analyzing, and creating visualizations of outcomes data.
Conducts analysis of hospital data trends against benchmarks. Prepares oral, written and visual presentations of data.
Identifies systematic issues with data integrity, develops and proposes solutions. Collaborates with entity and system resources via active participation in project teams and user groups.
Serves as a resource to senior leadership and quality managers on metrics and results.
Participates in Regulatory Readiness and Patient Safety activities as assigned.
Analyzes new software and data management systems as requested.

Minimum Qualifications
Education
Bachelor's degree in health informatics, information science, or relevant field required
Master's degree in health informatics, information science, or relevant field preferred
Experience
1-2 years performing analysis of patient population and/or hospital operational data required
Strong experience with using Cerner, Tableau, SQL, Python and other statistical analyses software preferred
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Must be capable of exploring innovative solutions to solve data analytics problems through the use of existing or custom-developed tools.


This position has a hiring range of $70,428 - $131,310

title: Quant Analytics
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Duties: Develop business strategies using appropriate statistical methods, Profit & Loss criteria, capacity planning and optimization to achieve specific business targets, implement operational rules in an automated environment, and perform end to end monitoring and evaluation of business rule effectiveness. Perform statistical modeling including linear regression and correlation coefficient assists in driving cause and effect of different features and strategies. Design and develop Customer Authentication and Identity metrics and perform ongoing metric monitoring. Develop capabilities to proactively look for and identify attack vectors. Perform ad-hoc analysis to support ongoing management and product area business initiatives. Build and work in a controlled data access and usage environment. Participate in roadmap discussions and capture data requirements to feed into a data roadmap. Drive efficiencies by using data, reporting, and analysis to develop and recommend improvements in existing operational processes. Synthesize analytical findings and articulate analytical findings to enable senior leadership to make evidence-based decisions.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum education and experience required: Master's degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field of study plus 3 years of experience in the job offered or as Quant Analytics or related occupation. The employer will alternatively accept a Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field of study plus 5 years of experience in the job offered or as Quant Analytics or related occupation.
Skills Required: This position requires two (2) years of experience with the following: Univariate and multivariate analysis of at least 1 billion records per month; predictive modeling including linear regression, logistic regression, and classification trees; Using SAS to write macro scripts and automation scripts; using SAS in UNIX environment; Extracting and manipulating data from Oracle, Teradata, and Microsoft SQL server; Writing SQL scripts and connecting to databases from both Windows and Unix environments using SQL, Python and SAS; combining datasets using SAS Data step, Python script and SQL; Developing advanced data visualization and presentations including Tableau and Alteryx; Defining Customer Authentication and Identity metrics, evaluating results, and drawing conclusions and insights to design and recommend system or process improvements; defining and establishing controls to monitor controls exceptions, identifying these exceptions, and providing them to a product team for remediation.
Job Location: 8181 Communications Pkwy, Plano, TX 75024.

title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
About the Role:
PURE Insurance is hiring a Lead Data Analyst to help transform how we manage and deliver regulatory data calls and statistical reporting. This is a critical role within our growing Data and ML/AI department and offers a rare opportunity to build and scale a centralized and highly efficient reporting function. This role also offers the chance to help build out a modern data platform using tools like Databricks, dbt, GitHub, and Hex. You will collaborate with technical personnel across data architecture, data engineering, analytics engineering, and data science.
You will lead the analysis and delivery of hundreds of recurring and ad hoc regulatory data calls that span across policy, exposure, rating, and claims/loss data. This work is now being unified under a centralized team, where you’ll help streamline and automate key workflows, standardize reporting logic, and partner closely with Product, Actuarial, Underwriting, Claims, and Finance to ensure accurate, consistent, and reliable reporting.
We value resolve, curiosity, and thoughtful execution. Our leadership team understands that building strong foundations in Data and ML/AI takes time — and embraces the learning that comes from taking on ambitious challenges. Your voice matters here, and your contributions will have meaningful impact.
What You’ll Do
Lead the end-to-end execution of regulatory data calls and statistical reporting, including recurring (monthly/quarterly/annual) and ad hoc requests.
Analyze and join complex P&C insurance datasets (policy, exposure, rating, claims/loss) to produce accurate, audit-ready deliverables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams — including Data Engineering, Product, Actuarial, Underwriting, Claims, Finance, and Compliance — to define requirements and implement reporting solutions.
Build robust SQL queries and reporting templates that can be automated, scheduled, and scaled.
Contribute to the design and maintenance of modern data pipelines alongside data and analytics engineers.
Own the documentation and validation of key regulatory deliverables to ensure reproducibility & transparency.
Drive quality, consistency, and efficiency across the newly formed regulatory reporting function.
What We’re Looking For
3–5+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably with experience in Property & Casualty (P&C) insurance.
Strong working knowledge of insurance and actuarial KPIs, and comfort working with regulatory requirements and structured filings.
Expertise in SQL, and experience building reports or dashboards in Tableau, Power BI, Hex, or similar BI tools.
Clear and confident communicator who can work effectively across technical and business teams.
Experience documenting analytical processes, reviewing peers’ work, and supporting audits.
Bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, actuarial science, business analytics, or a related field.
Bonus Points For
Direct experience with DOI data calls, NAIC statistical reporting, or regulatory/market conduct filings.
Familiarity with dbt, Databricks, and Git-based workflows.
A track record of modernizing legacy reporting processes or building analytical systems from the ground up.
Location & Work Environment
This is a full-time, fully remote position. You can work from anywhere in the United States or choose to work from one of PURE Insurance’s office locations, including White Plains (NY), Warren (NJ), Chicago (IL), Boston (MA), Charleston (SC), Atlanta (GA), Fort Lauderdale (FL), Scottsdale (AZ), and San Diego (CA).
The base salary for this role can range from $120,000 to $140,000 based on a full-time work schedule. An individual’s ultimate compensation will vary depending on job-related skills and experience, geographic location, alignment with market data, and equity among other team members with comparable experience

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Overview:
The Business Intelligence Developer (BID) will analyze, provide specifications for, and write individual reports and data extracts for various applications across the organization. The incumbent is responsible for validating model/foundation reports and identifying advanced reporting needs for the organization, will create technical specifications and outputs for new requests, and will build using the appropriate methodology in the business intelligence stack.

Responsibilities:
1. Develop complex SQL queries against various data models. Collaborate with Business Intelligence Analysts to apply these solutions within the Epic Cogito framework and Power BI tool to deliver metrics and metric drill through for end users.
2. Validate Foundation System reports and identify advanced analytics needs with report consumers.
3. Determine data needs through collaboration with application analysts and requestors to understand their data needs.
4. Create design specifications for new reports.
5. Identify and validate appropriate technological solutions for various reporting needs.
6. Create new reports using a third-party report writing tool (such as Power BI). Modify existing reports as necessary.
7. Review peer reports for validity.
8. Test report build in a specified testing environment and volume testing in live environments.
9. Review upgrade documentation related to Clarity and Caboodle features and other released reporting content and determine how to implement the changes.
10. BIDs are also responsible for building including but not limited to Universes, SSAS Cubes, extracts, SlicerDicer, and reports to query the Caboodle Data Warehouse

Qualifications:
QUALIFICATIONS:
Must possess and maintain Epic certification in all applications in their area and other related areas within 3 months of training.

EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree in computer sciences, math or information systems required. Four or more years of relevant experience above the minimum required may be substituted for the degree requirement at the discretion of the Assistant Vice President, Digital Transformation.

EXPERIENCE:
Minimum five years of applicable experience required, to include at least one year of experience writing and troubleshooting SQL queries.

Minimum pay range: USD $82,048.10/Yr. Maximum pay range: USD $146,883.36/Yr.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Sony Electronics Inc. is looking for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. So, if you want to join a “Best Place to Work” company and make the world say wow, let's talk.
The Business Intelligence Analyst works with the business intelligence SNA Reporting team. The team is responsible for working closely with the business and technical teams and is a contributor to the definition and analysis of how information assets drive business outcomes and is responsible for the development and maintenance of business intelligence and reporting tools.
Responsibilities
This role will take on a portion of the above duties as well as maintaining the business intelligence and reporting tools, which will include enhancements to existing reports and structures with some development. Also, there will be daily monitoring, troubleshooting and user support of BI platform tools and interfaces; daily/weekly/monthly/annual - report creation, maintenance and other business support for running the business activities and support the business intelligence team in overall department support/request of running the applications, reports and platforms. Furthermore, this individual should be capable of working in a team and individual environment, be self-driven within the responsibilities of this role.

In addition to a competitive base salary, this position is also eligible for an annual corporate bonus plan, which is based on company performance and is not guaranteed, and a comprehensive benefits package including healthcare benefits (medical, dental, and vision), paid medical leave, a 401k plan with matching company contributions, vacation time, education assistance, student loan assistance program, eighty hours of paid sick leave time annually, and up to twelve weeks paid parental leave.

title: BI Engineer
description:
Position Summary:
GreenState's Information Technology department adheres to the corporate values and acts as a business partner who understands the needs of the business, enables business units to meet strategic objectives through technology, and provides employees and members with quality technology platforms that are always available, always relevant, and always scalable.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The BI Engineer is responsible for developing and maintaining advanced data solutions, especially in Power BI. This role focuses on understanding business needs and deploying efficient, consumable models for end users via Azure and the Power BI service. The BI Engineer will develop and maintain complex semantic models, create advanced DAX calculations, and collaborate with end users to deploy solutions optimized for performance, scalability and reusability.

GREENSTATE CULTURE:
At GreenState, we exist to create lasting value for those we serve. We do this by putting immense value into our employees, members and communities. We empower our employees to create endless opportunities, which will then impact the lives of our members and enhance the vitality of our communities.

Salary range for this position is $119,078.70 - $139,216.74 with a progressive benefit package.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Performs essential duties and responsibilities in the following areas which may include but are not limited to those listed and are subject to change.
Adheres to the Credit Union's core values and Service Standards in conducting GreenState's mission and vision.
Demonstrates a positive member service (internal and external) focus at all times.
Demonstrates teamwork in all interactions with coworkers and in the completion of all duties and responsibilities.
Ensures confidentiality of member information.
Supports a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Designs, implements and maintains enterprise-wide data models optimized for performance in Power BI
Creates advanced DAX calculations and measures to meet specific business requirements
Develops and maintains Power Query (M) transformations to shape data for optimal use
Collaborates with business stakeholders to translate requirements into effective BI solutions
Implements best practices for Power BI report and dashboard design
Optimizes Power BI reports and dashboards for performance and user experience
Supports the deployment and maintenance of Power BI content in the Power BI service
Assists in the development of documentation and training materials for end users
Stays current with Power BI features and best practices
Admins Power BI/Fabric capacity
Performs other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements/Expectations:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related field
4 to 6 years of experience in business intelligence, with a focus on Power BI
Advanced proficiency in:
Power BI Desktop and Power BI service
DAX (Data Analysis Expressions)
M (Power Query Formula Language)
SQL
Strong understanding of data modeling techniques specific to Power BI
Experience with Power BI Dataflows and Datasets
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills and ability to work with business stakeholders
Financial services industry experience preferred
Prefer experience with Azure Analysis Service
Familiarity with Power Apps and Power Automate a plus
Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics integration would provide an edge
Reporting Relationship: This position reports to the IT Director Data Services and Development. Supervisory Responsibilities: This position is not responsible for the supervision of others. title: Specialist, BI & Analytics
description:
If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.
Job Summary
As a Specialist BI & Analytics, you will be responsible for providing timely and actionable data-driven insights to maximize business performance and achieve exceptional results. This role will provide expertise in the following areas of the business:
Performance Reporting and Dashboarding to support the Retail portfolios
Critical deep-dive analytical support for optimizing customer lifecycle value
Mentor and guide junior analyst/s
Job Description
Key Accountabilities
Responsible for implementation of business intelligence initiatives; play a crucial role in identifying profitable growth opportunities and in optimizing portfolio performance
Own / Develop / Deliver dashboards, data models and other BI solutions by utilizing Python, SQL, or other programming languages for data analytics and Tableau, Excel, and PowerBI for data visualization
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to provide meaningful and actionable recommendations to support various business functions (Pricing, Portfolio Management, Finance, Marketing and Customer Experience channels)
Lead in-depth analysis of portfolio performance and uncover root causes for trends in channel gains, portfolio and customer lifecycle losses, transactional margin performance, portfolio and product mix outcomes, etc.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry best practices in BI
Provide thought leadership and mentorship to team-members, fostering a culture of continuous learning, innovation and collaboration
Education, Experience, & Skill Requirements
Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years (or Master's with 3+ years, or equivalent 8+ years) of professional experience in data analysis or a related field
Extensive experience in analyzing large volumes of data using Python, SQL, SAS, R or similar programming languages. Experience in working with data engineers to define business requirements and dealing with ambiguity
Experience using PowerBI or Tableau for data visualization. Exposure to GenBI and the ability to build it from the ground up
Web analytics experience with working knowledge of web analytics tools such as Adobe or Google Analytics
Experience in A/B Testing and statistical analysis
Solid understanding of financial modeling and investment analysis (ROI, CLV)
Strong analytical skills coupled with an ability to think strategically. Collaborative and able to work in cross-functional projects
Ability to derive insights from complex data for decision-making
Key Metrics
Proactive in terms of learning the business and designing valuable dashboards / ad-hoc data analyses
On-time production of analyses and results of the highest integrity and quality
Development of clear, concise, and effective executive-level reporting and presentations
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and deliver quality results, while managing a diverse range of projects
