title: Power BI Administrator / Developer
description:
Company Overview
Iridium is an award-winning and innovative satellite communications company with bragging rights to the only network that offers voice and data connectivity anywhere in the world. For over 20 years, Iridium’s unique network and services have supported critical communications needs for individuals, businesses, and the evolving Internet of Things.

At Iridium, we understand the importance of staying connected and the limitations of traditional communications networks. People across the globe, including first responders, humanitarians, global militaries, scientific researchers, and lone workers, as well as ships, aircraft and remote operations all rely on Iridium to stay connected. We take our responsibility for providing these essential communications very seriously and pride ourselves on offering a reliable lifeline when needed. Likewise, Iridium is committed to providing an exciting and innovative workplace, where employees are challenged to think outside the box and collaborate on new, bold ideas and solutions. Our talented teams are passionate about their work and the impact our company makes around the world. Iridium fosters an empowering and inclusive culture that allows employees to genuinely be their best selves. We are looking for others who want to join this truly unique company that celebrates our employees and provides the opportunity to truly make a difference in the world.
What We’re Looking For:
As the Power BI Administrator/Developer on our team, you’ll play a key role in shaping how our organization leverages data for decision-making. This position will own the administration of our Power BI environment, including managing user access, workspace structure, semantic model management and gateway configuration to ensure a secure, scalable, and high-performing BI platform.
Additionally, this position will collaborate with stakeholders to design and develop compelling dashboards and reports that transform complex data into meaningful insights. The Power BI Administrator will work with data analysts to apply principles of data storytelling and wireframing to craft intuitive, impactful visual experiences. You will thrive in this role if you have a technical background, creative mindset, and enjoy a fast-moving and collaborative atmosphere within in a modern cloud environment.
What You’ll Do:
Power BI Platform Administration: Manage and oversee the Power BI tenant and service settings, including administering workspaces, user access roles, and security configurations. This involves controlling who can access reports/datasets and structuring workspaces for teams or projects, in line with governance policies
On-Premises Data Gateway Management: Configure and maintain on-premises data gateways in conjunction with the AWS group to ensure secure connectivity between cloud Power BI reports and on-prem or AWS-hosted data sources. This includes monitoring gateway performance, adding data sources, clustering for high availability, and applying updates or patches
System Monitoring & Maintenance: Continuously monitor Power BI platform usage and performance, and perform regular maintenance (capacity planning, updates, and reboots) to keep the environment reliable and performant. This may involve tracking workspace usage, dataset refresh timings, and optimizing Premium capacity or cloud resources for efficiency
Security & Compliance: Enforce data security and compliance standards within Power BI. Manage user permissions and ensure that data access meets organizational policies and industry regulations. Responsibilities include auditing activity (using Power BI logs) and maintaining compliance with data privacy laws
Dashboard & Report Development: Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards, paginated reports, and data models according to best practices. This involves robust data modeling, writing DAX measures, and creating interactive visualizations that align with business requirements, style guide and core KPIs
Stakeholder Collaboration & Support: Work closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective BI solutions. Provide user support and training as needed, helping business users understand the dashboards and self-service tools. This can include creating documentation, conducting demo sessions, and ensuring user adoption of Power BI across the organization
What You’ll Need to Succeed:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology/Systems or related technology studies (e.g. certifications)
5+ years of proven experience in BI administration, business intelligence, or a similar role
Advanced proficiency with Power BI Desktop and Service, including strong skills in data modeling, Power Query (M), and DAX for complex calculations; Experience in developing rich dashboards and data visualizations, as well as knowledge of optimizing data models and report performance
In-depth knowledge of Power BI administration features and best practices – from tenant settings and capacity management to content governance (workspace setup, deployment pipelines, usage monitoring); Ability to configure security (both at the data level and the workspace/app level) and to use admin tools or REST APIs for automating admin tasks
Hands-on experience with the Power BI on-premises data gateway including experience in installing, configuring, and managing gateways to connect to on-prem databases or cloud VPCs.
Working knowledge of cloud platforms for AWS and Azure
Ability to use scripting languages and APIs to automate tasks and streamline workflows; SQL proficiency including CTEs and DDL for validation and to create data assets supporting the data products
Proficiency in PowerShell (or Python) for automating Power BI admin tasks, and experience using Power BI REST APIs or Power Platform (Power Automate) for deployments and integrations
Strong analytical thinking coupled with a sense of design for data presentation; Creativity and the ability to turn data into impactful visuals and narratives
Ability to be adept at choosing the right visualizations, designing intuitive layouts, and employing data storytelling techniques so that end users can easily interpret the insights
Excellent communication and teamwork skills to effectively communicate with peers, end users of all levels and engineers including collaboration on requirements, communicating technical constraints, training, documentation and requirements gathering
Be comfortable managing upward, including being a proactive communicator and asking for help when needed
Have confidence and be able to establish valuable relationships with others
Must be able to prioritize key tasks and have a strong sense of ownership over your work
Be active in seeking out ways to continuously improve yourself and gain new knowledge
Things That Would be Great if You Brought to the Table:
Experience deploying BI solutions in cloud environments and using cloud resources (for example, using Azure VNets or AWS VPCs for Power BI connectivity)
Experience in the telecommunications or related industries (e.g. utilities)
Familiarity with network setup (VPNs or virtual networks) to host gateways on cloud infrastructure (AWS or Azure)
PowerBI administration or development related certifications
Experience with automation, CICD or similar in BI operations
Experience with optimizing for large data volumes
Analytical engineering exposure or experience including developing marts and pipelines with tools like DBT
We’ll also need you to:
Be able to work in the office at least 3 or more days a week to foster collaboration with the team and stakeholders
Be able to travel occasionally, a few times a year
Work Environment:
This position primarily works in an office setting and is largely sedentary with the majority of the position working with a computer. The role typically requires the use of basic office equipment such as a phone, video, computer, keyboard, mouse, and printer.

Iridium is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

title: Enterprise Power BI Architect
description:
LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY
Location: Hybrid, 3 days in Boston (Tues – Thurs); no relocation
Manager Notes: This is a mid-senior level role that will lead the design and implementation of an enterprise-scale Power BI environment. The ideal candidate will be based in the Boston area and possess extensive hands-on experience in Power BI implementation, with a strong foundation in architecture. This role requires proven expertise in setting up Power BI Gateway, integrating with Snowflake, and developing scalable analytics solutions. Additional responsibilities include supporting SSO integration and enabling Power BI functionality on mobile platforms. The preferred candidate will have 5–7 years of relevant experience, preferably within the financial services industry, but not required. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with infrastructure teams are essential. Manager will not consider anyone who does not have experience implementing and scaling the project.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Planning and Building an Enterprise Power BI Environment.
1. Environment Planning and Design:
Architecting a scalable and secure Power BI environment that integrates seamlessly with the organization’s existing data ecosystem, including on-premises databases and Snowflake.
2. Configuration and Setup:
Configuring the Power BI Service to enable enterprise-wide collaboration, sharing, and governance.
Implementing and configuring Power BI Gateway to establish secure connections to on-premises data sources and Snowflake.
3. Governance and Security Framework:
Assist in defining governance policies for user roles, permissions, and data access.
4. Optimization and Monitoring:
Developing processes to monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize the Power BI environment for reliability and performance.
Ensuring scalability to meet future organizational needs.
QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Power BI Expertise:
Extensive experience with Power BI Service, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI Gateway in enterprise environments.
Ability to connect Power BI to on-premises databases and cloud platforms like Snowflake.
2. Enterprise Architecture Experience:
Proven track record of designing scalable and secure architectures for analytics platforms.
3. Governance and Security Knowledge:
Expertise in implementing data governance policies, user role management, and security protocols.
4. Performance Optimization:
Experience in monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimizing Power BI environments for large-scale usage.

title: Power BI Analyst
description:

title: BI Specialist – R01552781
description:
BI Specialist - R01552781
About Brillio:

Brillio is one of the fastest growing digital technology service providers and a partner of choice for many Fortune 1000 companies seeking to turn disruption into a competitive advantage through innovative digital adoption. Brillio, renowned for its world-class professionals, referred to as "Brillians", distinguishes itself through their capacity to seamlessly integrate cutting-edge digital and design thinking skills with an unwavering dedication to client satisfaction.
Brillio takes pride in its status as an employer of choice, consistently attracting the most exceptional and talented individuals due to its unwavering emphasis on contemporary, groundbreaking technologies, and exclusive digital projects. Brillio's relentless commitment to providing an exceptional experience to its Brillians and nurturing their full potential consistently garners them the Great Place to Work® certification year after year.

BI Specialist
Primary Skills
Power BI, Data Modeling, Snowflake
Job requirements
We are looking for a highly skilled and visionary Senior BI Developer to support and develop the modernization of our business intelligence ecosystem. This onsite role in Virginia Beach is ideal for a BI expert with a strategic mindset and strong technical acumen in Power BI and data modelling. You will play a key role in designing scalable analytics solutions, driving BI best practices, and mentoring junior developers as we transition from legacy platforms to modern, self-service BI tools.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the end-to-end design, development, and optimization of Power BI dashboards and data visualizations aligned with business goals.
Collaborate with key business units (e.g., Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain) to translate complex requirements into maintainable BI solutions.
Architect efficient, scalable data models using Snowflake and integrate them with the broader enterprise data architecture.
Partner with Data Engineers, Architects, and Platform teams to ensure alignment of BI solutions with data infrastructure and pipelines.
Drive the migration from legacy BI tools (e.g., Solver) to Power BI, ensuring seamless transitions and minimal disruption.
Lead initiatives around BI governance, report rationalization, performance tuning, and standardization across departments.
Mentor junior BI developers, reviewing design approaches and ensuring high standards in code quality and project execution.
Qualifications:
8+ years of hands-on experience in BI development, with deep expertise in Power BI and advanced data visualization techniques.
Strong SQL skills and expertise in dimensional data modeling, especially in large-scale, complex data environments.
Experience with Snowflake or other modern cloud data platforms (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery, Azure Synapse).
Proven track record of leading cross-functional BI initiatives, including stakeholder engagement and delivery management.
Deep understanding of BI governance, metadata management, and performance optimization best practices.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to bridge the gap between business and technical teams.

title: BI Developer
description:
Location: Wentzville MO, 63385

Join Our Team as a BI Developer at etrailer.com
etrailer.com is seeking a talented and driven Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join our
growing team. This full-time role is based at our Wentzville, MO headquarters and comes
with a competitive benefits package. We offer flexible hours and hybrid work options, giving
you the best of both in-office collaboration and remote flexibility.
As a key contributor to our Business Insights team, you’ll help turn raw data into actionable
intelligence that drives smarter decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal
for someone with a strong analytical mindset, a curious nature, and a passion for solving
problems and uncovering patterns in data.
What you’ll do:
Accurately collect, model, and manage data for a variety of business reports

meaningful insight

Work cross-functionally with departments to understand goals and provide
analytical support
Translate complex data into clear, understandable stories that inform business
strategies

similar

priorities

across departments

title: Software Engineer – Data Warehouse & BI Development (SQL/Power BI)
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

We're looking for a Software Engineer specializing in SQL Data Warehouse Development and Power BI to join our team in building Delta Dental's Next Gen Applications & Products Suite-with a strong focus on scalable, data-driven solutions using Power BI and Snowflake. In this role, you'll design, develop, and maintain structured datasets, apply ETL processes, and create efficient Power BI data models, including calculated columns and measures. Your work will directly support user-friendly, visually impactful dashboards and reports optimized for performance and accuracy.

This is a highly collaborative role where you'll partner with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to deliver innovative, insight-driven solutions that support strategic decision-making.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Performs as a key contributor in building and supporting innovative data solutions, including the development, support, and optimization of Power BI reporting platforms to address complex business use cases.
Participates in architectural design and system analysis activities within SQL-based data warehousing and Power BI environments.
Develops high-quality, production-ready Power BI data models using best-practice data structures, design patterns, and frameworks.
Writes high-quality code, building secure and performant datasets and Power BI solutions from conception through production support.
Produces clear and readable technical documentation for developed Power BI reporting solutions, ensuring thorough documentation practices.
Tests and ensures quality of all deliverables utilizing test-driven development and quality practices within SQL and Power BI environments.
Assists in executing business intelligence initiatives to transition reporting from legacy platforms to Power BI.
Supports other Engineers through evaluation, design analysis, and integration efforts, aligning Power BI solutions with business requirements.
Maintains knowledge and promotes compliance with policies and procedures, serving as a technical expert across Power BI governance, data access management, and self-service enablement.
This list is not all-inclusive, and other duties may be assigned as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years of relevant professional experience with hands-on SQL dataset development, data modeling, and Power BI; 4+ years of experience with business intelligence solutions and Power BI development preferred.
BS in Computer Science or equivalent technical field or relevant work experience preferred; equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
Experience designing and developing secure datasets and data reporting solutions.
Demonstrated proficiency in building structured datasets, applying ETL processes, and developing data models in Power BI.
Experience with Snowflake or other SQL-based data warehouse technologies preferred.
Microsoft certifications related to Power BI preferred but not required.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ability to clearly identify and present technical alternatives across SQL data warehousing and Power BI development projects.
Ability to create and maintain detailed documentation supporting development, deployment, governance, and maintenance of Power BI solutions.
Proven ability to present data effectively, facilitating clear understanding of findings and technical recommendations.
Strong problem-solving skills using analytical approaches for dataset design, data modeling, and reporting.
Knowledge of prevailing data warehousing and business intelligence best practices and design patterns.
Detail-oriented, capable of managing multiple priorities in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with agile methodologies and their application to business intelligence and data warehouse development.

Base Pay Information

The national base pay range at the end is a good-faith estimate of what Delta Dental may pay for new hires. Actual pay may vary based on Delta Dental's assessment of the candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities (KSAs), related experience, education, certifications and ability to meet required minimum job qualifications. Other factors impacting pay include prevailing wages in the work location and internal equity.
Pay Grade 21. $80,500 - $174,300

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Behind the smile! We are dedicated to safeguarding the health and financial stability of our employees and their loved ones. This commitment extends beyond the workplace to foster personal growth and holistic wellbeing. Our life-changing rewards package includes:


Competitive base and incentive pay
401(k) with robust matching and non-matching contributions
Rich medical & pharmacy benefits
100% employer-paid dental and vision benefits
Holistic wellbeing program with deep financial incentives
Generous paid time off plus 12 paid holidays and your birthday off
Culture of growth and learning: career development; tuition reimbursement; recognition program
Family support: adoption assistance, fertility treatment, child, elder & pet care assistance
Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities
Employee discount program

Fair Chance Ordinances and Criminal Background Considerations

This position requires that the applicant undergo a background check. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with any applicable federal, state or local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and/or New York Corrections Law Article 23-A.

Important Work Authorization Information

Please note, Delta Dental will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

ABOUT THE TEAM

At Delta Dental, we're behind millions of smiles and counting. For over 68 years, we've served our communities by increasing access to affordable, quality care - but that commitment to care extends beyond the people we serve, to the dedicated employees who make those smiles genuine. We've come this far by building fair programs that offer opportunities for advancement, create meaningful connections and improve the lives of our employees and their families. Because we know that when we take exceptional care of each other, we can make a positive impact for all.

We champion an inspirational workplace through our commitment to trust, service, excellence and innovation. Joining us means working for a company that offers stability and balance, opportunities for leadership at all levels, and a work environment focused on teamwork and camaraderie.

Discover the smiling faces behind Delta Dental and experience our values and culture in action by connecting with us on social media. Follow Delta Dental Ins. on Facebook and Instagram, #LifeatDDins on Facebook and Instagram, Delta Dental Ins. on Twitter and Delta Dental Ins. on LinkedIn. If you've got an appetite for innovation and want to be a part of a team that's transforming the future of health care, join us!

Since 1955, we have offered comprehensive, high-quality oral health care benefits to millions of enrollees and built the strongest network of dental providers in the country. The Delta Dental of California network includes affiliates Delta Dental Insurance Company; Delta Dental of Pennsylvania; Delta Dental of New York, Inc.; Delta Dental of the District of Columbia; Delta Dental of Delaware, Inc.; and Delta Dental of West Virginia, providing dental benefits to more than 31 million people across 15 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

The company and its affiliates are part of Delta Dental Plans Association (DDPA), a not-for-profit national association based in Oak Brook, Illinois. Through our national network of Delta Dental companies, we offer dental coverage in all 50 states, Puerto Rico and other U.S. territories. We offer vision coverage through DeltaVision in 15 states and the District of Columbia. Collectively, we deliver benefits to more Americans than any other dental insurance company.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Collins Community Credit Union, a growing organization, is currently hiring a Power BI Developer onsite at our headquarters in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.
We're seeking a motivated individual to join our Technology and Data team. This role is responsible for working closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable dashboards and reports using Microsoft Power BI.
Essential Functions:
Demonstrate enthusiastic support of corporate mission, core values and long-term objectives. Performs duties within our bylaws, regulations, Board of Directors policies, established internal and external service standards and our work procedures.
Design, develop, and deploy Power BI reports and dashboards based on business requirements.
Connect to data sources, import data, and transform data for BI solutions using Power Query (M) and DAX.
Collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, and other stakeholders to understand data needs.
Optimize dashboard performance and ensure best practices in report design and usability.
Maintain and update existing BI solutions as business needs evolve.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Implement row-level security and data governance as required.
Stay updated on Power BI features and roadmap to introduce new functionalities
Job Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
2–5 years of experience in Power BI development or business intelligence roles.
Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases.
Experience with data warehouses, ETL processes, and cloud platforms like Azure or AWS is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Good communication and interpersonal abilities.
Collins Community CU is dedicated to teaching you skills to make you successful! We are focused on giving you a strong network of support, professional development, and career advancement opportunities, all of this we offer because we are dedicated to your success.

We live our Core Values with Purpose and believe putting our employees first will enable and embolden them to put our membership first.

title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Headquartered in New York City with offices throughout the U.S. and in Vancouver, Canada, Hudson is a market-leading specialty insurer that offers a wide range of property and casualty insurance products to corporations, professional firms and individuals through retailers, wholesalers and program administrators.
Hudson underwrites specialty primary and excess insurance on an admitted basis through Hudson Insurance Company and on a non-admitted basis through Hudson Specialty Insurance Company and Hudson Excess Insurance Company. Hudson Insurance Company is admitted in all U.S. jurisdictions. Hudson has surplus lines eligibility in all U.S. jurisdictions through Hudson Specialty Insurance Company and Hudson Excess Insurance Company.
Collectively known as Hudson Insurance Group, its companies are rated A+ (Superior) by A.M. Best, Financial Size Category XV. Hudson Insurance Group is the U.S. Insurance Division of OdysseyRe, a leading worldwide underwriter of reinsurance and specialty insurance and wholly-owned by Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited.

Position Summary:
The Junior Business Intelligence Analyst will be a motivated self-starter, joining a high-performing, highly-visible, cross functional team of BI Analysts and SQL developers. Operating in a fast-paced environment, they will have the ability to make a substantial impact on day-today operations and strategic initiatives. Operating across multiple disciplines, they will play a role in projects directly for the executive team and senior leaders and will gain exposure to a variety of business units, systems, and processes. In addition, they will be responsible for helping complete all Statistical and Surplus lines reporting and will be expected to oversee/guide other team members to facilitate project completion.

Essential Duties
Contribute to meetings with the business users and stakeholders to determine scope, requirements and proposes solutions
Analyzes and converts business requirements to technical requirements, designs and implements solutions, and works with report developers on the team to deliver information in the most effective way
Turns data into actionable insights for stakeholders
Will receive exposure to existing SQL (e.g. stored procs, functions, scripts) and learn to make simple modifications
Contribute to a high functioning team completing ad-hoc tasks for multiple departments and levels of leadership

Qualifications:
Beginner knowledge of excel (Vlookups, Basic Formulas)
Any level of exposure to PowerBi designing dashboard visualizations, building semantic layers, writing Dax/M Code or Tableau is a plus.
Resourceful and appetite to become a strong problem-solver
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities and timelines
Strong inter-personal and communication skills with a high level of engagement
Displays strong work ethic and motivation to consistently improve processes

Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics or other Business practices, computer science, information technology, math, statistics, or data science preferred
Prior work or internship experience is a plus, but not required

Office Requirements
This role offers a hybrid work schedule. Candidate is required to attend New York City office at least 3 times a week.
In New York City, NY the pay range for this role is 70,000-95,000. This role may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program. The specific offer will depend on an applicant’s skills and other factors. This range is specific to New York City, NY and may not be applicable to other locations.

#Hudson

title: Analyst II - Power BI
description:
Remote, but successful candidate MUST live within a state in which Point Broadband Operates (AL, FL, GA, MD, MI, NY, OH, TN, TX, and VA) #LI-remote

Summary:
We are looking for an experienced Analyst II with deep skills in Power BI and a strong analytical mindset to support key business functions in the telecommunications domain. You will develop dynamic dashboards, deliver insights from large telecom datasets, and support teams in areas such as customer retention, network quality, and revenue optimization.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

Design and maintain Power BI dashboards and visualizations to support telecom use cases, including:
Customer churn analysis
ARPU (Average Revenue Per User) tracking
Network performance monitoring (e.g., dropped calls, latency)
Customer segmentation and usage patterns
Gather requirements from stakeholders across marketing, operations, and engineering
Create data models and implement DAX calculations to reflect complex business logic and KPIs
Work with cross-functional teams to define and validate data sources such as Call Detail Records (CDRs), CRM data, billing systems, and network logs.
Ensure data consistency, accuracy, and performance across reporting tools.
Provide support for ad-hoc analyses to answer key business questions.
Automate reports and build scalable BI solutions that reduce manual effort.
Deliver actionable insights through storytelling and clear data visualizations.
Document data definitions, business rules, and reporting standards.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or relevant work experience.
2–4 years of experience in a business/data analyst or BI role—preferably in the telecommunications industry.
Strong expertise in Power BI (data modeling, Power Query, DAX).
Proficiency in SQL and experience querying large relational databases.
Solid understanding of telecom KPIs such as churn, ARPU, network performance metrics, and subscriber usage behavior.
Ability to work with large, complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with telecom-specific data (e.g., CDRs, OSS/BSS systems, CRM platforms).
Familiarity with Azure Synapse, Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps), or SSAS.
Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics is a plus.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and performance bonuses
Comprehensive benefits including healthcare and retirement
Exposure to cutting-edge telecom analytics use cases
Career growth and training opportunities
A collaborative, data-first culture
Physical Demands/Working Conditions:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Regularly required to talk, hear, and communicate effectively.
Frequently required to sit, stand, bend at the knees and waist, and walk.
Required to use hands to type, handle objects and paperwork.
Required to reach and hold on to items at chest level or reach above the shoulder.

title: ETL Reporting Lead Administrator
description:
Role: ETL Reporting Lead Administrator
Location: Houston, TX (Hybrid)
Who are we looking for?
We are looking for 8+ years of ETL Reporting Administrator experience in PowerBI /Tableau/Cognos/ MicroStrategy/Sigma/QlikView ETL reporting Tools. Administrator is a key figure within an organization responsible for overseeing and managing the Tableau environment, ensuring its smooth operation, security, and optimal performance. Overall responsible for the overall management, maintenance, and support of an IBM Cognos Business Intelligence (BI) environment. This role ensures that businesses can effectively utilize Cognos software for reporting, analytics, and forecasting by providing seamless operation and high availability of the BI infrastructure. Ensuring the optimal performance, security, and availability of QlikView applications and data.
Technical Skills & Responsibilities:
Strong knowledge of PowerBI /Tableau/Cognos/ MicroStrategy/Sigma/QlikView including its architecture and administration.
Power BI Administrator is responsible for managing, maintaining, and optimizing an organization's Power BI environment, encompassing configuration, security, performance, and user support
Overseeing the Power BI platform, including its configuration, security, and overall health
Managing user roles, permissions, and licenses within the Power BI service to ensure appropriate access and compliance.
Connecting to and managing data sources, ensuring data quality, and implementing data governance policies.
Monitoring the performance of reports, dashboards, and datasets, and optimizing them for efficiency. This also includes capacity planning for Power BI Premium
Installing, configuring, and maintaining Power BI gateways and ensuring seamless data flow.
Providing technical assistance to end-users, debugging issues, and resolving problems related to Power BI solutions.
Creating documentation for Power BI processes and providing training to users on its administration and usage.
Working with business teams, developers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver effective Power BI solutions.
Proficiency in Power BI administration tasks and the Power BI Service.
Strong understanding of data modeling, DAX queries, and data visualization best practices.
Experience with data sources like SQL, Azure services, and APIs.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Azure DevOps is often beneficial
Administration & Support: Administering and supporting the IBM Cognos BI environment, including server management and network tasks.
Installation & Configuration: Installing, configuring, and upgrading Cognos software. This includes setting up database connections and configuring the environment for optimal performance.
Performance Monitoring & Tuning: Monitoring system performance, troubleshooting issues, and implementing solutions to ensure smooth operation. This may involve performance tuning, optimizing reports, and managing server components.
Security & Access Management: Implementing security measures, managing user access permissions, and ensuring compliance with data governance policies. This includes defining security for packages, folders, and reports.
Data Modeling & Reporting: Collaborating with business units to understand reporting requirements and implement/maintain data models and reporting standards. This includes working with Framework Manager for data modeling and package creation.
Troubleshooting & Problem Solving: Proactively finding and fixing potential security vulnerabilities and technical issues related to the Cognos environment.
Documentation & Training: Creating technical documents, documenting system setups and best practices, and providing training and support to end-users.
Installation, configuration, and maintenance of QlikView Server and Publisher components.
Monitoring server performance, capacity, and resource utilization.
Troubleshooting and resolving server-related issues.
Managing server logs and backups.
Collaborating with the infrastructure team on patch and bug fix deployments.
Managing and coordinating the deployment and publishing of QlikView applications.
Scheduling and monitoring data reloads for QlikView documents.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with document reloads and application performance.
Managing application and server licenses.
Implementing and managing QlikView security, including user access and permissions.
Managing user access credentials and connectivity to all source systems.
Handling data integration and ETL processes.
Ensuring data accuracy and integrity within the QlikView environment.
Providing support and guidance to users and developers.
Creating and maintaining administrative documentation.
Staying updated on the latest QlikView and other BI technologies.
Participating in the overall architecture and strategy for the deployment of Qlik suite of products
Install, configure, and maintain MicroStrategy environments across development, QA, and production, including monitoring system performance and implementing proactive optimization.
Manage user accounts, roles, and permissions, ensuring compliance with security policies and providing access to data.
Conduct performance testing and troubleshooting for reports, dashboards, and the overall MicroStrategy infrastructure, including SQL query optimization and VLDB properties.
Address incidents and troubleshoot issues related to server outages, project accessibility, and reporting problems, providing support to both internal and external clients.
Implement backup and disaster recovery plans, perform version upgrades, patches, and hotfixes, and maintain system documentation and logs.
Maintain correct data source availability, develop and maintain schema objects, and monitor Intelligent Cubes and caches
Automate routine administrative tasks using scripts or MicroStrategy tools.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell for automation.
Familiarity with IT systems, infrastructure, and security methodologies.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in a 24/7 support rotation and handle urgent production issues.

Pay: $50.00 - $52.00 per hour

8 hour shift
Day shift

title: Data Analyst
description:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.
Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.
American Express engages with thousands of third parties to provide goods and services. To ensure we protect our brand, avoid financial impact and adhere to various laws and regulations, all high-risk third parties are subject to risk management throughout the third-party lifecycle.
The GSM Third-Party Center of Excellence (COE) Reporting & Analytics team is responsible for the data management, transformation, analysis, and visualization of insights in support of the third-party management program. This team produces reporting and analytics for various stakeholders including the Third-Party COE, AXP Business Units, Management Committees and Risk Subject Matter Experts.
Our Third-Party COE Reporting & Analytics team not only understands how process, technology and systems work, but how the information is used to generate valuable and actionable insights for our program stakeholders. So, if you’re interested in a career in analytics, machine learning and data strategy, creating breakthrough analytical products and making an impact on our internal customers and third parties, look no further.
How will you make an impact in this role?
In this role as Data Analyst, the successful candidate will be responsible for understanding analytical requirements, data transformation, applying statistical tools and ML applications and data visualization for the Third-Party COE. The candidate will drive success of the analytical reports by working closely with program stakeholders, maintaining a strong project management framework, developing transformation logic, and providing value-added reporting.
Drive Analytical capabilities in support of GSM and AXP Business Units
Analyze the existing environment and derive opportunities, recommend alternative solutions to technical problems.
Deliver high quality and accurate results in a timely manner.
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic models and systems.
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.
Propose and implement solutions to ad-hoc business problems, working independently to leverage data, drive insights, and presenting results in a clear and concise manner.
Predictive Analysis and visualization
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods.
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance
Meticulous attention to details while preserving the goal and timeframe of end products
Translate requirements into concepts and user experience design – associate with stakeholders/ business partners to enhance design suggestions.
Drive Data strategy initiatives
Minimum Qualifications
2+ years of experience in analytics.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree relevant to the industry (other credentials will be a plus)
Strong analytical bend and experience on analytics tools in Excel, Tableau, SQL, Alteryx etc.
Proficiency in dealing with large quantities of complex data and ability to derive actionable insights.
Strong communication and relationship building skills.
Prior project management experience, with proven ability to create powerful analytics and reporting is a must.
Proven strong performance behavior in previous role.
Excellent Visual Design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction – experience in developing reporting solutions towards complex multi-paneled, interactive dashboards.
Preferred Qualifications
Third-party risk reporting knowledge would be preferred.
Ability to communicate complex ideas in a simple manner to a global audience.
Independent and self-motivated, capable of executing under uncertainty with multiple priorities, in a fast-paced environment.
Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally:
Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities
For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. American Express will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For positions covered by federal and/or state banking regulations, American Express will comply with such regulations as it relates to the consideration of applicants with criminal convictions.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Business Central, Microsoft 365 & Power BI Analyst
description:
Business Central, Microsoft 365 & Power BI Analyst - Remote
Compensation: $95,000 - $120,000/Annually
ABOUT THE POSITION
Elevated Industrial Solutions is looking for a Business Central & Power BI Analyst to support and enhance our use of Microsoft Dynamics 365, Business Central and Power BI. This role will bridge the gap between operations, finance, and external partners, helping us get the most out of our ERP data through reporting, automation, and process improvements. We’re seeking someone who’s comfortable digging into data, understands business processes, and can build meaningful reports that support smart decision-making across the company. This position is remote and will report to the Vice President of Operations.
WHAT YOU’LL DO IN THIS ROLE
ERP Support & Development
Serve as the primary point of contact for Business Central user support, troubleshooting, and configuration Insurance, employee costs, almost 100% paid by employer contribution.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Goldberg Segalla, a dynamic and collaborative law firm with a national presence, seeks a highly motivated and organized individual to join its team as a Power BI Developer in its Buffalo, NY office. The Power BI Developer will be responsible for maintaining the existing portfolio of reports and dashboards as well as developing new work as requested, producing excellent results using both SSRS and SSIS as necessary. Development :

This position also offers bonuses, and a full benefits package. Our benefits package includes, but is not limited to, health insurance, dental insurance, life insurance, a 401(k) plan, flexible spending, and more.

Goldberg Segalla isn’t merely a business—we’re a community. We value the diversity of our team and strive to create a collaborative and enjoyable culture for everyone, where leadership is rewarded, and efficiency, mutual respect, and working together for the common good are traits we all embody.

Goldberg Segalla is a national civil litigation firm with offices spanning major metro markets across the U.S., providing strategic coverage wherever our clients do business. As a firm of experienced litigators and trial attorneys, Goldberg Segalla's capabilities span business and commercial disputes, employment and labor, insurance coverage, product liability, and more. Today, our more than 400 attorneys are trusted counselors to public and private clients in key sectors and industries including construction and energy, transportation, manufacturing, retail and hospitality, and insurance.

title: Reporting BI Developer
description:
Compensation: $85,000 to $105,000 annually
POSITION SUMMARY
Cardone Ventures is seeking a data-driven and analytical Reporting & BI Developer to join our fast-growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining dynamic dashboards, data visualizations, and automated reporting solutions that provide critical insights to stakeholders across the organization. You will work closely with business leaders and data teams to turn complex data sets into clear, actionable intelligence that drives strategic decisions.
ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES
Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.

SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE
Accurate and timely reports and dashboards that empower data-driven decision-making
Streamlined, automated reporting processes that reduce manual data work
High adoption and satisfaction from internal teams using BI tools
Clear and actionable data stories that align with business objectives
Consistently clean, reliable, and well-documented data models and visualizations

OBJECTIVES
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into reporting solutions
Automate and optimize existing reporting workflows for scalability and efficiency
Integrate data from multiple sources (CRM, financial, operational) into cohesive reports
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability across all reporting platform
Continuously monitor performance of BI solutions and recommend improvements
Support ad-hoc data analysis and deliver insights to cross-functional teams

COMPETENCIES
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases
Understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Ability to interpret complex data sets and present findings in a clear and concise manner
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across departments
Familiarity with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and cloud platforms (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift)
Experience integrating and analyzing data from CRM and financial systems

EDUCATION
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
3–5 years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or reporting roles
Relevant certifications in BI platforms or data analysis tools are a plus

10X TOTAL REWARDS
We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time employees that includes:
Medical, dental, and vision for FT positions and their dependents
Vacation and sick time policy that increases based on tenure with the company
Three work from home days per month (4/month during June-August)
Employee Assistance Program through Guardian
401k with up to 3% Company match
Pet Insurance through SPOT for your 10X pets!
Competitive parental leave policy: 100% paid - 8 weeks for primary caregiver, and 4 weeks for secondary caregiver + 1 month remote for both
Employee wellness initiatives including a 100% paid for gym membership and access to discounts on local meal prep services
Professional Development through reimbursements for courses/certifications outside of CV, and a 10X Mentorship Program
Continued Education: we provide team members complete access to our range of educational resources valued at over $250,000 in areas such as Sales, Operations, People, Finance and Marketing
Uncapped Commission Potential: all of our team members have the opportunity to sell our Products/Services (and are trained on how to do so). We have several examples of non-sales team members earning well over $20,000 in annual commission

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.
Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Company Description

At i360technologies, we’re invested in your success.
We offer competitive pay, robust benefits for full-time employees, and meaningful opportunities for professional development—just a few of the reasons why i360 is a great place to grow your career.

Founded in 1999, i360technologies is a fast-growing GOVCON professional services firm. We’re seeking motivated individuals who thrive in a dynamic environment and bring strategic problem-solving skills, a strong work ethic, and a positive, team-first attitude.

If you’re passionate about solving complex business challenges, technology implementation and are motivated to learn new technologies, you’ll find a home here.

Job Description

There are two task areas: 1) Report development; 2) Report Maintenance
Report development involves the following:
Identifying required data and its relationships within the enterprise system.
Note: The enterprise system will usually be related to Oracle Federal Financials, Azure-based .net developed systems, or the EFI Pace production management system. These enterprise systems will either have an Oracle database or a SQL Server database backend.
Once the data is known, the process of establishing and synchronizing data feeds to the Synapse Data Lake will be coordinated with the enterprise service bus team. If the data already exists within the Data Lake, then adding the fields to the semantic model will be done in Power Bl.
Once the semantic model is available, report development can be coordinated iteratively with the business unit staff until it is accepted and pushed to production.
Ad hoc Development: Business Units can and will request specific reports to suit their business needs, whether for reporting to upper management or producing reports for auditors. These could be enhancements or modifications of a previously developed report, or they could be something entirely new. These requests could come at any time during the contract year.
New report development will be done in Power BI, a cloud-based offering with application and infrastructure support provided by Microsoft.
Support work is currently underway to establish additional reports in Power BI, continuing the efforts to move away from Business Objects.

Qualifications
General report development using Power BI (Azure Synapse).
Knowledge of Business Objects is preferred but not required.
Must possess in-depth experience and understanding of Microsoft Azure Synapse, Microsoft Power BI report development and maintenance.
Five years or more of experience on projects that are similar to the requirements (reports development and maintenance)

Additional Information

Benefits
Referral Bonus
(401k) Matching
Eleven Paid Holidays
Adoption Assistance
Tuition Reimbursement
Technology Reimbursement
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Paid Time Off (0-3 years: 15 Days | 3+ years 20 Days)
Perks at Work – Employee perks program to help you live a better, healthier life.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or status within any other protected group.
Only Direct Hires - No recruiting or staffing firms’ submissions will be considered.

title: Data Analyst
description:

This role reports directly to the IT Director and will collaborate with key internal teams. The position is distinctly operational, ensuring focus remains on actionable insights within the company’s data framework.

Proficiency with data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Power BI) and a strong understanding of data visualization principles.

Thrives in environments with clearly defined expectations and workflows.

Exhibits strong analytical thinking and the ability to translate data into meaningful insights without deviation from existing structures.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a Sr. Power BI Developer to join our team! As a Sr. Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for responsible for transforming raw data into insightful and actionable reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI. This role works closely with technical teams to enhance data analytics and business intelligence strategies, with moderate autonomy in decision-making and minimal supervision, adhering to established processes. title: Power BI Developer/Analyst
description:
JOB SUMMARY
Monday - Friday 8AM - 5PM
The Business Intelligence Architect is responsible for the design, development, implementation, and support of business analytics reports and dashboards. The Business Intelligence Architect is responsible for providing timely and accurate business information, via various reporting solutions, based upon metrics, sales and financial information. This will empower Group CBS employees to more easily make data-driven management decisions. The position will be responsible for generating and delivering reports and data analysis reviews. This work requires a solid understanding of Group CBS business processes, existing reports, and BI tools. The position involves technically rigorous work, including the use of data analysis technologies.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: May be modified from time to time. Other duties may be assigned.
Develop, test, and deploy complex reports using business intelligence technologies.
Work with the user community to ascertain reporting requirements and then develop proper methods for extracting and displaying the data to the user in the form of reports or dashboards, identifying gaps in customer requirements and developing innovative solutions.
Required to test and ensure accuracy of various Group CBS reporting data points identifying and possibly combining/reducing redundant data sources
Maintain deep knowledge of Group CBS products and databases and reporting technologies.
Required to gain specialized knowledge of current procedures and facilitate the definition of report requirements.
Identify data sources and the appropriate data fields to use for reporting needs.
Collaborating with end users to identify needs and opportunities for improved data management and delivery.
Design, develop and implement a wide array of standardized and ad hoc reports from various reporting platforms such as BI, SalesForce, NetSuite, ADP.
Serve as a liaison to the leadership team for reporting requests and data analytics.
Demonstrate knowledge of BI and data warehousing
Gain a high-level understanding of Group CBS operational functions (i.e. sales order processing, purchasing, inventory management, shipping, and accounting) and the related software interaction.
Other tasks may also be required from time to time, at the discretion of management, in order to achieve department and company objectives.

METRICS
Business Intelligence Architects are required to complete reports & development commitments and are expected to conduct requirements analysis and presentation design of data quality. They will be measured by the quality of their work and on how effectively they accomplish their tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS
It is essential that a candidate possesses or can quickly acquire the necessary knowledge of the following systems which are crucial to the business:
Windows
Microsoft Office
Excel proficiency
MS SQL Server
Halo BI
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
MS Visual Studio
Data warehousing
Data Mining (plus)

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS REQUIRED
Ability to multi-task
Ability to work at fast pace
Attention to detail
Ability to solve complex problems
Ability to quickly learn and apply new technical
Ability to make and keep commitments to the team
Ability to work effectively with little or no supervision
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Interpersonal skills are a must
Sensitive to user needs

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
AS, AAS, BS or equivalent degree in Business or Management of Information Systems (MIS) with 3 to 5 years related experience and/or training.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Overview:
i3 is searching for a Power BI Developer to support the Missile Defense Agency Information Management and Software Services (AIMSS) effort. The mission is to design and implement a Missile Defense System with multiple layers of protection. The Power BI Developer is responsible for the design, development, testing, verifying, sustaining and fully documenting developed software. This position is located at Redstone Arsenal in Huntsville, AL.
Responsibilities:
Design and build BI dashboards and reporting solutions from the ground up, focusing on impactful insights and user-friendly experiences.
Maintain detailed technical documentation and create release notes for new features.
Monitor technological updates and emerging products. Provide recommendations for BI enhancement roadmap.
Support partners around the business through feedback and coaching as they adopt and integrate with our BI products.
Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, align priorities, and ensure reporting solutions meet business needs
Develops complex software applications involving graphical front-end interfaces, visualization toolsets, SQL Database interfaces, multi-user GUI interfaces, and rule base assessments.
Works with application Product Owner to decompose Use Case entities into implemental software requirements.
Performs software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software reviews, software risk analysis, and software reliability analysis.
Performs analysis on new software developments and revisions to existing systems to enhance system efficiencies.
Responsible for software testing and user/system requirements verification/validation processes and procedures.
Troubleshoots production problems related to deployment of software applications.
Evaluates implemented requirements in software to determine if these requirements were met in deliverable software.
Assists in the evaluation and recommendation of application integration and testing tools.
Participates in development of software user manuals and technical reports.
Works with project leads, developers, and end users to ensure application designs meet business requirements.
Understands MDA test processes related to data management, scheduling, planning and commitments across all types of tests.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related technical field. Additional experience may substitute for degree.
Minimum 10-14 years of relevant experience.
Working knowledge of current systems and applications.
Practical experience with data modeling, data design, database programming and data analytics.
Knowledge of database systems, as well as exposure to ETL software tools including best practices and methodologies.
Knowledge and/or experience in:
Translating data into informative visuals and reports.
Technical change management when it applies to business data that is under data governance.
Data and data domains.
Experience in data warehouse implementations.
Active Secret clearance required. Must be able to maintain the security clearance required for this position.
Approved DoD 8140 certification.
Must reside within a 50-mile radius of Redstone Arsenal in Huntsville AL or be willing to relocate prior to start date.
Ability to reliably commute to the office as business needs dictate.
U.S. Citizenship.
Knowledge/Skills
Knowledge of office administration and procedures.
Exceptional judgment capabilities and relationship management skills.
Excellent communication, teamwork, and client service skills; ability to clearly communicate in discussions and written documents, and to deliver feedback clearly and tactfully.
Interact with a diverse array of customers and staff in a professional and courteous manner.
Work independently with accountability for accurate and complete results.
Be extremely organized and exceptionally detail oriented.
Work well both independently and in a team environment.
Be energized by a fast-paced work environment.
Must be able to communicate with others effectively.
Analyze information and respond appropriately.
Manage time wisely and prioritize tasks.
Provide superior customer service.
Multi-task in a pleasant manner.
Work well under pressure.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must be able to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Regular i3 hours are 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Monday-Friday, however, additional hours may be required on occasion. Regular and punctual attendance is required.
About i3:
i3 is a technically diverse, 100% team member owned business, headquartered in Huntsville, Alabama specializing in missile and aviation systems engineering and logistic services, electronic warfare and electromagnetic effects analysis, UAS system integration and flight operations, full lifecycle C5ISR engineering services, cybersecurity and IT/IA innovative solutions and virtual training, simulation & serious game development and implementation. We have established a broad offering of products and capabilities collectively providing decades of experience supporting the full complement of DoD military services, Missile Defense Agency, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, and a variety of other Government organizations and private industry customers.

Perks of being a team member owner include:
Long-term financial security
Higher job satisfaction
Greater job security
Personal and professional growth
Great company culture
Other outstanding benefits:
Excellent insurance coverage
401(k) match
Generous PTO
Health and wellness incentives
Tuition and certification reimbursement
Countless opportunities to give back to the community through i3 Cares
We work hard. We compete hard. We play hard. Apply now to join us!

title: Sr BI Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Nintendo of America Inc.
About Nintendo of America : From the launch of the Nintendo Entertainment System ™ more than 30 years ago, Nintendo’s mission has been to create smiles through unique entertainment experiences. Here at Nintendo of America Inc., we deliver on this mission by partnering closely with Nintendo Co., Ltd., to bring Nintendo’s iconic and cherished franchises including Mario ™ , Donkey Kong ™ , The Legend of Zelda ™ , Metroid ™ , Animal Crossing ™ , Pikmin ™ and Splatoon ™ across the Americas through our video games, hardware systems, and collaborations with partners on a range of other entertainment initiatives like feature films and theme parks.
Based in Redmond, Wash., Nintendo of America serves as headquarters for Nintendo’s operations in the Americas. We are an equal opportunity employer offering a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, and the diverse consumers and communities we call home. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company’s website at https://www.nintendo.com/ .
Develops and maintains medium to complex data warehouse ETL (Extraction, Transformation and Loading), reporting, and analytic tasks for Nintendo global consumer contact centers.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:
Designs, develops, and maintains ETL routines and reporting with agreed-upon Service Level Agreements (SLAs) using Microsoft SQL Server, Excel, and Tableau.
Creates data extraction procedures and analytical products to measure, track and improve agent quality, contact center efficiency and outsourced vendor performance.
Provides expertise working with existing team (contract and FTEs) to create business intelligence stored procedures and reports, including design, development and management of a data warehouse environment used for analytics and reporting.
Understands the needs of the business and translates those into meaningful reporting that allows for actionable decisions.
Ensures the generation of standard or custom reports summarizing operational and financial data and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.
Identifies and recommends changes to optimize the ETL environment, implement monitoring, quality and validation processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Conducts or coordinates unit and system tests ensuring intelligence is consistent with defined needs.
Designs and deploys database table structures, reports, and queries.
Supports implemented BI solutions by monitoring and tuning queries and data loads, addressing user questions concerning data integrity, monitoring performance, and communicating functional and technical issues.
Documents specifications for Data Warehouse (DWH) extracts, reports, dashboards, or other outputs.
Facilitates and leads project planning and execution with cross functional teams across the organization.
Works with business and engineering managers to prioritize the project stream, aid roadmap definition and identify project dependencies.
Administers reporting systems including user/role provisioning, deployments and change control.
Conducts comparison processes to identify and develop process improvements; provides recommendations on next steps and manages deliverables.

SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in developing data warehousing solutions, dashboards, scorecards, and analytics.
Proficient in writing T-SQL code, SSIS packages, and Stored Procedures on Microsoft SQL Server.
Proficient in writing C# routines to extract data from various physical and cloud databases/data lakes through API calls.
Experience working as a database report developer to deliver BI to business users using Tableau or similar tool.
Familiarity with Operations KPI's and contact center forecasting.
Working knowledge of cloud data architectures like Snowflake.
Experience designing and deploying normalized and dimensional database objects (eg. star schemas).
Extensive reporting experience within an ETL based data migration paradigm.
Excellent native SQL skills; comfortable using a data access tool such as Toad or SSMS.
Share Point, Power BI, Excel macro, Windows script development experience (preferred).
Ability to analyze trends in metrics and suggest Dashboard layouts (preferred).
Customer Service, Operations, Retail, CRM, or B2C e-commerce background a plus.
Requires in-depth conceptual and practical knowledge in own technical job family and basic knowledge of related technical job families; has worked with a range of technologies.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience in computer science, information systems, or other quantitative field.
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role
This position includes a base salary range of $140,900 - $253,600 annually, potential for a semi-annual discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and paid time off. Please see our Benefits & Perks page for more benefits information. Fixed term employees are eligible for all listed employee benefits except tuition reimbursement.

title: Data Analyst, Specialist
description:

The B&I Analytics team supports Personal Investor's Brokerage & Investments business. The ideal candidate has:
A deep understanding of or interest to learn about the Brokerage & Investments business and PI product offerings
Strong technical skill set (SQL, Python and Tableau preferred)
Experience with PI enterprise Data
Desire & ability to collaborate closely with our business partners to consult & gather requirements
Experience in building resilient reporting products (e.g. dashboards)
Experience applying advanced analytical techniques in a workplace setting (e.g. predictive modeling, forecasting, clustering)
Core Responsibilities
Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and leads complex projects through completion. Delegates tasks and provides tactical and strategic guidance to peers. Serves as the analytics expert on cross-functional teams for large strategic initiatives.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods. Validates analytical techniques employed by other analysts.
Prepares and delivers expert level visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
Develops, owns and manages recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Actively develops the analytics community at Vanguard by mentoring, coaching and connecting others with resources and training. Participates and presents during scheduled analytics seminars.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Python, SQL and Tableau experience required.
Data science experience preferred.
Minimum of five years related Analytics work experience
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.
Special Factors
Sponsorship
Vanguard is offering visa sponsorship for this position.
About Vanguard
At Vanguard, we don't just have a mission—we're on a mission.
To work for the long-term financial wellbeing of our clients. To lead through product and services that transform our clients' lives. To learn and develop our skills as individuals and as a team. From Malvern to Melbourne, our mission drives us forward and inspires us to be our best.
How We Work
Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

title: Excel Rater Developer
description:
