title: Business Analyst - Remote
description:
Job Description:
About Us
Foundever® is a global leader in the customer experience (CX) industry. With 150,000 associates across the globe, we’re the team behind the best experiences for +800 of the world’s leading and digital-first brands. Our innovative CX solutions, technology and expertise are designed to support operational needs for our clients and deliver a seamless experience to customers in the moments that matter.

Supporting +9 million customer conversations every day in +60 languages across 45 countries, Foundever combines global strength and scale with the agile, entrepreneurial approach of our founder-led culture, enabling companies of all sizes and industries to transform their CX.

Winner of Comparably’s Award for Best Global Culture in 2024, 2023, 2022 and 2021
Gold Stevie Award Winner for Great Employers in 2024 and 2022
We foster an exciting culture of creativity, connection, and commitment

Read more about our culture: Foundever® Stories.
Job Summary
As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Foundever, you will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights through effective visualization. You will design intuitive and impactful dashboards that not only present data but also enhance user experience. Your expertise in business operations and experience in the BPO environment will allow you to understand client needs and deliver meaningful analytics.
Primary Job Responsibilities
Dashboard Development:

o Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards that visualize operational data, with a focus on agent performance metrics.
o Ensure dashboards are user-friendly, visually appealing, and optimized for user experience.

Data Analysis and Interpretation:

o Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and performance metrics relevant to client operations.
o Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.

Collaboration with Stakeholders:
o Work closely with operational teams, data engineers, and clients to gather requirements and understand business needs.
o Communicate findings and insights effectively to stakeholders at all levels.

Reporting Solutions:

o Consolidate and streamline reporting processes, aligning responsibilities previously held by operations reporting analysts, reporting analysts, and business analysts.
o Develop standard reports and ad-hoc analysis as needed to support operations and management.

User Experience Focus:

o Prioritize user experience in dashboard design by considering layout, navigation, and interaction.
o Conduct user testing and gather feedback to continuously improve the usability and effectiveness of dashboards.

Documentation and Training:

o Create documentation for dashboard functionality, data sources, and analytical processes.
o Provide training and support to end-users to maximize the value of BI tools and dashboards.

Continuous Improvement:

o Stay current with best practices in business intelligence, data visualization, and user experience design.
o Propose enhancements and new features based on user feedback and changing business needs.
Position Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.

3-5 years of experience in a business intelligence or data analysis role, with a strong focus on dashboard development.

Proficiency in Power BI and data visualization tools; familiarity with other BI tools is a plus.

Strong understanding of user experience (UX) principles and dashboard design best practices.
Required Experience
Prior experience in a Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) environment.
Proven ability to analyze performance metrics and translate them into insightful visualizations.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Pre-employment Requirements
Offers of employment are conditional and require that you complete and pass a criminal background check that reviews all criminal activity in every area of residence for the last seven years.

Foundever® is committed to selecting, developing, and rewarding the best person for the job based on the requirements of the work to be performed and without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability/handicap, marital status, protected veteran status, uniform status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity and expression, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. The Company forbids discrimination of all kinds, whether directed at Associates, applicants, vendors, customers, or visitors. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, benefits, training, discipline, and termination.

title: Data Analyst, Transformation
description:
About Us
At Cast & Crew, we’ve empowered creativity and supported the global entertainment industry for decades. Together with our family of brands - Backstage, CAPS, Checks & Balances, Final Draft, Media Services, Sargent-Disc, and The TEAM Companies – we operate as a combined entertainment technology and services provider offering industry standard screenwriting accounting software, digital payroll products, data & reporting, and a host of creative tools. The industry continues to move faster than ever, and the need for our expertise, our technology, and our people has never been greater. We are a production’s best ally every step of the way. #OneCastOneCrew
Position Overview
Cast & Crew is seeking a Transformation Data Analyst who will report to Chief Transformation Officer (CTrO) and support the Director, Program Management in managing the Transformation Office (TO) by enabling effective delivery, reporting, and data-driven decision-making across the transformation portfolio. The analyst will build and manage dashboards, performance metrics, and reporting processes to provide insights that support transformation governance. This role often involves collaboration with cross-functional teams, data modeling, and ensuring data accuracy and integrity.

Be a part of an organization that is modernizing and transforming it’s platforms, processes, and skills to accelerate business strategy.
Core Responsibilities
Requirements:
Dashboard & Reporting: Design, build, and maintain executive dashboards and detailed reports aligned with transformation goals, using Power BI, Tableau, Monday.com, or similar data visualization tools.
Performance Measurement: Develop and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track the effectiveness of transformation initiatives, including identifying data sources.
Data Analysis and Interpretation: Collect and analyze diverse data sources, identifying trends, and extracting insights to support business transformation efforts. Translate complex data into clear, concise insights for stakeholders.
Data Modeling and Documentation: Creating and maintaining data models, data dictionaries, and documentation to ensure data integrity and consistency.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with engineers and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for reporting improvements, translating them into actionable insights, and communicate findings effectively.
Problem-Solving: Identifying and resolving data quality issues, troubleshooting data discrepancies, and recommending solutions.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to improve data collection, reporting processes, and PMO tools. Collaborate to standardize best practices.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required; degree in business analytics, computer science, mathematics or science preferred but not required
2-3+ years in project or data analysis, business intelligence, project/portfolio operations or PMO roles.
Strong experience with project-tracking tools, relevant programming languages, and data visualization tools, such as Excel, Smartsheet, Monday.com, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and data governance principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and draw meaningful conclusions.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Possess discretion and sensitivity towards confidential information
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw conclusions.
Understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and techniques.
Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines.
Special Work Conditions
Sedentary – Involves sitting most of the time but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Some positions may entail exerting up to 15 lbs. of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force to lift, carry, push, or pull.
Benefits
Cast & Crew provides a comprehensive package of employee benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, health and wellness programs, employee discounts, and more! Note: Cast & Crew benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.
Cast & Crew is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.
CA residents
Your personal information may be collected in connection with certain services provided by Cast & Crew or its affiliated companies. A summary of your California privacy rights can be found at:
https://www.castandcrew.com/privacy-policy/
Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs. Compensation range for candidates in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location. The compensation range for this position is: $80,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year.

title: Assistant/Associate Engineer, Analytics Management - Power BI (Remote)
description:
Company Description

As a member of the Analytics Management team, this position is responsible for executing the development & support of our BI solutions. This position will work closely with our business partners & BI technical leads ensuring solutions meet their objectives including oversight of project delivery as well as management of day-to-day support activities

What Will You Be Doing?
Team up with the engineering teams, Business Analysis project members, and business partners to design and develop new Snowflake Views and Power BI objects including Dashboards, Reporting, and Apps among others.
Provide technical requirements for implementation of Snowflake and Power BI objects
Learn and support current on prem BI tools and processes while migrating to new Cloud tools
Work with Project Management to communicate timely estimates, updates, project status, and lead communication to project participants
Work in a fast-paced Agile/Scrum environment
Document and establish standards for best practices
What Do You Need To Bring?
1-3+ years of experience in a BI Engineering role, specifically Power BI
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred, or combination of education and experience
Strong organization, communication, and collaboration skills
Experience with retail industry, with focus on analytics, architecture and/or Business Intelligence
Strong understanding of data management principles
Personal Attributes: Self-starter, Collaborative, Curious, Strong work ethic, highly motivated, Team oriented
Experience designing and building BI Semantic layer models in an agile environment
Hands-on experience with Cloud technologies and open source technologies
Experience working with end users in a support style environment
Experience with new system implementation and change management
Demonstrated ability in developing a culture that embraces innovation, and challenges existing paradigms
Knowledgeable in DAX and SQL
Ability to identify usage scenarios and patterns for BI solutions
Experience with other BI reporting solutions such as OBIEE and Tableau nice to have
Our Company
Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a global, digitally led omnichannel specialty retailer of apparel and accessories catering to kids through millennials with assortments curated for their specific lifestyle needs.
The company operates a family of brands, including Abercrombie & Fitch, YPB, abercrombie kids, Hollister and Gilly Hicks, each sharing a commitment to offer products of enduring quality and exceptional comfort that support global customers on their journey to being and becoming who they are. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. operates over 750 stores under these brands across North America, Europe, Asia and the Middle East, as well as the e-commerce sites abercrombie.com, abercrombiekids.com, and hollisterco.com.
At Abercrombie & Fitch Co., we lead with purpose and always put our people first. We’re proud to offer equitable compensation and benefits, including flexibility and competitive Paid Time Off, as well as education and engagement events, including various Associate Resource Groups, volunteer opportunities and additional time off to give back to our global communities.
Benefits & Perks
As an Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (A&F Co.) associate, you’ll be eligible to participate in a variety of benefit programs designed to fit you and your lifestyle. A&F Co. is committed to providing competitive and comprehensive benefits that align with our company’s culture and values, but most importantly – with you! We also provide competitive incentives to reward the commitment our associates have for moving our global business forward:
Incentive bonus program
Annual companywide review process
Flexible spending accounts
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Life and disability insurance
Associate assistance program
Paid parental and adoption leave
Access to fertility and adoption benefits through Carrot
Access to mental health and wellness app, Headspace
Paid time off and one paid volunteer day per year, allowing you to give back to your community
Work from anywhere (Mondays and Fridays are “work from anywhere” days for most roles and six work from anywhere weeks per year)
Seven associate wellness half days per year
Merchandise discount on all of our brands
Opportunities for career advancement, we believe in promoting from within
Access to multiple Associate Resource Groups
Global team of people who will celebrate you for being YOU!

Additional Information

ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
This role allows for remote work across the U.S.. Therefore, in states and cities that require the hourly or salary compensation or pay range to be included in a job posting, the recruiting pay range for this position is $71,000 - $83,000. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include your specific skills, your years of experience, your work location, comparison to other employees in similar or related roles, or market demands. The range may be modified in the future.

title: Senior Power BI Analyst
description:
Location:
Palo Alto
San Francisco

Wilson Sonsini is the premier legal advisor to technology, life sciences, and other growth enterprises worldwide. We represent companies at every stage of development, from entrepreneurial start-ups to multibillion-dollar global corporations, as well as the venture firms, private equity firms, and investment banks that finance and advise them. The firm has approximately 1,100 attorneys in 17 offices: 13 in the U.S., two in China, and two in Europe. Our broad spectrum of practices and entrepreneurial spirit allow our staff exceptional opportunities for professional achievement and career growth.
We are seeking a Senior Power BI Analyst to join the Finance Technology team at the firm. This position is available as a hybrid work schedule.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Power BI Development: Design, develop, and maintain advanced Power BI reports, dashboards, and data models that meet the needs of various stakeholders.
Data Integration: Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into Power BI, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
SQL Expertise: Utilize strong SQL skills to query and manipulate data from databases and other sources to support reporting requirements.
SSRS Reports: Develop and enhance SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) reports to complement Power BI solutions when necessary.
Data Modeling: Create and optimize data models in Power BI to ensure efficient data analysis and visualization.
Mentorship: Act as a mentor to junior developers and analysts, providing guidance and training in Power BI best practices.
Lead Implementation: Lead the end-to-end implementation of Power BI projects, from requirements gathering to deployment, ensuring successful outcomes.
Performance Optimization: Identify and implement performance improvements in existing Power BI solutions to enhance efficiency and user experience.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.
Stay Current: Stay up-to-date with the latest Power BI features, trends, and best practices, and apply them to improve our reporting capabilities.
Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
6+ years of proven experience as a Power BI Developer, with a strong portfolio of Power BI reports and dashboards.
Expertise in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Proficiency in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services).
Strong data modeling skills.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Effective communication and mentoring skills.
Experience leading and managing Power BI projects.
Certifications in Power BI are a plus.

The primary location for this job posting is in Palo Alto, but other locations may be listed. The actual base pay offered will depend upon a variety of factors, including but not limited to the selected candidate’s qualifications, years of relevant experience, level of education, professional certifications and licenses, and work location. The anticipated pay range for this position is as follows:
San Francisco and Silicon Valley: $116,875 – $158,125 per year
The compensation for this position may include a discretionary year-end merit bonus based on performance. We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package.
Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

title: Power Apps Lead Developer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced PowerApps lead to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for leading the design, development, and implementation of PowerApps solutions that enhance our business processes. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into effective and efficient applications.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the design and development of PowerApps solutions to meet business requirements.

Ensure the quality and Performance of PowerApps applications through rigorous testing and debugging.

About Us
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. title: Microsoft Power BI Developer
description:
Join our team and become a part of something bigger – a force for change in the fight against hunger. The Community Foodbank of New Jersey is more than just a food bank – we champion healthier lifestyles and positively impact social and economic change. Together we can create a stronger, more resilient New Jersey for everyone.
The Microsoft Power BI Developer provides the ability to transform raw data into relevant insights via interactive and simple-to-understand dashboards and reports. You will work closely with members of the CFBNJ team to create, streamline and improve existing reports and dashboards while helping to create the next generation of tools to meet future needs.
What you’ll do in your role:
You will create and enhance SsaS cubes to support business intelligence solutions and collaborate with stakeholders to gr and understand reporting requirements.
You will create and enhance SSAS cubes to support business intelligence solutions.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand reporting requirements.
Develop and optimize SQL Server databases for reporting and analytics purposes and write and maintain efficient SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions.
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) with specific objectives and track them regularly.
Analyze data and display it in reports to aid decision-making.
Optimize data models to ensure performance and scalability in Power BI, SSAS, and SQL Server.
Integrate and manage data sources in Azure, including Azure SQL, Data Lake, and other services.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power BI, SSAS cubes, SQL Server, and Azure data pipelines.
Stay updated on the latest Power BI, SQL Server, SSAS, and Azure technologies and best practices.
Why you’ll love working at CFBNJ:
Opportunity for impact: Last year we provided over 90 million nutritious meals across New Jersey and educated over 25,000 people about health and nutrition.
Balance: Generous time off, 14 paid holidays, childcare resources, and organization-wide engagement days.
Financial Wellness: 401k with 4% company match after 1 year.
Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision and Wellness Programs.
Recognition and Certifications: Learning opportunities, tuition and certificate reimbursement, and engagement with our reward and recognition program, Bonusly!
Learning & Development: We emphasize professional growth for our team members by fostering a learning community and providing clear goals, along with supportive feedback to guide your ongoing development.
What you’ll need to be successful in this role:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering or Information Systems field of study preferred.
At least 2 yrs. of targeted/specialized experience with Power BI/Business Analytics Reporting or other business insight tools. Experience with SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS and Azure Data Factory/Azure Synapse Analytics.
Optimize data models to ensure performance and scalability in Power BI, SSAS, and SQL Server.
Integrate and manage data sources in Azure, including Azure SQL, Data Lake, and other services.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power BI, SSAS cubes, SQL Server, and Azure data pipelines.
Stay updated on the latest Power BI, SQL Server, SSAS, and Azure technologies and best practices.
Pay Transparency: The salary range for this position is $82,000-$110,000. The final rate may be influenced by factors such as the position's scope and responsibilities, work experience, training, job-related skills, internal equity, and market conditions.
CFBNJ is an equal employment opportunity employer and is committed to complying with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination based on race, religion, color, national or ethnic origin, age, sex , sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, marital status, domestic partnership or civil union status, pregnancy or breastfeeding, disability, being a victim of domestic violence, status in the uniformed services of the United States (including veteran status), record of arrest, as well as any other category protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Lead Freelance Tableau Design & UX Strategist
description:
Are you a visionary Tableau designer who sees beyond the dashboard, crafting intuitive user experiences that bring data to life? Do you thrive on leading design initiatives, empowering development teams to execute flawlessly, and understanding the practical balance between ideal design and project realities? If so, we want to hear from you!
We are a rapidly growing data and analytics consultancy passionate about helping organizations, particularly within the Non-Profit, Education, and Healthcare sectors, unlock the power of their data. Our team is innovative, fast-paced, and dedicated to delivering thoughtful, aesthetically pleasing, and impactful data solutions. We're looking to amplify our capabilities with a seasoned Freelance Tableau Design & UX Strategist to act as a design lead on key client projects.
The Opportunity:
This isn't just about making charts look good; it's about architecting how users will interact with and understand complex information. You'll be instrumental in defining the "art of the possible" in Tableau, creating designs that are not only visually stunning but also deeply functional and user-centric. Your work will directly support our team members in delighting our clients by transforming their data into actionable insights and democratizing data access within their organizations.
A key part of this role will involve developing and refining a scalable design process that seamlessly integrates with our Tableau development workflow. This includes ensuring customer needs are accurately captured, translated into precise design requirements, and then effectively communicated for best-practice Tableau implementation.
What You'll Do:
Lead Tableau Design: Conceptualize and design compelling, user-friendly Tableau dashboards and interactive visualizations that meet strategic and operational reporting needs.
Champion User Experience (UX): Go beyond visuals to define user flows, interactions, actions, and navigation within Tableau to create intuitive and engaging experiences.
Develop Design Standards & Processes: Play a pivotal role in creating and documenting a robust design-to-development framework for Tableau projects, ensuring quality and consistency.
Collaborate & Guide: Work closely with our internal Tableau developers, providing clear design specifications, guidance on implementation, and coaching on design theory and Tableau's technical capabilities to bring your vision to life.
Client Interaction (as needed): At times, interface directly with clients to understand requirements, present design concepts, and gather feedback.
Stay Ahead of the Curve: Maintain an expert understanding of Tableau's latest features and design best practices.
Manage Your Workflow: Proactively manage your project schedule, deliverables, and communication in an independent, remote setting.
What We're Looking For:
Proven Tableau Design Expertise: Extensive experience designing sophisticated and effective dashboards and visualizations specifically in Tableau. You know what’s possible, what’s practical, and how to push the boundaries creatively.
Strong Visual Design & UX Acumen: A keen eye for detail, aesthetics, data storytelling, and a deep understanding of user-centered design principles.
Strategic Thinker: Ability to understand complex business requirements and translate them into impactful data visualization strategies.
Commercial Awareness & Pragmatism: Crucially, you understand that exceptional design must align with project realities. You are adept at tailoring your design input and output to fit the specific scope and budget of each engagement, recognizing that practical trade-offs are sometimes necessary to deliver value within constraints. You know how to deliver the best possible design impact efficiently.
Process-Oriented Leader: Experience or strong aptitude for developing and implementing design processes and standards that improve efficiency and quality.
Exceptional Communicator: Ability to clearly articulate design rationale, provide constructive feedback, and coach team members. Comfortable presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences, including clients.
Independent & Proactive: Highly self-motivated, organized, and able to manage multiple projects concurrently with minimal oversight. You own your schedule and deliverables.
Adaptable: Comfortable with the dynamic nature of freelance work, including fluctuating workloads and project variety.
Portfolio Essential: A strong portfolio showcasing your Tableau design work, demonstrating your skills in visual design, UX, and creative problem-solving.
Availability: Able to attend occasional sync-up meetings during US East Coast business hours.
Why Join Us?
Meaningful Impact: Work on diverse projects for clients in impactful sectors like Non-Profit, Education, and Healthcare, helping them make better decisions.
Lead & Innovate: Take the lead on design and contribute to shaping our consultancy's Tableau design best practices and processes.
Flexibility: Enjoy the benefits of fully remote, project-based freelance work that can complement other commitments.
Collaborative Spirit: While you'll work independently, you'll be a key part of a supportive and forward-thinking team.
Competitive Compensation: We value expertise and are prepared to offer excellent rates, determined by your experience, portfolio, and demonstrated capabilities, particularly in design leadership and efficient, budget-conscious design delivery.
To Apply:
If you're excited by this opportunity to lead and innovate in Tableau design, we encourage you to apply! Please submit the following:
A brief cover letter describing your current situation, why you believe you're a great fit for this role (especially highlighting any experience in design leadership, process development, and your approach to budget-conscious design).
Your resume/CV.
A link to your portfolio (highly desirable, especially showcasing Tableau designs and any UX considerations).
Your general expectations for hourly or project-based remuneration. This will help us ensure alignment from the outset.
We will be posting this opportunity on multiple platforms. Please apply through the platform where you found this listing.
We look forward to seeing your amazing work and potentially welcoming you to our team!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Pay: Up to $100.00 per hour
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Manager IT- Power BI /Palantir Foundry
description:
Certain roles at Tyson require background checks. If you are offered a position that requires a background check you will be provided additional documentation to complete once an offer has been extended.
Job Details:
The Senior Manager, Information Technology will lead a dynamic team of IT professionals of various disciplines to support the company’s technological infrastructure and strategic IT initiatives and ensure the delivery of high-quality IT solutions that support business objectives. This role oversees the planning, implementation, and maintenance of the
company’s IT systems and ensures they align with business goals. The Senior Manager of IT will work closely with senior leadership to drive innovation, improve efficiency, and ensure the security and reliability of IT operations.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Agile Execution: Familiar with scrum practices focusing on technical delivery, ensuring that products are built on robust, scalable models.
Broader Oversight: Manage a large team or multiple small teams, providing guidance and support to ensure operational success.
Collaborate with Senior Leadership: Collaborate with senior leadership to define IT strategy and roadmaps, aligning technological initiatives with business priorities.
Culture Driver: Foster a positive and innovative IT culture that aligns with organizational values, promotes continuous learning, and encourages collaboration across teams and departments.
Drive Strategic IT Initiatives: Drive the implementation of strategic IT initiatives aligned with organizational goals, ensuring impactful results.
Lead and Develop Teams: Lead and develop multiple teams of IT professionals across different specialties, fostering growth and collaboration.
Manage Stakeholder and Vendor Relationships: Manage relationships with key stakeholders and vendors, ensuring effective communication and successful partnerships.
Mentorship & Development: Mentor team leads and managers on advanced techniques, helping them grow their technical expertise and leadership skills.
Operations Excellence: Drive operational improvements across multiple IT teams, leverage data analytics to demonstrate effectiveness, and optimize resource allocation and budget management to ensure efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
Optimize Resource Allocation and Budgeting: Optimize resource allocation and budget management across multiple teams to ensure efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
Oversee Complex Projects: Oversee complex, large-scale projects and programs, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to quality standards.
Performance Management: Leverage the enterprise-wide performance management system to align team and individual goals with organizational objectives, mentor team leads in effective performance management practices and ensure consistent application of performance standards across multiple teams.
Project Guidance: Guide multiple teams in implementing complex projects, ensuring they are delivered on time and meet business requirements.
Stakeholder Communication: Ensure frequent and effective communication with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to maintain alignment and transparency.
Strategic Alignment: Align IT initiatives with broader business goals and strategies, ensuring technology supports long-term business objectives.
Strategic Implementation: Ensure that IT practices are strategically implemented to support long-term business goals and objectives.
Risk Management: Develop and oversee risk management processes for multiple IT teams, proactively addressing potential issues and implementing mitigation strategies to ensure project and operational success.
Technical Oversight: Provide oversight on the architectural and design aspects of IT, ensuring alignment with industry standards and business needs.
Team Member Support and Empowerment: Actively support team members by identifying and creating opportunities for skill development, cross-functional exposure, and career advancement, ensuring their success and alignment with organizational goals.
Vendor Management: To ensure optimal service delivery, evaluate and manage relationships with IT operations vendors and service providers.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned, which align with our organization's vision, mission, and values and fall within your scope of practice.
Education: Bachelor's degree preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field, or relevant experience.
Preferred Certification(s): Certification related to Microsoft Power BI or Palantir Foundry
Experience: 7+ years of relevant and practical experience, preferably in IT management or a related role, with a proven ability to lead and motivate teams.
Special Skills:
Leadership and Team Management: Demonstrate strong leadership and team management skills, guiding teams toward achieving goals while fostering a collaborative and productive work environment.
Problem-Solving and Decision-Making: Demonstrate excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills, proactively addressing challenges and making sound decisions in high-pressure situations. Handle most operational issues autonomously, seeking upper management input primarily for strategic or high-impact decisions.
IT Project Management: Proficient in IT project management methodologies and tools, ensuring the successful planning, execution, and delivery of technology projects.
Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to non-technical staff and team members, ensuring alignment and understanding across all levels.
Expertise in Microsoft Power BI development, including data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
Experience with Power BI Service, including workspace management, security, and sharing.
Prior experience creating Power BI interactive dashboards and reports.
Knowledge of Power BI integration with other Microsoft tools (e.g., Excel, Azure).
Optionally, an understanding of Palantir Foundry's data integration and management capabilities.
Optionally, experience with Palantir Foundry's ontology and data pipeline creation
Optionally, proficiency in developing and maintaining Foundry applications and workflows.
Optionally, knowledge of Foundry's security and governance features.
** Not eligible for relocation **
**Not eligible for visa sponsorship now or in the future **
Relocation Assistance Eligible:
No
Work Shift:
1ST SHIFT (United States of America)
Hourly Applicants ONLY -You must complete the task after submitting your application to provide additional information to be considered for employment.
Tyson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.
We provide our team members and their families with paid time off; 401(k) plans; affordable health, life, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits; and more.
If you would like to learn more about your data privacy rights and how you may use that information, please read our Job Applicant Privacy Notice
here
.
Unsolicited Assistance: Tyson Foods and its subsidiaries do not accept unsolicited support from external recruitment vendors for open positions within the United States. Any resumes or candidate profiles submitted by recruitment vendors or headhunters to any employee or applicant tracking system at Tyson Foods or its subsidiaries, without a valid written request and search agreement approved by HR, will be considered the property of Tyson Foods. No fees will be paid if the candidate is hired due to an unsolicited referral.

title: On-site Power BI Data Analyst (1099 Contractor)
description:
Company Description

At Abramson Labor Group, we're not just committed to defending employee rights—we're passionate about it. Whether you're up against a small business or a corporate giant, our highly skilled team of attorneys and legal professionals are ready to fight for you. Headquartered in vibrant Burbank, California, we focus on exclusively protecting employees throughout the entire state of beautiful California. Our dedicated attorneys, paralegals and legal assistants work tirelessly to secure the justice you deserve in all workplace disputes. We pride ourselves on delivering top-notch solutions with integrity, efficiency, and professionalism. Choose Abramson Labor Group and let us champion your cause with unwavering dedication.

Job Description

Job Title: Power BI Data Analyst (1099 Contractor)
Location: On-site – Burbank, CA
Employment Type: 1099 Contractor
Duration: 3–8 months
Schedule: Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:30 PM PST
Compensation: $40-50 hourly

About the Role
Abramson Labor Group is seeking a Power BI Expert to join our team on a contract basis to support our business intelligence and data reporting needs. This is a temporary in-person position based at our Burbank, CA office, with a project duration of approximately 3 to 8 months.
The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in Power BI and a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights. You will be responsible for building a variety of interactive reports and dashboards, extracting and consolidating data from multiple sources, and translating business requirements into analytical solutions.

Key Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain visually compelling and interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.
Gather, clean, and transform data from various internal and external sources.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and business opportunities.
Present clear, concise, and actionable insights to stakeholders across departments.
Collaborate with internal teams to understand reporting needs and deliver customized solutions.
Troubleshoot and optimize data models, reports, and performance issues as needed.

Qualifications

Qualifications & Skills
Proven expertise in Microsoft Power BI with a strong portfolio of past dashboards and reports.
Solid understanding of data analysis, data modeling, and DAX functions.
Experience in data gathering, integration, and transformation from diverse sources (e.g., Excel, SQL, APIs).
Excellent problem-solving skills and high attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
Strong communication skills for effective presentation of findings and collaboration with team members.
Additional Information
This is a 1099 contractor role and is not eligible for benefits.
Must be able to work in-person at our Burbank office during the specified hours.
Project estimated to run between 3 to 8 months, depending on business needs.

To Apply:
Please submit your resume and any relevant work samples or portfolio showcasing your Power BI experience (if you have any).

Additional Information

Department
IT
Employment Type
Contract (3-8 months)
Location
Burbank, CA
Workplace type
Onsite
Compensation
$40 - $50 hourly

title: Senior BI Engineer
description:
Job Description
Location: Lewisville, TX
Position Type: Full-Time
Hours: 9:00am to 5:00pm Weekdays (Monday – Friday)
The Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions that help organizations make data-driven decisions. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide analytical insights through dashboards, reports, and data models. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes, and BI tools, as well as strong problem-solving skills and a passion for data analytics.
Minimum Degree Requirement: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering or closely related field.
Minimum Work Experience: 2 years of experience
Key Responsibilities
BI Solution Development & Maintenance
Design and develop robust BI solutions using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
Create interactive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights for business users.
Optimize and maintain existing BI solutions to enhance performance and usability.


Data Management & ETL Processes
Design, develop, and implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for data ingestion from multiple sources.
Develop and maintain data pipelines and workflows to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
Work with cloud-based data solutions such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.


Data Warehousing & Modeling
Design and maintain data warehouse structures and relational database schemas.
Develop efficient data models that support reporting and analytical needs.
Optimize database performance by writing efficient queries and indexing strategies.


Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement
Partner with business stakeholders to understand reporting and analytics needs.
Provide technical guidance and support to junior BI engineers and analysts.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to ensure consistency in data reporting.


Performance Monitoring & Optimization
Continuously monitor and improve BI tools, dashboards, and reporting solutions.
Implement automation techniques for BI processes to improve efficiency.
Ensure data security and governance best practices are followed.
Technical Experience
2 years of experience in BI development, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
2 years of proven expertise in using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
1 year of Hands-on experience with cloud-based data solutions like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
1 year of experience in designing and maintaining data warehouse structures and relational database schemas.
1 year of proficiency in SQL for writing efficient queries and optimizing database performance.
1 year of experience with ETL tools and processes for data ingestion and transformation.
1 year of knowledge of data modeling techniques to support reporting and analytics.
1 year of knowledge with automation techniques for BI processes.

title: Power Platform Developer
description:
Andworx is hiring a Power Platform Developer to provide expertise creating impactful and transformative solutions with the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) in support of a Federal Government client. As a candidate, you have strong technical skills with the ability to make visually pleasing low code/no code solutions and be able to construct rich data visualizations using the Microsoft Power Platform. You are highly organized and will be responsible for working with business subject matter experts and key stakeholders to understand customer business processes, objectives, and needs to provide timely and effective solutions. This is a dynamic position that will have high visibility within our customer's organization and requires the ability to perform a wide range of responsibilities.
Please note:
This position is currently remote, but candidates should live within a commutable distance to Falls Church, VA as there will be occasional requirements to meet with the team and work out of our headquarters and attend in-person functions.

Requirements

6 years' experience building technical solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power BI, Power Automate, Dataverse etc.).
Ability to identify functional business requirements and satisfy business needs through design, development, testing and delivery of effective solutions.
Ability to make solutions look good – attention to UX/UI design and solutions that are visually pleasing to users.
Able to carry out assigned projects to their completion, establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, customers, prospective customers, and vendors.
Able to communicate clearly in spoken and written word to audiences with a wide variety of backgrounds and differing levels of technical expertise.
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or other technical discipline OR high school diploma, PLUS 10 years of relevant experience, PLUS two relevant technical certifications.
Ability to successfully obtain a Position of Trust clearance. (VISA or Green card holders do not meet this requirement.)
US Citizenship is required.
Preferred Qualifications
Microsoft Power Platform certifications such as:
Power Platform Fundamentals
Power Platform Functional Consultant
Power Platform Developer
Power Platform App Maker
Power Platform Solution Architect
Experience integrating with industry leading cloud platforms.
An eye for clean, easy to use, UI/UX implementations.
An understanding of how to organize and present key data points through visualizations targeted at leadership.
Prior experience supporting federal government customers.
Responsibilities
As a Microsoft Power Platform Developer, the candidate will leverage their blend of business analysis, organization, communication, and technical skills, to perform the following:
Implement new solutions to business problems using the Power Platform and other applicable cloud platform solutions.
Participate in project teams with subject matter experts and key stakeholders to understand customer business processes, objectives, and solution requirements.
Train citizen developers and promote Power Platform usage and growth.
Assist in monitoring, governing, and controlling Power Platform environments.
Troubleshoot, debug, maintain, and improve existing solutions.
Understand high level data visualization needs to provide rich visualizations to leadership.
Compile and assess user feedback to improve technical solutions.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Andworx gets things done! We are a collaborative team of digital transformation experts and IT professionals who have an entrepreneurial mindset. We ignite the enthusiasm of our customers by delivering innovative, creative, and high-quality solutions, all paired with unparalleled services.

We are a team of life-long learners who enjoy excelling, coaching, and mentoring. Together we celebrate our achievements and learn from our challenges as we grow through each experience as a team.

Additional Information
Andworx employment decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
Andworx participates in the E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification Program.

title: Power BI Architect
description:
Who Are We?
Groundswell is a premier technology integrator resolutely committed to solving the most complex challenges facing federal agencies today. Our name, Groundswell, represents our commitment to be an unstoppable, seismic change in government. Ours is a small company culture with big company reach and results. Are you ready to be audacious, be bold and drive change at a rapid pace? Join us, where we’ll make a greater impact together.

What You'll do:
Participates in development, testing and delivery of software products or components to maintain existing systems. Develops detail program specifications and programs for these components. Develops and tests interfaces between software products and products of other vendors. Creates and tests modules and components for compliance to design specifications. Participates in design and code reviews; addresses findings. Senior Level. Employees in this level require greater knowledge, training, and/or experience than Sr Consultant. The amount of work review, checks, and supervision are less for an employee at this level. Complexity or variety of work is higher than Sr Consultant and may involve greater technical, mathematical, or scientific skills. The scope of assignments may vary when compared to Sr Consultant.
How You’ll Excel In Your Role:
Effective written and verbal communication
Ability to present internally and to clients

Minimum of 5 years of experience in SQL and RDBMS technologies (Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, etc)
Experience working directly with business stakeholders and gathering requirements
Experience with developing and implementing analytics in a production setting with large data sets
Experience with Version Control and/or DevOps tools (Azure DevOps, GitLab, etc)

Experience designing and maintaining production ETL/ELT pipelines using cloud services (Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, Informatica, etc)

title: Power BI Report Developer
description:
Company Overview:
Royal Oak Enterprises, LLC is a leading manufacturer and marketer of branded and private label charcoal, manufactured fire logs, fire building products, matches and toothpicks. In addition, the Company also manufactures railroad cross ties, which strengthens our relationship with our suppliers in the charcoal business. We offer a full suite of grilling products including charcoal briquettes, all-natural lump charcoal, fire starters along with the Pine Mountain fire building brand, the Diamond brand, and the Specialty Wood Products brand.
Position Summary:
The Power BI Developer will design, develop, and manage advanced Power BI dashboards, reports, and datasets tailored to business needs. This individual will build optimized data models (star/snowflake schemas) using Power BI and integrate with diverse data sources (SQL, Azure, Excel, APIs, etc.) . The Power BI Developer will lead BI projects from requirements gathering to deployment, working with cross-functional teams.
Position Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and manage advanced Power BI dashboards, reports, and datasets tailored to business needs.
Build optimized data models (star/snowflake schemas) using Power BI and integrate with diverse data sources (SQL, Azure, Excel, APIs, etc.).
Lead BI projects from requirements gathering to deployment, working with cross-functional teams.
Perform data analysis, profiling, cleansing, and transformation to ensure high data quality and reliability.
Implement row-level security (RLS), DAX calculations, and performance tuning of Power BI reports.
As a Power BI Developer, you will collaborate with stakeholders to understand KPIs and deliver actionable, user-friendly visualizations.
Establish best practices for Power BI governance, including workspaces, version control, and data refresh strategies.
Comfortable in a small / lean team environment* 5+ years of experience in data analytics/business intelligence, with 3+ years focused on Power BI development
Position Requirements:
Experience using Power BI, including creating reports, dashboards, and data visualizations from scratch.
Experience with Power BI gateways, dataflows, and enterprise-level deployment strategies.
Experience in SSRS development.
Experience developing reports using Transact Structured Query Language (T-SQL).
Strong knowledge of data warehousing, ETL processes, and relational databases (SQL Server, Azure Synapse, Microsoft Fabric, etc.).
Writing ad-hoc SQL queries to support the operational needs of an organization.
Solid understanding of data governance, security, and compliance standards.
Advanced proficiency in DAX, Power Query (M language), and Power BI Service.
Experience working with integrated data from ERP systems, e.g., D365 F&O, SAP, Oracle.
Strong communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to work closely with business and technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to analyze complex datasets and design intuitive, impactful dashboards.
A true team player and contributor.
Effective communication skills (both oral and written).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Bachelor’s degree
Royal Oak Enterprises, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an all-inclusive environment.
We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.
Equal Opportunity Employer
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Quant Analytics
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Duties: Utilize data tools to define, size, and execute on audiences. Collaborate with business partners by leveraging analytics and data insights to improve campaign performance. Develop and manage customer attributes and research new data elements for insights. Produce data validations on campaign populations to ensure marketing requirements are met. Identify correlations and trends in data, and communicate impacts that could affect results of the campaign. Participate in quality code reviews and identify issues and errors for correction or improvement. Recognize and implement ideas for global process improvements to increase department efficiency. Represent the Audience Management area in technical meetings with IT and other areas. Mentor new and more junior Audience Management resources. Support acquisition and engagement across credit card, Auto, Retail, Home Lending and Payments. Gather business requirements and specifications that capture the overall flow and details of the initiative. Follow standard procedures to ensure the accuracy of the audiences prior to execution.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum education and experience required: Master's degree in Economics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field of study plus one (1) year of experience in the job offered or as Quant Analytics, Quantitative Marketing Analyst, Data Analytics Co-op, Data Analyst, or related occupation. The employer will alternatively accept a Bachelor's degree in Economics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field of study plus three (3) years of experience in the job offered or as Quant Analytics, Quantitative Marketing Analyst, Data Analytics Co-op, Data Analyst, or related occupation.
Skills Required: This position requires experience with the following: Power BI; A/B Testing; building reports/dashboards in Tableau; wrangling, manipulating, analyzing, and interpreting big datasets in SQL, SAS, and Python; PowerPoint; Word; Alteryx; using p-value to determine the significance of results from marketing campaigns; utilizing Predictive model scores to optimize audience selection strategies; Pivot tables and Formulas with the ability to show results in a graphical manner using Excel; forecasting Lead flow and customer conversion; analyzing audience trends and summarizing findings; campaign sizing to support test designing; customer segmentation; automating processes to enhance controls, mitigate errors and increase efficiency; connecting Data sources to Data warehouse; Teradata; Oracle; building Waterfalls for marketing campaigns to improve program visibility.
Job Location: 1111 Polaris Pkwy, Columbus, OH 43240.

title: Power BI Architect
description:
Role description
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and translate them into effective visualizations and insights using Power BI
Create and optimize complex data models using DAX to support the specific reporting and analytics needs of the business
Utilize Power Query to extract transform and load data from various sources into Power BI Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports
Continuously monitor report performance and optimize DAX and other elements for faster rendering and data refresh cycles
Work closely with the IT and cloud teams to integrate Power BI with other platforms such as Azure Synapse Azure Data Factory Databricks and more when needed
Use Power BI REST APIs for embedding automating and managing reports and dashboards in thirdparty applications or portals
Present insights and dashboards to senior management and other stakeholders Provide training and support to endusers to ensure the effective use of Power BI reports and dashboards
Stay updated with the latest features and updates in Power BI and implement relevant ones to enhance reporting capabilities
Essential Skills
Proven experience in building deploying and maintaining complex reports and dashboards using Power BI
Strong expertise in Data Analysis Expressions DAX and Power Query for data modeling and transformation
Proficiency in using Power BI REST APIs for extended functionality and integration
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal to effectively liaise with stakeholders and present insights
Nice to have Skills
Familiarity with Azure Synapse and its integration with Power BI for enhanced analytics capabilities
Experience with Azure Data Factory for orchestrating and automating data workflows
Knowledge of the Lakehouse architecture and how it can be leveraged in Power BI reporting
Handson experience or understanding of Azure Databricks and its interplay with Power BI
Experience
Multiple years of experience as a dedicated Power BI developer showcasing a strong portfolio of reports and dashboards catered to varied business needs
Demonstrated capability in handling large datasets optimizing report performance and ensuring data security best practices
Past experience in working with crossfunctional teams including data engineers business analysts and cloud architects


Skills

Mandatory Skills : PowerBI,Tableau,BI Solutions Architecture,Dimensional Data Modeling

Other details

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
$120,000 to $130,000 At Outform Group, our guiding philosophy is Dare To Innovate.

Outform Group specializes in creating tangible consumer engagements that elevate, connect and humanize brand experiences. We unite leading experts in research, strategy, design, innovation and manufacturing, who work together to create unforgettable brand experiences.

Lean, interdisciplinary teams work in close collaboration with clients, helping them to solve their user’s biggest problems. Our user-centric, data-driven approach focuses on creating a seamless experience across different environments.
The Senior Power BI Developer will lead advanced dashboard development and business intelligence (BI) initiatives in support of operational and strategic decision-making for the Outform Group. The role is responsible for transforming complex datasets into interactive reports, managing large-scale KPI dashboards, and mentoring junior analysts. This position will work closely with key stakeholders from staff sections to design impactful, data-driven solutions.
Become an integral part of a professionally diverse team while working at an industry-leading organization. This is a great opportunity that will allow you to work on innovative projects that offer advancement and growth.
Responsibilities:
Utilize Power BI Copilot and other AI tools to streamline and enhance BI development processes and also to create powerful visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and iterate on reports using stakeholder feedback.
Design and implement data modeling concepts to support BI solutions (e.g., star schema, snowflake schema) and data warehousing principles.
Experience in connecting to and extracting data from various data sources with an emphasis on ensuring data accuracy and consistency (e.g., SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, Excel, CSV).
Develop and maintain refresh pipelines, gateway configurations, and PowerApps/Power Automate workflows.
Optimize Power BI reports and dashboards for performance and usability.
Excellent SQL skills for data querying and manipulation.
Understanding of data security and governance principles.
Develop and maintain documentation for BI solutions, including data models, reports, and dashboards.
Ensure compliance with organizational data governance standards and policies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years of experience working as a Power BI Developer using Microsoft Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Power Query (M) and DAX in a data analytics or BI development role.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience with advanced analytics and machine learning concepts within Power BI.
Minimum of 5 years working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O data model.
Data Modeling: Star/Snowflake schemas, normalized structures.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or R for data analysis and visualization.
Experience with data integration tools and processes.
Microsoft Power BI certifications (e.g., PL-300).
Experience managing and configuring Power BI workspaces and user access controls.
Familiarity with cloud-based BI platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake) is a plus.
A problem solver and troubleshooter who thrives in resolving complex problems.
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Superior organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.

Outform Group is an equal opportunity employer. Outform Group makes employment decisions and provides equal employment opportunity without regard to an applicant's or employee's race, sex, color, age, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, and local laws. If you need a reasonable accommodation in the application or hiring process, please notify the Outform Group Human Resources department.
Outform Group, Inc. offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) and matching contributions, HSA and FSA, leave programs, paid time off including holidays, and we continually review to align and update our benefit offerings

title: Power BI Administrator
description:
Calling all innovators - find your future at Fiserv.
We're Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another millions of times a day - quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we're involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.
Job Title
Power BI Administrator
What does a successful Power BI Administrator do at Fiserv?
You will be an integral part of our Contact Service Technology team, responsible for configuring and automating the management of Power BI gateways. You will work directly with business partners, external clients, and various development resources to ensure optimal data management and analysis. Your role will require expertise in an environment that includes Azure Services, Azure SQL, Snowflake, SSRS, ADF, SSIS, Cognos, Power BI, Python, and other data-related technologies.
What you will do:
Configure and automate the management of Power BI gateways to ensure seamless data flow and access.
Collaborate with business partners, external clients, and development resources to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Manage and optimize the Azure Services environment to support data-related programming and analytics.
Oversee the integration of various data sources, including Azure SQL, Snowflake, SSRS, ADF, SSIS, Cognos, and Python, into Power BI for comprehensive reporting and analysis.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for Power BI gateways, ensuring high availability and performance.
Develop and maintain documentation for Power BI configurations and processes.
Ensure data governance and compliance with industry standards and best practices.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in Power BI and related technologies to continuously improve our systems.
What you will need to have:
6+ years of experience in Power BI administration and configuration.
6+ years of experience with Azure Services, Azure SQL, Snowflake, SSRS, ADF, SSIS, and Cognos.
3+ years proficiency in Python and other data-related programming languages.
Bachelor’s degree in data science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or an equivalent combination of education, work, and/or military experience.
What would be great to have:
1+ years of experience supporting Fiserv products.
Experience managing and optimizing Azure Services environments.
Knowledge of data governance and compliance standards.
Ability to develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for data-related processes.
#LI-RM1

$86,300.00 - $147,900.00
These pay ranges apply to employees in New Jersey, New York and California. Pay ranges for employees in other states may differ.

title: Healthcare Strategy Analyst, Corporate Strategy
description:
Baptist Health is the region’s largest not-for-profit healthcare organization, with 12 hospitals, over 28,000 employees, 4,500 physicians and 200 outpatient centers, urgent care facilities and physician practices across Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward and Palm Beach counties. With internationally renowned centers of excellence in cancer, cardiovascular care, orthopedics and sports medicine, and neurosciences, Baptist Health is supported by philanthropy and driven by its faith-based mission of medical excellence. For 25 years, we’ve been named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For, and in the 2024-2025 U.S. News & World Report Best Hospital Rankings, Baptist Health was the most awarded healthcare system in South Florida, earning 45 high-performing honors.
What truly sets us apart is our people. At Baptist Health, we create personal connections with our colleagues that go beyond the workplace, and we form meaningful relationships with patients and their families that extend beyond delivering care. Many of us have walked in our patients’ shoes ourselves and that shared experience fuels out commitment to compassion and quality. Our culture is rooted in purpose, and every team member plays a part in making a positive impact – because when it comes to caring for people, we’re all in.
Description:

The Healthcare Strategy Analyst serves an important role in the strategic framework development for Baptist Health South Florida, supporting enterprise strategy, analytics, and research. Works collaboratively in a team-based environment, is the analytic lead in the assessment and understating of internal business dynamics, external market drivers, and the quantification of current offerings and future opportunities. Develops, maintains and updates utilization, capacity and competitive databases to improve decision-making. Responsible for data mining, including collecting and synthesizing information from a variety of sources, routine ad hoc reporting, interpreting findings, and tracking performance. Assists with the development and monitoring of business plans, operational improvement initiatives, and financial analysis spanning the current and future continuum of service offerings and markets across South Florida. Maintains databases and software applications to ensure data accuracy, analytic integrity, and reporting validity. Estimated salary range for this position is $68813.24 - $89457.21 / year depending on experience.
Qualifications:

Degrees:
Bachelors.
Additional Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Health Services Administration, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics required.
Three years of quantitative analytic experience required, healthcare consulting, market research and analysis, or financial analysis preferred.
A Master's Degree in Business Administration or Health Services Administration is preferred and may be substituted for experience.
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite required.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel or Access preferred.
Advanced data analytic skills to impact key business decisions required.
Experience in using business intelligence, competitive analyses, forecasting and visualization/mapping tools a plus, including Tableau, Premier, Advisory, SG2 or Diveport.
Highly motivated, detail-oriented complex problem solver, with an ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Exceptionally strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills required.
Some experience in organizational design, functional and business process design and improvement preferred.
Minimum Required Experience: 3 Years

EOE, including disability/vets
