title: Senior Analyst, Delivery Excellence – Data Analytics
description:
WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH
You will be positioned as a key pivot role supporting two of five global Delivery Excellence organizations (the function is headquartered in Nike Singapore office and has additional locations in China and Vietnam) – Americas Delivery Excellence (supporting strategic inline apparel and accessories factory partners in the Western Hemisphere) and Uniform Operations (supporting NA Team and on-field / Promo uniforms delivery, including through a domestic / US-based factory partners) teams. Along with building critical relationships with WHQ-based Delivery Excellence teams, you will also work closely with a wide range of Nike functional teams including Global Sports Marketing, Partner Management, Global Sports Apparel teams, Product Creation Center, Factory Partners, Global/Geo Supply & Inventory Planning, Marketplace Operations, Sourcing, and others.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our Delivery Excellence team in Apparel / Accessories Manufacturing organization (part of Product Supply Chain) to enable on-time Nike delivery from regional partners, while supporting Uniform Operations business. We’re looking for some length of experience with data analytics and related suite of tools and practices, enabling rapid data governance and exploration - someone who is comfortable around data and can extract, digest, and visualize it based on the needs of the business. You’ll work independently coordinating process and data priorities across two teams you’ll support, through becoming intimately connected to the teams’ full value chain. We’ll expect you to balance multiple fast-shifting priorities with critical thinking & out-of-the-box digitally forward solutions for key issues, to drive process clarity, to balance Nike and partner needs, and to develop strong agency and a good sense of prioritizing most business-critical tasks. If you’re a well-organized data-driven digital citizen, are ready to make a real impact on the operational and business health of both Nike and our partners, and can easily make complex things simple and scalable while working with a global network of Nike and partner teams, we’d love to speak with you.
Bachelor’s degree in Business / Marketing, Sports Management, Product Creation, Supply Chain, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field. Will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training.
3-5+ years of experience in retail, project management, supply chain operations, product creation, planning, customer service, or similar fields strongly preferred.
2+ years in data manipulation & visualization; familiar and experienced with data flow management and tool design.
Seasoned technical acumen in Nike suite of tools (Tableau, Alteryx, SQL Server, Snowflake); thought leader able to influence what tools we build and how we use and generate the data.
Experience in apparel manufacturing a plus.
Able to organize, research, analyze and integrate large amounts of information accurately and quickly
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization, including both tactical and executive comms, converting process and data outputs into influence and storytelling.
WHAT YOU’LL WORK ON
The role has process and data accountabilities for Americas DEC; and requires data support for our Uniform Operations team.
Within Americas DEC, the role focuses on leading the global Sports Marketing deliveries, Americas data maintenance, analysis, and governance, and factory partner support in day-to-day operations as needed. On the Sports Marketing side, you’ll implement and maintain best practices and process discipline for Promotional product deliveries and drive SOP (standard operating procedures) compliance / training with our delivery excellence team and factory partners. You’ll also maintain and own all Promo stakeholder communications to global and regional leadership. For data analytics, you’ll provide support to our for intra-team and factory-facing activities, validating that our dashboards and reporting are accurate and aligned, troubleshooting reporting issues, optimizing/ reducing redundant manual data intervention by our teams, and creating new tools. You will also liaison to the Global DEC Center of Excellence team working in lockstep on dashboard governance, data cleansing, and ad-hoc projects as needed. Finally, you’ll know the factory-facing responsibilities of our office which include capacity management, delivery management, and delivery operations - this will allow you to provide process support for the team as needed and help the team iterate on ways to make their work more efficient and data-friendly.
In addition, you will be a key partner with the Uniform Operations team providing data and BI support for the team delivering product for our most visible assets – on-field and Team apparel. Those needs include data cleansing, dashboard creation, task automation, and creating executive level reporting.
NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.
We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

title: Microsoft Dynamics CE & Power Platform Application Analyst
description:
Full-time
Department: Information Technology
Company Description
The IT Lead Application Analyst will play a pivotal role in shaping, developing, and supporting Microsoft Dynamics CE applications, the Power Platform, and associated integrations at FBIN primarily for Service to start with. This position is responsible for maintaining and optimizing Service systems and processes while driving continuous improvement initiatives and overseeing project-related tasks. The position will also lead any future MS Dynamics Sales CRM discovery and implementations. Success in this role requires close collaboration with business stakeholders and other IT team members to ensure alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
Job Description
Position location – This position is eligible for a hybrid schedule based out of Deerfield, IL. Effective mid-2025, Fortune Brands will transition to a new world-class campus in Deerfield, bringing together associates from across our U.S. offices, brands, and functions. The campus will offer vibrant workspaces for collaboration, along with amenities for dining, onsite daycare, fitness and recreation

RESPONSIBLIITIES:
What you will be doing
We are seeking an accomplished and motivated Microsoft Dynamics CE & Power Platform Application Analyst to join our high performing team focused majorly on the Service processes. In this pivotal role, you will leverage your expertise in Microsoft Dynamics and Power Platform to shape the design, development, and deployment of innovative solutions within FBIN’s Service domain. The role will also lead future Sale CRM discussions as we create that roadmap. Working in partnership with cross-functional teams, you will play a critical role in identifying business challenges, driving scalable solutions, and optimizing processes to align with organizational goals.

System Support: Provide day-to-day system and application support, including user setup, management, and training. Troubleshoot and debug system issues.
Technical Development and Project Support: Utilize advanced programming expertise in Power Platform, JavaScript, plugins, Logic Apps, and other relevant tools to design, develop, and implement custom functionalities and seamless integrations. Tailor and enhance Dynamics CE features to align with specific business needs, and leverage Power BI reporting and analytics to deliver impactful, data-driven solutions.
Business Requirements: Analyze business needs and translate them into technical solutions within Dynamics CE. Create clear and effective reporting based on business requests.
System Optimization: Optimize system performance, ensure scalability, and suggest improvements to existing configurations and workflows. Facilitate upgrades, patching, and module implementations.
Collaboration & Leadership: Partner with stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of Dynamics modules and third-party systems. Provide technical leadership by coordinating and supporting managed services/external resources and priorities, mentoring junior developers and guiding the implementation of best practices. Collaborate with business teams to refine internal processes and systems, driving efficiency and standardization. Optimize system performance, ensuring scalability and reliability. Suggest innovative uses for new features introduced in semiannual releases and recommend enhancements to existing configurations and workflows to boost system performance and improve user experience.
Testing & Documentation: Conduct system testing, debugging, and documentation. Assist in the design, development, testing, and deployment of system configuration changes, workflows, process extensions, and events.
Governance & Risk Management: Leverage IT governance processes to ensure proper project definition and control. Manage risk through corporate compliance and support Agile methodologies.
Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest Dynamics CE and Power Platform technologies and best practices.
Qualifications
7+ years’ experience with Dynamics CE architecture development and implementation with Customer Service focus.
Strong understanding of Service CRM processes

Fortune Brands Innovations, Inc. is an industry-leading innovation company focused on creating smarter, safer and more beautiful homes and improving lives. title: Bi Developer
description:
Who are we:
We are part of the Wonderfield Group which includes the YO!, Taiko, Bento, AFC Sushi, and SNOWFOX/SNOWFRUIT brands – we operate more than 1500 kiosks, 60 restaurants, our grab and go sushi is available in over 3,700 locations and we have 50 major retail partners.
Our key markets are the USA, Canada, and the UK with additional geographic presence in Europe and Australia. Our JFE Franchising, Inc brands are:
SNOWFOX - the franchisor of over 1,000 full-service sushi kiosks in 25 states throughout the continental U.S., Hawaii, and Alaska
SNOWFRUIT – the franchisor of over 1,000 fresh cut fruit and Vegetable throughout the U.S. – Refreshingly, Crips and Flavorful!
We Believe in Better Food For Everyone, The Japanese Way…
We continue to capitalize on consumer trends, spearheading category growth by bringing our proposition to more people around the world across more channels, in more locations, on more occasions and in more innovative ways. We are committed to purposeful progress and profit for the benefit of our people, our communities and our planet and we have a clear ESG strategy that delivers progress against nine UN sustainability development goals.
Our Purpose:
We Believe in Better Food For Everyone, The Japanese Way…
We continue to capitalize on consumer trends, spearheading category growth by bringing our
proposition to more people around the world across more channels, in more locations, on
more occasions and in more innovative ways. We are committed to purposeful progress and
profit for the benefit of our people, our communities and our planet and we have a clear ESG
strategy that delivers progress against nine UN sustainability development goals.
Our Values:
Own it
We are accountable and make no excuses.
We always look to improve
We take the initiative and are courageous and confident
Care about it
We do the right thing, avoiding unnecessary shortcuts
We act with integrity and respect our communities, people and our plant
Make it Exceptional
We build relationships and make people smile
We say thank you
We’re positive and kind
Win Together
· We’re open minded an inclusive · We communicate with clarity · We take time to look out for others and to celebrate the good stuff
Overview of the role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Azure Senior BI Developer to join our
dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Power BI and extensive
experience in developing data warehouses. As a Senior BI Developer, you will be responsible
for designing and implementing robust BI solutions on the Azure platform, ensuring data
accuracy, and delivering actionable insights to drive business growth.
If you are a passionate and dedicated BI Developer with a deep knowledge of Azure and
Power BI, we would love to have you join our team. Apply now and contribute to driving
data-driven decision-making processes and enhancing business intelligence capabilities.
Key Accountabilities:
Develop and maintain data warehouses on the Azure platform, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
Design, develop, and deploy end-to-end Power BI solutions, including data modelling, report creation, and dashboard development.
Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to understand and gather requirements for BI solutions.
Transform complex data into actionable insights, implementing best practices for data visualization and analytics.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Work closely with data engineers to optimize data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.
Develop and maintain data quality processes to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in BI development, power BI, and Azure services.
Conduct performance optimization, tuning, and troubleshooting of BI solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project implementation and timely delivery.
What you’ll need:
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in developing BI solutions, with expertise in Power BI and Azure services.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, including data modelling, ETL/ELT processes, and dimensional modelling.
Experience in developing and maintaining data warehouses on the Azure platform, using technologies such as Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, etc.
Proficient in Power BI development, including data modelling, report creation, and dashboard development.
A strong understanding of DAX functions and expressions to derive valuable insights.
Proficiency in Power Query is essential for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) operations. Power Query allows developers to connect to various data sources, perform data cleansing, and shape the data for reporting purposes.
Strong SQL skills and experience with SQL Server, Azure SQL or similar databases.
Experience working with business stakeholders to gather and understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and a keen eye for creating visually appealing and insightful dashboards.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Azure certifications (e.g., DP-200, DP-201, DA-100) will be a plus.
What’s in it for you?
We’re committed to building inclusive Teams and giving our People the opportunity to grow their careers alongside us
Group Personal Pension: 4% of basic monthly salary (matched by YO!)
Group Income Protection Scheme: up to 75% of your basic monthly salary after 26 weeks’ continuous absence from work due to serious injury or illness
Private Medical Cash Plan: including dental, GP access, physiotherapy, money back on contact lenses and 24/7 Employee Assistance Line
Brilliant support services designed to enhance mental and financial wellbeing including mental health first aid courses, access to Wagestream and our mental health Partner Minding Minds
Bespoke reward platform including access to retail, cinema & gym discounts
50% off your food every time you dine with us for you and 3 friends
Annual Awards ceremony celebrating our success and offering winning Managers free trips to Japan and lots more
We’re committed to building inclusive Teams and giving our People the opportunity to grow their careers alongside us

The SNOWFOX Group is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all
backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and
accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour,
national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age,
genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family
status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Power BI Platform Developer
description:
Date: Jul 7, 2025
Location: Wright-Patterson Air Force Bas, Ohio, United States
Company: HII's Mission Technologies division
Requisition Number: 23839
Required Travel: 0 - 10%
Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt
Anticipated Salary Range: $80,517.00 - $110,000.00
Security Clearance: Ability to Obtain
Level of Experience: Mid

This opportunity resides with Warfare Systems (WS), a business group within HII’s Mission Technologies division. Warfare Systems comprises cyber and mission IT; electronic warfare; and C5ISR systems.
HII works within our nation’s intelligence and cyber operations communities to defend our interests in cyberspace and anticipate emerging threats. Our capabilities in cybersecurity, network architecture, reverse engineering, software and hardware development uniquely enable us to support sensitive missions for the U.S. military and federal agency partners.

Meet HII’s Mission Technologies Division
Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense – the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that’s right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.

To learn more about Mission Technologies, click here for a short video: https://vimeo.com/732533072
Job Description
HII Mission Technologies is seeking an experienced Power BI Platform Developer to help support our customer at Wright Patterson AFB. This role will work closely with the organization application development team. The contractor will support organization's efforts to develop and implement the Digital Business Operations strategy. The contractor will leverage Microsoft Power Platform tools—Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI—to create innovative solutions that drive process optimization and automation that to reduce toil and improve operational efficiency. As part of the Innovation team, the contractor will develop and maintain applications using Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI.

Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements and define project scope. Design user-friendly interfaces and ensure application performance and quality. Integrate data across apps. Conduct code reviews and provide mentorship to junior developers. Troubleshoot and optimize existing applications for improved efficiency.
Essential Job Responsibilities
1. Application Development:
Design and develop custom applications using Power Apps to meet organizational needs.
Build automated workflows with Power Automate to enhance operational efficiency.
Support data BI SME to build interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI for data visualization.
Create reusable components and templates to streamline the app development process.
2. Collaboration and Requirements Gathering:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and translate them into effective application solutions.
Work closely with stakeholders to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
3. Advanced Functionality Implementation:
Utilize Power Platform’s advanced capabilities, including integration with Microsoft Dataverse and third-party data sources.
Implement best practices for app development, data management, and user experience to ensure clarity and usability.
Build a platform in Azure that can digest forms, populate a structured database, and leverage Azure OpenAI for processing.
4. Data Integration:
Implement data integration solutions across Power Apps, connecting to various data sources such as SharePoint, SQL Server, and external APIs.
Support Data SME to develop and manage data models to ensure seamless data flow between applications.
Utilize Power Automate to create workflows that integrate data across different systems, ensuring consistency and accuracy.
Provide technical expertise in leveraging Power Platform to address specific business challenges and support data-driven decision-making.
5. Training and Knowledge Sharing:
Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate users on Power Platform tools and best practices.
Foster a culture of digital literacy within the RQ by sharing insights, tips, and techniques for citizen development.
Serve as a subject matter expert on Power Platform, providing mentorship and support to team members as needed.
6. Guide Environment Setup
Set up a new Power Platform environment through the Microsoft Power Platform admin center.
Determine the type of environment needed (e.g., production, development, test) based on organizational requirements.
Guide definition and configuration of security roles to ensure proper access control for users and administrators.
Establish best practices for application development, including naming conventions, version control, and coding standards.
Set up monitoring tools to track performance, usage, and any issues within the Power Platform environment.
Minimum Qualifications
6 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 4 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 10 years relevant experience.

Active Secret Clearance or ability to obtain a clearance required.

CompTia Security + certification required at time of hire.
The listed salary range for this role is intended as a good faith estimate based on the role's location, expectations, and responsibilities. When extending an offer, HII's Mission Technologies division takes a variety of factors into consideration which include, but are not limited to, the role's function and a candidate's education or training, work experience, and key skills.

Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Do You Need Assistance?
If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to buildyourcareer@hii-co.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Mission Technologies.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description:
The Business Intelligence Developer is a key contributor to True Homes’ data-driven decision-making strategy. This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining intuitive, high-impact data visualizations and analytics solutions primarily using Power BI and the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem. The BI Developer will partner with business stakeholders, data architects, and engineers to translate business needs into scalable, cloud-native BI solutions aligned with enterprise standards and strategic objectives.

Partner with Data Architects and Engineers to define and evolve cloud-first data architecture within Azure Synapse, Data Lake, Delta Lake, and OneLake

Troubleshoot production issues and manage report lifecycle in collaboration with IT support and DevOps

Builds trust and credibility with stakeholders through integrity, reliability, and transparency
Encourages data-driven culture through collaboration, training, and evangelism of BI best practices
Demonstrates ownership and follow-through, resolving issues proactively and independently
Drives innovation by embracing new tools within Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Power BI
Promotes consistency in design patterns, naming conventions, and data practices across BI assets
Maintains compliance with internal data policies, quality standards, and security protocols
Delivers Power BI solutions on time that meet business objectives

Drives engagement by creating a climate where people are motivated to their best to help the organization achieve its objectives
Drives results by consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances
Ensures decision quality by making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward
Plans and aligns by planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
Ensures accountability by holding self and others accountable to meet commitments
Manages conflict by handling conflict effectively, with a minimum of noise

Focuses on action by taking on new opportunities/tough challenges with a sense of urgency, energy/enthusiasm

High school diploma or GED required

Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric, including Data Factory, Notebooks, and Lakehouses

General Requirements:
Exceptional attention to detail
Strong communication skills, written, and verbal skills
Strong organizational skills

Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment

title: Consultant-Business Strategy
description:
When you join Verizon
You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the #VTeamLife.
What you’ll be doing...
The Verizon Business Group Strategy team holds a key role in helping shape this new path. As a key member of the VBG Strategy team’s Analytics Center of Excellence, you will be finding and analyzing data to answer a number of strategic questions to support our executive team in the Verizon Business Group. Your analyses will form the basis of recommendations that shape the way Verizon goes to market, services our customers, builds new products, and much more! These requests will come from all corners of the organization including Global Enterprise, Business Markets, Product, and Strategic Governance. You will support these strategy professionals across our organization in the development of their strategic recommendations when it comes to everything from data sourcing to query formulation to data stitching to analytical modelling. In order to succeed, you will become an expert in Verizon’s data architecture and ecosystems as well as developing and maintaining strong relationships with the key data stakeholders in the company.
Collaborating with stakeholders, data engineers, developers, and business leaders on initiatives that require an analytical expertise and/or an analytical solution
Sourcing data from key stakeholders, company systems, surveys, and external 3rd party sources
Efficiently joining and manipulating numerous large, disparate datasets, ensuring data integrity and accuracy
Identifying and implementing opportunities for parallel processing and query optimization to improve data retrieval times
Contributing to the development and enhancing of data warehousing solutions
Investigating data issues to resolve inconsistencies and ensuring high quality
Finding answers to difficult strategic questions through deep analysis and formulating actionable recommendations
Socializing solutions and gathering feedback to ensure accuracy and actionability of analysis and recommendations
Visualizing data and building presentations to help stakeholders, leaders, and executives understand the analysis
Leveraging advanced analytics/modeling to examine word frequency and sentiment, cluster natural groupings, and predicting key phenomena to help us prioritize the right things
Asking good questions and probing deeply to learn more every day about important business processes and opportunities
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
A Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience
Four or more years of relevant experience required, demonstrated through work experience and/or military experience
Proficiency using SQL
Understanding of advanced data engineering (e.g., building data pipelines, data cleansing, fuzzy matching, etc.)
Understanding of advanced statistical methods (e.g., regression, classification algorithms, gradient boosted ensembles, etc.) and experience in data analytics platforms and visualization software tools
Ability to translate complex ideas and express them in concise, simple to understand ways
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, meet deadlines, and simultaneously work on multiple projects
Comfortable working across all levels of an organization, leveraging organizational, interpersonal, presentation, and time-management skills
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
Advanced degree in a technical field (in particular, Data Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics) or MBA
Two or more years of experience in a quantitative/technical role (e.g., data engineering, data science, applied analytics, mathematics, engineering, etc.), even better for a tier 1 management consulting firm
Proficiency using Python or R
Knowledge of data engineering and data science tools (e.g., Alteryx, Knime) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
Experience with business problem definition, insight synthesis, and executive communication
If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.
Where you’ll be working
In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40
Equal Employment Opportunity
Verizon is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to veteran status, disability or other legally protected characteristics.
Benefits and Compensation
Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefit options including: medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability, basic life insurance, supplemental life insurance, AD&D insurance, identity theft protection, pet insurance and group home & auto insurance. We also offer a matched 401(k) savings plan, stock incentive programs, up to 8 company paid holidays per year and up to 6 personal days per year, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. Depending on the role, employees have the opportunity to receive compensation in the form of premium pay such as overtime, shift differential, holiday pay, allowances, etc. Newly hired employees receive up to 15 days of vacation per year, which grows with additional service. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.
The annual salary range for the location(s) listed on this job requisition based on a full-time schedule is: $105,500.00 - $184,000.00.

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Position Overview
We are seeking a Power BI Developer with a deep understanding of the Power BI platform and its capabilities. This role will focus on creating impactful visualizations, managing the integration of Power BI within enterprise environments, and driving user adoption. While a foundational understanding of data engineering processes is important, this role is centered on Power BI development, integration, and optimization.
Key Responsibilities
Develop dynamic and interactive Power BI dashboards, reports, and KPI scorecards that meet business requirements.
Utilize advanced Power BI features, including:
- Subscriptions and data alerts for automated notifications.
- Integration with Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, and SharePoint for collaboration and workflow automation.
- Row-Level Security (RLS) to enforce data access policies.
- Power BI Service and Premium capabilities such as shared datasets, app workspaces, and dataflows.
Optimize report performance through effective data modeling, DAX optimization, and Power Query transformations.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, translate business needs into technical solutions, and provide best-practice guidance.
Configure and manage Power BI environments, ensuring alignment with governance policies and enterprise standards.
Integrate Power BI with external data sources, APIs, and third-party tools as needed.
Promote Power BI adoption by conducting user training and creating documentation for self-service BI users.
Required Skills
3-5 years of hands-on experience with Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service.
Expertise in DAX, Power Query (M), and creating calculated measures, columns, and hierarchies.
Strong knowledge of Power BI's capabilities, including data alerts, subscriptions, dataflows, and app workspaces.
Familiarity with integrating Power BI into broader Microsoft ecosystems such as Teams, SharePoint, and Power Automate.
Solid understanding of data modeling concepts, including star schemas and relational data models.
Proficiency in managing Power BI environments, including tenant administration and Row-Level Security (RLS).
Preferred Skills
Experience with Power BI Paginated Reports and Report Builder.
Knowledge of Power BI Premium capacities, including large dataset management and XMLA endpoints.
Familiarity with data warehouse principles and how data engineers' structure and persist data.
Azure certifications (e.g., Azure Fundamentals, Power Platform certifications).
Why Join Oakwood?
Competitive compensation with bonus potential.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision benefits.
Generous PTO and paid holidays.
Professional development opportunities, including certification support and training programs.
Flexible work environment with remote and hybrid options.
This position does not provide immigration-related sponsorship. Please don’t apply for this role if you will need sponsorship now or in the future. Thank you.

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
About Peraton
Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.

Program Overview
Encompasses technical, engineering, data analytics, cyber security, management, operational, logistical, and administrative support for Bureau of Diplomatic Security, Cyber and Technology Security Directorate in three key offices/functional areas: Cyber Monitoring and Operations, Cyber Threat and Investigations, and Technology Innovation and Engineering State.

About The Role

Peraton is looking for a Senior Power BI Developer to become part of Peraton's Department of State (DOS) Diplomatic Security Cyber Mission (DSCM) program providing leading cyber and technology security experience to enable innovative, effective and secure business processes.

Location: Arlington, VA

We are currently seeking a Senior Power BI Developer with experience in SharePoint Development and Administration to join our team. As the ideal candidate, you will need to be skilled in creating data visualizations with various backend data sources, designing data models, and writing complex queries. Additionally, you will need to be proficient in designing SharePoint spoke and hub sites using SharePoint lists and metadata. If you are a motivated and experienced professional with a passion for Power BI and SharePoint, we encourage and invite you to apply to this exciting opportunity.

In this role, you will:

Develop and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards, ensuring data accuracy and performance.
Integrate Power BI with Dataverse and SharePoint to create comprehensive data solutions.
Write and optimize complex DAX queries for advanced data analysis.
Design, create, and manage SharePoint hub and spoke sites.
Manage SharePoint metadata and permissions to ensure proper access and organization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Provide technical support and training to end-users as needed.
Lead SharePoint migration projects, including planning, execution, and post-migration support.
Develop and implement customized SharePoint-based configurations using best practices.
Create and manage workflows to improve process efficiency and guide business teams on best practices.

General:

Need to have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Diagnose and resolve issues within Power BI solutions, ensuring data integrity and performance
Have excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Have the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Possess strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
Have experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe) development.
Have experience in preparation of business requirements documents, functional requirements documents, governance documents, test plans, training documents, and user guides.
Have experience with other Microsoft 365 tools and services (e.g., Teams, OneDrive).
Possess knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
Have a strong understanding of the relationships between operational needs and business processes, ensuring alignment of technical architectures with business strategies.
Have a strong understanding of data modeling, data visualization, and business intelligence concepts.
#DSCM

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 9 years' of relevant experience. An additional 4 years of experience will be considered in lieu of degree/education.
Either possess or obtain prior to start date ONE of the following certifications:
CASP+ CE, CCNA Cyber Ops, CCNA-Security, CCNP Security, CEH, CFR, CISA, CISSP (or Associate), Cloud+, CySA+, GCED, GCIA, GCIH, GICSP, SCYBER, VCA DCV, PPDA, Agile IC, SNOW App Dev
Power BI Skills:
Proficiency in designing and building data models that accurately represent business needs and facilitate efficient analysis.
Proficiency in building interactive and dynamic dashboards and reports to present data insights and enable data-driven decision-making.
Experience with Power BI integration with Dataverse and SharePoint.
Experience utilizing DAX to create custom calculations, measures, and filters within Power BI models.
Ability to optimize Power BI performance and troubleshoot issues.
Experience connecting Power BI to various data sources, including databases, Excel files, and cloud services.
Familiarity migrating dashboards using deployment pipelines
SharePoint Skills:
Experience in creating and managing hub and spoke sites.
Proficiency in managing SharePoint metadata and permissions.
Knowledge of SharePoint Online, Teams and SharePoint Server
Ability to design and implement SharePoint workflows and custom solutions.
Experience with SharePoint Designer and workflows development.
Microsoft 365 Skills:
Experience with Microsoft 365 apps and services such as Teams, OneDrive, Power Platform (Power BI, PowerApps, Power Automate).
Experience with Azure Active Directory, Azure DevOps, and Azure integration with Microsoft 365.
U.S. citizenship required.
Active Secret security clearance.
The ability to obtain a final Top Secret security clearance.

Desired:

Power BI Skills:
Experience with Power BI Desktop, Service and Power BI Embedded.
Knowledge of Power Query, DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M (Powe Query Formula) languages.
Familiarity with Power BI security and governance best practices.
SharePoint Skills:
Experience with SharePoint Framework (SPFx) for custom development.
Experience integrating Power Apps and Power BI into SharePoint sites
Knowledge of Power Automate (formerly Microsoft Flow) for automating workflows.
Familiarity with SharePoint migration tools and processes (e.g., Sharegate, MetaLogix).
Proficiency in SharePoint Designer, InfoPath forms, workflows development, and customization using jQuery, Java, and Query String.
Proficiency in C#, VB, Visual Studio, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, ASP, JavaScript, XML, CSS, HTML, AJAX, and web services.
Experience with PowerShell commands for backup and restore operations.

Certifications:

Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description:
Drive Smarter Decisions with Data
Are you a data-driven professional who thrives at the intersection of finance and analytics? Merchants Fleet is looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join our team and empower our Finance Operations and FP&A teams with the tools and insights they need to make impactful decisions.
In this role, you'll act as a strategic partner—translating complex business questions into powerful reporting solutions. Your dashboards, models, and insights will directly influence high-level financial planning, performance tracking, and strategic direction.

Location: Merchants Fleet Headquarters in Hooksett, NH (Hybrid)

What You'll Do:
Partner with Finance Operations and FP&A teams to define reporting and data need
Explore and integrate data across systems to support real-world financial use cases
Design scalable data models aligned with reporting and forecasting goals
Build intuitive dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar tools
Collaborate with data engineering to access and transform source data
Ensure consistency, clarity, and accuracy across data layers
Create documentation that promotes transparency and a shared understanding of data
Act as a trusted analytics advisor to key finance stakeholders
What You Bring:
5+ years of experience in BI development or analytics engineering with a focus on financial or operational data
Expertise in SQL, Snowflake, and Power BI (or equivalent BI tools)
Strong understanding of financial concepts (forecasting, budgeting, variance analysis)
Experience designing semantic layers and data models for business use
Excellent communication skills—able to explain technical solutions to non-technical users
Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT tools (e.g., Matillion, Databricks, SSIS)
Familiarity with data governance platforms, especially Atlan, is a plus
Background in finance, accounting, or economics is a strong advantage
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Applied Mathematics, Data Engineering, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related technical field
A business degree (Finance, MBA, etc.) is a plus

The Company
You're invigorated by team collaboration and a fast-paced work environment. Opportunities for growth motivate you to always bring your A-game. You're tired of being told "no" when you think of ways to improve, innovate, and do things better.
There's a place for people like you. Welcome to Merchants Fleet.
We've been around for more than 60 years, but we're the fastest growing fleet management company in North America. The fleet industry is behind every delivered package, the summertime memories kids make on their way to camp, and the heavy-duty trucks and vans that keep the lights on. That's a lot of responsibility, and why we want our employees to always be at their best.
Everything at Merchants Fleet is fueled by our entrepreneurial spirit, including:
Leadership who truly lead and engage with employees
Real career paths and the tools you need to grow and develop
A work environment that's encouraging and collaborative
We know employees won't stay if they're not happy, which is why we provide a great benefits package on top of our award-winning work environment. In fact, we've just made the "Great Companies to Work For in NH" list for the eighth year in a row and have a 88% employee satisfaction score (higher than the national average of 57%).
So, what are you waiting for? See why a career with Merchants Fleet is the best decision your future self has ever made.

We are fortunate to have an in-house team of Talent Acquisition experts who meet the needs of our business. Because they are AWESOME, we do not need support from external recruiting partners to identify talent or augment staffing for this role.

Join Center Stage at Merchants Fleet: Explore More + Apply Today! Merchants Fleet® is the fastest-growing and most electric fleet management company in North America, serving over 20 diverse industries, powered by 700 employees in 29 states with HQ in New Hampshire and Innovation Center in the Chicago area.
Discover the unique benefits, perks and rewarding culture we offer you — download the Merchants Fleet 2025 Total Rewards Employee Benefits Guide today! Visit www.merchantsfleet.com/explore
Merchants Fleet is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. If you require an accommodation with our hiring process please send an email to careers@merchantsfleet.com or call (603) 836-6483. To provide all candidates with the highest level of our attention, Merchants Fleet does not accept uninvited solicitations or resumes from third parties. All workplace policies, required notices and guidelines (including EEO posters, CCPA notice for California residents) are available online.

title: Construction Reporting Analyst
description:

About the Company

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Overview
Who we are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for transforming data into insights that drive business value. This position works closely with stakeholders across departments to identify trends, develop dashboards, and support data-driven decision-making.

This role is expected to work with information digital solutions, Risk team members, Enterprise D&A, business stakeholders, and vendors to help formulate strategies that support the Company’s strategic vision, maximize revenue, client retention and reducing risk. All solutions must meet Toyota’s technology standards.
Primary Job Accountabilities
Data Management: Extraction, Analysis, and Reporting:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from internal and external sources.
Partner with the business to identify data and reporting needs.
Manage SQL, query, and other related databases for data analysis.
Perform data modeling using Python and/or other relevant programming languages.
Develop, manage, and communicate data analysis and reports.
Manage and maintain process documentation and reports within Power BI.
Perform proof of concept for reports and other business solutions.
Support the Company’s vision for cloud-based data and reporting strategy.
Oversee the development of reports (dashboards, views), from discovery through implementation, and ensure alignment with BI data and reporting governance practices.
Facilitate and participate in project status meetings to identify and resolve issues and mitigate risks.
Business Support:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions.
Lead the business requirements/user stories gathering sessions with stakeholders and IT to understand what data is required to support projects or initiatives.
Ensure business needs and requirements are communicated, understood and documented. Translate the business and user requirements into system requirements.
Leverage the understanding of our business and system processes to propose data solutions that are aligned with the business’ needs.
Analyze programming requirements using business knowledge, subject matter experts (SMEs), and programming languages.
Develop new tools to support the automation of current manual processes and reports.
Apply problem-solving and analytical skills to uncover insights buried in data.
Evaluate effects and implications of possible actions based on data insights, feedback provided by customers, employees, policies, SOPs and regulations.
Support data stewardship.
Risk Management:
Support the Enterprise Risk Management Committee (ERMC); including assisting with analysis, reports and recommendations.
Monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRI’s) continuously.
Develop and enhance reports for Portfolio Management.
Conduct data segregation to understand the root cause of issues.
Build data-driven presentations and reports for TCPR Executives and business stakeholders.
Database Management:
Ensure calibration of models while enhancing controls (Auto Approval, CDX, Pricing, etc.)
Assist in the development of applications with a focus on data classification, data privacy, data protection, and security controls aligned to compliance regulations.
Assess local databases to propose alternatives for standardization and optimization.
Ensure database fields are well documented.
Assist the IT Department in defining and designing different components for local databases.
Write scaling secure code and maintain appropriate programming documentation, including workflows.
Update and validate the reports used for decisioning (i.e., Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge and Skills
Required:
Four-Year College Degree (BA or BS): Business administration, Information Technology
Preferred:
Advanced Degree. Specify: Data Science, Analytics, or Data Management related.
Experience – Subject Matter Expertise
Required
2-5 years of relevant / progressive work experience (in a similar field and/or industry)
Expertise in SQL and querying related databases to acquire the necessary data for analysis.
Ability to interpret and present findings in a clear, concise manner, including the creation and use of charts and graphics to summarize results.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English and Spanish
High degree of organization skills, able to work in a deadline-driven environment
Proficiency in Microsoft Office software: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Outlook
Skilled in data mining and analysis for patterns and trends identification by applying quantitative and analytical tools.
Preferred:
5-10 years of relevant / progressive work experience (in similar field and/or industry)
Python and other relevant programming languages for data modeling.
Expertise in Tableau, Power BI, or other reporting tools
Kaizen, Lean, Agile, Six Sigma
Financial Services, banking, or automotive industry experience
Knowledge and understanding of Portfolio Management
Project management knowledge
Additional Comments, Including Unique Circumstances
Work schedule: Monday-Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. However, there could be instances in which working overtime, weekends and/or during holidays could be required.
Travel could be required up to 5% of the time.
This position is based out of San Juan, Puerto Rico. This position does not offer relocation assistance.
Belonging at Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace all perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Have a question, need assistance with your application or do you require any special accommodations? Please send an email to tcpr_human_resources@toyota.com.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst/BI Engineer
description:

Department: Resources/Data
Location: Liberty Drive Facility Bloomington, IN
Reports To: Director – Finance/IT

title: Sr. Power BI Administrator
description:
Why GMF Technology?
GM Financial is set to change the auto finance industry and is leading the path of embarking on tech modernization – we have a startup mindset, and preserve our small company culture, in a public company environment with financial stability and intense growth over a decade-plus history. We are data junkies and trust in data and insights to advance our business objectives. We take our goal of zero emission, zero collision, zero congestion, and zero friction very seriously. We believe as an auto finance market leader we are in the driver's seat to lead us in the GM EV mission to change the world. We are building global platforms, in LATAM, Europe, China, U.S. and Canada – and we are looking to grow our high-performing team. GMF is comprised of over 10,000 team members globally. Join our fintech culture within a Blue-Chip company where we are changing the way we use technology to support our customers, dealers and business.
Overview:
The Senior Power BI Administrator provides advanced expertise on various projects and supports requests focused on administration, configuration, user support, and developer best practices training for business intelligence and analytics platforms with a specialization in Power BI .

What makes you an ideal candidate?
Manage and monitor the Power BI platform to ensure a stable production environment.
Collaborate with team members to plan and implement Power BI system upgrades, security, auditing, and configuration
Provide capacity planning and performance tuning for the Power BI platform.
Install and manage data gateways and tenant settings.
Regularly maintain terminal and gateway servers and assess the impact of new Power BI releases.
Act as an escalation point for platform issues and liaison with Microsoft Technical Support.
Provide on-call support and direction for Power BI related issues.
Define and document best practices and standards for BI tools.
Ensure compliance with IT policies and service levels.
Act as a Power BI expert, providing training and technical direction.
Communicate production issue status with business and BI team.
Understand SDLC process and project management steps.
Have advanced knowledge of IT systems, infrastructure, security methodologies, and Power BI products.
Possess extensive knowledge in troubleshooting Power BI issues, report development, data modeling , SQL, and database design.
Ability to manage PowerShell scripts, develop metrics and KPIs, and manage multiple projects.

Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent work experience required
5-7 years experience designing, developing, and administering Business Intelligence applications including maintenance and support activities, performance monitoring, tuning, upgrading versions, software configuration, business continuity and disaster recovery planning and general IT processes such as Change Management, Configuration Management, Problem Resolution, and Incident Tracking required
5-7 years of experience with report development, data models and administration processes in an enterprise BI reporting tool required
5-7 years of experience with database software (Oracle, SQL Server, Informatica , etc.) as well as relational and OLAP database designs required
Experience with report development, data modeling , and administration processes in Power BI preferred
Experience with Power BI administration performing system monitoring, log analysis, performance analysis, performance tuning and capacity planning
Experience with data bricks preferred
Bilingual with proficiency in Spanish and Portuguese preferred.
What We Offer: Generous benefits package available on day one to include: 401K matching, bonding leave for new parents (12 weeks, 100% paid), tuition assistance, training, GM employee auto discount, community service pay and nine company holidays.
Our Culture: Our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes innovative ideas, fosters integrity, and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.
Compensation: Competitive pay and bonus eligibility
Work Life Balance: Flexible hybrid work environment, minimum of 2-days a week in office
