title: BI Analyst II
description:
About Us:
Mid-States Distributing is the leading Farm, Ranch, and Home Retail Organization. Our 71+ year old company is owned by 29 independent Farm, Ranch & Home retailers (“Members”) who operate approximately 700 stores across the US and Canada with combined annual sales in excess of 7.5 billion dollars. Our member/owners retail items such as agriculture parts & supplies, petroleum products, hardware & tools, pet food, lawn & garden, animal health supplies, apparel & footwear, sporting goods, and various other products for the Farm, Ranch, and Home.
We are looking for enthusiastic people who like to win! We place a tremendous amount of emphasis on creating a dynamic and positive company culture. Most of our employees will tell you that Mid-States is the best place they’ve ever worked. We value high-energy people with positive mental attitudes who believe in the concept of “serving to wow”! Our consumers are primarily rural people raising kids, pets, cows, and crops so traditional values like God, family, and patriotism are important virtues. So, if you are enthusiastic, competitive, have a great attitude, have excellent written and verbal communication skills, like to build strong relationships, like to win, and refuse to eat meat grown in a lab – Mid-States may be the place for you! If you are not, please apply with our competitors!
POSITION OVERVIEW:
The BI Analyst II is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing scalable business intelligence solutions that empower data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role involves collaborating with stakeholders to translate business requirements into robust data architectures, ensuring data integrity, availability, and optimal performance for BI systems. They ensure that a formal data standard is adhered to and that the company’s data assets align with the business's goals, establishing and maintaining a cohesive data strategy for both internal and external data.
The BI Analyst II is expected to partner with the BI team, senior leaders, and product teams to create scalable, flexible, and reporting solutions that address customer business problems, leveraging Domo as our primary platform for data ingestion, transformation, and visualization.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and maintain data models and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure efficient data storage, integration, and retrieval.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into technical specifications and actionable BI solutions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability across all BI systems and reporting environments.
Create and maintain connections to various data sources in Domo via API, direct query, no code JSON, etc.
Identifies opportunities for standardization of existing workflows and developing more efficient processes to support maximum efficiency and productivity.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
Establish and enforce best practices, standards, and guidelines for BI development and implementation.
Continuously evaluate and recommend improvements to existing BI solutions, staying current with emerging BI technologies and trends.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent work experience will be considered.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence, and/or other related roles.
Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Domo, Power BI, Tableau) and knowledge of ETL processes. Experience with Domo and D365 is a plus.
Have used programming languages such as SQL for data manipulation. R, HTML, CSS, Python, and JavaScript would be a plus.
Demonstrated experience in data visualization, creating reports and dashboards, and working with large and complex datasets.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Strong understanding of data security and compliance best practices.
Proven experience leading BI projects and managing stakeholder expectations.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Generally, the job requires 80% sitting, 10% walking, and 10% standing. This job is performed in a generally clean environment. The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: some lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling, some stooping and significant fine finger dexterity.
TRAVEL:
Some travel involved
OTHER DUTIES:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this position. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Reasonable accommodations may enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
A few words from our COO:
I have had the pleasure to work for some incredible companies during my career, but Mid-States is truly the best company I have ever worked for. Lead by our dynamic CEO, Tom Mahlke, our team strives to provide a unique, exciting, fun, and fulfilling work environment for our staff. Things like drama, laziness, and entitlement have no place in Mid-States, which makes Mid-States a refreshing place to work. We offer competitive salaries, have a fantastic benefits package, and believe in rewarding those who produce. We serve a wonderful industry, and we are financially sound and growing rapidly. If you are an enthusiastic, high-energy person with a positive attitude and the skills described above, you may have just found the last job you will ever apply for! I look forward to meeting you. – Jeff Rash, COO

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
Overview:

Xanterra Travel Collection is a growing, exceptional group of travel and leisure businesses operating across the globe. Our properties/services combine dramatic settings and landmark buildings with exceptional service to deliver unforgettable experiences. We are inspired by our guests, our environment, and each other. Headquartered in our beautiful Greenwood Village, Colorado offices, we strive to create a collaborative experience and a transformational journey for our valued team members. We have a high commitment to sustainability, growth and are seeking driven, innovative individuals who value offerings in career development and professional advancement. Our Travel Collection includes lodging, food and beverage, Windstar Cruises, short-line railroad, and adventure travel companies. Please visit xanterra.com for more information on the company and its environmental initiatives.

We are currently seeking a detail-oriented and driven professional to join us as a Senior Power BI Developer within our Data and Analytics Team. Our technology team is dynamic, with a strong sense of dedication to our customers. In our collaborative and inclusive work environment, individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. Per our company policy, we will require this position to be in office 5 days a week.
Responsibilities:
In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable Power BI dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate closely with business analysts, data engineers, and leadership to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. Per our company policy, we will require this position to be in office 5 days a week.

You Will Make an Impact By
Designing and developing advanced Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations using DAX and Power Query.
Translating business requirements into technical specifications and creating reports that meet business needs.
Optimizing performance of BI solutions, including data modeling and report refresh efficiency.
Connecting to data sources, importing data, and transforming it into Business Intelligence reporting.
Building and maintaining complex data models in Power BI.
Collaborating with data engineering teams to ensure high data quality and availability.
Conducting code reviews and mentoring junior Power BI developers.
Staying current on Power BI features, updates, and industry best practices.
Creating documentation for data models, workflows, and processes.
Working with stakeholders to define KPIs and success metrics.
Ensuring data governance and security best practices are followed.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. 5+ years of hands-on experience in Power BI development, including creating complex reports, dashboards, and custom visualizations. Significant work experience can substitute for formal education. Working knowledge of standard project management methodology, tools and software.
Technical Knowledge: Advanced knowledge of DAX and Power Query for data transformation and modeling in Power BI. Experience in Power BI Service for sharing reports, managing workspaces, and automating report scheduling. Strong understanding of business intelligence concepts and reporting strategies. Ability to work with large datasets and perform performance tuning to ensure scalability and efficiency in Power BI reports. Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering actionable insights to business users. Experience with integrating Power BI with other business systems and data sources is a plus.
Security Knowledge: Knowledge and prior experience with common security and privacy standards – PCI-DSS, GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA — and implicit integration of these security standards in all aspects of your work. Understanding of Power BI workspace roles.
Documentation Toolset Skills: Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to synthesize and present information clearly. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite of products for authoring and collaboration is required.

What Will Set You Apart
Our preferred candidate will also bring one or more of the following skills:

Microsoft Power BI certification (e.g., PL-300 or PL-600).
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and user experience design for BI solutions.
Working knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Ability to interact with team members at all levels of the organization and with cross functional teams.
Experience in travel, hospitality and/or cruise industries.

COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $105,000.00 to $115,000.00.
BENEFITS: For full-time employees, Xanterra offers a comprehensive benefits package including: Medical, Dental & Vision; HSA & FSA; Life & Disability; Accident, Hospital & Critical Illness; Pet Insurance; PTO and paid Holidays; 401(k) with Company Match; Employee Assistance Plan; Education Assistance; RTD-Denver transit pass for in-office employees, and Employee Discounts & Travel Deals.
EEO: Xanterra is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Freelance Data Modeler & Analytics Engineer – Build the Pipelines That Power Insight
description:
Do you turn messy source systems into streamlined, query-ready data models?
Is writing high-performance SQL, orchestrating API ingestions, and stitching it all together in cloud warehouses your idea of a good day? If so, we’d love to meet you.
We’re a fast-growing data & analytics consultancy serving mission-driven organizations in Non-Profit, Education, Healthcare — and beyond. Your mission: architect scalable data models, build robust pipelines (from APIs to databases), and deliver clean, trusted datasets that unlock reporting and advanced analytics in tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
The Opportunity
You’ll sit at the heart of our data engineering workflow — from source analysis and schema design to ELT pipelines and documentation. Your work will guarantee that analysts and visualization developers always have fast, reliable, and well-governed data at their fingertips.
What You’ll Do
Analyze & Architect Data Models – Profile raw sources, capture business logic, and design dimensional or 3NF schemas that balance flexibility and performance.
Build End-to-End Pipelines – Ingest data from APIs, databases, flat files, and SaaS tools; automate transformations using SQL, dbt, or similar frameworks.
Optimize SQL & Warehousing – Write clear, maintainable queries; tune for speed and cost-efficiency on Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or comparable platforms.
Expose Clean Analytics Layers – Package data for BI consumption (Tableau experience a must) and set up extracts, views, or semantic layers with appropriate security.
Document & Govern – Produce ERDs, data dictionaries, and lineage diagrams; champion data quality checks and version control.
Collaborate Across Functions – Work closely with analysts, dashboard developers, and business stakeholders to validate requirements and iterate quickly.
Stay Current – Track advancements in cloud warehousing, orchestration, and API tooling, bringing the best of them into our practice.
Must-Haves
Expert-Level SQL – Proven ability to write, refactor, and debug complex queries on at least one major RDBMS.
Data-Modeling Mastery – 3-5+ years designing star, snowflake, or normalized schemas for analytics workloads.
Pipeline Development – Hands-on experience building automated ELT processes and consuming third-party APIs.
Tableau Familiarity – Comfortable publishing data sources and troubleshooting performance for Tableau (experience with other BI tools a plus).
ETL/ELT Tooling – Proficient with Tableau Prep, dbt, Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivalent.
Autonomous & Deadline-Driven – Manage your own sprints, surface risks early, and deliver polished work without hand-holding.
Nice-to-Haves
Tableau Desktop/Server/Cloud Certification.
Python or JavaScript for custom API connectors and data validation.
Experience with orchestration tools (Airflow, Prefect) and CI/CD pipelines.
Background in Non-Profit, Education, or Healthcare analytics.
Passion for data governance frameworks (Data Vault, Kimball, Medallion).
Why Work With Us?
Impactful Projects – Your data pipelines will fuel decisions that genuinely improve lives.
End-to-End Visibility – See your models come to life in dashboards and advanced analytics.
Flexible, Remote Freedom – Plan your schedule, work from anywhere, and integrate projects around other commitments.
Competitive Compensation – We value expertise and are prepared to offer excellent rates, determined by your experience, portfolio, and demonstrated capabilities, particularly in data-modeling leadership and efficient, budget-conscious solution delivery.
Collaborative Culture – Small, expert team that values knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement.
To Apply
Please provide:
Brief Cover Note – Tell us what you’re up to now, how your data-modeling and pipeline experience aligns with this role, and your typical rate expectations.
Resume / CV – Highlighting relevant projects, tech stack, and any certifications.
Sample Work or Portfolio (preferred) – ERDs, code snippets, or anonymized notebooks that showcase your best-practice craftsmanship.
Apply through the platform where you discovered this posting — no lengthy forms, just your essentials. We review applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to qualified candidates for a quick chemistry chat.
We’re excited to see how you architect data that powers meaningful insight. Let’s build something impactful together!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Pay: Up to $100.00 per hour
Experience:
Data modeling: 3 years (Required)
License/Certification:
Tableau Certification (Preferred)
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist
description:
OUR STORY

TechInsights is the information platform for the semiconductor industry.

Regarded as the most trusted source of actionable, in-depth intelligence related to semiconductor innovation and surrounding markets, TechInsights’ content informs decision makers and professionals whose success depends on accurate knowledge of the semiconductor industry—past, present, or future.

Over 650 companies and 125,000 users access the TechInsights Platform, the world’s largest vertically integrated collection of unmatched reverse engineering, teardown, and market analysis in the semiconductor industry. This collection includes detailed circuit analysis, imagery, semiconductor process flows, device teardowns, illustrations, costing and pricing information, forecasts, market analysis, and expert commentary. TechInsights’ customers include the most successful technology companies who rely on TechInsights’ analysis to make informed business, design, and product decisions faster and with greater confidence. For more information, visit www.techinsights.com.




THE OPPORTUNITY:

TechInsights is seeking a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team and play a key role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. Our Data Analytics team is dedicated to delivering clear, goal-oriented analysis that informs leadership and supports operational improvements and future business initiatives.

In this role, you’ll leverage your expertise in data analytics—from data wrangling and processing to advanced analysis and visualization—to develop and deploy impactful Tableau dashboards, reports, and data models. You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders to ensure business decisions are guided by accurate, meaningful, and accessible data. Your ability to bring structure to ambiguity and communicate insights with clarity will be essential to your success.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Partner with business stakeholders to understand operational goals, challenges, and data needs.
Design, develop, and maintain advanced Tableau dashboards that provide clear, actionable insights into critical KPIs and metrics.
Build and manage scalable Tableau and PostgreSQL data sources to support complex analytical needs.
Identify, investigate, and resolve data inconsistencies; perform root cause analyses and collaborate with system owners on remediation.
Ensure ongoing data quality through continuous monitoring, validation, and dashboard reconciliation.
Regularly evaluate and enhance existing dashboards to improve accuracy, usability, and business relevance.
Document data models, sources, and reporting processes to support team knowledge sharing and continuity.
Serve as a trusted analytics advisor to non-technical users, providing guidance on data access and interpretation.
Share best practices, tools, and innovations with the Data Analytics team to drive continuous improvement.
Support a data-driven culture by developing internal resources such as how-to guides, documentation, and training sessions.


WHO YOU ARE
Expert in data visualization and reporting, with strong Tableau Cloud experience and a user-centric approach to dashboard design; experience with other BI tools is a plus.
Strong critical thinker and problem solver with keen attention to detail; able to identify data anomalies, ensure accuracy, and drive business decisions through data.
Highly proficient in data preparation techniques and quick to adapt to new tools and technologies.
Advanced SQL skills and strong knowledge of common database systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL); comfortable working with data warehouses and data modeling.
Possesses executive presence and can confidently present complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.
A collaborative team player with a track record of working effectively across teams and departments.
Self-motivated and quick to learn in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Familiarity with the Atlassian suite (e.g., Jira, Confluence) and Salesforce is a plus.
A background in statistical modeling would be ideal.
Willing and able to work onsite from our Greenwood Village, CO office

As part of the recruitment process for this position, you will be required to submit your latest citizenship and/or permanent residency information. This information will be used to comply with U.S. Export Control Laws and Regulations.

WHY WORK WITH US
High growth company driven by high performance
Competitive pay and generous benefits (medical, dental, vision, wellness, RRSP/401K Matching)
Expected salary: $118,000 to $132,000 USD
Flexible vacation policy
Annual fitness reimbursement
Bring your own device program
Strong sense of camaraderie, mutual respect, and shared goals among colleagues
Support for community through charitable alliances
Professional and career development opportunities
Wellness resources and support from management
Technology knows no bounds, and neither does TechInsights. Bringing together talented humans from different perspectives, backgrounds and abilities is something we take seriously. We’re committed to building an inclusive environment that welcomes you to be your authentic self and allows us to push past the boundaries together.
TechInsights is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
As part of any recruitment process, TechInsights collects and processes personal data relating to job applicants. We are committed to being transparent about how we collect and use that data and to meeting our data protection obligations. Our Privacy policy can be referenced here: https://www.techinsights.com/privacy-policy

title: Data Modeler/Power BI Lead
description:
Job Overview
Data Modeler/PowerBI Lead: As our Data Modeler and PowerBI Lead, you will play a central role in transforming data from multiple systems into actionable insights through advanced data modeling and dynamic Power BI reports/dashboards. You will collaborate across teams—including data integration specialists and business stakeholders—to design and maintain robust data models and deliver impactful reports. Your ability to translate business requirements into intuitive visualizations and reliable models will drive strategic decision-making across the organization.

Key Aspects of the role include:
Blending data modeling and Power BI development expertise to create comprehensive business intelligence solutions.
Supporting data-driven initiatives through clean, accurate, and optimized data models and visualizations.
Job Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models to support business analysis and reporting.
Create and enhance interactive Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to business needs.
Develop and optimize DAX calculations and measures for insightful analytics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Maintain data dictionaries and metadata to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Monitor report performance and troubleshoot issues in Power BI solutions.
Ensure compliance with data security standards and governance practices.
Provide user support and training to empower data-driven decision-making.
Stay informed on Power BI updates, data modeling techniques, and industry trends.

Education – Experience Required
Minimum 3 years of experience in data modeling and Power BI development.
Advanced proficiency in Power BI including dashboard/report design and DAX.
Strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Understanding of data warehouse concepts and relational databases.
Experience with performance tuning and query optimization.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Adaptability in a fast-paced, changing business environment.

title: Power BI Lead (CPG)
description:
Tiger Analytics is a fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.

The right candidate will have broad skills in database design, be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, have experience building self-service dashboards, be comfortable using visualization tools, and be able to apply your skills to generate insights that help solve business challenges. We are looking for someone who can bring their vision to the table and implement positive change in taking the company's data analytics to the next level.
We are also market leaders in AI and analytics consulting in the CPG & retail industry with over 40% of our revenues coming from the sector. This is our fastest-growing sector and we are beefing up our talent in the space.
We are looking for someone with a good blend of business consulting skills and a data analytics background to add to our team.

Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
10+ years of experience in a Business Intelligence space
Knowledge of Power BI Business intelligence reporting tool is a must
Knowledge of SQL is a must
Deep knowledge and understanding of the CPG space in Sales, marketing and Supply chain.
Experience and knowledge with Data Warehouse ETL process using SSIS packages is preferred
Ability to engage with executive/VP-level stakeholders from the client’s team to translate business problems into high-level analytics solution approaches.
Consulting experience is highly preferred

title: Sr Engineer, Business Intelligence
description:
Thank you for considering a career at Ensemble Health Partners!
Ensemble Health Partners is a leading provider of technology-enabled revenue cycle management solutions for health systems, including hospitals and affiliated physician groups. They offer end-to-end revenue cycle solutions as well as a comprehensive suite of point solutions to clients across the country.
Ensemble keeps communities healthy by keeping hospitals healthy. We recognize that healthcare requires a human touch, and we believe that every touch should be meaningful. This is why our people are the most important part of who we are. By empowering them to challenge the status quo, we know they will be the difference!
O.N.E Purpose:
Customer Obsession: Consistently provide exceptional experiences for our clients, patients, and colleagues by understanding their needs and exceeding their expectations.
Embracing New Ideas: Continuously innovate by embracing emerging technology and fostering a culture of creativity and experimentation.
Striving for Excellence: Execute at a high level by demonstrating our “Best in KLAS” Ensemble Difference Principles and consistently delivering outstanding results.
The Opportunity:
The Senior Engineer, Business Intelligence plays a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights. This position involves developing and optimizing Power BI reports, building and maintaining data pipelines, and implementing automation tools.
This role will require both analytical depth and technical expertise in data engineering, business intelligence, and automation. The Senior Engineer, Business Intelligence will develop scalable analytics solutions, automate business processes and reports, and act as an administrator for our Power BI and Azure resources.

Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports with complex data models to meet business requirements.
Develop, test, deploy, monitor, and maintain scalable data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Python to ingest, transform, and store data efficiently.
Perform root cause analysis on data discrepancies and production issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Create, manage, and optimize tables within Azure Databricks for use across BI platforms.
Leverage Power Automate to design and deploy automation solutions for routine business tasks and data workflows.
Automate recurring report generation and business processes to improve operational efficiency.
Serve as a Power BI platform administrator, managing permissions, workspace governance, and capacity optimization.
Utilize advanced SQL, DAX, and M language skills to manipulate and analyze large datasets.
Provide mentorship to junior engineers by providing technical guidance on best practices and contribute to knowledge sharing and process improvement initiatives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure requirements are clear and deliver data-driven solutions.
Implement and follow standard SDLC processes and agile methodologies.
Engage in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance reporting capabilities and data quality.
Leverage Databricks and Visual Studio Code for data engineering tasks and workflow automation.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience with relational databases and advanced T-SQL.
3–5 years of experience developing Power BI reports with proficiency in DAX and M languages.
3+ years of experience with ETL processes and best practices and Azure data warehouse concepts, including Azure Databricks and Azure Data Factory.
2+ years of experience with Power Automate and automation tools.
Hands-on experience in Visual Studio Code, Git, and CI/CD pipelines.
Experience in platform administration (Power BI and Azure) including provisioning, monitoring, and policy enforcement.
Proficiency in Python for data engineering tasks.
Experience with tools such as DAX Studio, Performance Analyzer, and Vertipaq.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Healthcare or revenue cycle management experience is strongly preferred.
Essential Job Functions:
Manage big data and create solutions for reporting requirements provided by stakeholders.
Solve problems and perform root cause analysis on production bugs.
Follow standard SDLC process and agile practices within a team.
Develop internal and external partnerships to provide opportunities for efficient solutions to various data, system, and application uses.
Serve as a technical resource and mentor to other developers/engineers and aid in troubleshooting and resolving issues.
Actively review new bugs reported and complete grooming and sprint planning.
Complete bug root cause analysis and work with other teams as needed to resolve issues and complete documentation and notification to the bug reporter at least twice per week.
Be a subject matter expert (SME) of report data modeling, knowledgeable about what each field is used for, and able to determine appropriate uses of data fields to create reporting.
Have advanced knowledge and skills for secondary tools such as Microsoft Azure, SQL data warehouse, Visual Studio, etc.
Possess advanced programming and optimizing skills in DAX, Dax Studio, Performance Analyzer, Vertipaq, SQL, and M languages.
Collect, organize, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy through Power BI report development.
Responsible for data mining, manipulation, and delivery to key stakeholders and executives in accordance with priorities and deadlines.
Form key relationships with and deliver professional, customer-focused service to key stakeholders and executives.
Lead the evaluation of current and future data needs and translate needs to stakeholders and product owners to support all lines of business.
Lead high-level discussions with a focus on making recommendations and identifying how data can support key business decisions.
Identify report requirements and determine how the desired results can be achieved.
Develop and maintain strategic reports from multiple databases and systems.
Complete systems validation for client data, identifying discrepancies in data totals or PKs.
Work with team members as a mentor and provide opportunities for open collaboration to problem-solve or optimize reports.
Have practical application experience with Dax Studio and Performance Analyzer and can optimize reporting based on analysis findings.
Complete code review/peer review of completed work by co-developers and provide feedback identifying issues or required report updates to meet requirements ahead of the report moving to UAT.
Present and/or publish completed reports in accordance with publishing guidelines.
This position pays between $91,400-175,200 based on experience

title: Power BI Technical Lead
description:
Company Overview:
Req ID: 326224
NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.
We are currently seeking a Power BI Technical Lead to join our team in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania (US-PA), United States (US).

Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced and hands-on Power BI Technical Lead to drive the design, development, and delivery of enterprise-level financial reports and dashboards. You will lead a team of BI developers and SQL Developers, collaborate with QAs, business analysts, and other stakeholders, and ensure robust, scalable, and insightful reporting solutions using Microsoft Power BI. This role requires deep expertise in Power BI, data modeling, DAX, and SQL, along with a strong understanding of financial data and reporting processes. Knowledge and hands-on experience with Power BI integration with Snowflake would be preferred.

Location: Oaks/Hybrid
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s (or above) degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
At lease 7-9 years of experience with at least 4 years of experience as a Technical Lead.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Technical Skills:
Proven track record of designing, implementing, and optimizing Power BI solutions.
Strong understanding of data modelling, data visualization, and DAX.
Experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Familiarity with data warehouse concepts.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Certifications: Power BI certifications are a plus.
Responsibilities:
Develop data models, reports, and dashboards that align with business objectives.
Define and manage data architecture based on business reporting needs.
Ensure the Power BI environment can handle large datasets and user loads efficiently.
Gather and analyse requirements, translating them into technical specifications.
Work with data engineers and other teams to integrate Power BI with existing infrastructure and analytics platforms.
Provide guidance and mentorship to development teams on best practices for Power BI development.
Create documentation like solution architecture, design, etc.

About NTT DATA:

NTT DATA is a $30 billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long term success. title: Power BI Technical Lead
description:
Holman is a family-owned, global automotive services organization anchored by our deeply rooted core values and principles that have enabled us to continue Driving What’s Right throughout the last century. Our teams deliver the Holman Experience by treating our customers and each other as we would like to be treated, and creating positive, rewarding relationships all around.
The automotive markets Holman serves include fleet management and leasing; vehicle fabrication and upfitting; component manufacturing and productivity solutions; powertrain distribution and logistics services; commercial and personal insurance and risk management; and retail automotive sales as one of the largest privately owned dealership groups in the United States.
Position Overview:
Holman, a Computerworld 2024 “Best Places to Work in IT” company is hiring an experienced technical lead with strong knowledge of Power BI to shape the future of data analytics by developing a comprehensive roadmap for Power BI adoption, creating best practices and architectural standards, and resolving any technical challenges related to Power BI. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on technical expert who can design scalable and efficient solutions aligned with business needs and serve as the technical authority for Power BI development across the organization. This is a hands-on role that will work closely with the data engineering team (without performing data engineering tasks) and provide leadership on the technical side of report/dashboard creation, data modeling, and semantic layer development.
Key Responsibilities:
Architecture & Design
Lead the design, development, and implementation of the company’s BI architecture and strategy.
Develop and maintain the technical roadmap for Power BI implementation.
Design scalable and performant semantic models to support current and future business needs.
Establish architectural patterns and best practices for Power BI development.
Create and maintain documentation for Power BI architecture standards.
Design robust testing frameworks for Power BI solutions.
Collaborate with data governance team in developing data modeling standards and governance frameworks.
Technical Leadership
Serve as the technical authority for Power BI development.
Provide technical guidance in developing Power BI reports, dashboards, and advanced analytics solutions.
Guide the use of advanced Power BI features such as DAX, custom visuals, and Power Query to deliver high-impact analytical solutions.
Ensure the Power BI environment is optimized for performance, including query performance, report rendering, and dashboard responsiveness.
Guide optimization of DAX queries and data models
Collaborate with data engineering team to ensure data models and data flows are optimized for Power BI consumption.
Ensure proper implementation of security standards
Evaluate and recommend new Power BI features and capabilities
Development & Implementation
Develop complex semantic models using best practices.
Create reusable components and templates for Power BI development.
Build proof-of-concept solutions for new requirements.
Optimize existing solutions for better performance.
Design and implement automated testing solutions.
Create development standards and patterns.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
7+ years of experience in Business Intelligence development
4+ years of hands-on Power BI development experience
Deep expertise in:
Power BI semantic model development
DAX programming
Dimensional modeling
Power BI performance optimization techniques
Power BI architecture and best practices related to dashboard/report development
Power BI paginated report development
Strong understanding of:
Data warehousing concepts
ETL/ELT processes
Data Security implementation
Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL, SQL Server, and Oracle databases
Azure DevOps practices

title: Customer Experience Insights
description:
AppFolio is more than a company. We’re a community of dreamers, big thinkers, problem solvers, active listeners, and multipliers. At every opportunity, we set the pace while delivering innovation built to carry real estate into the future. One in which every experience feels effortless, yet meaningful. Where customers are empowered to take on any opportunity. We show up as one team, connected by our values to be a force for good. Because together, we have the power to create extraordinary outcomes for our customers, our communities, and ourselves.
We’re seeking a data-driven, customer-obsessed Customer Experience Insights expert to help us better understand our customers and optimize their experience across every touchpoint. You’ll be a critical partner in uncovering actionable insights that guide cross-functional decisions and fuel exceptional customer journeys.
Your impact
Drive strategic decision-making by identifying customer insights, opportunities, and pain points through the analysis of structured and unstructured data from multiple sources (e.g. surveys, support tickets, call transcripts, NPS/CSAT/Customer Effort scores, behavioral data)
Socialize insights and influence organizational strategies using tools like Tableau and reports with effective data visualizations and clear narratives
Enhance cross-functional collaboration by acting as a central hub for customer insights, fostering a shared understanding of the customer across all departments, and promoting a customer-centric culture
Partner across Services teams to inform and support efforts to build customer experiences based on customer expectations, needs, preferences, and behaviors
Qualifications
3–5+ years of experience in customer insights, data analysis, or customer experience strategy roles.
Familiarity with survey tools (Qualtrics, Alchemer (fka SurveyGizmo)) and VoC platforms.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate data into clear, actionable recommendations.
Experience interacting cross-functionally with teams such as Product, Customer Support, and Marketing.
Experience working in a fast-paced, data-driven B2B SaaS environment is preferred.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Must have
Expertise in analyzing customer feedback data, using tools like Excel/GSheets and SQL, including text analytics experience.
Experience leveraging data warehouses to extract and transform raw data.
Strong experience building visualizations in Google Slides or PowerPoint and dashboards in Tableau.
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy in reporting.
Curiosity, empathy, and a passion for improving the customer experience.
Location
Find out more about our locations by visiting our site.
Compensation & Benefits
The compensation that we reasonably expect to pay for this role is: $80,000 - $103,000 [base pay / OTE].
The actual compensation for this role will be determined by a variety of factors, including but not limited to the candidate’s skills, education, experience, and internal equity.
Please note that compensation is just one aspect of a comprehensive Total Rewards package. The compensation range listed here does not include additional benefits or any discretionary bonuses you may be eligible for based on your role and/or employment type.

Regular full-time employees are eligible for benefits - see here.

title: Freelance Tableau Developer & Data Visualization Engineer
description:
Are you the kind of Tableau developer who can spot a performance snag before the first extract finishes refreshing?
Do you delight in transforming raw tables into compelling, pixel-perfect dashboards that stakeholders actually use? If you’re equally at ease writing a complex LOD calculation, optimizing a SQL query, and collaborating with designers to elevate user experience, we’d love to meet you.
We’re a fast-growing data & analytics consultancy serving mission-driven organizations in Non-Profit, Education, Healthcare — and beyond. Your mission: translate design briefs (or craft your own when needed), wrangle data, and deliver performant, insightful Tableau solutions that empower our clients to act.
The Opportunity
This role sits at the heart of our delivery pipeline. You’ll own the end-to-end Tableau development lifecycle—from data prep and modelling through dashboard polish and deployment—while partnering closely with our design lead to ensure every build meets both aesthetic and analytical standards.
What You’ll Do
Develop & Optimize Dashboards Build interactive Tableau workbooks that surface key metrics, enable drill-downs, and perform smoothly at scale.
Own Data Prep & Modelling Craft efficient data sources using SQL and Tableau Prep (or the tool of your choice), ensuring refresh reliability and transparent logic.
Collaborate on UX & Design Translate wireframes or high-level requirements into concrete Tableau artifacts; offer feedback to elevate usability and storytelling.
Performance Tune & QA Conduct load testing, identify bottlenecks, and implement best practices in extracts, calculations, and server configuration.
Client-Facing Problem Solving Join occasional workshops or demos to gather requirements, validate prototypes, and transfer knowledge.
Stay Current Track the latest Tableau releases, extensions, and community tricks—so we (and our clients) benefit from every new capability.
What We’re Looking For
Must-Haves
Proven Tableau Development Mastery – 3-5+ years building production dashboards that balance form and function.
SQL Fluency – Comfortable writing, tuning, and debugging queries across at least one major RDBMS.
Tableau Prep Expertise – Able to design repeatable flows for data cleansing and transformation.
Performance & Scaling Know-How – Understand extracts vs. live connections, aggregation strategies, indexing, and VizQL optimization.
Collaboration Skills – Can read a design spec, ask clarifying questions, and iterate quickly in an async, remote environment.
Autonomous & Deadline-Driven – Manage your own sprints, surface risks early, and deliver polished work without hand-holding.
Nice-to-Haves
Tableau Desktop/Server/Cloud Certification (Associate or higher).
Familiarity with Python or R for advanced data shaping.
Experience with Snowflake, Redshift, or other cloud data warehouses.
Exposure to dbt, Alteryx, or other ETL/ELT tools.
Background in Non-Profit, Education, or Healthcare analytics.
Strong data-storytelling skills—turning insights into a compelling narrative.
Why Work With Us?
Impactful Projects – Your dashboards will guide decisions in organizations that genuinely improve lives.
Design-Dev Synergy – Partner with a UX strategist who ensures you’re never coding in a design vacuum.
Flexible, Remote Freedom – Plan your schedule, work from anywhere, and integrate projects around other commitments.
Competitive Compensation – We value expertise and are prepared to offer excellent rates, determined by your experience, portfolio, and demonstrated capabilities, particularly in visualization leadership and efficient, budget-conscious solution delivery.
Collaborative Culture – Small, expert team that values knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement.
To Apply
Please provide:
Brief Cover Note – Tell us what you’re up to now, how your Tableau experience aligns with this role, and your typical rate expectations.
Resume / CV – Highlighting Tableau projects, data environments, and any certifications.
Sample Work or Portfolio (preferred) – Screenshots, public gallery links, or anonymized packaged workbooks that exhibit your best practice craftsmanship.
Apply through the platform where you discovered this posting—no lengthy forms, just your essentials. We review applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to qualified candidates for a quick chemistry chat.
We’re excited to see how you bring data to life. Let’s build something impactful together!
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Pay: Up to $100.00 per hour
Experience:
Tableau: 3 years (Required)
License/Certification:
Tableau Certification (Preferred)
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
This position has a future anticipated start date of September 2025.
The Challenge
As the United States Marine Corps expands its data-centric operational capabilities, the need for expert data visualization and analytics is paramount. What if you could directly support mission-critical decisions by transforming raw data into powerful insights? At JCTM, we’re seeking a Senior Power BI Developer with USMC and DoD expertise to play a leading role in shaping operational readiness through advanced analytics.
Build Your Career
At JCTM, we value knowledge, experience, integrity, and commitment. Joining our team means becoming part of an organization that empowers individuals, prioritizes ethical practices, and fosters a culture of collaboration and growth.
Challenging Projects
As a Senior Power BI Developer, you’ll be the primary visualization lead on strategic data initiatives supporting the Marine Corps and other Department of Defense partners. Your dashboards and data models will directly inform operational planning, resourcing, and readiness across multiple echelons—driving visibility at the AO, O-6, and GO/SES levels.
Key Responsibilities
Lead the development of scalable Power BI solutions, including role-based dashboards, paginated reports, and embedded analytics.
Translate user requirements and client vision into database improvements for enhanced data correlation and visualization
Synthesize multiple disparate data streams from USMC operational units and partnering agencies into interactive and actionable visualization
Design and implement robust data models using DAX and Power Query.
Integrate structured and unstructured data sources across secure networks, ensuring alignment with IL5/IL6 compliance standards.
Collaborate closely with functional and technical teams to enhance data accessibility and fidelity across the enterprise.
Mentor junior analysts and provide expert technical guidance to cross-functional stakeholders.
Act as a key liaison between JCTM and USMC leadership to ensure timely delivery of data products.
Ensure all analytics outputs align with DoD cybersecurity requirements, data governance standards, and STIGs.
State-of-the-Art Technology
Harness a full Microsoft and Azure ecosystem—Power BI, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, and Cognitive Services—within a secure, mission-driven environment.
New Skills
Work side-by-side with senior data strategists, analysts, and mission partners across the USMC and DoD. Build domain knowledge in readiness metrics, command-level data ecosystems, and defense-specific tools such as eDST and DRRS.
Room to Grow
Take ownership of high-visibility projects with strategic importance to national defense. At JCTM, you’ll have the opportunity to broaden your skillset, take on greater responsibilities, and strengthen your expertise through collaboration with senior leaders, mission partners, and cross-functional teams. We foster an environment that supports continuous development and recognizes individual contributions to team success.
You Have
Active TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline (or equivalent experience)
6+ years of experience in Power BI development, including:
Advanced data modeling, DAX, and Power Query
Paginated reporting and role-based visualization
Expertise in data integration (Azure Data Factory, SSIS), ETL, and data governance
Experience working in IL5/IL6 environments and familiarity with DoD compliance frameworks
Proven ability to communicate complex data insights to senior-level military audiences
Nice to Haves
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate
ITIL, PMP, or other project management credentials
DISA Cyber Awareness or DoD 8570 certifications (e.g., Security+)
Prior experience with Marine Corps networks, data workflows, and systems (eDST, DRRS, etc.)
Clearance
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. TS/SCI clearance is required.
Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
JCTM is an Equal Opportunity Employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive internal and external change while supporting the safety and security of our great nation.

title: Jr. Tableau Developer
description:
Job Title – Jr. Tableau Developer
CORMAC is seeking a Jr.Tableau Developer to join our analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and data visualizations that transform raw data into actionable insights. You'll collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to understand reporting needs and bring data to life using Tableau's powerful visualization capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain Tableau dashboards, visualizations, and reporting solutions.
Gather business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Optimize dashboard performance and data model efficiency.
Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure accurate data representation.
Integrate Tableau with various data sources (e.g., SQL Server, Excel, cloud platforms).
Establish best practices for data visualization and storytelling.
Provide support and training to business users on Tableau usage.
Maintain data security and governance standards in Tableau projects.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or related field.
2+ years of hands-on experience developing in Tableau.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases.
Experience with data modeling and ETL processes.
Knowledge of Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud environments.
Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in scripting languages (e.g., Python, R) for data preparation.
Familiarity with other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker).
Understanding of cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery).
Tableau certification (e.g., Tableau Desktop Specialist or Certified Associate).
Why CORMAC?
At CORMAC, we leverage the power of data management and analytics to enable our customers to achieve their strategic goals. With over 20 years of experience in health information technology (HIT), human-centered design principles, and Agile development methodologies, CORMAC delivers complex digital solutions to solve some of the most challenging problems facing public healthcare programs today
As a US Federal Government contractor in the public healthcare sector, our work is impactful and cutting-edge while being performed in a supportive, collaborative, and welcoming environment. We offer flexible work schedules with remote, hybrid, or fully in-person workplace options to empower our employees to decide the workplace most suitable for them. At CORMAC, we have a highly diverse workforce and believe a work environment is a place where creativity, collaboration, enthusiasm, and innovation happen, regardless of location.

description:

Professional Services

Summary: Assurety Consulting, a leader in the postal/parcel ecosystem, seeks highly qualified applicants for a Data Analyst position. This is a full-time position in Washington, D.C., with a hybrid working opportunity 2-3 days a week remotely. This position requires a US Postal Service (USPS) security clearance, and the applicant must be either a US Citizenship or a Green Card holder.

The Sr. Data Analyst-Azure Power BI must have a minimum of 6 years of professional experience analyzing data needs and will work under the guidance and direction of a Lead Analyst and Project Manager. In addition, the Data Scientist will be responsible for using applied statistics to develop solutions, data mining, data analysis, data summarization, and developing client presentations.
Conditions of Employment (REQUIRED):
US Citizenship or Green Card.
The position requires security clearance.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6-9 years of proven experience as a Data Scientist/Analyst/Engineer, preferably with a focus on Azure technologies.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python
Experience with Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, and Azure Data Lake.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Solid understanding of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency in data visualization in Power BI along with hands-on experience with SQL and DAX
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data-related issues and propose effective solutions.
Strong communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Experience Needed:
Develop and implement machine learning models using Azure Machine Learning and other Azure services.
Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that drive business strategies.
Interact with business stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand their data visualization and business intelligence needs
Design, develop, test, and deploy Power BI scripts and generate visually appealing and insightful reports
Use advance level calculations on the data set using DAX functions in Power BI
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) and feature engineering to enhance model performance.
Create and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and related tools.
Write optimized SQL & DAX for data transformation and calculation within reports
Create interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI and other visualization tools.
Collaborate with end users to gather reporting and data analysis requirements
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous data validation processes.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data science and machine learning technologies.
Document processes, methodologies, and best practices for reproducibility.

title: BI Full Stack Developer - Tableau
description:
Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning and AI. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner.
We are seeking an experienced BI Full Stack Developer specializing in Tableau. The ideal candidate will be responsible for end-to-end Tableau dashboard development and design, managing the entire development lifecycle from requirements gathering to deployment, with a strong focus on stakeholder collaboration and management.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the end-to-end development and design of Tableau dashboards, from requirement gathering to deployment.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into scalable Tableau solutions.
Design intuitive, visually impactful dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights.
Manage the full Tableau stack (data preparation, visualization, and user interface design).
Optimize dashboard performance, ensuring high availability and fast loading times.
Integrate Tableau with various data sources and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Provide regular updates to stakeholders and incorporate feedback into design improvements.
Stay updated on Tableau features and best practices to implement innovative solutions.
Requirements
8+ years of experience in Tableau development, design, and full-stack BI development.
Expertise in end-to-end dashboard development, data visualization, and design.
Strong experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to gather business requirements and provide data-driven insights.
Proficiency in SQL, ETL, and data modeling concepts to support Tableau dashboards.
Solid understanding of Tableau server configuration, performance tuning, and access control.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong experience in Supply Chain, CPG, and Retail domains.
Benefits
Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Snowflake/SQL/Tableau exp REQUIRED) Hybrid - Reston, VA
description:
About Ellucian:
Ellucian is a global market leader in education technology. We power innovation for higher education, partnering with more than 2,900 customers across 50 countries and serving over 20 million students. Ellucian's AI-powered platform, trained on the richest dataset available in higher education, drives efficiency, personalized experiences, and strengthened engagement for all students, faculty and staff. Fueled by decades of experience with a singular focus on the unique needs of learning institutions, the Ellucian platform features best-in-class SaaS capabilities and delivers insights needed now and into the future. These solutions and services span the entire student lifecycle, from student recruitment, enrollment, and retention to workforce analytics, fundraising, and alumni engagement. Ellucian's innovative solutions, vast ecosystem of partners, and user community of more than 45,000 provide best practices leading to greater institutional success and achieving better student outcomes.

Values Rooted in Purpose

We embrace the power to lead, the courage to innovate, and the determination to grow. At our core, we believe in humanizing our approach, recognizing that our people are our greatest strength. With a shared vision of transformation, we endeavor to shape a brighter future for higher education.
About the Opportunity:
Ellucian is seeking a passionate and analytical Business Intelligence Analyst (Snowflake/SQL/Tableau exp REQUIRED) to join our Enterprise Data and Analytics team. In this role, you will develop enterprise-level insights to support high-impact decision-making and strategic planning. The ideal candidate brings a consultative, problem-solving mindset, thrives in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, and embraces a self-starter attitude to drive initiatives that support the organization’s digital evolution.
Where you will make an impact
Assist with the definition and creation of executive or summarized-level reporting compiling metrics across different business domains, including board of director level reporting.
Build automated reporting at scale using SQL, Tableau, and PowerBI for strategic programs including cloud modernization, partner ecosystem, and additional business development.
Review and streamline data workflows to enable more seamless cross-functional reporting that provides overviews of company-wide performance.
Partner closely with a variety of stakeholders to validate metrics relevant to their domains to compile, create, and best represent organizational performance metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders, cross-functional teams, and executives to design, develop, and implement data assets and reporting tools that enhance performance transparency and improve outcomes.
What you will bring
2-3 years experience in a similar role
Experience related to data analytics leveraging any software tools such as: Snowflake, Tableau, SQL Queries, Microsoft Excel, PowerBI, etc
Experience researching source systems and interpreting/tracing results back to inputs
Demonstrated interest in handling ad-hoc analysis by querying large databases to deliver insights and answer key business questions
Skilled in translating analytics and KPIs into clear, actionable stories for end-users.
Experience using quantitative and qualitative analysis to deliver actionable insights and recommendations to sales teams and leadership
Knowledge of data analytics methods, structures, and techniques (data extraction, analysis, queries, data blending)
Structured thinker with a high level of attention to detail and organizational skills
Results oriented with thoughtful actions, flexible and collaborative
Creative problem solver with a healthy mix of intellectual agility and curiosity
Interest in data storytelling through qualitative and quantitative data analytics
Communication & presentation skills
Proven ability to drive projects, lead BI demos, and manage stakeholders across departments and organizational levels
Foundational Excel and PowerPoint skills
Demonstrated experience or interest in data management and workflows is a plus
Experience with Salesforce and/or ServiceNow is a plus
What makes #Ellucianlife:
Comprehensive health coverage: medical, dental, and vision
Flexible time off
Thrive Flex Lifestyle Account (LSA) that allows you to contribute towards your health, financial or learning interests
401k w/ match & BrightPlan - to help you save for the future
Parental Leave
5 charitable days to support the community that supports us
Telemedicine
Wellness
Headspace Care (mental health)
Wellbeats (virtual fitness classes)
RethinkCare & Wellthy– caregiver support
Diversity and inclusion programs which provide access to internal employee resource groups
Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team
We Foster a learning culture with:
Education Assistance Program
Professional development opportunities

title: BI Business Analyst
description:
U.S. - What we do matters
By playing this video you consent to Google/YouTube processing your data and using cookies Learn more.
Position Description:
CGI is seeking a data reporting & integration analyst to support a client team in the Department of Justice. The successful candidates will support an application reporting environment that is critical to several areas of the clients business, providing data to help users and executives make informed decisions. The environment includes the IBI WebFOCUS Business Intelligence platform, IBI Data Migrator, Oracle RDMS, and Momentum. The Analysts will perform both support for existing reports and project work (e.g. enhancements, new development of reports).
Our team helps our clients deploy, upgrade and enhance their instances of webFOCUS in order to help them maximize the benefits they derive from using the reporting application, while providing support to ensure that the systems are reliable and stable for their end users.
This position is located in Washington, DC.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
The data reporting & integration analysts responsibilities will include:
Assess, investigate and resolve issues reported by Client support team in webFOCUS
Elicit functional requirements from the business community and work closely with technical team members to develop solutions.
Execute short term projects in the above applications, including owning all functional areas: requirements gathering, documentation, testing, etc.
Regularly contribute to refining operating processes and tooling to improve how the team operates.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Top Secret Clearance required
Minimum Education Required: Bachelors Degree or 5 years work experience covering the desired qualifications.
Desired qualifications/non-essential skills required:
Desired qualifications to be successful in this role
1. 1-3 years experience in software development support, data analytics, or business intelligence reporting
2. Experience troubleshooting and defining application issues
3. Ability to update support and development related documentation, e.g. solution design, testing results
4. Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
5. Ability to gather and understand a clients requirements
6. Experience developing reports in an Agile framework
7. Ability to work independently and conduct research to find solutions that are beyond existing knowledge
8. Track record of being able to quickly learn new applications, and ongoing interest in learning new technologies
9. Programming / scripting experience in modern languages, e.g. SQL, JavaScript or Python
10. Experience with webFOCUS, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, or PowerBI a plus

11. Experience with Momentum or Oracle Financials and understanding of the database/data model
12. Project management experience

title: Power BI Developer
description:
Qualifications (Must Have’s):[skills, knowledge, and expertise required]
PowerBI developer will have extensive PowerBI experience and exceptional data modelling and SQL skills. He or she will have previously used Bookmarks, Custom Visuals, and Field parameters to create flexible user-defined PowerBI experiences.

SQL skills will also be extensive. The developer will have modelled numerous situations and be able to understand and adapt to data needs quickly. He or she will be creative and by able to apply his or her experience on a regular basis.

8-12 Years of overall development experience
5+ Years of PowerBI Development that demonstrates advanced skills
8+ Years of SQL experience modelling data and writing complex queries
GIT for version control
Nice to Haves: [Skills that would be a plus, but are not mandatory for the role]
Object-Oriented Framework development is a plus
Miro is a plus.

Tasks & responsibilities -
The Senior End-to-End PowerBI Developer will work independently under the Product Manager to deliver internal projects by turning requirements into data models, reports, and dashboards with proper performance and security.
End-to-end dashboard creation, product owner communication, tracking the development timeline and RAID log, and confidently testing his or her work.
Participate in knowledge transfer sessions with Product Manager to quickly learn and apply our data schemas, metrics, and visual standards.
Collaborate with BAs and Product Manager to refine technical requirements.
Work with the data engineering and data architecture team to ensure data flows and data availability.
Design and implement interactive reports and dashboards in PowerBI, following NT best practices and standards for development.
Include drill-through, drill-down, and tool-tips as required for end user interaction.
Ensure reports meet performance benchmarks.
Configure appropriate refresh schedules.
Perform data validation to ensure accuracy.
Conduct unit tests, work with QA/QC, conduct UAT.
Document data models, report structures, and logic used in the data product development.
Participate in daily stand-ups.
Benefits
Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging, and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

title: Power BI Report Developer
description:
As the Power BI Report Developer, you will be responsible for implementing and maintaining reports, ensuring accurate and timely delivery. You will collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, develop Power BI reports, and optimize performance and user experience. This role involves strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to troubleshoot and enhance report functionality. This role offers an opportunity to stay current with Power BI advancements and contribute to continuous improvement in report development processes.

This is a hybrid role from our office in Peabody, MA. Remote candidates will also be considered.

Moore is a data-driven constituent experience management (CXM) company achieving accelerated growth for clients through integrated supporter experiences across all platforms, channels and devices. We are an innovation-led company that is the largest marketing, data and fundraising company in North America serving the purpose-driven industry with clients across education, association, political and commercial sectors.

Check out www.WeAreMoore.com for more information.

Your Impact:

Strong understanding of data visualization principles and ability to translate business objectives into visual formats.
Work closely with the Senior Report Developer to understand project requirements and technical solutions.
Develop Power BI reports according to established standards and best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical expertise.
Perform testing and troubleshooting to ensure report accuracy and functionality.
Assist in optimizing report performance and user experience.
Promote best practices in dashboard design and data visualization within the team.

Your Profile:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.
3+ years of experience developing Power BI reports.
Strong understanding of report development principles and best practices.
Proficiency in Power BI desktop and Power BI service.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Good communication skills and attention to detail.
Power BI certification preferred.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Gallagher Fluid Seals, Inc. is a global distributor and manufacturer of Fluid Sealing products. Gallagher represents the strongest seal manufacturers in the world, in addition to operating its own gasket fabrication facility. Gallagher serves both OEM & MRO customers through the development of technical solutions that solve sealing challenges.
PURPOSE: The Business Data Analyst is responsible for overseeing the creation, maintenance, and governance of critical business data across systems. This role ensures data accuracy, consistency, and integrity to support enterprise-wide operations and strategic decision-making.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze business data from various sources (CRM, ERP, customer databases, sales performance reports) to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Develop and maintain dashboards, KPIs, and reports to support sales forecasting, customer segmentation, and executive decision-making.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights and recommendations for internal stakeholders
Develop and implement master data management (MDM) policies, standards, and procedures.
Support cross-functional teams with ad hoc reporting and data extraction needs.
Ensure consistent data definitions and reporting methodologies across departments.
Implement best practices for data entry, system usage, and documentation.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Prepares and delivers expert level visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
Provide training and guidance on data governance best practices.
Manage change requests around product and packaging labels using Bartender software and Companywide business forms using Cystal reports.
Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS/BASIC JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools (SSRS, Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
2–5 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
SQL experience in writing complex queries across multiple tables, data analysis and profiling skills for the creation of the mapping documents.
High attention to detail with a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server a plus
Experience with ERP or CRM (Salesforce) platforms is a plus.
Experience in the manufacturing or industrial sector is a plus.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Employee assistance program

Health insurance
