title: Senior Power BI Technical Specialist
description:
FirstEnergy

About the Opportunity
This is an open position with FirstEnergy Service Company, a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [SC00]
Position Summary
The Fleet Senior Technical Specialist position is responsible for developing and maintaining a data-driven business intelligence platform using Power BI. This platform will provide critical insights into vehicle expenses, safety performance (leveraging telematics), vehicle replacement cycles, and overall fleet operational performance. The role is integral to optimizing fleet management practices for fleet operations, ensuring cost efficiency, safety, and reliability of vehicles critical to delivering utility services.
Key Responsibilities
Build and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to the utility industry’s unique fleet operations.
Develop actionable insights and visualizations for monitoring vehicle costs, utilization, and safety metrics.
Aggregate data from various sources, including telematics systems (e.g., Geotab, Samsara), fuel management systems, fleet tracking tools, and ERP software.
Ensure the accuracy and consistency of integrated data, aligning with utility compliance standards.
Analyze vehicle expenses, including maintenance, fuel, depreciation, and repair costs.
Identify trends and provide recommendations to reduce operational and lifecycle costs.
Utilize telematics data to track driver behavior, vehicle safety metrics, and incident reports.
Provide detailed reports and recommendations to improve driver safety and reduce accidents.
Analyze data to determine optimal vehicle replacement cycles based on total cost of ownership (TCO), utilization, and maintenance history.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as asset utilization, vehicle downtime, and route efficiency specific to utility service needs.
Provide insights to improve fleet reliability, reduce outages, and enhance customer service responsiveness.
Generate reports to demonstrate compliance and fleet performance to regulators and internal stakeholders.
Train stakeholders to effectively use Power BI dashboards for data-driven decision-making.
Continuously enhance the business intelligence platform to address evolving fleet management challenges and utility-specific needs.
Stay updated on emerging fleet technologies, analytics tools, and industry trends.
Qualifications:
Senior Level: Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field with a minimum of 10 years relevant work experience or, in lieu of a degree, a minimum of 12 years of relevant work experience will be required.
Related experience includes: Data modeling, statistical analysis, scenario analysis, data forecasting, etc.
Certification in Power BI, fleet telematics, or data analytics is a plus.
Experience in fleet management, data analytics, or business administration preferably in the utility or transportation industries.
Proven experience developing dashboards and reports in Power BI, with a focus on fleet or operational data.
Familiarity with telematics systems, fuel management platforms, and fleet maintenance software used in utility operations is preferred, but not required..
Advanced proficiency in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and data modeling with the ability to query, join and manipulate complex data tables.
Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel for data extraction and analysis.
Proficiency with ChatGPT is preferred.
Knowledge of utility-specific fleet challenges, such as service truck optimization, emergency response, and environmental compliance is preferred, but not required.
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to proactively identify highly complex challenges or roadblocks, make impactful recommendations, and implement, test, and improve solutions to prevent issues from reoccurring while developing deep knowledge of the subject matter.
Demonstrates excellent interpersonal skills when interfacing with all levels of the organization.
Demonstrates leadership skills by identifying and accepting ownership of job responsibilities and tasks and working through others to accomplish business objectives.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills to convey complex insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to develop process improvements and automation to enhance work processes
Demonstrate a questioning attitude to continue to learn, produce results, and strengthen existing relationships.
Benefits, Compensation & Workforce Diversity

At FirstEnergy, employees are key to our success. We depend on their talents to meet the challenges of our changing business environment. We are committed to rewarding individual and team efforts through our total rewards philosophy which includes competitive pay plus incentive compensation, a company-sponsored pension plan, 401 (k) savings plan with matching employer contribution, a choice of medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, and life insurance programs, as well as skills development training with tuition reimbursement. Please visit our website at www.firstenergycorp.com to learn more about all of our employee rewards programs. FirstEnergy proudly supports workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability. No recruiters or agencies without a previously signed contract. Unable to sponsor or transfer H-1 B visas at this time.

Safety
Safety is a core value for FirstEnergy and is essential to all of our business activities. We ensure employees have the tools, information, and processes to perform their duties in a manner that assures safety for themselves, their co-workers, our customers and the public. Our goals are to provide a safe work environment, to maintain an accident-free, injury-free workplace, and to promote and maintain public safety. To meet these goals, we dedicate ourselves to achieving world-class safety standards.
FirstEnergy Human Resources Team

title: MS Power BI Data Scientist
description:
Job #: R-00161525
Location: Remote, US
Category: Business Systems Analysis
Schedule (FT/PT): Full Time
Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the time
Shift: Day
Remote Type: Remote
Clearance: Public Trust
External Referral Program: Ineligible
Sector: Digital Modernization

Description
The primary focus of the MS Power BI Data Scientist position in the ECIS program, is to create and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards, handle ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and ensure data is consistent, reliable, and accessible to stakeholders. The individual in this role will also play a key role in improving the overall data experience within the ECIS program by focusing on data integrity, user design, and communication of insights.
Primary Responsibilities:
Requirements Gathering & Stakeholder Collaboration
Work closely with ECIS program stakeholders across departments to understand their data needs and the specific requirements for reports and dashboards.
Translate program requirements into data models and reporting solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and priorities.
Lead discussions and discovery sessions with stakeholders to refine data needs and adjust deliverables as required.
Power BI Report & Dashboard Development
Design and build visually impactful Power BI reports and dashboards that provide meaningful ECIS program insights and enable stakeholders to make data-driven decisions.
Ensure that all reports and dashboards are developed with a strong focus on program goals, data integrity, maintaining accuracy and reliability throughout the data pipeline.
Prioritize the user experience in report and dashboard design, ensuring that all visualizations are intuitive, easy to interpret, and meet the needs of the intended users.
Develop and maintain a program design guide for consistent reporting, ensuring uniformity in style, layout, and presentation across all dashboards and visualizations.
Data Analysis & Insight Communication
Analyze large and complex data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that are valuable to the business.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to program members based on data analysis, helping them make informed, data-driven decisions.
Present findings and insights in a clear, compelling, and understandable manner, tailoring communication to different audiences, from operational teams to senior management.
ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and Data Integration
Manage the ETL processes using SQL, Power Query, Power BI, and API connections to consolidate data from multiple sources into a central data model for analysis and reporting.
Ensure data is properly cleaned, transformed, and integrated before being used in reports and dashboards.
Continuously monitor and improve the ETL pipeline to ensure data is accurate, timely, and meets business requirements.
Program Collaboration
Work closely with ECIS program members and CMS employees, to ensure data flows smoothly and reporting solutions meet program needs.
Support program users by troubleshooting data issues, answering queries, and offering training on how to use reports and dashboards effectively.
Collaborate on initiatives related to improving the overall ECIS program, data strategy, sharing insights, and refining reporting practices.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and 2+ years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
Requires proficient knowledge of Microsoft Power BI, demonstrated through practical, hands-on experience in a professional setting.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or higher security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Technical Skills
Expert-level knowledge with Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and the creation of custom visualizations.
Familiarity with SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation.
Ability to learn to create and maintaining ETL pipelines using Power BI and other tools.
Experience with API connections and integrating data from multiple sources such as SCCM, Druva, Aternity, ServiceNow, JAMF, etc.
ECIS Program Acumen & Analytical Skills
Strong ability to interpret data and communicate meaningful insights to Leidos program members and CMS stakeholders.
Experience in translating business requirements into technical solutions that drive decision-making.
Strong focus on the success of the ECIS program through data integrity, to ensure accurate and consistent reporting.
Communication & Collaboration
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to collaborate with program team members and manage multiple stakeholders' needs effectively.
Ability to work independently and proactively, with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outputs.
Design & User Experience
Familiarity with data visualization best practices to create intuitive, user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Ability to design visualizations that emphasize usability and clarity for ECIS program members and CMS (when necessary).

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Book of the Month is looking for an ambitious, detail-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join our growing data analytics team. Our user-base generates millions of rows of data daily, and the BI Analyst will be responsible for transforming this information into analytic solutions that facilitate informed business decisions. This person will be responsible for data querying, analysis and reporting that supports all teams across the company. This is a great opportunity for an analytics enthusiast with strong SQL skills to deliver insights that impact all parts of the business, including finance, operations, marketing, editorial and customer experience.

What you’ll do…
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to provide historic, current and predictive trends in KPIs
Write complex SQL queries to clean and transform user data into datasets ready for reporting
Create and improve existing Tableau reports and dashboards to promote business insights
Collaborate with teams across the company to define KPIs and create reporting solutions for new projects
Take an active role in translating analytical findings into concrete strategic recommendations for teams across the business

What you should have…
2+ years of experience using SQL to query and analyze data
Experience building reports and dashboards in Tableau
Experience with Snowflake, Amazon Redshift or MySQL databases is a plus.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Passion for digging deep into complex datasets to find hidden relationships and patterns
Excellent collaboration skills with a team-player mentality
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment

Minimum Requirements:
BS/MS in computer science, statistics, or a related major
Experience working with Tableau
Advanced proficiency in SQL

Base Salary: $70,000 - $90,000

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
Job Description
.
Department: Data Technology
Job Status: Full Time
FLSA: Exempt

Work Location: The Woodlands, TX
Travel Required: 5-10%
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday; 8 a.m. 5 p.m.
Position Supervised: None

.
POSITION SUMMARY: Responsible for the implementation and execution of the EWS analytics and business intelligence strategy. Individual will do this by working to create solutions that empower Evolution’s core operations to make data-driven decisions using new and existing information and technologies. This position will be responsible for aspects of the architecture, design, development, implementation, and maintenance of dashboards or other reporting tools as well as certain data capture platforms.
.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: (The following duties and responsibilities are all essential job functions, as defined by the ADA, except for those that begin with the word "May." Furthermore, these job functions are not intended to be all-inclusive in nature and employees may be given responsibilities not explicitly defined below.)
Work to bring relevant data, analytics, and insights to our core business by leveraging reporting tools, dashboards, analytics etc.
Work with EWS Operational Excellence Center, Field Engineers, Assets, and Operations teams to understand areas for improvement as it pertains to how data is being captured, reviewed, and used to improve and expedite decision making
This may also include designing and creating the platform on which to capture this data in an enterprise manner
Design, build, and implement tailored dashboards for internal and/or external use
Be continuously flexible, able to work in multiple different technology stacks or wear many different technical “hats” on any given day
Work with a multi-disciplined team to gather requirements for current and future technology projects
Understand EWS’s current technology stack and identify ways in which we can bring data, insights, and information closer to our decision points
Execute on this strategy via business intelligence processes
Work with EWS customers to understand their data needs and help identify ways to meet them
Stay abreast of current or latest data management and analytics technologies or practices and determine if they can or should be implemented at EWS
Facilitate, manage, and build reports on data captured from field equipment & real-time data sensors
Assist with the continuous development and implementation of Evolution’s overall data strategy
Educate current and potential stakeholders on EWS technology
Be an internal and external advocate for Evolution’s digital culture
Will be required to engage with various technology vendors and partners
Will be required to travel on occasion for discussions with stakeholders
Performs other related duties as assigned to assist with successful operations and business continuity.

.

BA/BS Undergraduate degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, IT, or related field

Experience in one or more of the following (or similar) roles
Business Intelligence
Data Analysis and Visualization
Data Management
Systems Analysis
Business Analysis
Real Time Data Analysis, Acquisition, and/or SCADA
.

Relational database architecture
Database design
Data visualization
Power BI (preferred)
Tableau
Spotfire
Dashboard creation and design
DAX
Analytics and delivering data insight
Application development
Ability to learn rapidly and work effectively with new technologies
Strategic, critical yet creative thinker with a passion for improving the business through data
Advanced data visualization skills and ability to create complex data models/dashboards/reports
Ability to work within cross-functional team environment
Must be able to understand often complex business requirements and effectively deliver upon them
Highly detail oriented and strong work ethic with the ability take initiative, prioritize tasks, and execute on Evolution’s Data Strategy without continuous direction
Ability to manage a variety of projects simultaneously
Highly proficient in capturing, understanding, interpreting, and analyzing data sets
Ability to communicate effectively
Ability to accurately and effectively explain complex technical principles to business users
.

.

title: BI Engineer (Power BI) - Dallas, TX
description:
**Job Description: **

As a BI Engineer specializing in Power BI, you will play a key role in the design, development, and deployment of modern reporting and analytical solutions on the Snowflake and Power BI platform. You will be instrumental in migrating existing reports and dashboards from OBIEE to Power BI, ensuring data accuracy, performance, and user satisfaction. Your expertise in data modeling, ETL/ELT processes, and Power BI development will be critical to the success of this strategic initiative.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with business stakeholders, data analysts, and other team members to understand reporting requirements and translate them into robust Power BI solutions.
Design and develop scalable and efficient data models in Power BI, leveraging best practices for performance and usability.
Participate in the migration of existing reports and dashboards from OBIEE to Power BI, ensuring data integrity and functional parity.
Develop and maintain ETL/ELT processes to load and transform data from Snowflake and other relevant data sources into Power BI datasets.
Create interactive and visually compelling dashboards and reports in Power BI that empower end-users with self-service analytics capabilities.
Implement and maintain data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of reporting data.
Optimize Power BI report performance and troubleshoot any performance bottlenecks.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of technical documentation for Power BI solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Power BI features and best practices and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our reporting capabilities.
Participate in testing, deployment, and ongoing support of Power BI applications.
Work closely with the Snowflake team to ensure seamless integration between the data warehouse and Power BI.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience 6-10+ as a BI Engineer or similar role with a strong focus on Power BI development.
Hands-on experience in designing and developing data models within Power BI Desktop.
Proficiency in writing DAX queries for calculations and data manipulation within Power BI.
Experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL/ELT) processes.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and principles.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with relational databases (experience with Snowflake is a significant plus).
Experience migrating reporting solutions from legacy BI platforms (OBIEE experience is highly desirable).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to effectively interact with both technical and business stakeholders.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Preferred Skills:
Experience with advanced Power BI features such as Power BI Service administration, dataflows, and Power BI Embedded.
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python for data manipulation or automation.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (Snowflake preferred).
Experience with agile development methodologies.
Understanding of financial services or investment management data.
Compensation, Benefits and Duration
Minimum Compensation: USD 38,000
Maximum Compensation: USD 134,000
Compensation is based on actual experience and qualifications of the candidate. The above is a reasonable and a good faith estimate for the role.
Medical, vision, and dental benefits, 401k retirement plan, variable pay/incentives, paid time off, and paid holidays are available for full time employees.
This position is not available for independent contractors
No applications will be considered if received more than 120 days after the date of this post

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Responsibilities:
Physical Requirements of the Job: Lift 30 lbs.
Primary Job Functions:

Data Extraction and Analysis-
Should be able to extract data from various sources by executing existing processes or using an existing tool.
Should assist in creating processes to profile, clean, manipulate, and map the extracted data.
The candidate should be able to reconcile the data to ensure there are no discrepancies or missing data from the source after extraction and cleanup.
Candidate should be able to assist in summarizing, analyzing the data, and interpreting results.

Data Warehousing –
Candidate should be able to use established design, update, and maintain the databases used for the data warehouse.
Assist the data analyst in designing and creating data models for data warehousing and mining.
Build and run SQL scripts to pull, aggregate, display, and interpret data.

Reports and Visualization -
Build, monitor, and maintain dashboard.
Use existing analytical tools available in different applications and create, modify data visualizations based on user requirements (i.e. Avatar KPI, Azara, PowerBI, etc.).
Should inform stakeholders of any red flags by looking at the data and help them make decisions.
Respond and review ad-hoc data requests. Create and format reports based on user requests.

Company and project initiatives
Learn AltaPointe business processes and organizational needs.
Collaborate with IT stakeholders to understand business needs and assist in providing analytical information and/or solutions.
Participate in new project initiatives and assist in analyzing the impact on existing analytics and developed applications, and communicate necessary changes and development.
Document all development in various systems and maintain ongoing documentation.

Other IT duties as deemed necessary should include, but not be limited to the following
Test and document compliance related to the MIS policy and procedure.
Assist in system(s) evaluations with other IT staff.
Participate in IT team meetings and initiatives.
Participate in the strategic planning process for IT.
Participation in and chairing committees deemed necessary to support standards and accreditations.
Assist in providing training when deemed necessary.
Participate in Orientation Training for IT.
Provide application training when deemed necessary.
Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

Administrative and other related duties as assigned
Actively participates in Performance Improvement activities
Actively participates in AltaPointe committees as requested.
Completes assigned tasks in a timely manner.
Treats consumers with dignity and respect.
Works in a cooperative manner with other AltaPointe employees.
Follows AltaPointe policies and procedures.
Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or Business. Experience in SQL database design, T-SQL programming, data modeling, data warehousing, experience in Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting service (SSRS), and Analytical services (SSAS), experience in .Net programming, ASP, JavaScript; experience managing software deployments; application planning, development, and training; experience working with departmental leaders, task-oriented, good communication, analytical, quick learner, problem-solving, and organizational skills. Candidate must possess a combination of business, technical, and project management skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Office and analytical and reporting tools, i.e. Power BI and Crystal.

title: Clinl Sys & Outcomes Analyst
description:
General Summary of Position
The Clinical Systems and Outcomes Analyst is responsible for data collection, data management, analysis and dissemination of hospital outcomes data; and, for reporting and analysis of healthcare information obtained from a variety of sources including clinical, administrative, financial and demographic data. Identifies relevant clinical and operational process measures from which to assess outcomes. Provides technical support and serves as an internal consultant to the Quality Resource & Regulatory Department. Develops and prepares data analytics to provide meaningful and actionable information.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Contributes to the strategic functions of the data and analytics team to include identification of data needs, planning, development and implementation of analytic processes. Serves as a mentor and contributes to the successful development of the Quality and Outcomes Department.
Is highly skilled in building, analyzing, and creating visualizations of outcomes data.
Conducts analysis of hospital data trends against benchmarks. Prepares oral, written and visual presentations of data.
Identifies systematic issues with data integrity, develops and proposes solutions. Collaborates with entity and system resources via active participation in project teams and user groups.
Serves as a resource to senior leadership and quality managers on metrics and results.
Participates in Regulatory Readiness and Patient Safety activities as assigned.
Analyzes new software and data management systems as requested.

Minimum Qualifications
Education
Bachelor's degree in health informatics, information science, or relevant field required
Master's degree in health informatics, information science, or relevant field preferred
Experience
1-2 years performing analysis of patient population and/or hospital operational data required
Strong experience with using Cerner, Tableau, SQL, Python and other statistical analyses software preferred
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Must be capable of exploring innovative solutions to solve data analytics problems through the use of existing or custom-developed tools.


This position has a hiring range of $70,428 - $131,310

title: Data Analyst
description:
Summary of Position:
A Data Analyst is responsible for using their knowledge of data processing software and business development strategies to provide sound business decisions to the company. Their duties include collaborating with other data professionals to extract data figures, creating reports based on their findings, and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) to determine business initiatives’ success.
Essential Functions:
Work with the business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement
Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data
Use graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize data
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
Structure large data sets to find usable information
Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information
Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings
Use automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Remove corrupted data and fix coding errors and related problems
Develop and maintain databases, data systems
Perform analysis to assess quality and meaning of data
Filter data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Assign numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time
Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
Prepare reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Work with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies
Prepare final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends
Competencies:
Ensures Accountability
Tech Savvy
Communicates Effectively
Values Differences
Customer Focus
Resourcefulness
Drives Results
Plans and Prioritizes
Decision Quality
Self-Development
Work Environment:
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.
Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee in this position frequently communicates with other co-workers/clients who have inquiries about the various projects and other needs. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations. The employee must be able to remain in a stationary position 75% of the time. The employee in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc. Constantly operate a computer and office machinery such as a calculator, keyboard, copy machine, and printer. Frequently moves boxes with equipment weighing up to 25lbs across the building and/or to other offsite buildings for various project needs.
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelors Degree
5+ years of experience
Qualifications:
Manipulate scripts and dump data into Excel and Excell PowerQuery
C#, Visual Studio, DotNet, and Powershell
Technical writing skills
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to set and meet deadlines
Ability to work in high-pressure situations
Experience with statistical software
Reporting and data visualization skills
Excellent attention to detail
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize, and analyze data
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing
Adept at using data processing platforms
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets to find solutions
Problem-solving skills
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Team-working skills
Verbal and Written communication skills
Proven working experience in data analysis

title: BI Engineer
description:
Position Summary:
GreenState's Information Technology department adheres to the corporate values and acts as a business partner who understands the needs of the business, enables business units to meet strategic objectives through technology, and provides employees and members with quality technology platforms that are always available, always relevant, and always scalable.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The BI Engineer is responsible for developing and maintaining advanced data solutions, especially in Power BI. This role focuses on understanding business needs and deploying efficient, consumable models for end users via Azure and the Power BI service. The BI Engineer will develop and maintain complex semantic models, create advanced DAX calculations, and collaborate with end users to deploy solutions optimized for performance, scalability and reusability.

GREENSTATE CULTURE:
At GreenState, we exist to create lasting value for those we serve. We do this by putting immense value into our employees, members and communities. We empower our employees to create endless opportunities, which will then impact the lives of our members and enhance the vitality of our communities.

Salary range for this position is $119,078.70 - $139,216.74 with a progressive benefit package.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Performs essential duties and responsibilities in the following areas which may include but are not limited to those listed and are subject to change.
Adheres to the Credit Union's core values and Service Standards in conducting GreenState's mission and vision.
Demonstrates a positive member service (internal and external) focus at all times.
Demonstrates teamwork in all interactions with coworkers and in the completion of all duties and responsibilities.
Ensures confidentiality of member information.
Supports a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Designs, implements and maintains enterprise-wide data models optimized for performance in Power BI
Creates advanced DAX calculations and measures to meet specific business requirements
Develops and maintains Power Query (M) transformations to shape data for optimal use
Collaborates with business stakeholders to translate requirements into effective BI solutions
Implements best practices for Power BI report and dashboard design
Optimizes Power BI reports and dashboards for performance and user experience
Supports the deployment and maintenance of Power BI content in the Power BI service
Assists in the development of documentation and training materials for end users
Stays current with Power BI features and best practices
Admins Power BI/Fabric capacity
Performs other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements/Expectations:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related field
4 to 6 years of experience in business intelligence, with a focus on Power BI
Advanced proficiency in:
Power BI Desktop and Power BI service
DAX (Data Analysis Expressions)
M (Power Query Formula Language)
SQL
Strong understanding of data modeling techniques specific to Power BI
Experience with Power BI Dataflows and Datasets
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills and ability to work with business stakeholders
Financial services industry experience preferred
Prefer experience with Azure Analysis Service
Familiarity with Power Apps and Power Automate a plus
Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics integration would provide an edge
Reporting Relationship: This position reports to the IT Director Data Services and Development. Supervisory Responsibilities: This position is not responsible for the supervision of others. Equal Opportunity Employment Statement: GreenState Credit Union is an EEO/AA Employer. We strongly encourage all individuals to apply for openings with the credit union. #LI #ID

title: Tableau or PowerBI Admin
description:
Austin, TX

title: Power BI developer w/python
description:
Long term contract position with a major financial firm.
Hybrid 3 days/week in Newark, NJ.

Looking for a senior business intelligence resource to support senior leaders in building all new visualization and data analytics within the various departments in Fixed Income. Our ideal candidate will have proven experience in building dynamic analytics report/dashboards for financial end-users. The right candidate for this role will identify this challenge as a unique and valuable opportunity to help drive our global technology transformation.

What You Will Do:
Create Power BI and Tableau Dashboards to meet complex user requirements and demand.
Performance tuning and aesthetics customization to meet user expectations.
Develop and implement design best practices to ensure a seamless user-experience for business stakeholders.
Transform complex reporting needs into technical specifications, including calculations, custom groups, parameters, filtering criteria, aggregations etc. Breakdown complex requirements into user stories, and drive delivery with the product team
Work with the business on managing Power BI & Tableau user permissions, performance troubleshooting, and managing general help inquiries.
Develop and Test Python and Custom API-related Workflows to build on the capabilities of the Power BI and Tableau Platform.
Work with Tableau for support, ticket resolution, feature requests and defect tracking.
Demonstrate strong backend platform expertise and front-end consultancy capability
Recommend best practices from both a technical and process perspective as related to Power BI and Tableau development.
Groom large datasets for optimal performance and maintainability
Troubleshoot issues as they occur, identify criticality and impact, and provide appropriate workarounds
What You Will Need:

General Skill Profile in order of preference: Power BI, SQL, Python, Power Automate, Tableau
5+ years of Power BI application development experience including visualizations, parameters, and report optimization
3+ years of Tableau application development experience, including visualizations, parameters, and report optimization
5+ years of hands-on SQL Experience
3+ years of working on Power BI or Tableau Administration Responsibilities (Permissions, Server Maintenance and upgrades, Monitoring)
3+ years working in Python, Pandas Data Frames, API-driven workflows.
Expertise across multiple BI platforms and data visualization tools include Tableau and Power BI
Strong experience with performance tuning business intelligence and database platforms for maximum performance in each technical configuration
Expertise with multiple database platforms including relational databases (ie. SQL Server and Oracle) as well as cloud-based data warehouses such as Microsoft Fabric and Snowflake
Experience with both server and desktop-based data visualization tools
Expertise with managing and mining very large internal and external data sets
Experience with sourcing external data sets to meet business needs
Demonstrated experience with testing business hypotheses, asking the right questions to provoke thoughts from business users and ultimately using data to test and validate hypothesis
Very strong experience with quickly building data visualization worksheets and dashboards to analyze, view and interpret data sets
Hands-on experience with Python for building automations for business processes
Demonstrated experience with using predictive, prescriptive and descriptive data analytics to test, question and solve business problems
Have a consulting mindset when working with internal clients across multiple departments of the organization
Ideally familiar with financial services datasets across investment, product and distribution functions - not essential but highly desirable
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent, with a strong preference in a Data-centric major.

Job Summary
University Medical Billing ( UMB ) is a fully remote department that is viewed as the premier billing office for the University of Utah School of Medicine, serving over 1,800 providers and 30 different specialties across Utah and surrounding states. We strive to be a great place to work while providing the best service to our customers. Our leaders and employees value collaboration, innovation, and accountability – attributes a successful candidate will exemplify.
Job Summary:
Drive business decisions by delivering both quantitative and qualitative data analysis, reporting patterns, insights, and trends to stakeholders. Collect, aggregate, and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources to generate insights into business performance. Produce actionable reports that highlight key performance indicators, identify areas for improvement, and uncover root causes of issues. Communicate findings clearly to stakeholders and provide strategic recommendations to optimize performance. Develop reporting solutions and respond to ad hoc data requests across multiple domains. Contribute to the design and enhancement of business intelligence tools and reporting systems. Embrace innovation and forward thinking by continuously seeking new ways to leverage data for smarter, more strategic decision-making. Handle increasingly complex assignments with minimal supervision and significant latitude for independent judgment.
Compensation & Benefits:
The starting salary for this position is $77,000-$84,000/yr , depending on experience. Members of UMB are eligible for a bonus based on department performance. All team members are eligible for the University’s comprehensive benefit package that includes 90% employer- paid medical insurance, a generous 14.2% retirement contribution, reduced tuition, PTO and holiday pay, and more!
Employment is contingent on the successful completion of a background check and the adherence to departmental policies, including UMB’s Telecommuting Agreement which requires a distraction-free and HIPAA compliant workplace, cameras on for all virtual calls/meetings, and the ability to work during office hours or assigned shift (M-F, approximately 8am to 5pm Mountain Time) regardless of what time zone you live in. Additionally, new hires are required to provide their own monitors (two) and reliable internet service.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Advanced Reporting
Develop more complex reports and dashboards.
Implement best practices for data visualization.
Data Integration
Integrate data from multiple sources.
Ensure data consistency across different systems.
Data Analysis and Insights
Conduct in-depth data analysis.
Provide actionable insights based on data.
Process Improvement
Identify areas for process improvement.
Implement changes to enhance data collection and reporting.
Stakeholder Communication
Communicate findings to stakeholders.
Provide support for data-driven decision-making.
Meets productivity and accuracy expectations of the position, and completes other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Requires a bachelor’s degree in related area or equivalency (one year of education can be substituted for two years of related work experience). Two to four years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.
Applicants must demonstrate the potential ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined in the position description.
Preferences
An especially qualified candidate will also possess the following:
Bachelor’s degree in statistics, computer science, or a related field.
3 years of experience in data analysis or data science.
2 years’ experience in healthcare analytics preferred.
Solid business acumen.
SQL certification preferred.
Experience with Excel, Tableau, Python, SQL , medical billing, and standard financial procedures preferred.
This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It’s not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.

title: DATA ANALYST
description:
Empresa puertorriqueña líder en la industria energética se encuentra en búsqueda de un Analista de Datos. Este rol implica la creación, presentación y documentación de informes y paneles para explicar y revisar análisis/hallazgos con los miembros del equipo y el personal del cliente. El candidato ideal poseerá habilidades técnicas para generar los informes/paneles necesarios, experiencia en la construcción de almacenes de datos y la capacidad de presentar interpretaciones de datos a la alta gerencia de manera clara y concisa.
Se espera que el Analista de Datos tenga experiencia sólida en análisis de datos y herramientas de visualización como SQL Server, Power BI, Tableau y MS Excel.
Responsabilidades principales:
Realizar análisis de datos para interpretar resultados de informes y hallazgos, mientras desarrolla visualizaciones e informes para los proyectos solicitados utilizando Power BI y Tableau.
Analizar de manera precisa para comprender las necesidades del negocio, el comportamiento del cliente y mantener métricas claves esenciales.
Crear informes y presentar hallazgos/interpretaciones de datos a ejecutivos, detallando su impacto en el negocio para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Explicar y revisar análisis/hallazgos con miembros del equipo y personal del cliente.
Documentar productos y flujos de usuarios, además de recopilar, analizar y documentar requisitos de negocio, flujos de procesos y transferir conocimientos al equipo de desarrollo dentro de entornos ágiles.
Proveer actualizaciones y reportes de estado del proyecto a la gerencia cuando sea necesario.
Requisitos:
Bachillerato en Bachillerato en Sistemas de Información
Bilingüe en inglés y español (escrito, hablado y lectura).
De 2 a 4 años de experiencia con tecnologías de inteligencia empresarial (BI), como Microsoft Power BI y Tableau Software.
Sólido entendimiento de funciones de MS Excel.
Experiencia previa con bases de datos SQL Server y consultas SQL.
Disponibilidad para trabajar de lunes a viernes de 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Plus:
Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
Tableau Desktop Specialist / Certified Associate
Certificaciones basadas en SQL (por ejemplo, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server)
Salario y beneficios:
Salario competitivo.
Bono de reclutamiento.
Plan médico con aportación patronal.
Seguro de vida.
Programa de ayuda al empleado.
Día de cumpleaños libre sin descuento de nómina.
Día de aniversario laboral libre sin descuento de nómina.
Días festivos libre sin descuento de nómina, según calendario de la empresa.
Bono de Navidad por acumulación
Ochenta horas de vacaciones al año.
Ochenta horas de enfermedad al año.
Licencia de paternidad.
Somos una empresa que no discrimina en sus oportunidades de empleo por razón de raza, sexo, color, edad, origen nacional, ideas políticas o religiosas, género, preferencia sexual, origen étnico, por ser víctima o ser percibido como víctima de violencia doméstica, agresión sexual o acecho, por ser militar, ex militar, por ostentar la condición de veterano, incapacidad o cualquier otra categoría protegida por ley.

Dental insurance
Health insurance

Monday to Friday

title: Power BI Developer (Associate-Level)
description:
Link Solutions is seeking a Power BI Developer (Associate-Level) to join our team at Fort Stewart, GA.
Must be a US Citizen
DoD Clearance required (Active or Interim)
Non-remote (relocation incentive available)
The Power BI Developer (Associate-Level) will assist in the creation and maintenance of visual reports and dashboards supporting various Army operational units. This entry-level role will work under the direction of senior analysts to transform data into meaningful insights, support system integrations, and gain exposure to end-user interactions and report delivery workflows.
Become an integral part of a professionally diverse team while working at an industry-leading organization. This is a great opportunity that will allow you to work on innovative projects that offer advancement and growth while helping protect our national security.
Job Responsibilities:
Assist in building Power BI dashboards using provided data models and source connections.
Develop and refine visualizations using DAX and Power Query (M).
Work with Excel/CSV and SharePoint files to prepare data for ingestion.
Maintain and update dashboards with current data according to defined schedules.
Participate in stakeholder feedback sessions and incorporate usability improvements.
Document visualizations, data sources, and refresh processes for reuse.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.
Qualifications:
US Citizen
Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Security Clearance.
IAT Level II Certification equivalent or higher per DoD 8570/DoD 8140 (CompTIA Security+ CE, CCNA Security, CISSP, GICSP, GSEC, SSCP, etc.).
At least one (1+) year of experience developing reports using Power BI or similar visualization tools.
Familiar with DAX, Power Query (M), and complex data modeling.
Familiar with Power BI, PowerApps, Power Automate, and SharePoint tools.
Familiar with DAX, M (Power Query), and SQL languages.
Familiar with Power BI Gateway, Azure Synapse, Vantage, and Advana platforms.
Microsoft PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate (or willingness to obtain within 6 months).
Preferred:
Active DoD Security Clearance.
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related IT field.
Microsoft PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate.
Data Modeling: Star/Snowflake schemas, normalized structures
UX/UI: Advanced visualization design and interactivity
Experience working in a Department of Defense (DoD) environment.
A problem solver and troubleshooter who thrives in resolving complex problems.
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Superior organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.
Additional Information:
Link Solutions Inc. offers a competitive compensation and benefits package to include paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, vision, company-paid long and short-term disability, life insurance, referral bonuses, relocation incentive program, certification reimbursement program, retirement, and more.
Link Solutions, Inc. is an EOE. AA/M/F/D/V. We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Service Delivery Lead, BI & Analytics (Hybrid)
description:
Work Flexibility: Hybrid
As a Service Delivery Lead, BI & Analytics, you will lead Azure production support to ensure the successful delivery of services with the Azure platforms and the attainment of agreed KPIs. In this role, you will tap into your hands-on experience with Azure Synapse, Databricks, PowerBI and Azure Data Factory (ADF). You will manage the execution and delivery of data and analytics services. You will also oversee the analytics and reporting platforms and drive continuous improvements to support the global data analytics strategy and roadmap while collaborating with IT partners to ensure smooth support services.
What you will do
Strategic IT & Vendor Management
Manage relationships and contracts with IT vendors to ensure optimal service delivery and performance, as a subject matter expert in Azure data warehouse solutions.
Work closely with the IT Service Delivery leadership and support teams to manage daily support and maintenance of application instances and conduct long-term improvement operations to ensure compatibility with evolving mission requirements.
Continuously improve the customer experience by maturing operations through automation, self-service, and shift-left approaches.
Identify opportunities to improve the system process flow, performance, and technical efficiencies.
Drive adherence to global governance/release management processes to ensure system integrity.
Azure-Based Solutions & Architecture
Offer best practices, advice, and recommendations to the Managed Services team regarding the overall architecture and strategy of Azure-based solutions.
Design, improve, and maintain Azure-based data warehouse solutions.
Implement, monitor, and optimize workflows using Azure Synapse, Databricks, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory (ADF).
Application Development & Performance Optimization
Design and develop reusable custom application components that meet customer requirements while upholding high standards of reliability, security, maintainability, and performance.
Investigate and resolve complex technical issues and bugs, ensuring the stability and reliability of applications and data warehouse solutions.
Service Excellence:

Monitor vendor performance against agreed expectations (contractual or otherwise) including regular vendor meetings to review expectations and performance.

Experience in an ITIL-based service management role, like Service Level Management.
