title: Power BI Reporting Specialist
description:
Overview:
Why join?

Join us in revolutionizing an entire industry's customer engagement. We prioritize human connection through technology. If you're driven by purpose and want to make a meaningful impact on people's lives, this is the place for you. Our team challenges norms with the support of a trusted American brand.
Purpose: A leading professional services firm found that AAA Life associates demonstrate some of the highest levels of commitment, empathy, and dedication when compared to top U.S. companies in a benchmark analysis.
Growth: We have the privilege to offer our products to tens of millions of Americans that make up the AAA member base
Focus is on “working families”, “everyday Americans”, “ordinary citizens”, “mainstream population” “average income households”, providing life insurance products that truly impact people's lives (more information will be provided in the interview).
Team (Culture): USA Today named us a 2024 and 2025 top US workplace

Who are we looking for?

AAA Life is seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual with experience in the insurance industry and expertise in Power BI to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in developing, publishing, and maintaining Power BI reports to drive data-informed decision-making.

This role demands a detail-oriented professional who can develop, standardize, and optimize reports while ensuring the data presented delivers actionable insights, not just information. The candidate will also collaborate with data teams to help build sustainable datasets for reporting. If you have a knack for translating complex data into intuitive dashboards and possess deep knowledge of Power BI, SQL, and Excel, we want to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
How will you contribute?
Report Development & Maintenance:
Design, develop, and publish Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to business needs.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency by integrating and transforming data from various sources.
Data Cleanup & Standardization:
Review and optimize existing Power BI reports to improve efficiency and user experience.
Establish and enforce report standardization protocols to ensure consistency across all deliverables.
Optimization & Insights:
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and trends.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.
Operational Data Management:
Lead resolution efforts when data issues are identified during report development.
Collaborate with relevant teams to develop and maintain sustainable datasets for reporting needs.
Prepare data requests and follow up with engineering teams to resolve potential issues effectively.
Collaboration & Documentation:
Work closely with internal teams, including IT, operations, and business leaders, to align reporting outputs with strategic goals.
Document processes, models, and changes to ensure knowledge transfer and operational continuity.
Qualifications:
What do you offer?
Bachelor’s degree in data science, analytics or a related field
3–7 years of analytics and reporting experience, preferably within the insurance or financial services industry.
Advanced expertise in Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and data modeling.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and integration.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools.
Ability to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights.
Keen attention to detail with a focus on data quality, operational troubleshooting, and report usability.
Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with non-technical and technical stakeholders
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with other data visualization tools or platforms such Tableau, Qlik etc.
Knowledge of other programming languages such as Python, R etc.

What can we offer?
Enjoy a hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage starting from your first day.
Employer 401k match and employer contribution to a pension plan.
Generous PTO and paid parental leave to support your family needs.
Opportunities for associate engagement in various social programs and community involvement initiatives backed by the company.

title: Analyst, Data Analytics, US Portfolio Transformation
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com
Job Function:
Sales Enablement
Job Sub Function:
Sales Operations & Administration
Job Category:
Professional
All Job Posting Locations:
Cincinnati, Ohio, United States of America, Raritan, New Jersey, United States of America
Job Description:
Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for an Analyst, Data Analytics, US Portfolio Transformation to join our MedTech Surgery business located at our Raritan, NJ or Cincinnati, OH sites.
#Li-Hybrid
This is a limited duration role. (12/31/2026 end date)
Eligibility for severance.
About Surgery
Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments.
Are you passionate about improving and expanding the possibilities of surgery? Ready to join a team that’s reimagining how we heal? Our Surgery team will give you the chance to deliver surgical technologies and solutions to surgeons and healthcare professionals around the world. Your contributions will help effectively treat some of the world’s most prevalent conditions such as obesity, cardiovascular disease and cancer. Patients are waiting!
Your unique talents will help patients on their journey to wellness. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/medtech
The Analyst, Data Analytics - US Portfolio Transformation, will deliver data driven insights and develop analytics resources to support the Medtech Surgery transformation. Will partner and collaborate closely with the Supply Chain, Marketing, FSO, KAM, and Customer Solutions teams. Key responsibilities include:
Deliver the metrics and reporting tools linked to transformation execution inclusive of financial indicators, conversion progress, performance vs plan, and other key information to commercial leadership including Director, US Portfolio Transformation.
Delivers National, Area, Regional, and Account level analytics and insights related to transformation activities.
Responsible for KPI measurement and reporting for all related transformation initiatives.
Collaborates with multidisciplinary partners to drive Surgery transformation forward in a timely manner.
Execution of innovative initiatives aligned to the HIT Next needs of the commercial organization.
Ensures data analytics are integrated at all levels (National, GPO, IDN, Area, Region, Territory, Account) to monitor and ultimately improve execution, speed to next action, and accountability across the organization.

This job is salaried.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required
Experience:
2+ years professional business experience across Commercial or Supply Chain roles preferred
Data Analytics experience required
Technical Skills including Tableau, MS Office, Power BI and other data tool sets required.
Strong knowledge of Excel (i.e. vLookups, pivot tables) is required.
Experience in Medical Devices/Technology preferred
Experience partnering with multi-functional business partners preferred.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
The ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives and work independently while demonstrating initiative.
The ability to work across functions (Sales, Marketing, KAM, Supply Chain, Finance) where priorities change rapidly and strict timelines exist is required
Deep knowledge of MedTech Industry and US Hospital Systems
Understanding of data analysis, US sales/ contracting landscape to build out meaningful and actionable reporting and metrics.
Understanding of US Medtech Surgery systems and data workflows.
Creative thinking to develop effective strategies and translate into actionable insights to monitor and drive commercial effectiveness.
Ability to establish a strategy, a complex project plan and then complete proactively, be it independently or within a team
Exceptional interpersonal, professionalism, communication and presentation skills.
Lean, Six-Sigma or Process Excellence training and/or certification is appreciated.
Benefits Summary:
Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year
Additional information can be found through the link below!
https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits
Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.
Johnson & Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants’ needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, please contact us via https://www.jnj.com/contact-us/careers or contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.
The anticipated base pay range for this position is :
$63,000 - $102,350
Additional Description for Pay Transparency:
The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

title: Lead BI Engineer
description:
Job Description
Lead BI Engineer
212 W 2nd St, Winona, MN 55987
HEADD
Full-time Shift(s): MON TUE WED THU FRI 8:00am - 5:00pm

OVERVIEW:
Working as Full-time Lead BI Engineer, you will drive the design and delivery of business intelligence and reporting solutions across the enterprise using Microsoft Fabric, Databricks. You will be responsible for building curated semantic models, reusable datasets, and intuitive dashboards that provide actionable insights to business stakeholders.

This role also includes modernizing legacy BI platforms, ensuring data quality and governance, and leading a team of BI professionals in delivering scalable reporting frameworks.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
The duties and responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
o Designing, developing, and maintaining enterprise-grade BI dashboards, paginated reports, and analytics solutions using Microsoft Fabric (Power BI)
o Creating and managing curated datasets, semantic models, and data marts to support enterprise reporting
o Leading the migration and modernization of legacy BI systems (e.g., SSRS, SSAS, Oracle Reports, APEX Reports) to cloud-native platforms
o Defining and documenting enterprise-wide KPIs, data definitions, and governance practices
o Optimizing Power BI datasets and dashboards for performance, access control, and refresh efficiency
o Implementing and managing CI/CD pipelines and source control for Power BI artifacts using tools like GitHub or Azure DevOps
o Providing technical leadership and mentorship to BI developers and analysts, ensuring best practices in data modeling and report development
o Working cross-functionally with business units to gather requirements, validate data, and deliver high-impact visualizations and paginated reports
o Ensuring compliance with data security, access policies, and audit requirements

REQUIRED POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
The following skills and qualifications are required for this position:
o Possess a bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field OR equivalent experience
o Possess at least 5 years of experience in BI-Reporting development, Data Analytics/Engineering
o Hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric/Power BI components, Databricks
o Familiarity with legacy tools such as SSRS, SSAS, Oracle Reports, or APEX
o Expertise in SQL, data warehouse design, and ETL development
o Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with a proven ability to translate business needs into technical deliverables
o Demonstrate our core values of ambition, innovation, integrity and teamwork
o Pass the required drug screen and background check (applicable in the US, Puerto Rico and Guam ONLY)

PREFERRED POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
o Advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D.) or equivalent experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Data Engineering
o Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform, Bicep), Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)

ABOUT US:
Since 1967 Fastenal has grown as a distributor of industrial and construction supplies from a single branch to a Fortune 500 company with over 3,000 servicing locations, each providing tailored local inventory and personal service for our customers. As we've expanded across the world, we've retained a core belief in people and their ability to accomplish remarkable things - if given the opportunity. From this philosophy stems an entrepreneurial culture that challenges every employee to run their own business, create their own success, and advance to become company leaders.

As a growth company with a solid financial position, we are committed to training, promoting from within, and creating opportunities for our employees. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are looking to make your mark as part of an elite growth company, you won't find a better fit than Fastenal.

FULL-TIME BENEFITS:
Fastenal offers a competitive benefits package to all full-time employees. This package includes Health, Life, Long Term Disability, and Dental Insurance, in addition to, paid vacation, sick leave, holidays, and 401(k) with an employer contribution.

COMPENSATION:
The pay range for this position is $100,000 - 120,000.

title: Senior BI Developer
description:
We are looking for a Senior BI Developer to join our team. Daisy Brand is modernizing its data platform and data visualization strategies from a traditional solution (SQL Server, SSIS, and Tableau) to a more modern cloud data platform using Azure SQL Managed Instance and Microsoft Fabric.
The ideal candidate will play a key role in orchestrating the transition to a modern data platform, have a deep technical understanding of Power BI and possess strong business acumen to translate customer use cases into compelling and efficient visualization designs. This role will drive innovation, enhance user experience, and enable data democratization across our organization.
Principal Duties:
Collaboration
Collaborate with subject matter experts, often in ambiguous situations, to determine business information and reporting requirements.
Foster improved alignment of technology initiatives with business strategies by building and maintaining relationships with technology teams and business partners.
Provide technical and architectural guidance to projects and teams to ensure effective reporting and analyses.
Data Visualization and Administration
Define, design, develop, document, and maintain Power BI data models and visualizations.
Implement advanced techniques using Power BI Premium, XMLA Endpoints, and Tabular Editor 3 to elevate our analytics capabilities.
Develop and maintain complex DAX, Power Query formula language (M), and T-SQL queries.
Stay ahead of data science trends and emerging tools and technologies to continually enhance frameworks, processes, and best practices.
Provide guidance on Power BI security, user mapping, and app deployment.
Maintain adherence to security and architectural standards as well as usability design principles.
Data Engineering
Work with various data sources such as SQL Server, DataVerse, Excel, Azure SQL, SharePoint Lists/Libraries, API based data, and unstructured data.
Oversee and conduct analysis, design, implementation, and support of the company data warehouse which may include developing ETL routines using appropriate tools.
Stay informed about new developments and technologies through continuous learning, industry publications, vendor contacts, trainings, etc.
Qualifications:
8+ years relevant experience.
Thorough understanding of PowerBI architecture and capabilities such as CI/CD pipelines, data modeling, security, architecture, etc.
Experience with Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, On-Premise SQL Server and Azure DevOps.
Strong knowledge of PowerBI dashboard development, Data Visualization concepts, ETL processes, Data Architectures, and Data Modeling.
Must have an analytical mind, be a critical thinker and problem solver.
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment.
Proven experience working in a team oriented, collaborative environment.
Skills:
Familiarity with Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and/or SSIS
Knowledge of Azure services, including Azure Data Lake
Experience implementing API calls
Experience with manufacturing data
Knowledge of D365 Finance and Operations data
This is a full-time position located at the Dallas office and may require occasional travel to Daisy’s manufacturing sites.
This position will abide by the hybrid/work-from-home policies for the Corporate IT team.
This position is not available for remote work.
For five generations spanning over a century, Daisy Brand has been a family-owned company committed to providing the freshest, most wholesome dairy products. The company is headquartered in Dallas, Texas with manufacturing facilities in Garland, Texas (1998), Casa Grande, Arizona (2008), and Wooster, Ohio (2015).
Daisy is the market leader in two billion-dollar categories, sour cream and cottage cheese, and generates over half a billion in revenues annually. Daisy Sour Cream represents 1 out of every 2 sour cream purchases in the United States and is the largest sour cream brand in food service, military, and club. It is recognized by consumers for A Dollop of Daisy, a tagline that put this once small brand on the map. Daisy Cottage Cheese is America’s #1 cottage cheese brand and continues to bring new consumers into the category with its innovative single serve packaging and consistent high quality. Daisy recently expanded into a new category with the launch of two dip products and is in the process of expanding distribution.
Daisy's core values, Clean and Trust, resonate in all aspects of our business operations. In 2008, the Foundation for Financial Service Professionals awarded Daisy the prestigious American Business Ethics award.
While maintaining a strong culture of curious and innovative problem-solvers, Daisy Brand has more than doubled employment over the last 15 years and is continuing to grow. Currently, we are proud to employ over 650 full-time staff across more than 25 states throughout the United States.
At Daisy Brand, we value longevity and aim to foster a working environment where employees can envision a long-term career. Companywide, the average employee tenure stands at over seven years. Our corporate office and sales team each boast an average tenure exceeding eleven years, while our manufacturing facilities also demonstrate strong employee retention with tenures averaging over seven years.
Daisy Brand offers an industry leading benefits package that includes:
A no-deductible, $0 premium option for employee-only health coverage.
401(k) with 50% company match on first 8% of earnings you contribute.
Safe harbor and profit-sharing company contributions to 401(k).
Company paid short- and long-term disability coverage.
Company paid 2X annual salary life and AD&D insurance.
4 weeks annual paid time off.
Extra time off for volunteering.
Tuition reimbursement.
Fitness membership reimbursement.
And more
Daisy Brand is a nicotine-free company. Daisy Brand is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Veterans and disabled encouraged to apply.

title: Analyst, Analytics
description:
Overview
Who we are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
An important part of the Toyota family is Toyota Financial Services (TFS), the finance and insurance brand for Toyota and Lexus in North America. While TFS is a separate business entity, it is an essential part of this world-changing company- delivering on Toyota's vision to move people beyond what's possible. At TFS, you will help create best-in-class customer experience in an innovative, collaborative environment.
To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position currently.
This position is based at the Toyota Headquarters in Plano, TX with onsite work Monday-Thursday and remote work on Fridays

Analyst – Analytics @ Toyota Financial Services (Multiple Open Roles – please see below)
These positions are based at the Toyota Headquarters in Plano, TX

Who we're looking for

Toyota Financial Services is looking for highly motivated people to fill multiple openings as an Analyst in one of our Analytics teams. The primary focus of our Analytics teams is to generate actionable insights by leveraging data and using effective data storytelling to help our company make better data-driven decisions.

Find out more about our various Analytics teams here: Analytics @ TFS (toyota.com)

What you'll be doing
Uncover business needs and the true questions that the company is trying to answer in order to properly frame your analysis
Leverage your SQL/Python/R coding skills to pull and organize data that is needed for your analysis
Find insights buried in the data by applying your arsenal of creative problem-solving, data exploration, and quantitative analytical skills (including statistical methods)
Assess the quantitative and qualitative impacts of possible actions based on your insight, taking into consideration our customers, our employees, and our company
Recommend actions based on your insights by effectively telling the story that is supported by data through presentations (PowerPoint), data visualizations (Tableau), and clear and concise verbal and written communications skills
Coordinate with various stakeholders to help implement and measure recommended actions
Build relationships with key stakeholders across Toyota such as Sales, Marketing, Servicing, Insurance, Risk, Technology, Legal/Compliance, Finance, Treasury, etc.
Continuously improve your analytical, technical, communication, and people skills through offered training and on-the-job experience to prepare for advancement into analytical leadership roles.
Become a subject matter expert for your business area by developing a comprehensive understanding of its strategies, processes, policies, and data
Guide/mentor other analysts on best practices for analysis and data storytelling.

Current openings
Analyst, Data Analysis
Leverage technical skills, business knowledge, and problem-solving skills to provide analytical insights and reporting to help the business make better data-driven decisions
Provide value by answering business questions and drive efficiency gains with a focus on the following areas: Servicing, Voluntary Protection Products, Sales, Legal and Compliance, Accounting, Risk, Fraud, and other areas.
Senior Analyst, Pricing Analytics
Perform pricing simulations within an optimization system and analyze the impacts of various pricing scenarios on unit conversion, profitability, and risk. Collaborate with colleagues to maintain system of pricing models and regularly monitor performance.
Utilize external data sources to develop insights into the competitive dynamics of the auto finance industry including vehicle sales, interest rate environment, auto loan rates, dealer compensation, credit performance, and competitor loan origination patterns.
What you bring
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Accounting, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering or similar analytical / STEM field
Demonstrated relevant experience coding in SQL, Python and/or R (this will be tested during interviews)
Experience with Excel and Powerpoint, and Tableau experience
Creative and quantitative problem-solving skills with strengths in Data Acquisition, Manipulation, Cleaning, Analysis and Presentation of Results
Basic statistics knowledge
Presentation skills including proposing strategic recommendations to management and clearly articulating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Intellectual curiosity – always making an effort to understand and find the truth in the data
Ability to collaborate with others
Added bonus if you have
MBA or Master’s degree in an analytical field
Background in Auto Finance or Consumer Lending industries
Professional experience in one or more areas covered by the Analytics Job Family (see list above)
Intermediate to advanced statistics knowledge

What We’ll Bring
During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility and respect.
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.
Team Member Vehicle Purchase Discount
Toyota Team Member Lease Vehicle Program (if applicable)
Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.
Paid holidays and paid time off
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools and more.
Tax Advantage Accounts (Health Savings Account, health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA)
Belonging at Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace all perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Have a question, need assistance with your application or do you require any special accommodations? Please send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com.

title: Sr Insights & Analytics Analyst
description:
Nintendo of America Inc.
About Nintendo of America: From the launch of the Nintendo Entertainment System™ more than 30 years ago, Nintendo’s mission has been to create smiles through unique entertainment experiences. Here at Nintendo of America Inc., we deliver on this mission by partnering closely with Nintendo Co., Ltd., to bring Nintendo’s iconic and cherished franchises including Mario™, Donkey Kong™, The Legend of Zelda™, Metroid™, Animal Crossing™, Pikmin™ and Splatoon™ across the Americas through our video games, hardware systems, and collaborations with partners on a range of other entertainment initiatives like feature films and theme parks.
Based in Redmond, Wash., Nintendo of America serves as headquarters for Nintendo’s operations in the Americas. We are an equal opportunity employer offering a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, and the diverse consumers and communities we call home. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company’s website at https://www.nintendo.com/ .
SUMMARY:
Leads data analysis and research for the Nintendo of America Inc. (NOA) Communications team by crafting complex scalable business solutions that retrieve and aggregate data from multiple sources to present in a digestible and actionable format for various Nintendo business groups. Delivers recommendations for improvement to all analytic lines of thinking and technical solutions for the functional teams within Communications, including PR, Social Media, and Influencer Marketing.
DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:
Develops reporting and data warehousing solutions to address growing business reporting, analytics, and data requirements.
Leverages expert knowledge to develop reports and analysis to support Communications teams, including PR, Social Media, and Influencer Marketing.
Proactively identifies business questions and provides answers through executive level storytelling leveraging data and other materials.
Leads production of all reporting for Communications team, summarizing the results, trends and, opportunities within the ongoing campaign planning cycles and always-on public-facing communications.
Develops executive level content for business review presentations, including PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Act) on previous activities as well as forward-looking recommendations.
Owns the development of forecasting models and solutions end-to-end in support of business needs.
Leads primary research studies (leveraging both qualitative and quantitative methods) that provides in-depth insights and informs improvements to business processes, channel and functional strategies, and department KPIs.
Drives vision and requirements for new automated report solutions to meet long-term stakeholder data needs, as well as maintaining existing suite of automated reports.
Manages early warning system with social media tool(s) for key issues that could impact brand and acts as crisis team liaison.
Other duties as assigned.

SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS:
Five (5) plus years of experience in an Analyst role developing dashboards, analysis, reporting, and data warehousing solutions.
Experience managing direct reports highly preferred.
Expertise in SQL, relational databases, data warehousing, and automation.
Ability to work with extremely large datasets.
Experience in working with data visualization tools such as Tableau, building interactive reports, complex dashboards for different audiences, and creating calculated KPIs or metrics by writing complex formulas.
Ability to translate complex analytical work into meaningful insights and recommendations for business stakeholders preferred.
Demonstrated experience in how to extract, clean, and manipulate data from multiple systems into reporting objects for analysis.
Excellent project management skills with ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to tight deadlines in a high paced environment.
Experience in user interface design and data visualization front-end architecture and implementation experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in computer science, information systems, engineering, economics, or other technical field.
Applicants must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role
This position is hybrid in Redmond, WA. Hybrid positions require regular onsite work following the schedule and guidelines for their division. This position is not open to fully remote status at this time.

This position includes a base salary range of $105,300 - $168,500 annually, potential for a semi-annual discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and paid time off. Please see our Benefits & Perks page for more benefits information.

title: Manager of Reporting & Data Visualization
description:
TJX Companies
At TJX Companies, every day brings new opportunities for growth, exploration, and achievement. You’ll be part of our vibrant team that embraces diversity, fosters collaboration, and prioritizes your development. Whether you’re working in our four global Home Offices, Distribution Centers or Retail Stores—TJ Maxx, Marshalls, Homegoods, Homesense, Sierra, Winners, and TK Maxx, you’ll find abundant opportunities to learn, thrive, and make an impact. Come join our TJX family—a Fortune 100 company and the world’s leading off-price retailer.
Job Description:
Manager of Reporting & Data Visualization
Job Summary:
The Manager of Reporting & Data Visualization will lead the development and implementation of supply chain reporting and data visualization strategies within the organization. This role involves leveraging data analytics and visualization techniques to provide actionable insights, improve decision-making, and drive supply chain business performance. The successful candidate will work closely with operations, IT, and business teams to develop, execute, and measure data-driven strategies that enhance the ability to drive profitable sales.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop Reporting Infrastructure: Oversee the strategy, design, development, and architecture of the reporting infrastructure to ensure robust and scalable, self-service focused solutions.
Promote Data-Driven Decision Making: Advocate for the use of data, reporting, and visualization to drive key business, digital, and technology decisions.
Collaborate with Key Stakeholders: Influence the direction of key business partners (IT, operational groups, business units, vendors, etc.) to develop and execute data-driven reporting strategies.
Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME): Lead all initiatives related to reporting and data visualization, including data ingestion, governance, management, and analytics.
Enhance Operational Efficiency: Lead analytics initiatives to drive operational efficiency, reduce costs, and improve service levels through effective reporting.
Cross-Functional Partnership: Partner with cross-functional teams to improve business processes using advanced analytics and data visualization.
Data Governance: Develop rules for managing data governance, sharing, reporting, privacy, and security.
Process Improvement: Work with business and IT partners to improve business processes and automate reporting functions.
Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of data analysts and visualization experts to develop and implement data-driven solutions for reporting optimization.
Analyze Large Datasets: Uncover trends, patterns, and insights from large datasets to inform strategic decisions.
Present Findings: Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders.
Stay Updated: Keep abreast of the latest advancements in data visualization, analytics, and business intelligence.

Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field; master’s degree preferred.
Experience: Minimum 10 years’ experience in data analytics and visualization, with 5+ years leading a team, preferably within a business intelligence or reporting domain.
Technical Skills: Strong technical and business skills in data strategy, reporting systems, and data infrastructure development.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Visualization Tools: Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Leadership: Ability to lead and mentor a team, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines.
Proficiency: High degree of proficiency with Microsoft Office products.
Big Data Technologies: Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Oracle, SAP).
Benefits include Associate discount; 401(k) match; medical/dental/vision; HSA; health care FSA; life insurance; short/long-term disability; paid holidays/vacation /sick/bereavement/parental leave; EAP; incentive programs for management; auto/home insurance discounts; tuition reimbursement; scholarship program; adoption/surrogacy assistance; smoking cessation; child care/cell phone discounts; pet/legal insurance; credit union; referral bonuses. All benefits are subject to applicable plan or program terms (including eligibility terms) and may change from time to time. Contact your TJX representative for more information.
In addition to our open door policy and supportive work environment, we also strive to provide a competitive salary and benefits package. TJX considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity and expression, marital or military status, or based on any individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. TJX also provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local law.
Address:
300 Value Way
Location:
USA Home Office Marlborough MA 300 Value Way
This position has a starting salary range of $113,600.00 to $147,700.00 per year. Actual starting pay is determined by a number of factors, including relevant skills, qualifications, and experience. This position is eligible for an annual incentive as well as long-term incentives.

title: Revenue Cycle Analyst (Remote)
description:
Job Description
Align yourself with an organization that has a reputation for excellence! Cedars Sinai was awarded the National Research Corporation’s Consumer Choice Award 19 years in a row for providing the highest-quality medical care in Los Angeles. We also received the Advisory Board Company’s Workplace of the Year. This award recognizes hospitals and health systems nationwide that have outstanding levels of employee engagement. Join us! Discover why U.S. News & World Report has named us one of America’s Best Hospitals.
What will you be doing in this role?
The Revenue Cycle Analyst is responsible for the development, assessment and quantification of trends. This will require direct working relationships with management and key staff members, in addition to key members of Finance and Medical Network and Medical Center Departments. The primary duties of this role include:
Analyzing trends to determine where variances are occurring and develop reports to assess these variances.
Summarizing information, data, and recommendations, and preparing presentation materials. May present findings to management.
Making recommendations based upon overall analysis to effectively monitor areas of opportunity/risk.
Creating/developing regular and ad-hoc reports.
Payor Policy analysis and review.
Using independent judgment to resolve issues.
Completing complex/special assignments.

Revenue Cycle experience highly preferred
Tableau experience highly preferred.
Experience working with KPIs highly preferred.
Excel work experience, to include using advanced functions, preferred.
Why work here?
Beyond outstanding employee benefits (including health, vision, dental and life and insurance) we take pride in hiring the best employees. Our accomplished and compassionate staff reflects the culturally and ethnically diverse community we serve. They are proof of our dedication to creating a dynamic, inclusive environment that fuels innovation.

title: Amazon Reporting and Analytics Lead (Applicants from all over the world are welcome to apply.)
description:
Position Type: Full-time
Location: Applicants from anywhere in the world are welcome to apply. (Remote)
Schedule: Flexible EST
About the Company
Our client is a growth-focused firm that builds and scales high-performing e-commerce brands across Amazon, Shopify, and Walmart. With a strong track record of launching and operating successful consumer product brands, they bring a data-driven approach to brand building, combining performance marketing, operations excellence, and strategic innovation. Their team is fully remote, collaborative, and passionate about driving results in a fast-paced digital commerce environment.
About the Role
We’re looking for a skilled and forward-thinking Amazon Reporting and Analytics Lead to design and manage robust data reporting systems across Amazon, Shopify, and Walmart platforms. This role involves building scalable dashboards, automating data flows, and translating business needs into actionable insights. The ideal candidate is both technical and business-minded, comfortable working cross-functionally, and eager to grow into a leadership role within six months with mentorship from the current Head of Analytics.
Responsibilities
Build and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly ecommerce performance reports using Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, and similar tools.
Create user-friendly dashboards in tools such as Looker Studio or Power BI to visualize key performance metrics.
Integrate and analyze data from platforms like Amazon, Shopify, Walmart, Meta Ads, and Google Ads.
Develop and manage systems for data storage and organization using tools like BigQuery, Snowflake, or AWS.
Automate reporting processes using scripts and APIs to streamline workflows and reduce manual effort.
Collaborate with marketing, operations, and executive teams to deliver insights and answer key business questions.
Maintain clear and up-to-date documentation for all reports, systems, and dashboards.
Lay the groundwork for a high-performing analytics function, with the opportunity to grow into a leadership role.
Competencies and Qualifications
Must-Have
4-5+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or data engineering roles.
Direct experience with ecommerce analytics from platforms like Amazon Seller Central and Shopify.
Proficient in building automated reports and dashboards using tools like Looker Studio, Power BI, SQL, and Google Sheets.
Strong experience with data storage and pipeline tools (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS).
Excellent communication skills, able to explain data to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Self-starter with a proven ability to manage multiple projects independently in a remote setting.
Experience working with US or UK-based ecommerce or DTC companies.
Experience with API integration and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Apps Script).
Effective communicator who can translate data into meaningful narratives and influence decision-making at all levels.
Nice-to-Have
Prior experience in a fast-growing startup or analytics leadership role.
Background in consumer product goods (CPG) or digital marketing analytics.
Familiarity with tools like Segment, GA4, or Supermetrics.
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or technical field (e.g., Statistics, CS, Business Analytics).
Demonstrated stability in career progression—ideally someone who has grown within organizations and been promoted through performance.
Key Qualities
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and clearly communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Goal-oriented with a strong focus on driving measurable results aligned with business objectives.
Action-oriented, taking initiative to turn insights into execution and moving projects forward with urgency and ownership.
What We Offer
100% Remote Work – Work from anywhere in the Philippines.
Career Growth Opportunities – Gain hands-on experience, and continuous learning.
Collaborative & Innovative Team – Work alongside skilled professionals who value excellence.
Application Process
We understand that searching for a new job can be challenging, and we’re here to support you every step of the way. Our goal is to make the process as transparent and respectful as possible.
The interview process includes a Recruiter Interview, Client Interview, and Assessment. As part of the process, candidates complete a hands-on task during the technical interview. Throughout each stage, we keep you informed and provide feedback as quickly as possible, ensuring you feel valued and supported throughout your journey with us.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $1,405.00 - $2,600.00 per month
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Do you have experience integrating and analyzing data from platforms like Amazon or Shopify? If so, briefly describe.
Work Location: Remote

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:

Provide Business Intelligence insights to enhance strategic decisions as well as ensure SQL backend maintenance and integrity.

Job Summary:
The Junior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for reporting, data requests, ETL development and database maintenance.

Understanding of backup software and best practices

Advanced problem-solving skills

Self-starter who takes pride in the ownership of robust software solutions that meet specific, well-understood business needs
Experience working directly with internal clients, departmental managers, and executive leadership
High degree of professionalism and strong written and oral communication skills
Strong business acumen
Basic understanding of relational database concepts and best practices
Desire to constantly improve in various professional facets through assisted and unassisted means
Ability to learn quickly and to creatively solve new problems.
Ability to negotiate and settle differences quickly and peacefully.
Ability to act as a team player.
Education and/or Experience
1+ year’s experience working with Microsoft SQL Server
Experience with BI visualization software such as Tableau, Power BI or SSRS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
Experience with Salesforce and/or Marketo a plus

title: Business Technology Analyst
description:
The Business Analyst position will work closely with the business to collect business requirements, review, approve and implement design changes. Will also work with development team to ensure requirements are met. Will lead project teams providing technical and functional guidance. Will independently drive outcomes to meet the business needs with various Carlisle Technologies. Excellent communications skills, an above average work ethic and a positive customer service-oriented attitude is required.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Implement, maintain, and support of business solutions, to include but not limited to SharePoint, Power Automate, Power Apps, Power BI, Teams, and any related technologies the organization may employ. Work with business partners throughout the organization to leverage these resources to meet business goals.
Work as tier 3 support for user issues
Will work with Project Manager on projects that require project teams to complete
Assist all efforts to standardize usage of software in Carlisle.
Occasional upload of new data to entities or changes to existing in the timely manner
Elicit detailed business requirements from users and translate into technical or functional requirements
Create and maintain Technical Documentation in a central repository
Enforce data best practices and work with Business to correct deficiencies
Develop dashboards, views and charts within PowerBI, Share Point, Teams, etc..
Collaborate and work with others within IT on open projects as well as strategically evaluate where the Office 365 Platform would benefit current operational processes
Troubleshoot business issues as they arise
Required Skills/Abilities/Knowledge:
Three plus years of Business Analyst experience is required
Proven ability to provide leadership and engage effectively with multiple levels of business stakeholders.
Ability to manage own tasks, plan, organize and coordinate work assignments
Ability to propose, implement and maintain platform with the ever-changing Microsoft landscape
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Time-management and organizational skills.
Ability to collect and analyze data.
Basic knowledge of relation databases
Knowledge of computer technology.
Education and Experience:
3 plus years work experience as a business analyst.

title: SR Analyst, Store Ops BI and Reporting
description:
Overview:
Discover greater levels of performance. With over 1,200 stores throughout the U.S., Ulta Beauty is revolutionizing the beauty retail experience. With new stores coming online on a continual basis and the re-engineering of existing locations with the latest design and technological advancements for heightened guest experiences, we’re not just growing, we’re thriving. Through consistent innovation and a bold commitment to reimagination. If you want the opportunity to build something strategic, to take ownership of your career trajectory, to apply your passion to operational excellence, Ulta Beauty provides the kind of stability and support few organizations can match. So be curious. Be flexible. Be more than you thought possible. The future is yours at Ulta Beauty.

:
THE IMPACT YOU CAN HAVE

The Senior Analyst, Store Operations plays a key role in supporting the Store Operations team by delivering reporting and insights to both corporate partners and field leadership. As part of the Store Operations Analytics team, the Senior Analyst supports field-facing analytical tools and capabilities that empower store leaders and teams. This role is responsible for managing the daily performance and accuracy of existing dashboards, while also leading mid-sized reporting projects tied to operational business initiatives. This role collaborates with business stakeholders to define the reporting needed to enable data-driven decisions. The Senior Analyst then leads the buildout and delivery of the solution, partnering with data engineering teams as needed.

YOU'LL ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS BY:
Build, maintain, and iterate high-visibility Power BI reporting that are accurate, insightful, interactive, and durable
Partner cross-functionally with business leaders and stakeholders to enhance reporting processes and drive innovation.
Collaborate with IT to identify and resolve data inconsistencies, streamline processes, and improve data reliability.
Draft business rationale and technical requirements for ingestion of new data sources, additions to existing data models, calculation of new metrics, and improvements of existing reporting
Serve as a key resource for reporting needs, with a deep understanding of data sources and accessibility.
Manage support ticket SLAs, ensuring timely resolution of issues submitted by store and field leaders.
Manage recurring reporting initiatives that support business growth and decision-making.
Analyze and establish key relationship metrics across different business segments (services, retail, boutiques) while ensuring alignment with broader enterprise (e.g., finance, consumer analytics)
Work with the Manager of BI&A and Reporting to develop accurate and timely reporting that supports sales strategies and identifies new opportunities.
Build strong cross-functional relationships through trust, collaboration, and proactive communication across all levels of the organization.
Optimize and automate legacy reporting processes that currently include manual intervention

:
THE ESSENTIALS FOR SUCCESS

Bachelor’s degree in business, Analytics, or related field.
Proficiency in SQL and understanding of database design principles.
Experience with data visualization tools—Power BI preferred; Tableau, Looker also valued.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Highly organized, self-motivated, and curious, with a proactive mindset.
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel (advance), PowerPoint, and Word.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills.
Skilled at interpreting ambiguous data, developing insights, and communicating recommendations clearly.
General understanding of retail systems, operations, and technologies.
Demonstrated business acumen—retail or store-level experience a plus.
Capable of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Able to work independently with minimal supervision and adapt to changing priorities from a variety of stakeholders.

#LI-JR
#LI-Hybrid
: The pay range for this position is $77,600.00 - $93,000.00 / Year with the opportunity for eligible associates to earn additional compensation pursuant to the Company’s bonus plan. Exact pay will be based on factors including, but not limited to relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, level, shift, geographic location, and business and organizational needs. Full-time positions are eligible for paid time off, health, dental, vision, life and disability benefits. Part-time positions are eligible for dental, vision, life, and disability benefits. For additional information concerning our benefits, visit our Benefits and Career Development page: https://learn.bswift.com/ulta About:
At Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ: ULTA), the possibilities are beautiful. Ulta Beauty is the largest North American beauty retailer and the premier beauty destination for cosmetics, fragrance, skin care products, hair care products and salon services. We bring possibilities to life through the power of beauty each and every day in our stores and online with more than 25,000 products from approximately 500 well-established and emerging beauty brands across all categories and price points, including Ulta Beauty’s own private label. Ulta Beauty also offers a full-service salon in every store featuring—hair, skin, brow, and make-up services.

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest records, conviction records, or other criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of any applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York City Fair Chance Act.

title: Developer/Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Job Title : Developer/Business Intelligence Analyst
FLSA Status: Exempt (Salary)
Pay Range: $60,000 - $67,000
Department: IT
Reports To: Director of IT
Essential Functions:
Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, views, and functions.
Build and maintain SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
Build and maintain data interface solutions using SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services).
Develop dynamic and visually appealing Power BI dashboards and data models.
Maintain, enhance, and develop code for the ERP system.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline data flows and improve reporting processes.
Ensure data integrity and security in all solutions.
Troubleshoot data issues, analyze root causes, and implement long-term solutions.
Qualifications:
A minimum of 3 years of experience with SQL Server and strong proficiency in writing complex SQL queries and stored procedures.
Hands-on experience creating and managing SSRS reports in a production environment.
Proficiency in Power BI for creating dashboards, DAX calculations, and data modeling.
Experience in designing, coding, and testing business programs without impacting day-to-day operations.
Exposure to version control systems.
Experience with Unix is advantageous.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Experience with ETL processes and data integration.
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Benefits:
401k with 6% match
Health insurance
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Short and Long term disability
Life insurance
Paid time off
Employee discount
Employee assistance program

title: SharePoint & Power BI Developer
description:
EnTech Engineering, PC is a multidisciplinary engineering and construction management firm devoted to delivering best-in-class design and construction support services for infrastructure and facility projects that strengthen communities nationwide. Based in New York City, our firm is made of engineers, technologists, environmental scientists, construction professionals, and consultants who are passionate about improving the infrastructure, buildings, and communities that surround us.

About the Role:
EnTech is hiring a SharePoint & Power BI Developer to lead the development of our client-facing portal and data visualization tools. This role requires expertise in SharePoint Online and Power BI (including Report Server) to enhance collaboration, document management, and real-time insights for clients and internal teams.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
SharePoint
Design and implement SharePoint Online solutions tailored to client and team collaboration
Build secure document libraries, modern sites, workflows, and web parts.
Integrate with Microsoft 365 tools (Power Automate, OneDrive, Outlook, etc.)
Configure access controls and security groups using Azure AD and SharePoint permissions
Provide end-user documentation and training materials
Power BI
Develop dashboards and reports in Power BI Desktop and deploy them to Power BI Report Server
Build and manage secure, role-based reports for internal departments
Automate data refreshes and improve the performance of existing reports
Work with SQL Server, SharePoint lists, and other data sources for report creation
Help establish Power BI governance standards and publishing workflows

Required Qualifications:
3+ years of experience with SharePoint Online in a design/development role
Hands-on experience with Power BI Desktop, DAX, and Power BI Report Server
Proficiency in Power Platform tools: Power Automate, Power Apps, Microsoft Lists
Understanding of security, permissions, and site architecture within Microsoft 365
Strong UI/UX sensibility and ability to build intuitive portal experiences

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience deploying and maintaining Power BI Report Server in on-premises or hybrid environments
Working knowledge of SPFx, JSON formatting, and front-end customization
Familiarity with SQL, Azure AD, and Microsoft Teams integration
Experience in AEC or engineering project environments is a strong plus
Microsoft certifications (PL-300, MS-600, PL-900, etc.) are a bonus

Estimated Annual Compensation:
$95,000 - $120,000

Location:
New York, NY

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal opportunity for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other legally protected status. EnTech Engineering participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm work authorization.

title: Power BI Service Engineer
description:
About Infinitive:
Infinitive is a data and AI consultancy that enables its clients to modernize, monetize and operationalize their data to create lasting and substantial value. We possess deep industry and technology expertise to drive and sustain adoption of new capabilities. We match our people and personalities to our clients' culture while bringing the right mix of talent and skills to enable high return on investment.
Infinitive has been named “Best Small Firms to Work For” by Consulting Magazine 7 times most recently in 2024. Infinitive has also been named a Washington Post “Top Workplace”, Washington Business Journal “Best Places to Work”, and Virginia Business “Best Places to Work.”

We are seeking a Power BI Service Engineer to support our migration efforts during an enterprise domain split and separation. This role will focus specifically on identity repointing, workspace integrity, and data source continuity in the Power BI environment as we split a shared Microsoft 365 tenant into two.

This is not a dashboard development or BI analyst role—this is a backend-focused opportunity for someone with hands-on experience maintaining Power BI Service in enterprise environments where identity and access governance is the focus.

Responsibilities:
Audit and remap Power BI workspace roles and ownership during UPN/domain migration
Ensure seamless continuity of:
Dataset refresh schedules
Gateway configurations
OAuth-based and service principal–based data source connections
Coordinate with identity teams to:
Migrate or repoint Azure AD/Entra ID users and groups
Validate SCIM/SAML/SSO mappings as needed for Power BI access
Reassign ownership of:
Reports and dashboards
App workspaces
Datasets and pipelines (if in use)
Prevent and remediate broken:
Scheduled refreshes
Row-level security (RLS) policies tied to old user identities
Embedded or shared content

Required Experience:
3+ years administering Power BI Service in enterprise environments
Strong understanding of dataset refresh behavior, gateway configuration, and OAuth token security
Deep familiarity with Azure AD/Entra ID identity structure and how it ties to Power BI access
Experience with domain migrations, UPN changes, or identity provider transitions
Ability to navigate Power BI Admin Portal, audit logs, and tenant-level settings
Experience working with IT/Security teams to validate group and role mapping
Strong troubleshooting skills in access loss, broken reports, and dataset failures

Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with PowerShell scripts for bulk repointing users or managing API-driven workspace configuration
Comfort working alongside Okta or hybrid Entra/Okta SSO configurations
Prior involvement in tenant splits, M&A work, or regulated data environments

description:

About Us
We are a technology services company focused on data, analytics and intelligent robotic processes.

Job Description
Lead the design, development, and deployment of Power BI dashboards and reports to provide clear insights into operational, financial, and customer performance.
Collaborate closely with C-level executives to gather requirements, present insights, and support strategic decision-making.
Oversee end-to-end business intelligence lifecycle, including data gathering, modeling, visualization, and performance tuning.
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure alignment on goals and deliverables.
Analyze trends, identify root causes of issues, and recommend actionable solutions across transportation, warehousing, and last-mile logistics functions.
Manage and mentor a team of BI developers and analysts.
Partner with IT and data engineering teams to ensure data integrity and system integration from multiple logistics and supply chain platforms.
Establish KPIs and develop performance tracking frameworks for 3PL partners and internal logistics teams.
Drive data governance, standardization, and quality control processes to ensure reliable reporting and analysis.

Experience with data warehousing concepts and working with large datasets.
Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.

title: Business Analyst (Operational Analytics)
description:
University of Colorado Medicine (CU Medicine) is the region’s largest and most comprehensive multi-specialty physician group practice. The CU Medicine team delivers business operations, revenue cycle and administrative services to support the patients of over 4,000 University of Colorado School of Medicine physicians and advanced practice providers. These providers bring their unparalleled expertise at the forefront of medicine to deliver trusted, compassionate health care services at primary and specialty care clinics as well as facilities operated by affiliate hospitals of the University of Colorado.

We are seeking a highly motivated Business Analyst (Operational Analytics) to join our Operational Analytics Department (OAD).

This job can be performed 100% remotely, and out of state candidates will be considered.

The Business Analyst will coordinate analytics project delivery using agile methodologies while serving as a key liaison between business stakeholders and development team. Organizes sprint planning, facilitates requirements gathering, and drives efficient execution of analytics and automation initiatives.

Essential Duties
Facilitates regular team standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings
Maintains clear understanding of CU Medicine data ecosystem and the team’s technical capabilities
Leads information gathering sessions with business stakeholders to scope and solution technical specifications
Maintains project backlogs and sprint boards using agile project management tools
Works with OAD Leadership to identify impediments and resolve dependencies blocking analytics project delivery
Manages stakeholder expectations around delivery timelines and scope changes
Establishes and maintains delivery frameworks, standards, and best practices
Coaches team members on agile principles and continuous improvement
Requirements
2-4 years business analysis experience supporting technical teams
Strong facilitation and project management skills are essential to this role
Experience with agile project management tools (Azure DevOps, Jira, etc.) is required
Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) or equivalent agile certification preferred
Proven track record coordinating software development or analytics projects is required
Background in data analytics or technical process improvement is preferred
Experience working with SQL, Python, or automation platforms a plus
Experience building dashboards with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platform is a plus
Experience in healthcare (specifically revenue cycle) strongly preferred; experience with AthenaIDX is a plus
BA/BS or equivalent job experience is required
The ability to work in a team environment working cohesively with others to achieve goals and initiatives is essential
All applications MUST be submitted via our website. In any materials you submit, you may redact or remove age-identifying information such as age, date of birth, or dates of school attendance or graduation. You will not be penalized for redacting or removing this information.

CU Medicine is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment. We are committed to creating a workplace where all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, and we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, including protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment.
The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.
A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.
CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here.

CU Medicine will post all jobs for a minimum of 7 days or until 250+ applicants have been received (whichever comes first).

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

title: BI Data & Reporting Architect
description:
Who We Are:
Mid-States Distributing ("Mid-States") is the leading Farm, Ranch, and Home Retail Cooperative. Our company is owned by 29 independent Farm, Ranch & Home retailers (“Members”) who operate over 700 stores in 33 states with combined annual sales in excess of 7 billion dollars. Our member/owners retail items such as agriculture parts & supplies, petroleum products, hardware & tools, pet food, lawn & garden, animal health supplies, apparel & footwear, sporting goods, and various other products for the Farm, Ranch, and Home.
We are looking for competitive people who like to win big and have fun doing it. We place a tremendous amount of emphasis on creating a unique and positive company culture. Most of our employees will tell you this is the best place they’ve ever worked. We value high-energy people who like to work hard and play hard. Our consumers are primarily rural people raising “kids, pets, cows, and crops” so traditional values like God, family, and patriotism are important virtues around here. So, if you are enthusiastic and competitive, have a great attitude, have good communication skills, build relationships, love to win, and like ice cream – Mid-States is the place for you! If you are not, please apply with our competitors!
POSITION OVERVIEW:
The BI Data Architect is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing scalable business intelligence solutions that empower data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role involves collaborating with stakeholders to translate business requirements into robust data architectures, ensuring data integrity, availability, and optimal performance for BI systems. They ensure that a formal data standard is adhered to and that the company’s data assets align with the business's goals, establishing and maintaining a cohesive data strategy for both internal and external data.
The BI Data Architect is expected to partner with the BI team, senior leaders, and product teams to create scalable, flexible, and resilient architectures that address customer business problems, leveraging Domo as our primary platform for data ingestion, transformation, and visualization.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Design and implement scalable BI architectures to support business objectives and strategic decision-making.
Develop and maintain data models and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure efficient data storage, integration, and retrieval.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements, translating them into technical specifications and actionable BI solutions.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability across all BI systems and reporting environments.
Create and maintain connections to various data sources in Domo via API, direct query, no code JSON, etc.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
Establish and enforce best practices, standards, and guidelines for BI development and implementation.
Continuously evaluate and recommend improvements to existing BI solutions, staying current with emerging BI technologies and trends.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, COMPETENCIES, AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent work experience will be considered.
Minimum 5 years of experience in BI architecture, data warehousing, and data modeling.
Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Domo, Power BI, Tableau) and strong knowledge of ETL processes. Experience with Domo is a plus.
Have used programming languages such as SQL, Python, JavaScript for data manipulation. R, HTML, CSS would be a plus.
Experience designing and implementing data models, database structures, and data integration solutions.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Strong understanding of data security and compliance best practices.
Proven experience leading BI projects and managing stakeholder expectations.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Ability to stand, walk, reach, climb, bend and kneel
Ability to lift up to 30 pounds frequently and 50 pounds+ occasionally
Ability to reach above and below the shoulders
Ability to use hands and fingers to grasp, twist, and pull
Ability to withstand external weather conditions (rain, cold, heat or other adverse weather) to perform tasks as assigned
OTHER DUTIES:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
A few words from our COO:
Mid-States is truly the best company I have ever worked for. We strive to provide a unique, exciting, fulfilling work environment for our staff. We are cautious when we hire because we want to protect that environment. Drama, laziness, and entitlement have no place in Mid-States. Our company is very financially sound and growing like crazy. If you are an enthusiastic, high-energy person with a positive attitude and the skills described above, you may have just found the last job you will ever apply for. I look forward to meeting you. – Jeff

title: Data Analyst
description:
Piper Companies is currently seeking a skilled Data Analyst to support a digital transformation team in a remote capacity based in Columbia, MD.

Responsibilities for Data Analyst include:
Understands, cleans, models, and prepares data derived from an enterprise data warehouse and other primary data sources for analytics use
Identifies and documents key performance metrics for in-market products. Works with stakeholders to develop specific, repeatable definitions of metrics.
Develops and manages effective visualizations for key product metrics using Power BI. Conveys quantitative data in a way that is easily understood by stakeholder
Work with data scientists and analytics staff to operationalize data workflows and modeling.
Participates in meetings with the multi-disciplinary quality and service improvement team and on committees and
Represent the department and hospital in community outreach efforts on committees.
Communicates results and metrics with project stakeholders via clear written and spoken communication.
Qualifications for Data Analyst include:
Education: Bachelor's degree in relevant field
Experience: Minimum 3 years of related experience
Skills and Abilities:
Strong Data Modeling & analysis (familiarity with Databricks, Python/Pandas, SQL etc)
Proficiency with Relational Databases (Microsoft SQL Server preferred)
Proficiency with Version Control, such as GitHub or Azure DevOps
Proficiency in Power BI and Excel
Compensation for Data Analyst includes:
Salary Range: $80,000 to $110,000 **depending on experience*
Full Benefits: Remote environment, Healthcare, Dental, Vision, 401k, Paid Time Off, paid holidays and Sick Leave (as required by law)

This job opens for applications on 06/30/25. Applications for this job will be accepted for at least 30 days from the posting date.
