title: Six Sigma Black Belt
description:
Career Area:
Strategy
Job Description:
Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.
When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.
As a Lean Six Sigma Blackbelt, you will lead projects and initiatives located at our prime product facilities in North America as well as the remaining Paving facilities outside of North America. Your primary focus will be to identify waste within the Paving Product Development and Maintenance areas and execute projects to eliminate that waste. This involves collaborating with the global extended Paving team including business resources, engineering, manufacturing, purchasing, and supply chain to develop targets, identify projects to close gaps, and report out to leadership.
What You Will Do:
Lead the effort to identify both Lean and Cost opportunities for Cat Paving. This includes working with cross-functional leadership as well as the working teams to charter projects and get them piloted and in-place.
Lead the effort at Paving to simplify our products to achieve both cost reduction and development efficiency.
Lead the effort to drive efficiency in the Paving product maintenance space. This includes current product updates, quality fixes, component source changes, and other maintenance activities.
What You Have:
Bachelor's degree in engineering or business, coupled with extensive and progressive experience in product development, with a foundational understanding of product cost inputs, accounting methodologies, and tracking metrics.
Proven experience in project management, with a track record of leading cost projects and initiatives, particularly in a manufacturing or engineering environment.
Demonstrated ability to influence through expertise, effectively guiding and mentoring teams and stakeholders to achieve long-term competitive cost structure goals without direct leadership responsibilities.
Strong skills in requirements analysis, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams (including business resources, engineering, manufacturing, commercial, and supply chain) to develop targets, identify projects to close gaps, and report progress to leadership.
Top Candidates Will Have:
Master’s degree in business or engineering.
Six Sigma BB Certification
High level of verbal and written communication skills; an ability to see the big picture; the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects concurrently with a diverse global team.
Experience with data analysis, manipulation, and relevant tools (Excel, PowerBi, Tableau, etc.).
Additional Info:
Caterpillar operates in a in-person work environment, requiring 5 days per week of onsite, in office work.
Domestic relocation is available to those who qualify.
15% international and domestic travel is expected.
ISE is not available.
Visa sponsorship is not available.
Summary Pay Range:
$110,520.00 - $165,840.00
Compensation and benefits offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, job level, market location, job-related knowledge, skills, individual performance and experience. Please note that salary is only one component of total compensation at Caterpillar.
Benefits:
Subject to plan eligibility, terms, and guidelines. This is a summary list of benefits.
Medical, dental, and vision benefits*
Paid time off plan (Vacation, Holidays, Volunteer, etc.)*
401(k) savings plans*
Health Savings Account (HSA)*

These benefits also apply to part-time employees
Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.
Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Including Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Qualified applicants of any age are encouraged to apply.

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
9th Way Insignia is a service-disabled, veteran-owned small business bringing transformative technology to our government customers so they can achieve their missions. Our specialties include cybersecurity, cloud modernization, software development, data analytics, enterprise architecture, enterprise IT, analytics, process automation, and artificial intelligence. Learn more about 9th Way Insignia at https://9thwayinsignia.com/.
Team (Project) Introduction
The Office of Performance Analysis and Integrity manages and enhances the Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) which resides on one Oracle M8 Supercluster database and thirteen application servers. Our team provides the technical services required to sustain EDW applications to include Project Management, Data Warehouse Management, Advanced Analytics, Tableau Server Administration/Tableau Desktop Administration, Technical Collaboration Support, Lessons Learned, Executive Orders and Special Projects, Architectural Enhancement, and Cloud Migration. We also provide management, enhancement, integration, implementation, maintenance, modernization, and infrastructure support for EDW applications as well as enhancement and maintenance of business intelligence capabilities and predictive analytics.
9th Way Insignia is looking for a Senior Power BI Developer to join this team.
Professional Level Information
An Engineer 3 typically plans and directs research or development work on complex projects, along with engaging various parties in design and development. Costs and recommendations of new components may also involve part of the job scope. Performs multiple engineering-related tasks in various assignments within the project and firm. An Engineer 3 oversees the design, development, implementation, and analysis of technical products and systems. An Engineer 3 has broad knowledge of engineering procedures and assists in the resolution of complex problems. An Engineer 3 has strong technical skills and background, a knack for learning new technologies, and a blend of good problem-solving and innovation needed to resolve a wide variety of technical production challenges.
Responsibilities:
Participate in planning and design sessions of Power BI reporting solutions, ensuring they are scalable, performant, secure, and meet stakeholder reporting requirements.
Architect, design, and develop scalable, interactive reports and dashboards using Power BI that are intuitive and meet established UI/UX objectives.
Design and implement Power BI data strategies and models that support complex reporting and analytics and ensures optimal performance and scalability.
Create Composite Data Models by integrating data from disparate sources into Power BI, ensuring that data is accurately captured, transformed, and presented.
Implement security measures within Power BI reports and dashboards to ensure data confidentiality, integrity, and compliance with VA's data governance and security policies.
Monitor and optimize the performance of Power BI reports and dashboards to ensure they are running efficiently and effectively, minimizing load times, and enhancing user experience.
Collaborate with business analysts, database administrators, and other VA stakeholders to understand business requirements and deliver Power BI solutions that meet expectations.
Develop test plans and conduct thorough testing of Power BI reports and dashboards. Document software defects, resolve, and re-test to ensure the highest level of quality and reliability.
Draft training materials and documentation as required and assist Business Analysts to provide training and support to end users on the use of developed software products.
Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups, ensuring timely delivery of Power BI development tasks.
Solicit feedback from business stakeholders to gather UI/UX/CX insights of delivered Power BI reports, and document lessons-learned to inform future development efforts.
Serve as a technical leader within the project team, mentoring junior developers, and providing guidance on best practices in software development, data integration, and system design.
Requirements:
Master's degree in computer science or other technical disciplines (an additional 10 years of experience can substitute for a degree).
15+ years of relevant experience including 8+ years' experience developing Power BI dashboards and reporting products, especially data warehousing solutions.
Must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S
Must be able to obtain and maintain the required security clearance
Location
On site in Washington DC.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Overview:
The Business Intelligence Developer (BID) will analyze, provide specifications for, and write individual reports and data extracts for various applications across the organization. The incumbent is responsible for validating model/foundation reports and identifying advanced reporting needs for the organization, will create technical specifications and outputs for new requests, and will build using the appropriate methodology in the business intelligence stack.

Responsibilities:
1. Develop complex SQL queries against various data models. Collaborate with Business Intelligence Analysts to apply these solutions within the Epic Cogito framework and Power BI tool to deliver metrics and metric drill through for end users.
2. Validate Foundation System reports and identify advanced analytics needs with report consumers.
3. Determine data needs through collaboration with application analysts and requestors to understand their data needs.
4. Create design specifications for new reports.
5. Identify and validate appropriate technological solutions for various reporting needs.
6. Create new reports using a third-party report writing tool (such as Power BI). Modify existing reports as necessary.
7. Review peer reports for validity.
8. Test report build in a specified testing environment and volume testing in live environments.
9. Review upgrade documentation related to Clarity and Caboodle features and other released reporting content and determine how to implement the changes.
10. BIDs are also responsible for building including but not limited to Universes, SSAS Cubes, extracts, SlicerDicer, and reports to query the Caboodle Data Warehouse

Qualifications:
QUALIFICATIONS:
Must possess and maintain Epic certification in all applications in their area and other related areas within 3 months of training.

EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree in computer sciences, math or information systems required. Four or more years of relevant experience above the minimum required may be substituted for the degree requirement at the discretion of the Assistant Vice President, Digital Transformation.

EXPERIENCE:
Minimum five years of applicable experience required, to include at least one year of experience writing and troubleshooting SQL queries.

Minimum pay range: USD $82,048.10/Yr. Maximum pay range: USD $146,883.36/Yr.

title: Manager, Corporate Strategy
description:
Austin, TX
Requisition ID 2025-112936
Category Data Analytics and Strategy
Position type Regular
Pay range USD $102,500.00 - $130,000.00 / Year
Application deadline 2025-07-28

Your opportunity

At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.
The Corporate Strategy team is an internal strategy group that acts as a trusted advisor to executives and business leaders by providing thought partnership, strategic analysis, and insights. The group leads several key functions for Schwab to support informed decision making, including leading key strategic initiatives for our executives, maintaining perspectives on broader industry trends and Schwab’s competitive landscape, and supporting the annual corporate strategic planning cycle. Corporate Strategy supports the Board, C-suite, and senior leaders, and is responsible for delivering thoughtful, insightful contributions across a range of high-level strategic projects.
The Manager, Corporate Strategy will drive key strategic initiatives and insights across a range of topics, typically at the cross-enterprise or corporate level while working with business partners of all levels across the firm. Working both independently and in a team setting, the Manager will perform data-driven analysis, synthesize large quantities of information to generate insights, and contribute recommendations for strategy development that will drive sustained growth for Schwab.
The group is one of the main intake valves for high caliber talent at Schwab and provides members with an unparalleled opportunity to define and work on Schwab’s most critical strategic opportunities while gaining visibility among Schwab’s senior leadership.
What you will do
Facilitate a timely review and socialization of key components of our corporate strategy by collaborating with leadership and business partners (e.g., Communications) to ensure clarity, alignment, and consistent messaging across the company.
Prepare materials for and lead meetings with internal and external stakeholders (including executive leadership and the Board of Directors).
Regularly collaborate with business partners across all levels and subject matters to ensure that deliverables are high quality, completed on time, and with full stakeholder visibility.
Synthesize large quantities of information to generate insights through both quantitative and qualitative analysis
Develop high-impact analysis and presentations
Build and maintain perspective on strategic implications of key developments in the internal and external environment (e.g., industry trends, competitor actions)
Form strong relationships across the firm and cultivate the team’s linkages with different functional organizations across Schwab
Plan and execute workstreams for large, complex projects, as well as take full ownership end-to-end for smaller projects
In all aspects of the role, exercise professionalism and integrity in communications and actions, as well as prudent judgment in the handling of confidential strategic, financial, and other sensitive information
Manage and support ad-hoc strategy projects, investigating / answering critical questions for the Board and senior executives
What you will gain:
Opportunity to influence the key strategic decisions that are crafting the direction of the company
Learn how to balance “theory” and “practice” in adapting analysis and recommendations for the complexities of real-world conditions – industry trends, competitor actions, and client behavior
Develop credibility and rapport with key business partners as you learn about Schwab’s clients and businesses and develop a deeper understanding of key business drivers
What you have

To ensure that we fulfill our promise of “challenging the status quo,” this role has specific qualifications that successful candidates should have.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of work experience at a strategy consulting firm or 3+ years of work experience on an internal corporate or business strategy team
Significant experience working on strategy related projects
Experience with financial modeling, strategic planning, project management, market research analysis and business development
Excellent problem solving and storytelling abilities
Proficient in MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
Superior communication skills, both written and verbal, with demonstrated ability developing materials and effectively presenting to diverse audiences
Superior analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent collaboration and relationship building skills; ability to develop rapport and maintain positive working relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders and influence outcomes through partnerships
Comfort dealing with ambiguity in a dynamic and fast-moving work environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Prior experience in financial services
Experience with Tableau
The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for learning and is an enthusiastic team player comfortable working on multiple subject matters simultaneously

What’s in it for you
At Schwab, we’re committed to empowering our employees’ personal and professional success. Our purpose-driven, supportive culture, and focus on your development means you’ll get the tools you need to make a positive difference in the finance industry. Our Hybrid Work and Flexibility approach balances our ongoing commitment to workplace flexibility, serving our clients, and our strong belief in the value of being together in person on a regular basis.
We offer a competitive benefits package that takes care of the whole you – both today and in the future:
401(k) with company match and Employee stock purchase plan
Paid time for vacation, volunteering, and 28-day sabbatical after every 5 years of service for eligible positions
Paid parental leave and family building benefits
Tuition reimbursement
Health, dental, and vision insurance

Eligible Schwabbies receive
Medical, dental and vision benefits
401(k) and employee stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement to keep developing your career
Paid parental leave and adoption/family building benefits
Sabbatical leave available after five years of employment

title: Business Operations Analyst I
description:
About the Role:

The Business Operations Analyst is part of the WorldCompliance Data Operations team. We have analysts responsible for the Americas (LATAM and NOAM), APAC, and EMEA. This position will be part of the APAC region team and will have responsibility for supporting our regional office responsible for the US and other English-speaking countries.

An ideal candidate would have some knowledge or interest in world affairs, current events, politics, economics, history, criminology and/or similar subjects, and it may be beneficial for them to have some basic knowledge on the political, economic, and AML/CTF structures specific to those regions.

The candidates should also have the following skillset:
o strong written and verbal communication
o ability to juggle multiple tasks, projects, and responsibilities effectively, as well as a high volume of emails while remaining organized
o analytical mindset and critical thinking skills, and ability to analyze details and nuance
o Interpret and analyze data to explain variances and trends
o ability to apply knowledge developed through education, past experience, or examples from others
o Solve routine problems using existing procedures and standard practices
o Work within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines.
o proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite, especially Outlook and Excel
o aptitude to work well within a team atmosphere

The key responsibilities for the analyst role are:
o Customer Service:
o Provide resolutions to content and policies related inquiries from sales, clients, and other departments regarding our database. This is not technical support or frontline support, but the intent is for the BOA to be the Subject Matter Expert on the data and content within the WorldCompliance database, with a focus on the applicable region (e.g.: Americas, EMEA, APAC), and be able to clearly communicate on those topics to clients via email.

o Analysis (database/qualitative):
o Perform analytics and maintenance of the database. Utilize SQL, Tableau/PowerBI, Excel or just simple Google search to identify gaps, discrepancies, and possible enhancements, so the data continues to be relevant and comprehensive, and meet quality standards. Review information from government sites or media sources to identify relevant information and topics to the database. Research and interpret laws and regulations in other countries, especially Anti Money Laundering Laws, regarding financial crimes, politically exposed persons, and terrorism in order to provide the research teams with guidelines.

o Team/Project Management:
o Supervise offshore researcher centers located in 8 offices across 7 countries and 4 continents. Monitoring and ensuring production and productivity, clarifying policies and standards, coordinating projects and meetings to ultimately optimize the offices and the tools which they utilize. Act as a liaison between the research teams and the department director regarding project management, including updating both entities on project statuses with progress reports.

Example of a typical day:
o Check emails/review requests that came in overnight from clients, offshore teams, and/or internal stakeholders, and provide responses as needed to address requests, concerns, and provide deliverables in a timely manner.
o Process open items in internal queues, such as investigations on specific entities in the database, and deletion requests submitted by researchers.
o Review and process routine reports using Excel scheduled for that day.
o Attend/run meetings with internal or offshore teams as needed/applicable for that day.
o Prepare, develop, review, and/or execute projects in order to enhance the information in our database.

Interview Process:
We typically utilize a two round interview process. A 30 minute screening call will be scheduled with the team supervisor, and qualifying candidates who proceed to the next round will then be scheduled for a panel interview with the rest of WCO Operations team.

About WorldCompliance:
WorldCompliance is an Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorist Financing (AML/CTF) focused database which contains information which can help identify individuals and companies that are linked to more than 60 different risk categories, that demonstrates an elevated risk of abuse of the financial system and meets our inclusion parameters for the WorldCompliance categories and subcategories.

WorldCompliance data can be used to support a risk-based approach that helps businesses navigate shifting sanctions, compliance, and anti-bribery obligations by fortifying screening with an extensive database of sanctions, enforcements, PEPs (politically exposed persons), and adverse media.
https://risk.lexisnexis.com/products/worldcompliance-data

About the business:
LexisNexis Risk Solutions provides customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. We use the power of data and advanced analytics to help our customers make better, timelier decisions. By bringing clarity to information, we ultimately help make communities safer, insurance rates more accurate, commerce more transparent, business decisions easier and processes more efficient. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below,
https://risk.lexisnexis.com/
.

description:

Emotional: Fast pace environment, Able to handle multiple priorities, Frequent and intense customer interaction, Able to adapt to frequent change

The Database Reporting Analyst will be assigned to the Virtual Care Institute at VCU Health and will be responsible for providing insight-driven, clinical, operational and financial analyses to enhance and inform decision-making across the enterprise and to assess the impact of virtual care delivery. title: Sr. Data Analyst, Purchasing & Cost Analytics
description:
What to Expect
The Supply Chain Analytics team at Tesla is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to support our rapidly growing global supply chain organization by analyzing and visualizing data to drive informed decisions for launching and scaling various programs. In this role, you will lead the effective utilization of large supply chain datasets for our global supply management team, deliver impactful analytics solutions for Supply Chain Managers and Supplier Industrialization Engineers, and contribute to strategic projects and continuous improvement efforts across Supply Chain. You will interact with stakeholders at all levels, including executives, requiring a sharp business focus, excellent communication skills, and the ability to synthesize complex issues into data-driven solutions. As part of a fast-paced, innovative environment, flexibility, adaptability, and a proactive mindset are essential, and the ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a passion for data analytics, adept at automating processes and tackling complex problems to achieve desired outcomes.

What You'll Do
Support a large and expanding global supply chain organization by creating analytics solutions tailored to the needs of Supply Chain Managers and Supplier Industrialization Engineers
Design and maintain core analytics tools and dashboards to address stakeholder requirements and enhance decision-making capabilities
Drive automation initiatives to eliminate manual efforts and streamline reporting processes currently managed by stakeholders, saving time and ensuring better scalability and efficiency across supply chain teams and related function
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align analytics solutions with business goals and deliver actionable insights
Identify opportunities to optimize processes, proactively address risks, and ensure compliance through data-driven approaches
Monitor and enhance existing analytics workflows to improve scalability, accuracy, and stakeholder satisfaction

What You'll Bring
Degree in Data Analytics or equivalent experience
4-6 years of experience in Data Analytics, focusing on building dashboards, automating processes, and providing actionable insights in complex environments
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation, and experience with Python or R for data analysis and automation
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create intuitive and impactful dashboards for diverse stakeholders
Strong understanding of supply chain processes and metrics, with the ability to translate business needs into analytical solutions
Experience in automating manual processes and developing key performance indicators (KPIs) to support business objectives
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels

Compensation and Benefits
Benefits
Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
Tesla Babies program

Employee discounts and perks program
Expected Compensation
$108,000 - $186,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits

title: Data Analytics and Visualization Assistant/Assistant Research Scientist
description:
New York University: NYU - NY: Office of the Provost: Institute for Public Knowledge
Location
NYC or Remote
Open Date
May 06, 2025
Description
BACKGROUND:
Climate change is here, and storms that feel extreme now will only become more frequent and more intense. Rebuild by Design’s research on federal disaster declarations due to extreme weather, documented in the Atlas of Disaster (2022) and theAtlas of Accountability (2025) finds that 95% of Americans and 99% of congressional districts have had a climate disaster since 2011. The analysis includes county-level data for where major disasters have occurred, where post-disaster federal assistance has been given, where the most socially vulnerable populations reside, the energy reliability by utility area, and where compounding physical and social risks indicate a potential high return on investment. The research is a blueprint for equitable planning, and better decision-making for government, the private sector, philanthropy, and finance. Rebuild utilizes this data to call for state-level Resilient Infrastructure Funding sources supported by a ballot measure or a small surcharge on insurance, as well as a number of federal disaster policy changes to ensure that communities, no matter where they live, will not suffer from increasingly severe climate events.

Part-time Data Analytics and Visualization Assistant/Assistant Research Scientist
Working under the Director of Rebuild by Design, this position will support the organization’s climate adaptation research, spatial data analysis, and policy-driven publications that inform local, state, and national decision-making. This is an ideal opportunity for a graduate student or recent Master’s graduate interested in applying technical data skills to equity-centered, policy-relevant work.
Data Analysis & Policy Research
Analyze climate impact data (e.g., FEMA declarations, sea level rise projections, floodplains) using R, Python, or Excel to identify trends and vulnerabilities across states and counties.
Aggregate and clean publicly available datasets (ACS, CDC SVI, NOAA, etc.) to support climate adaptation policy recommendations.
Identify and extract key metrics that support equity-focused adaptation policies and reform opportunities.
Conduct research on existing adaptation strategies and legislation at the state and local levels.
Support the translation of quantitative findings into compelling data stories for a variety of audiences.

Geospatial Analysis & Mapping
Perform GIS analysis including spatial joins, overlays, and intersect functions to assess vulnerability and infrastructure exposure.
Create static and interactive maps using QGIS, ArcGIS Pro, or Mapbox for inclusion in public reports, presentations, and web-based tools.
Assist in developing geospatial methodologies that quantify climate risk and social vulnerability at multiple scales.
Maintain and organize internal geospatial datasets and metadata documentation.

Visualization & Communication
Develop clear and engaging data visualizations (e.g., infographics, charts, Tableau dashboards) to accompany reports and advocacy materials.
Collaborate with policy and communications teams to ensure that visual outputs align with messaging goals and are accessible to non-technical audiences.
Assist with layout and formatting of reports using InDesign, Illustrator, or Google Workspace tools as needed.
This position will require approximately 15-20 hours per week. Scheduling is flexible in coordination with the Rebuild team. Tasks can be performed at either the Rebuild by Design office at New York University or remotely.

Additional Information: In compliance with NYC’s Pay Transparency Act, the compensation for this position is $40/Hourly USD. A New York University considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and organizational considerations when extending an offer.

About Rebuild by Design
As the world faces rising populations, mass migration, climate change, social injustices, and economic challenges, communities can’t afford to wait until after the next crisis to plan for the future. Through regional competitions, local engagements, research and policy, Rebuild by Design is reimagining the way communities find solutions for today’s large-scale, complex problems by creating collaborations across communities and governments.
Rebuild convenes global expertise, with regional leadership, and community stakeholders to gain a better understanding of how overlapping environmental and human-made vulnerabilities leave communities at risk. Rebuild’s core belief is that through collaboration our communities can grow stronger and better prepared to stand up to whatever challenges tomorrow brings.

Rebuild achieves its mission through a four-pronged approach: regional competitions, place-based engagements, research & policy, and education. We are a small team with a passion for social justice and equity in all our work. We recognize that championing true equity and inclusion begins in our own office. We strongly encourage applications from people of color, women, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ individuals. If this position speaks to your interest and experiences, we strongly encourage you to apply. If you need any accommodations in the application process, please contact info@rebuildbydesign.org.

Qualifications
Qualifications
The ideal candidate will have a graduate-level background (or current enrollment in a relevant Master’s program) and the following skills:
Graduate degree (completed or in progress) in Urban Planning, Data Science, Public Policy, Environmental Studies, or a related discipline.
Demonstrated experience working with spatial data and GIS software (e.g., QGIS, ArcGIS Pro).
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as R, Python (Pandas, GeoPandas), or advanced Excel.
Familiarity with U.S. Census, FEMA, NOAA, and other public climate/socioeconomic datasets.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, Datawrapper, Tableau, Mapbox, Datawrapper) is a strong asset.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and synthesize complex information.
Commitment to equity-centered, climate-forward solutions and collaborative work environments.
Application Instructions
Please submit a resume and coverletter explaining why you want to work at Rebuild by Design through Interfolio. For accommodation request, please email info@rebuildbydesign.org. All other inquries regarding this posting will not be answered.

title: Data Analytics SME
description:
Company Description

Compass Government Solutions is a Woman Owned Small Business serving those who have served our nation and is committed to excellence in our daily practices. At Compass Government Solutions (CGS), our employees are our most valuable piece of the puzzle.

Job Description

Compass Government Solutions LLC is seeking an experienced Data Analytics SME to provide services to Service Members (active duty, reserve components, and National Guard), Coast Guard, Veterans, and their families at The Psychological Health Center of Excellence (PHCoE). In preparation to bid on this contract, we are seeking qualified candidates willing to be included in our proposal as interested and skilled individuals.
The Data Analytics SME (SME IV Data Analytics) will manage and produce analytics reported for all aspects of the inTransition program. This person shall be able to identify and report fluently on all metrics associated with the program. for the metric reporting requirement.
Job Requirements
Serve as the leading expert on data analytics methodologies, tools, and technologies within the organization.
Define and champion best practices and standards for data collection, cleaning, analysis, modeling, and visualization.
Research and evaluate new data analytics tools, techniques, and platforms, and make recommendations for adoption.
Develop and present complex data insights and recommendations to executive leadership and other stakeholders.
Identify opportunities to leverage data analytics to drive innovation, improve efficiency, and enhance decision-making across the organization.
Stay abreast of the latest trends and advancements in data analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.
Troubleshoot complex data-related issues and provide expert solutions.
Evaluate the performance of analytical models and recommend improvements.

Qualifications
A bachelor’s or master’s degree and three years or more relevant experience in mental health data analytics or a related field (healthcare data analytics)
At least one year of experience post-degree in mental health data/database management
At least one year of experience post-degree in analysis and presentation of program data
Proficient with database management and/or statistical software such as Excel, Access, Stata, or SPSS. Proficiency in SQL and Tableau

Accrued paid time off
Paid Federal Holidays
Health and Wellness benefits to help cover medical costs
Dental and Vision Plans
401k Plan
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

title: Microsoft Power BI Developer
description:
Job ID: 2507204
Location: REMOTE WORK, VA, US
Date Posted: 2025-07-09
Category: Software
Subcategory: SW Engineer
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time
Minimum Clearance Required: Secret
Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None
Potential for Remote Work: Yes

Description
Introduction
Make a difference for national security by joining a team of dedicated IT professionals who will sustain, modernize and transform the enterprise IT capabilities for the Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency (DCSA). The Air Force and Combatant Commands Business Group of SAIC is seeking a Microsoft Power BI Developer to support a transformational infrastructure program for DCSA.
SAIC is proud to be supporting DCSA in safeguarding our nation’s information. DCSA is the designated oversight authority on the accreditation of classified facilities, information systems, and the insider threat program. This involves security oversight of more than 10,000 companies and approximately 13,000 facilities involved in classified work throughout the DoD and 31 Federal agencies.
Specifically, on the DCSA One IT program, SAIC will provide an enterprise IT solution that delivers highly secured and adaptable IT infrastructure, provides customer support, and cutting-edge technologies that support operations and advance the DCSA mission under a single IT environment (i.e., One IT).
Job Description
The Microsoft Power BI Developer will work with our team of IT professionals to design, develop, and deploy interactive reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI to visualize and analyze data to assist government clients with making data-driven decisions. The Power BI Developer will work with stakeholders to understand business requirements, extract and transform data from various sources, and create insightful visualizations.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Working with stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and translating them into technical specifications for Power BI solutions.
Developing data models within Power BI, importing data from various sources, and transforming it into a usable format for analysis.
Designing and building interactive and user-friendly Power BI dashboards and reports, using visualizations to effectively communicate data insights.
Performing data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.
Providing support to users and troubleshooting issues related to Power BI reports and dashboards.
Working closely with Power Platform developers and other stakeholders to deliver effective BI solutions.
Documenting, testing, and demonstrating solutions to government clients.
Qualifications
It is required that the Microsoft Power BI Developer have the following qualifications.
Required Qualifications:
IAT II certification i.e., SEC+ or higher.
Bachelor's degree.
Nine (9) or more years of experience.
Secret security clearance.
Demonstrated expertise using Microsoft Power BI, including data modeling, visualization, and DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) to build dashboards and data analytics.
Ability to perform ad-hoc analyses and created standard reports.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders and present findings.
Skilled using Microsoft 365 suite of applications.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to multitask and remain flexible with shifting priorities.
Ethical and hard-working; able to perform with minimal supervision.
U.S. Citizenship.
Desired Qualifications:
Master's degree.
Seven (7) or more years of experience.
Proficiency in SQL and/or other programming languages.
Experience with integrating different data sources into SharePoint including the use of Power Platform connectors.
Experience with Microsoft Dataverse.
Experience with Agile and iterative software development methodologies.


Target salary range: $120,001 - $160,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

title: Data Analyst/Data Visualization Developer (PSS2), Rowan Online
description:
Data Analyst/Data Visualization Developer
Help Rowan University make data-driven decisions that shape the future of online education.
Rowan University's next area of explosive growth is Rowan Online, and you can be the professional who helps our leadership team understand the data related to our students, faculty, and courses. We're looking for a Data Analyst who gets excited about transforming numbers into actionable insights.
What you'll do
You'll evaluate datasets from across our university to answer the big questions: Are online students succeeding? Which courses are working best? How can we support our online faculty more effectively? Then, you'll compile, analyze, and present dashboards that directly influence how we operate and grow.
Your work will include:
Analyzing student information, including performance, engagement, and retention patterns
Tracking course effectiveness and identifying improvement opportunities
Evaluating performance and faculty support needs
Creating clear, compelling reports and dashboards for leadership
Building data models that help predict trends and outcomes
Collaborating with different departments to understand their data needs
Why this role matters
Good decisions require great data, and that's exactly what you'll provide. Our leadership team relies on accurate and timely insights to make informed choices that impact thousands of students and hundreds of faculty members. Your analysis will help Rowan Online to understand where to invest resources, which programs to expand, and how to better serve and enrich our online academic community.
What we're looking for
3+ years of experience analyzing data with tools like Tableau.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and at least one statistical software (R, Python, or similar)
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
Ability to explain complex findings to non-technical audiences
Detail-oriented but also able to see the big picture
Curious mindset and knack for asking the right questions
What you'll get
Flexible/Hybrid work arrangements with State Holidays and 3+ weeks of paid time off
Professional development opportunities
Chance to directly impact how we serve our students
Collaborative team that values your expertise
Salary & Benefits:
In compliance with The State of New Jersey's Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for this position is AFT: Range 24 $73,899.91 to $84,980.25, with placement within the range determined by candidate's qualifications, professional experience, internal equity, and other factors.
For eligible employees, benefits include: comprehensive NJ State health, dental and retirement benefits, extensive accrued time off/paid holidays, and tuition reimbursement for employee, spouse, and dependents to attend Rowan University, Glassboro. (Tuition reimbursement will apply to undergraduate degrees only for spouse and dependents).”
For more detailed information, please visit: https://sites.rowan.edu/hr/benefits/
Notes:
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the US, and the university will not sponsor an applicant for a work visa for this position.
Only completed, online applications submitted on or before the deadline will be considered.
Ready to help us make smarter decisions with better data? We'd love to hear from you.

HIRING CONTACT: Thomas (Wayne) Baker, (713) 397-2804

PHYSICAL WORK ADDRESS: IT-Application Development, TPWD Headquarters, 4200 Smith School Road, Austin, TX 78744

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
Under the direction of the Strategy/Business Development Manager, this position performs complex (journey-level) computer programming work including interacting closely with project management and customers to develop requirements, design, build and maintain custom reports and dashboards. The primary focus for this position will be on development of reports, paginated reports, views and dashboards in a Power BI environment. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Performs additional duties as assigned. Complies with all Agency, Division and Branch rules, regulations, and procedures.
NOTE: Required to pass a national fingerprint-based background check to maintain employment.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s degree.
Experience:
Minimum of three years of full-time experience creating enterprise-level reports using business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or comparable platforms.
At least one year of hands-on experience developing interactive reports and dashboards specifically within Microsoft Power BI.
One year of experience designing and generating Power BI paginated reports.
NOTE: Experience may have occurred concurrently.
Background Check:
Required to pass a national fingerprint-based background check prior to employment offer. Potential candidates will be responsible for expenses related to the background check.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
Graduation from an accredited college or university with an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science or Data Science.
Experience:
Experience in the Microsoft Power BI platform, including Power BI Service, Power BI Report Builder, and Power BI desktop.
Experience integrating Power BI reports into custom-built web applications with Oracle databases and Dataverse as the data sources
Experience with paginated reports in producing government issued precise placement documents, such as titles, licenses, certificates, etc.
Experience in related Microsoft apps such as PowerApps, Power Automate, RPA, and Power Pages.
Experience with Oracle, SQL, SAS, the Dataverse, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Two years of the required experience performing Power BI report building is from a Texas government agency.
Licensure:
Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate certification (PL-300).

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Knowledge of designing and implementing reports with Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and Power BI Report Builder.
Knowledge of the various Power BI report types and has clear understanding of their use cases.
Knowledge of Power Query, M code, and DAX.
Knowledge of current technological trends in Power BI, report development and business intelligence.
Knowledge of functional, business and architectural aspects of Power BI components for providing solutions.
Knowledge of Power BI best practices.
Knowledge of Power BI datasets, Apps report packages, Dataflow, Datamart, deployment pipelines, and Workspaces.
Knowledge of how to connect to various data sources.
Knowledge of data management and data governance best practices.
Knowledge of Agile, Iterative and Waterfall project methodologies.
Knowledge of developing applications for compliance with Section 508 of the U.S. Rehabilitation Act.
Skill in the Power BI platform and its capabilities.
Skill in creating various types of Power BI paginated reports, such as precise placement fulfillment paginated reports (certificate cards, title documents, coupons, etc.), table layout detail paginated reports, summary paginated reports, and receipts.
Skill in creating different paginated report implementations and printing options, such as ensuring report compatibility with non-standard print sizes and OCR font printing and configuring print tasks to select specific paper trays for output; producing PDF and Excel files for output.
Skill in integrating Power BI reports into custom-built web applications preferably with both Oracle databases and the Dataverse as data sources.
Skill in creating and publishing visually appealing Power BI interactive reports, mobile reports, and dashboards.
Skill in developing ad hoc reports with variable selection criteria and visualizations, such as slicers, charts, graphs, maps, tables, etc.
Skill in designing and developing data models.
Skill in data transformation, data cleanup, data consolidation, etc. using Power Query.
Skill in advanced data transformation tasks using M code.
Skill in creating custom calculations and measures using DAX.
Skill in connecting to a variety of data sources using connectors and creating custom connectors.
Skill in managing real-time and batch fulfillment jobs, including night-time batch fulfillment that updates databases.
Skill in managing data refresh schedules to ensure up-to-date information.
Skill in optimizing data models for faster query performance.
Skill in managing permissions to reports, row level security, and sharing reports with stakeholders.
Skill in using pipelines and version control.
Skill in troubleshooting production issues.
Skill in using MS Excel, Word and Outlook.
Skill in effective verbal and written communication with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Skill in collaborating with other developers and developing in a multi-tier environment.
Skill in establishing and maintaining effective work relationships with co-workers and work-related contacts.
Skill in prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines.
Ability to work independently with little or no supervision.
Ability to integrate Power BI report technologies and methodologies into an existing application development environment.
Ability to understand and analyze requirements and provide solutions.
Ability to develop reports from ground up including designing database tables, user interfaces, and report delivery.
Ability to choose the right type of visualization for different data types and applications.
Ability to manage data and report delivery ensuring data privacy and compliance with agency policies.
Ability to create documentation and user guides for reports and dashboards.
Ability to provide support and training to end-users.
Ability to implement best practices for improving report performance.
Ability to conduct testing, verification, troubleshoot and performing root cause analysis.
Ability to understand statistical concepts, methods, KPIs and metrics.
Ability to perform detailed work accurately.
Ability to maintain flexibility and work with frequent interruptions and multiple changing priorities.
Ability to follow standards for report and software development.
Ability to perform the steps required of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
Ability to process information logically.
Ability to manage several projects simultaneously.
Ability to participate in Joint Application Development sessions for requirements gathering.
Ability to conduct work activities in accordance with TPWD safety program.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Required to work overtime as necessary.
Required to provide after-hours support as needed.
Required to pass a national fingerprint-based background check to maintain employment.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Sony Electronics Inc. is looking for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. In addition to competitive pay and benefits, we offer an environment and culture that promotes Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. In addition, our team members enjoy innovative work-life balance opportunities including a hybrid home/office workplace, monthly “Free Fridays”, and early shutdowns on Fridays throughout the year (including half-days during the summer).

So, if you want to join a “Best Place to Work” company and make the world say wow, let's talk.
The Business Intelligence Analyst works with the business intelligence SNA Reporting team. The team is responsible for working closely with the business and technical teams and is a contributor to the definition and analysis of how information assets drive business outcomes and is responsible for the development and maintenance of business intelligence and reporting tools.
Responsibilities
This role will take on a portion of the above duties as well as maintaining the business intelligence and reporting tools, which will include enhancements to existing reports and structures with some development. Also, there will be daily monitoring, troubleshooting and user support of BI platform tools and interfaces; daily/weekly/monthly/annual - report creation, maintenance and other business support for running the business activities and support the business intelligence team in overall department support/request of running the applications, reports and platforms. Furthermore, this individual should be capable of working in a team and individual environment, be self-driven within the responsibilities of this role.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Data/Information Science or Information Technology or 3 years work experience and a Degree in Science, Engineering, or Mathematics.
3+ years professional experience in business reporting applications from various source systems
Previous Work Experience in Data Analytics and Data Engineering
3+ Years Working use of Power BI and Power Query
Experience in designing Power Automate Cloud and Desktop Flows
Knowledge and experience of data structures, data modeling, and data warehousing strategies.
Understanding of how data is turned into knowledge to support business decisions and possess an understanding of the business environment, competitive landscape and market.
Knowledge in Financial and Sales Reporting
Effective communication skills
Advanced Excel knowledge
Preferred Requirements:
Advanced knowledge with Microsoft PowerBI, Power Query and Excel
Experience with SAP
Experience with SAP BW
Experience with SQL
Experience with Python Script
Experience with Visual Basic Application (VBA) Macros
Experience with Microsoft Power Automate
Knowledge and/or hands-on practice with Microsoft Fabric a plus

In addition to a competitive base salary, this position is also eligible for an annual corporate bonus plan, which is based on company performance and is not guaranteed, and a comprehensive benefits package including healthcare benefits (medical, dental, and vision), paid medical leave, a 401k plan with matching company contributions, vacation time, education assistance, student loan assistance program, eighty hours of paid sick leave time annually, and up to twelve weeks paid parental leave.

WHAT WE'RE DOING
Join Lockheed Martin Rotary and Mission Systems, Cyber & Intelligence, where we foster innovation and integrity.

TKO provides systems engineering, software development, data science and cloud development and engineering services to the Cyber Infrastructure Solutions customer. The services enable the Data Transformation, Malware Analysis, and Cyber Threat Intelligence processing and sharing capabilities for the customer, fulfilling mission objectives and offering actionable information to detect and mitigate cyber threats. WHO WE ARE
Lockheed Martin is a global leader in aerospace, defense, and security solutions, committed to excellence and integrity.

WHO YOU ARE

You will provide extensive Power BI expertise to the development team, work with customers to resolve complex Power BI issues, and fulfill new data ingest requests, among other tasks.

title: Operations Analyst - Tableau
description:
Join the exciting world of Travel and help grow America’s largest full-service travel agency!
Do you have a passion for making a meaningful impact? This is your chance to lead a transformation to modernize the data, reporting, and analytics environments of a very large department serving hundreds of vendors, thousands of employees, and millions of members. We support travel and in-branch members services and sales, including DMV, Notary, and more. We have an ambitious goal to grow our travel business by 50%, and we need your help to build creative and actionable solutions to help us find opportunities, boost productivity, drive sales, and generally operate at a higher level. As the lead on a team of developers, you’ll have the opportunity to drive the strategic direction of our analytics while leading the growth of other analysts. Come be a part of something big as we transform our business for growth and success to support one of our core products.

Who We Are Looking For
If you are a passionate and creative developer with a strong technical background in Tableau, and you get joy from driving business changes with your solutions, then we want to hear from you! We’re looking for someone to lead the modernization of our reporting environment by transitioning all visualization and analytics solutions to Tableau while leveraging cloud data sources (AWS). To be successful in this mission, you should be very comfortable with large and highly complex data environments of a large enterprise, have strong data prep and scripting (initial SQL) skills, and be able to develop beautiful and creative solutions that solve business problems without requiring detailed specs (consultant minded). Your primary mission is to help drive sales, grow revenue, and optimize operations. To do this, you must understand the business well enough to independently design and develop solutions that delight your customers. We want your solutions to drive our team to reach new heights, enable breakthroughs, and drive success.

Key Qualities We Value
Craftsmanship : Measure twice; cut once. Maintain an extreme attention to detail and focus on delivering the highest level of quality.
Integrity: Lead from the front and by example. Inspire others through your own growth, say what you mean, mean what you say, and exercise courageous candor.
Fun-loving : We believe in enjoying our work and celebrating successes together.
Communication : Be able to adjust your verbal and written communication based on your audience, whether explaining complex technical terms with a developer, an executive or any level in between.
Inspirational : Embrace challenges as opportunities and be inspired to try new things.
Creative Problem Solver : Passionate about problem-solving and seeking innovative solutions to overcome challenges, break through walls, and navigate barriers.
Consultant minded : Focus on deeply understanding the problem to make recommendations that others may not consider. Don’t be an order taker; be a solution provider.

What You'll Be Doing
Design, develop, and deploy Tableau solutions that drive results, answer questions, and solve business problems.
Support other analysts as they embark on their journey to learn Tableau
Drive technical excellence within the team, ensuring best practices are followed
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to overcome and resolve dependencies
Foster a culture of courage and experimentation by exploring new ideas, technologies, and approaches to problem-solving
Maintain a consultant-mindset in place of an order-taking mindset
Oversee the full development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment and maintenance, ensuring projects are delivered on time and with high quality.
Champion a collaborative and inclusive team environment, promoting communication, trust, and respect among team members.
Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies, identifying opportunities for innovation and continuous improvement.

What We Require
Proficient in designing and building interactive dashboards.
Experience developing operational reports, forecasts and variance analyses.
Experience working in Enterprise Data Warehouse environments.
Experience writing complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from different sources.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive decision-making and strategic initiatives.

Use various features such as filters, parameters, and calculations to create interactive and guided navigation links within the dashboards
Experience working with various data connectors, especially AWS
Knowledge when to use extracts versus live connections
Skilled in knowing which visuals have the most impact for the desired use-case.
Must be a self-starter and require limited guidance towards project deliverables.

The starting pay range for this position is:
$90,400.00 - $120,300.00
Additionally, for full time positions, you will be eligible to participate in our incentive program based upon the achievement of organization, team and personal performance.
.

Remarkable benefits:
Health coverage for medical, dental, vision
401(K) saving plan with company match AND Pension
Tuition assistance
PTO for community volunteer programs
Wellness program
Employee discounts
Auto Club Enterprises is the largest federation of AAA clubs in the nation. We have 14,000 employees in 21 states helping 17 million members. The strength of our organization is our employees. Bringing together and supporting different cultures, backgrounds, personalities, and strengths creates a team capable of delivering legendary, lifetime service to our members. When we embrace our diversity – we win. All of Us! With our national brand recognition, long-standing reputation since 1902, and constantly growing membership, we are seeking career-minded, service-driven professionals to join our team.

“Through dedicated employees we proudly deliver legendary service and beneficial products that provide members peace of mind and value.”

AAA is an Equal Opportunity Employer

The Automobile Club of Southern California will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable federal, state, and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance (FCIHO), the Unincorporated Los Angeles County (ULAC) regulation, and the California Fair Chance Act (CFCA).

description:

title: Brazil Country Analyst - Apple Maps
description:
Apple Maps Evaluation is seeking a country analyst to represent the Brazilian market who is passionate about enhancing the user experience of Apple Maps in the locale. An ideal candidate will have in-depth knowledge of the country's nuances, understands the geographical, social, cultural, and historical conditions of the country and recognizes the unique challenges to bridging the gap. You will thrive in highly dynamic environments and will encourage the team to build an incredible customer experience with every interaction. You will be an advocate for your country and play a key role in influencing our partners and collaborators to create a positive impact on shaping customer experience for the desired market, which is a key to success in this role.

Description

We are looking for a great teammate and a business-savvy individual! You can quickly grasp and distill highly complex insights into clean, comprehensible reports. You are a skilled communicator at all levels of leadership and possess the ability to make informed decisions in partnership with your collaborators. You Will: - Analyze and grade large data sets relevant to your specific market to monitor and maintain evaluation data quality - Validate Maps data from internal databases and external sources, investigate and provide feedback on issues and trends reported - Report performance metrics and present trends and insights to partners and collaborators - Provide local expertise with recommendations and insights from quality metrics for Maps products and features to influence product direction - Manage day-to-day priorities and requests from various partners, ensuring results for your market - Identify improvement opportunities, initiate, implement and deliver evaluation projects to inform on areas of opportunity

Minimum Qualifications
Possess local knowledge (address format, regional trends, user behavior and expectation, etc.) and language skills (proficiency in reading, writing and speaking) for Brazil
2+ years experience in Search Relevance and Search Quality
2+ years experience in analyzing and grading large data sets, conducting quantitative & qualitative data analysis, preferably geospatial data
Strong web research and problem-solving skills, with ability to recognize patterns and apply inductive and deductive reasoning on a global scale
Meticulous, strong organizational, analytical, decision-making and critical thinking skills
Ability to work across multiple timezones, cultures and business groups

Preferred Qualifications
Excellent written and communication skills, with solid ability to navigate ambiguity
Experience in working with software engineering and data scientist teams to implement solutions to open-ended problems
Experience managing programs/projects for feature and data quality evaluation and user experience improvement in a multicultural setting
Able to prioritize and complete multiple assignments and work successfully with teams on multiple projects under tight deadlines
Experience with analytics tools and scripting languages (e.g., Tableau, SQL, Python)

Pay & Benefits

At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $118,500 and $244,100, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

title: M365 Power Platform Developer
description:
Job #: R-00161524
Location: Remote, US
Category: Software Development
Schedule (FT/PT): Full Time
Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the time
Shift: Day
Remote Type: Remote
Clearance: Public Trust
External Referral Program: Ineligible
Sector: Digital Modernization

Description
Leidos Digital Modernization Group in Windsor Mill, MD in support of the End User Centric IT Support (ECIS) Contract for Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) is looking to improve and advance the organization. Our program is focused on the delivery of end-user centric IT technology solution to our customer CMS where we are challenged to provide ongoing innovative and seamless experience while using CMS systems, applications and solutions, provide proactive secure development of IT integrations, concepts, and designs across the CMS enterprise and integrate end-user computing devices, conference room technology, infrastructure hardware and software, and user applications into a streamlined and seamless experience across the CMS user base. We foster a positive end-user experience while ensuring protection of the data.
Primary Responsibilities
The successful candidate under the direction of the Development and Engineering Lead, Product Manager, Program Manager and Deputy Program Manager will work within an Agile ITIL environment with a large focus on DevOps. The candidate will be a member of the ECIS Development Team providing Subject Matter Expert support for the M365 Power Platform. You will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and delivering innovative software solutions that enhance user experience across various Microsoft products and services. You will independently develop solutions, approaches, or recommendations to resolve a wide range of complex issues for both internal and external customers, including vendors. These tasks often require a flexible work schedule.
The candidate may need to deliver presentations and produce well-written technical documents tailored to the customer's environment and objectives. Participation in scrum sprint activities related to M365 Power Platform solutions will be required as necessary. The candidate must possess strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with the customer's technical staff.
The role is focused on Power Apps backed with modern PP components (including AI components, power pages and especially Dataverse.
Additional responsibilities include troubleshooting and collaborating with other technical functional groups such as Service Desk, Datacomm, EUA, Security, and Engineering Teams for all supported technical issues. Other duties will encompass, but are not limited to:
Application Development: Design, develop, and deploy custom applications using Power Apps to meet business requirements.
Workflow Automation: Create, configure, and maintain workflows using Power Automate to automate business processes.
Data Visualization: Develop interactive and insightful dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Solution Design: Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Integration: Integrate Power Platform applications with other Microsoft and third-party applications.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, secure, and aligned with business objectives.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with the latest features and updates in the Power Platform and propose improvements to existing applications.
Assist with customer workshops to identify pain points and design effective Power Platform solutions.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for developed solutions.
Support: Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power Platform applications, providing ongoing support and maintenance.
Technical Leadership: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers, ensuring best practices and high-quality deliverables.
Work closely with other support teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment.
Champion a collaborative culture, sharing knowledge and fostering innovation.
Optimize performance, scalability, and reliability.
Assist in the development of concise and accurate engineering documentation on current and proposed cloud environments including Visio Diagrams, As-Built documents, recommendations for solutions, run books, knowledge guides, and other operations guides.
Work with little or no supervision, provide guidance to the team when necessary, and be able to adapt to changing requirements.
Participate as required with Agile Scrum sprints and other Agile ceremonies.
Stay abreast of current and emerging technologies, regularly analyzing and evaluating their impact and benefit to the customer by providing recommendations to management
Provide guidance to address risks related to data privacy, ethics, and compliance.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree and 8+ years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Dataverse.
Strong understanding of Microsoft 365 services, including SharePoint, Teams, and OneDrive.
Familiarity with Azure services, including Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Azure DevOps.
Proficiency in programming languages such as JavaScript, C#, and SQL.
Knowledge of REST APIs, JSON, and OAuth.
Knowledge of Azure services and how they integrate with Power Platform.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or higher security Clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong understanding of Microsoft Dataverse (formerly Common Data Service).
Experience with API integrations and custom connectors.
Knowledge of data management and governance.
Experience with SharePoint, Dynamics 365, and other Microsoft 365 services.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Previous experience working in an agile scrum environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Detail-oriented and highly organized.
Proactive and able to adapt to changing project requirements.
Previous experience employing DevOps methodologies.
Strong leadership experience and willingness to embrace change.
Experience with change control principals and ticket with Service Now (SNOW).
Understanding of agency Capstone and NARA data retention compliance principles.
Experience with design, planning and implementation in environments with 10,000+ users.
Experience in Agile development methodologies.
Knowledge of data modeling and relational databases.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and version control systems.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered.
Original Posting:
June 24, 2025
For U.S. Positions: While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $104,650.00 - $189,175.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.
